description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Amare Stoudemire finally arrived at the Knicks training site Thursday and walked straight into a firestorm of speculation that would give him the center he has always wanted alongside him, but one who would all but dash the teams hopes of acquiring Chris Paul.

title: Wedding Q&A
description: When Cash Is Preferred

title: Trader Pleads Guilty in 17-Year Investment Scheme
description: A trader implicated in a 17-year scheme pleaded guilty on Thursday to receiving confidential tips about company takeovers from a lawyer who worked at some of the nations most prestigious law firms.

title: The Caucus Click: The Scope of History
CBS Clips Fox and ABC on Wednesday Night
description: For the first time this season, CBS was the No. 1 network in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic on a Wednesday night, narrowly surpassing Fox and ABC while also pulling in the highest number of total viewers. The victory was at least partly the result of some key programs on the other networks underperforming. Modern Family on ABC had a below-average showing in the 18-to-49 demo and hit a season low in total viewers  12.1 million. On Fox, a 90-minute episode of The X Factor was also down 11 percent in that demo when compared to last week, and that singing show had 10.6 million total viewers.

title: Clinton Urges Countries Not to Stifle Online Voices
description: THE HAGUE  Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and other international leaders urged countries and private businesses on Thursday to fight increasing efforts to restrict access to the Internet by repressive governments and even some democratic ones.

title: Of Mice and Coffee
description: S. Amanda Caudill, a doctoral student at the University of Rhode Island, writes from Costa Rica, where she is assessing mammal diversity on coffee farms.

title: Holiday Shows, in Many Permutations
description: Holiday theater divided into three loosely defined, Dickens-inspired categories: past, present and future.

title: Holiday Theater, in Three Flavors
description: Instead of making Ebenezer Scrooge watch those instructive scenes from his past, present and future, perhaps the ghosts would have completed their Grinch-eradication mission faster if theyd taken him to a show. They might have come up with a list like this one, which divides some of this years notable holiday productions into three loosely defined, Dickens-inspired categories: Past (for nostalgia lovers), Present (for current-events followers) and Future (for tech geeks or more adventurous-minded theatergoers). Tiny Tim may have wished Gods blessings on everyone, but be aware that not all these shows are good for families with children.

title: Jury in Seabrook Trial Says It Is Still Deadlocked
description: Updated 5:44 p.m. |The jury in the federal corruption trial of City Councilman Larry B. Seabrook indicated on Thursday that it remained unable to reach a verdict on any of the 12 counts against him after more than five days of deliberation, and suggested that jurors should be discharged no later than Friday.

title: Afghan General Survives Assassination Attempt
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  The bomb under the generals chair was pretty clearly an inside job.

title: Theater Listings for Dec. 9  15
description: Theater

title: Pictures of the Day: Congo and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Congo, Pakistan, Syria and Russia.

title: Magic/Bird Gets Its Larry Bird
description: A 69 leading man who could match the height of basketball great Larry Bird was probably too much to hope for in Magic/Bird, the new play whose producers are aiming for Broadway in the spring of 2012. But 65 will do. The producers, Fran Kirmser and Tony Ponturo, said in an interview Thursday that they have cast actor (and former college basketball player) Tug Coker in the role of Bird, the former Boston Celtic forward whose on-court rivalry and off-court friendship with Magic Johnson, the Los Angeles Lakers point guard, are the heart of the play.

title: Weekend Miser
description: Committing to a love affair with New York is hard work for a Miser. As with any long-term relationship, you have to keep discovering new ways to get to know each other if you want to preserve the thrill. Thats what Avi Millmans New York, the Game is all about: rediscovering the city in a way thats new and fun. To play, you need $12 and a cellphone.

title: The Happy Houseplant | Indoor Gardening with Richard Chai
description: What Richard Chai calls his orchid cemetery is a narrow, north-facing window sill in the kitchen area of his Financial District loft. There, five flowerless orchid plants in uniform terracotta pots are getting indirect sunlight and enough water to keep the soil moist most of the time, and thats it. Just ignore them, says Chai, who is literally  a word he uses quite frequently  bringing the gentle plants back to life (maybe rehab is a better word for the facility). I used to obsess about orchids. But if you ignore them, theyre so much happier.

title: Two Soldiers, Their Girls, Those Doubts
description: In an essay about Mozarts Cos Fan Tutte in his book On Opera, the English philosopher Bernard Williams wrote: Nothing is denied of what has happened; that is what is sad in this comedy, that all that dimension of feeling exists, but the world will rumble on as though it did not.

title: Think Big, Build Small: Inventors Prototypes
description: American inventors in the 19th century shipped operable miniatures by the hundreds of thousands to the federal government, as models for potential patent approval. Tinkerers in every realm, from piano keyboards to collapsible lifeboats, were required to submit three-dimensional scale prototypes.

title: Lead From Old U.S. Batteries Sent to Mexico Raises Risks
description: NAUCALPAN DE JUREZ, Mexico  The spent batteries Americans turn in for recycling are increasingly being sent to Mexico, where their lead is often extracted by crude methods that are illegal in the United States, exposing plant workers and local residents to dangerous levels of a toxic metal.

title: A Brooklyn Store Offers Astounding Variety, With Patter
description: NOT all of Brooklyn glows with gentrification. Deep in the boroughs southwest pocket is Bath Beach, a few dozen blocks sandwiched between Bensonhurst and the Belt Parkway. Shuttered storefronts and signs in competing languages testify to economic hardship and ethnic flux. But amid the comings and goings is a monument to fortitude: Nicks Discount Store.

title: Neighborhood Joint | Nicks Discount Store
description: Dominick Cavalieri, known as Big Nick, greets customers, always ready to hear anyones business and share his own opinions.

title: TimesCast | Lead Poisoning in Mexico
description: Mexicos booming business in recycling car batteries leads to growing cases of lead poisoning.

title: Expletive Deleted
description: I thought that tomorrow might be a really bad day, because the markets have been pricing in high expectations for the European summit, and seemed set for a fall.

title: Japanese Star Pitcher Available, for a Price
description: DALLAS  A little after 1 a.m. Eastern time Thursday, the market for available pitchers was restocked with perhaps the best talent available. The Japanese star right-hander Yu Darvish will be posted by his team, the Hokkaido Nippon Ham Fighters, according to a Twitter message from Don Nomura, one of Darvishs agents.

title: Romney Campaign Looks to Draw Contrasts With Gingrich
description: And so it begins.

title: Homage to a Picture-Book Rebel
description: IN 1962 Ezra Jack Keats started a quiet revolution that in its own way had as much influence as some of the decades louder protests. An author and illustrator, Keats published The Snowy Day, about a small boys delight in his first snowstorm. Nothing radical there. But the story differed profoundly from virtually all the mainstream American picture books preceding it: Peter, the little boy, was black.

title: A New Look for Senator Coburn
description: There is a great deal occurring in Congress right now, but let us stop for a moment to ponder Senator Tom Coburns beard. For weeks now, the usually baby-faced Republican from Oklahoma has been strolling about the Capitol with a new look, his push-broom head of hair complemented by a slightly scruffy goatee.

title: Tech Talk Podcast: Say Nice Things
description: With the holiday shopping season in full swing, credit-card numbers and other personal bits of information are flying around the Web in a flurry. But while some shoppers may be nervous about identity theft, the problem goes far beyond just getting your credit-card number stolen, as Daniel Mohan explains. Mr. Mohan, the president and chief operating officer of ID Watchdog, describes what else thieves are after and how his companys identity-monitoring service works. He also offers some tips for staying safer online.

title: Derring-Dont
description: It looks like the tightrope walker Nik Wallenda wont able to cheat death at Niagara Falls, at least not the way he originally proposed  on 1,800 feet of cable between the American and Canadian sides. On Wednesday, Canada said no. Its Niagara Parks Commission rejected Mr. Wallendas request, in keeping with its 100-year history of rejecting daredevil acts at the falls.

title: Demand for Estate-Like Condos
description: REAL ESTATE optimists have been picking up blips on the radar in Bergen County lately, most recently this one: 24 of 68 attached manor condominiums with prices starting at $1.25 million sold in a single weekend  before they went up, and before a sales office had time to open.

title: Potently Moving Music and Imagery to Match
description: In any successful opera performance, all the various parts of the presentation  music, text, singing, playing and staging  add up to more than the sum of the parts. The stage being by its nature a precarious and dangerous place, true parity among all those elements is a rare and difficult achievement. But a successful evening can still result when, on balance, the stronger aspects of a performance rise to compensate for the weaker ones.

title: Slavery Is Freedom, And All That
description: One of my many radicalizing moments during the Bush years came when a number of the usual suspects began attacking John Kerry because he was, wait for it, too rich. Even with all the cynicism Id developed over the previous four years, the idea that Republican operatives would invoke class envy for political advantage  and that voters would fall for it  caught me off guard.

title: Heisman Watch: The Finalists
description: Connor Ennis breaks down the Heisman Trophy race between Andrew Luck, Robert Griffin, Monte Ball, Tyrann Mathieu and Trent Richardson.

title: A Democratic Face-Off in California
description: Two Democratic incumbents will face each other in a primary battle for Californias newly redrawn District 30.

title: Vows: Alexis and Miriam
description: Alexis met Miriam while working at Methodist Hospital in Park Slope, Brooklyn. Miriam had just moved New York from California and was in need of some guidance from a native.

title: Jawbone Offers Refunds and Apologies to Up Wristband Customers
description: Earlier this summer, Jawbone, a company best known for its chic audio accessories and Bluetooth headsets, took a leap into wearable health and fitness devices with the Up wristband, which can track and monitor exercise and sleep.

title: Holiday Music Across the Centuries to the City
description: A sampling of noteworthy musical presentations for the holiday season at churches, synagogues and concert halls in New York City, compiled by Anne Mancuso. All are free unless otherwise noted. (Houses of worship accept donations.) Unless noted, church choirs are featured in church concerts.

title: Count the Hallelujahs
description: A sampling of performances of Handels Messiah and other oratorios in New York, all free unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations.)

title: Chicken Cutlets Meunire
description: Mark Bittman sauts chicken breast in olive oil.

title: Seeing With a Warriors Eyes
description: Gaza, 1971:

title: The Minimalist: Chicken Cutlets Meunire
description: The most famous meunire preparation is probably sole  its a slam dunk for pretty much any thin, delicate, white fish fillet. But its also one of the best ways to treat chicken cutlets. The recipe, which I wrote about in an early Minimalist column, is infinitely variable, but here Ive done it about as simply as possible. Dredge the chicken in flour, cook it in a skillet with oil or butter until nicely browned and just cooked through  as long as you get really nice browning on one of the sides, youre fine  and finish with lemon juice and chopped parsley. The brown butter is luxurious and totally optional.

title: Show and Revelry
description: A sampling of holiday celebrations, including dance and theater events, in New York, all free unless otherwise noted. (Churches accept donations.)

title: Eavesdropping on Sondheim
description: But then I met James Lapine. Thus ends, on a cliffhanger worthy of an artist who cherishes a passion for mystery tales, the first volume of Stephen Sondheims collected lyrics, published last fall and already well thumbed and argued over by this composer-lyricists legion of passionate admirers, second only to Wagnerians in their obsessive dedication.

title: Israeli Strikes Kill Two Palestinians in Gaza
description: JERUSALEM  In an airstrike in central Gaza City, the Israeli military on Thursday killed two Palestinians whom it described as terrorists involved in a plot to attack Israelis.

title: Movie Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Movies

title: Pop and Rock Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Pop

title: State Puts a Precise Cost on Helping Illegal Immigrant Students
Poking Fun at Technology: PencilChat
Tweeting out of Love for  a Movie They Havent Yet Seen
description: Anyone looking to buy a used zoo?

title: The Giving Spree | Olivier Theyskens
description: Who: The designer for Theory and Theyskens Theory Olivier Theyskens

title: Jazz Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Jazz

title: Better With Words
description: My husbands elderly parents and brother live in England. We exchange gifts for Christmas and birthdays. Recently his mother said the logistics were becoming difficult for her. My husband suggested we stop, and she agreed. Then he e-mailed the same suggestion to his brother, who sent a blistering reply. My husband apologized by e-mail and suggested we go back to the status quo. But hes still hurt by his brothers angry message. How can we resolve this?

title: In Protest, Islamists Quit Egypt Council
description: CAIRO  The Muslim Brotherhood, the Islamist group whose political party is leading in parliamentary elections here, on Thursday accused Egypts interim military rulers of attempting to undermine the legislatures authority and interfering in the writing of a new constitution.

title: Classical Music/Opera Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Classical

title: Dance Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Dance

title: N.J. Pension Fund Commits Up to $1.8 Billion to Blackstone
description: New Jerseys pension fund has committed up to $1.8 billion to funds managed by the Blackstone Group, a big win for the money-management giant and the latest signal that the fund-raising climate, at least for the largest private equity firms, is on the upswing.

title: A Griot for a Global Village
description: Across the country institutions large and small, art-specific and otherwise, are celebrating the Romare Bearden centennial year. Theres a reason for this. In Beardens embracing art all borders are down  between personal and universal, town and country, history and myth. Africa, Europe and the Americas too are borderless. Bearden is artist in chief of the modern cosmopolis, griot in residence of the global village. All hail.

title: Heisman Watch: Breaking Down the Finalists
description: Connor Ennis breaks down the Heisman Trophy raceinvolving Andrew Luck, Robert Griffin III, Montee Ball, Tyrann Mathieu and Trent Richardson.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Dec. 9-15
description: Art

title: From Score to Text, a Hands-On Involvement With Bachs Sacred Cantatas
description: Whether you cherish the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Centers presentations of Bachs Brandenburg Concertos during its annual Baroque Festival as a developing holiday tradition or dismiss them as an easy out, you know pretty much what to expect (this year on Dec. 18 and 20).

title: A Varied Dreamscape Thats Also a Farewell
description: In a famous letter from 1871 about the poet as visionary, the 17-year-old Arthur Rimbaud wrote of le drglement des sens: the derangement of the senses, which he argued should be long, immense and deliberate. In the performing arts of our time, there has been no better exemplification of this principle than the dance theater of Merce Cunningham.

title: Spare Times: For Children, for Dec. 9-15
description: A Christmas Carol, as Told by Charles Dickens (himself)

title: An Oscar Wild Card, and Hes Holding It Tight
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Spare Times for Dec. 9-15
description: Around Town

title: Too Close for Comfort
description: Being labeled too close to Washington may be a negative for candidates in the 2012 elections.

title: A Voyeur Makes Herself at Home in the Louvre
description: Its a rare artist who gets to wander barefoot through the Louvre during its off hours, photographing anything she likes, as Nan Goldin did last year. Its a rarer one who can see her own life and art reflected in those palatial galleries, as Ms. Goldin clearly has.

title: Number of Bicyclists Keeps Climbing, City Says
description: The Bloomberg administration has aggressively expanded New York Citys bicycle infrastructure, creating hundreds of miles of bicycle lanes and encouraging residents to try out the cleaner, often speedier mode of transport.

title: A Brooklyn Store Offers Astounding Variety, With Patter
description: Not all of Brooklyn glows with gentrification. Deep in the boroughs southwest pocket is Bath Beach, a few dozen blocks sandwiched between Bensonhurst and the Belt Parkway. Shuttered storefronts and signs in competing languages testify to economic hardship and ethnic flux. But amid the comings and goings is a monument to fortitude: Nicks Discount Store.

title: Suffocated by Motherhood, and a Child Whose Hold Still Lingers
description: Every parents nightmare would be the evening news boilerplate description of We Need to Talk About Kevin, Lynne Ramsays disturbing movie about the mother of a child who goes on a killing spree at his high school. That trite phrase is accurate in an almost technical sense: Ms. Ramsay (who adapted Lionel Shrivers novel with Rory Stewart Kinnear) follows a kind of dream logic in telling a chronologically splintered story, weaving patterns of associated images and sensations into an intense and claustrophobic web of fear.

title: Policy, Painted or Set in Stone
description: Can artists change the world?

title: A United Russia? Far From It
description: Moscow

title: Cold, Claustrophobia and Confetti: What Fun
description: New Years Eve is a depressing two-hour infomercial pitching Times Square as the only place in the universe you want to be when the ball drops at midnight on Dec. 31. (Believe me, its not.)

title: Former Treasury Official Rejoins Hellman & Friedman
description: A former senior Obama administration official is resuming his Wall Street career after a two-year stint in Washington.

title: Charging Stations Await Cars
description: WHEN Kinne Yon, a developer, and her brother Neal Sigety were planning an environmentally friendly rental tower at 1510 Lexington Avenue a few years ago, they incorporated a charging station for electric cars  even though there were few, if any, plug-in models available at the time.

title: Inside Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, the director Tomas Alfredson narrates a look at his film "Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy."

title: Sharing the Regrets, and the Sex and Drugs
description: I Melt With You may set a record for the movie in which the most drugs are consumed and the most tears shed by grown men. That is a dubious distinction for any film but especially for one whose unofficial theme song is the Sex Pistols Pretty Vacant, which is not exactly a tearjerker.

title: The Life Report: Byron R. Wien
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

title: 2 Dead of Gunshots as Violence Revisits Virginia Tech
description: BLACKSBURG, Va.  Nearly five years after a massacre at Virginia Tech that was the deadliest ever on a school campus, two men, including a campus police officer, died of gunshot wounds there on Thursday afternoon.

title: Selling a Town on Rentals
description: DESPITE a dearth of buyers and a glut of renters these days, an effort to make a rental community of 284 previously approved two-bedroom condominiums in a new Central Islip development has hit several major speed bumps.

title: Housing Lawsuit Alleges Bias
description: DARIENS attitudes toward affordable housing are once again under scrutiny, this time in a federal civil rights action accusing the towns planning and zoning commission, and its chairman, Frederick B. Conze, of trying to keep out black residents.

title: Knicks Close to Adding Chandler to an Already Strong Frontcourt
description: Tyson Chandler, whose defense and grit helped deliver a championship in Dallas, is close to joining the Knicks, two people involved in the talks said Thursday. The deal faces some hurdles, however.

title: The Spy Who Emerged From the Fog
description: Dread throbs like a heartbeat in Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy, a superb new adaptation of the 1974 spy novel by John le Carr. Its a deep pulse that maintains its insistent rhythm throughout the films murmured conversations, life-and-death office intrigues, violence and yearning loves. The throbbing does a number on your nervous system  this is a movie you watch on high alert  and brings you into the state of mind that can feel like a state of siege and goes by the name of British secret service, or just the Circus. For those inside the intelligence service, like George Smiley, played with delicacy and understated power by Gary Oldman, knowledge is power, but so too is fear.

title: Q & A
description: A Tight Deadline for Stabilized Renewal

title: Loans for Multifamily Homes
description: THE rental markets strength may be enticing some buyers to look at multifamily properties, but qualifying for a mortgage on rental units is often more difficult than on a single-family residence.

title: Books on Paper, Ours to Love and to Hold
description: To the Editor:

title: The Decision on the Morning-After Pill
description: To the Editor:

title: The Encyclopedia Out the Window
description: WHEN I moved from the East Side to a four-guy apartment at West End Avenue and 88th Street, I was 25, and most apartment houses looked alike to me, 15-story masonry boxes.

title: Life Without Earplugs
description: TWO years ago, when David and Kathleen Conte moved to New York, they were relatively unfamiliar with it. Mr. Conte is from the Boston suburbs, and Ms. Conte is a native of Berlin, Germany.

title: The Snowy Day and the Art of Ezra Jack Keats
description: Images from the new exhibition at the Jewish Museum.

title: Variety to Offer Service Tracking Film Production
description: LOS ANGELES  Can a movie database help save Variety?

title: Using Twitter, Virginia Techs College Newspaper Kept On Publishing
description: Every so often, a college newspaper is thrust into the national spotlight. For The Collegiate Times at Virginia Tech University, this has happened twice in recent years  once in 2007 when a gunman opened fire and killed 33 people, including himself, in the deadliest mass shooting in American history.

title: Brooklyn City Councilman Is Fined
description: City Councilman Vincent J. Gentile of Brooklyn was fined nearly $27,000 by the citys Campaign Finance Board on Thursday, with most of the fine  $25,757  for exceeding spending limits in the 2009 election.

title: Food Aid to the Poor
description: To the Editor:

title: An Ally on Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: Medicares Chief
description: To the Editor:

title: The Role of Institutions in Reporting Child Sex Abuse
description: To the Editor:

title: A Would-Be Ratings Agency Without Rose-Colored Glasses
description: Credit ratings agencies have few friends on Wall Street or in Washington.

title: Union Seeks to Dismiss Complaint Against Boeing
description: The machinists union at Boeing asked the National Labor Relations Board to drop a complaint against the company after union members approved a new four-year contract that increases production in Seattle and averts the risk of a third consecutive strike.

title: Rolling Stones Members to Pay for Bluesmans Funeral
description: Mick Jagger and Keith Richards have offered to pay for the funeral of Hubert Sumlin, a great Chicago blues guitarist to whom they owe a musical debt, a spokeswoman for the Rolling Stones, Fran Curtis, confirmed. Mr. Sumlin died on Dec. 4.  He was 80. He was the longtime guitarist for Howlin Wolf and inspired a generation of rock and blues players with his emotional solos, among them Mr. Richards.

title: Excerpt: 'Game of Thrones'
description: The HBO fantasy series includes its own language, called Dothraki, which was developed for the show.

title: Death on the Streets Prompts a Life on the Roof
description: A few days after officiating at his 10th funeral in less than a year for a young black man killed on the streets of the South Side, the Rev. Corey Brooks decided he had had enough.

title: Shipping Batteries to Mexico
description: Many companies now legally export batteries for recycling to plants in Mexico, where they face less stringent regulation. These export plans were submitted to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency in 2010, but many batteries also cross the border illegally and go unrecorded.

title: Fine, Former Syracuse Assistant, Is Sued by an Accuser
description: Zach Tomaselli, the third man to accuse the former Syracuse assistant mens basketball coach Bernie Fine of sexual abuse, filed a lawsuit against him in Pittsburgh on Thursday, even as the federal investigation of Tomasellis allegations continues.

title: After Morning Skate Accident, St. Louiss Streak Ends at 499
description: Tampa Bay forward Martin St. Louis missed what would have been his 500th consecutive regular-season game Thursday, a streak that ended after he took a puck to the eye and sustained facial and nasal fractures during the morning skate at Madison Square Garden.

title: Excerpt: 'Homeland'
description: The Showtime thriller stars Damian Lewis as a war hero with an uncertain agenda.

title: Restore Our Future Campaign Ad
description: A campaign ad by a super PAC supporting Mitt Romney attacks Newt Gingrich.

title: Settlement With Wachovia Points Up a Controversy
description: WASHINGTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department sit a little more than a mile apart in this city. But they are light-years apart in how they deal with lawbreakers on Wall Street.

title: Mayor and Congressman Clash on Police at Occupy Wall Street Protests
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg criticized a prominent New York City congressman on Thursday for asking the Justice Department to investigate reports of police misconduct at the Occupy Wall Street protests in Lower Manhattan.

title: St. Johns Loses Another Player
description: A St. Johns basketball season possibly destined for ineptitude took an even worse turn Thursday when one of its leading scorers decided to transfer, furthering the attrition from a once-promising recruiting class.

title: Corzine Defends His Actions at MF Global
description: 9:05 p.m. | Updated

title: Lines Redrawn, Longtime Allies Fight for a Seat
description: LOS ANGELES  Democrat-on-Democrat warfare has returned to the San Fernando Valley.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Black Keys and Price Checks
description: Interesting things that Bits reporters and editors found on the Web. More here.

title: Libya Will Allow British Police to Visit for Lockerbie Inquiry, Briton Says
description: Libyas post-Qaddafi leaders signaled new flexibility in prosecuting the Libyan perpetrators of the Lockerbie bombing and the killing of a London policewoman during the 1980s, telling a visiting British official that British investigators would soon be invited into the country to conduct inquiries, Britain said Thursday.

title: Cereal? Cookies? Oh, Whats the Diff?
description: Weall know the importance of real food in the morning: kids who eat high-sugar breakfasts have a harder time in school, and a growing body of research suggests that foods sweetened with sugar or high-fructose corn syrup can be as addictive as nicotine or cocaine. Its clear, too, that for most of us the eating patterns we develop as children hang around forever.

title: Unlikely Hero in an Underground Hideout, Away From the Nazis
description: Agnieszka Hollands In Darkness, inspired by the real exploits of a Polish sewer worker and sometime burglar named Leopold Socha, who helped Jews during the Nazi occupation of Lvov (now Lviv, in Ukraine), provides the latest evidence that the Holocaust movie has become a genre in its own right. Even a true story can follow the familiar conventions of film narrative, and this tale of a righteous gentile selflessly assisting in the survival of a handful of persecuted Jews is no exception.

title: What Blagojevichs Sentence Says About Corruption and Greed
description: Even as Rod Blagojevich said he was unbelievably sorry on Wednesday, one wondered whether he was, unbelievably, sorry  and if a central premise of his 14-year-sentence was as nave as this glad-handing felon.

title: A Nod to Willing Flesh Entangled in Dispiriting Words
description: LONDON  The existence of the Bad Sex in Fiction award immediately raises the question, Why not a Good Sex in Fiction award?

title: Taxing the Rich, New York Style
No Upgrades Elsewhere, So Yankees Draft Relievers
description: DALLAS  A league rival added perhaps the most threatening hitter in baseball, so Yankees General manager Brian Cashman was asked Thursday if he would react to it. The Los Angeles Angels now have Albert Pujols, but would that make Cashman redouble his efforts to add pitching?

title: A Twitter for My Sister
description: In the early days of Twitterthe companys founders repeatedly saidthat expanding the service was like building a rocket ship inmid-flight. Twitter grew so quickly that it was almost impossible to add new features because engineers spent their time trying to keep therocket shipfrom stalling  which often happened anyway.

title: Holder, Grilled on Gun Inquiry, Says He Wont Resign
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans pummeled Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. on Thursday over the disputed gun-trafficking investigation called Operation Fast and Furious, accusing the Justice Department of hiding the truth and lying to Congress in a slugfest of an oversight hearing.

title: Pujols Leaves Behind Fractured Legacy in St. Louis
description: DALLAS

title: Mr. Putin Seeks a Scapegoat
description: Twenty years after the fall of communism, Prime Minister Vladimir Putin of Russia seems determined to resurrect the Soviet playbook. His United Russia Party tried to steal a parliamentary election on Sunday, and, when the results still delivered a stinging rebuke, he claimed the United States was whipping up protests and demonstrations.

title: Proposition 8 Appeals Case Winds Down
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The legal battle over Californias voter-approved ban on same-sex marriage came one step closer to resolution on Thursday as lawyers argued before a federal appeals panel over whether a federal judges decision to strike down the ban should be vacated because the judge is gay.

title: Goodbye to Gays, Guns & God
description: How do you praise the sanctity of traditional heterosexual marriage when the best-known nuptials of the year, between a Kardashian and a basketball player, lasted all of 72 days? Or, for that matter, when a possible Republican nominee for president, Newt Gingrich, cares so much about marriage that hes tried it three times?

title: Judge Allows  Dodgers Plan for TV Rights
description: A federal bankruptcy judge ruled Thursday that the Los Angeles Dodgers can accelerate the sale of their future television rights over the objections of Fox Sports, whose Prime Ticket channel has a contract to carry the teams games through 2013.

title: Jerry Robinson, Godfather of a Comic-Book Villain, Dies at 89
description: Jerry Robinson, a prolific comic-book artist, comics historian and editorial cartoonist who is credited with having created the Joker, the archenemy of Batman with devilish eyes and ghoulish smile, died on Wednesday at a hospice on Staten Island. He was 89 and lived in Manhattan.

title: Brawling for Money, Clan and Just Because
description: The fighting families in the documentary Knuckle are blood relatives with a vengeance. The movie, a no-frills affair from the first-time Irish director Ian Palmer, offers a circumscribed look inside the often-closed world of Irish travelers through their bare-knuckle fistfights. Historically nomads who were once better known as tinkers and described by Yeats as the people of the roads, the travelers long lived outside the mainstream, but from their on-camera showboating  as they duke it out, crow about their wins, taunt the losers and bang the drums for the next slugfest  theyre ready for their collective close-up.

title: A Wartime Leader Ends a War He Never Wanted
description: WASHINGTON  In October 2002, a little-known Illinois state senator joined a rally in Chicago against the Iraq war, declaring: Im not opposed to all wars. Im opposed to dumb wars. It was a defining moment for the young politician, who used this position to set himself apart in the race for the White House in 2008.

title: Americans Got Much Poorer Last Quarter
description: Americans got much poorer last quarter, as their collective household net worth suffered the biggest decline in three years.

title: Deep Roots of Fraud at Olympus
description: Blame it on James A. Baker III. The Plaza Accord that halted the appreciation of the United States dollar in 1985 was largely his doing, as Ronald Reagans Treasury secretary. It set in motion a series of events that led to a huge fraud at the Olympus Corporation, the Japanese maker of cameras and medical imaging equipment, that lasted more than two decades.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,833 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

title: Joseph E. Robert Jr., Investor in Real Estate, Dies at 59
description: Joseph E. Robert Jr., an international real estate investor with a talent for turning troubled properties into profits  including billions of dollars worth of assets from the collapse of the savings and loan industry in the 1980s  died on Wednesday at his home in McLean, Va. He was 59.

title: Race to the Bottom
description: Campaign ads are often deceitful, offensive or infuriating, cynically exploiting religion or families and distorting an opponents record. The latest ones from the Republican primary, however, are so brazen and the politicians so unapologetic that it is only bound to get worse.

title: Prince of the Universe, and His Maid
description: In My Piece of the Pie, Gilles Lellouche, a handsome, rough-around-the-edges French star who could be the next generations Grard Depardieu, nails the essence of a predatory capitalist shark. Having spent 10 years in London, his swaggering character, Stphane (in England hes called Steve), is dispatched to Paris to start a hedge fund. Before he leaves, his Mephistophelean mentor counsels, Business is not a sport for gentlemen; its not for good people. To which Stphane assures him, Im bad! And he is.

title: The Real Way to Help Small Business
description: With only a week to go before Congress adjourns for the holidays, Congress has yet to renew federal unemployment benefits or the payroll tax cut that will expire at year-end. Unfortunately, Republican leaders seem far more interested in advancing their partisan aims than helping millions of struggling American families.

title: You Mean Those People Who Put Me Here?
description: New Yorks legislators began arriving in Albany on Tuesday morning, and, by late Wednesday night, the Legislature had voted to revamp the entire state income tax code. The Senate voted less than half an hour after Gov. Andrew Cuomos 19,000 word bill was made public. As for the voters and taxpayers? They were out of the loop.

title: N.B.A. Owners and Players Ratify Labor Deal
description: Officially calling an end to a costly and contentious five-month-long lockout, Commissioner David Stern said Thursday that the 30 N.B.A. owners had ratified a new collective bargaining agreement that was approved simultaneously by the players.

title: Anthony Says Chandler Would Fit in Very Well
description: Carmelo Anthony spent his last official basketball-free night hosting a premiere of Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked at a Manhattan theater.

title: N.B.A. Rejects Trade Sending Paul to Lakers
description: An epic trade that would have made Chris Paul and Kobe Bryant teammates in Los Angeles was vetoed Thursday night by N.B.A. Commissioner David Stern in a decision that rocked the league just as it emerged from a five-month lockout.

title: In Tough Times, a Boom in Cremations as a Way to Save Money
description: As Toni Kelly battled lymphoma, first with a bone marrow transplant and then with brutal rounds of chemotherapy, she worried obsessively that her four-year struggle would destroy her familys finances.

title: U.S. Finds No Link Between Vieques Bombings and Health Risks
description: A federal agency announced Thursday that it had found no evidence that decades of live fire and bombing exercises by the Navy on the Puerto Rican island of Vieques had caused health problems documented among its residents.

title: Keeping the Water Flowing in Rural Villages
description: Keeping projects in business for the long term has been a constant theme of the Fixes column, and if sustainability has a poster child, it would be a water pump. Travel anywhere in Africa or South Asia or Central America, and you will find a landscape dotted with the rusting skeletons of dead water pumps or wells..

title: Dont Bother Checking In With This Baby Sitter
description: Noah, the nobodys fool played by Jonah Hill in the breezily indifferent comedy The Sitter, is a character in search of a movie, a setup in search of a punch line. Less directed than doodled by David Gordon Green, this on-and-off funny rehash of Adventures in Babysitting centers on a college dropout who, at his mothers urging, reluctantly agrees to mind three children for pay. Somewhat of a big baby himself, Noah sets off with a pout, apparently unaware that most American excursions in comedy these days come with mandatory opportunities for growth.

title: Marketers, and Media Companies, Set Their Sights on Latin Women
description: WITH the Census Bureau counting nearly 25 million Latin women in the United States, marketers and media companies have started getting excited about the potential to reach them.

title: The Gingrich Tragedy
description: Of all the major Republicans, the one who comes closest to my worldview is Newt Gingrich. Despite his erratically shifting views and odd phases, he continually returns to this core political refrain: He talks about using government in energetic but limited ways to increase growth, dynamism and social mobility.

title: Auto Club and Port Authority Fight in Court Over Rise in Toll
description: When the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey raised bridge and tunnel tolls in September, officials said the increased revenue was necessary to ensure the financial health of the infrastructure the authority controls, including the World Trade Center project.

title: Leader in the Cancer Fight, and Son of an Illegal Immigrant
description: A few minutes before Ronald DePinho was to give a speech to his graduating class at Fordham College in the Bronx, he sat with his father in a student lounge. It was May 1977. His father had been in the United States for nearly 40 years. The son was on his way to a career in medicine and research that would bring him to the presidency of the biggest cancer center in the country. It was a time for the father, Alvaro DePinho, to pass along some history.

title: Obama Endorses Decision to Limit Morning-After Pill
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, who took office pledging to put science ahead of politics, averted a skirmish with conservatives in the nations culture wars on Thursday by endorsing his health secretarys decision to block over-the-counter sales of an after-sex contraceptive pill to girls under age 17.

title: Factional Splits Hinder Drive to Topple Syria Leader
description: ANTAKYA, Turkey  Even as the government of President Bashar al-Assad intensifies its crackdown inside Syria, differences over tactics and strategy are generating serious divisions between political and armed opposition factions that are weakening the fight against him, senior activists say.

title: All the G.O.P.s Gekkos
description: Almost a quarter of a century has passed since the release of the movie Wall Street, and the film seems more relevant than ever. The self-righteous screeds of financial tycoons denouncing President Obama all read like variations on Gordon Gekkos famous greed is good speech, while the complaints of Occupy Wall Street sound just like what Gekko says in private: I create nothing. I own, he declares at one point; at another, he asks his protg, Now youre not nave enough to think were living in a democracy, are you, buddy?

title: Texas Instruments Forecasts Lower Sales for 4th Quarter
description: Texas Instruments, the chip maker, gave a fourth-quarter sales forecast on Thursday that fell short of analysts estimates, citing weaker demand for electronics components.

title: Chiefs Get a Left-Handed Compliment
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Rex Ryan was asked Thursday what he thought about Tyler Palko, who is the Kansas City Chiefs starting quarterback more or less by default. Ryan, whose Jets face Palko on Sunday, carefully considered the question.

title: Lottery Numbers
Perrys Anti-Gay Rights Focus Is Divisive Even to Staff
description: OKATIE, S.C.  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas hard turn the past two days on gay issues, in which he has suggested that gay rights are inconsistent with both American and Christian values, has generated enormous criticism from lesbian and gay organizations and some religious groups, and has even helped split Mr. Perrys top campaign aides over a new ad.

title: For Latin America, a Zone of its Own
Girls Just Wanna Shoot Up a Diner
description: Three bad gals and assorted bad guys spread a lot of gunfire around in Catch .44, a drug-deal tale featuring top-drawer actors trying to have fun with a medium-strength script. Sometimes they succeed, but not often enough to elevate the film to Pulp Fiction territory.

title: And Now Shes Got a Fantastically Mean Spike
description: Recent offerings from the distributor China Lion, which specializes in mainstream Chinese movies  Beginning of the Great Revival, The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman  have tended to be blustery, leaden or galumphing affairs. Its latest bid to beat Hollywood at its own game, the fantasy Magic to Win, has, for all its derivative special effects and conceits, an agreeable light-footedness (a clue to its Hong Kong, not mainland, provenance). Its buoyancy may not redeem its predictability, but it makes the movie bearable and even enjoyable at times.

title: Tributes to Romare Bearden
description: The artists work is on display in exhibitions at the Studio Museum, the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture and the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: E.P.A. Links Tainted Water in Wyoming to Hydraulic Fracturing for Natural Gas
description: DENVER  Chemicals used to hydraulically fracture rocks in drilling for natural gas in a remote valley in central Wyoming are the likely cause of contaminated local water supplies, federal regulators said Thursday.

title: Manning Keeps Calm as Injuries Multiply
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Shortly before the Giants took the field against the Green Bay Packers last Sunday, players began to murmur that two of their offensive linemen would not be available. Eli Manning took it as an occasion for some gallows humor.

title: Friday: Removed From the Can
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Ahh, wide open spaces. Where the pencils are sharp, the long entries are fresh, and the deer and the buffalo roam. Where a person can stretch out without hitting all sorts of black squares and actually get some thinking done.

title: To Fix Health, Help the Poor
description: New Haven

title: So Many Secrets, Soon to See the Light
description: The daytime soaps are being bug-zapped from the networks one by one, disappearing into oblivion after decades of reliably dishing out startling coincidences and staggering secrets. Where to go for a sustaining dose of torrid, troubled romances and the occasional heated catfight?

title: Unspooling Memories From the Soul on a Machine
description: A command of the speaking power of silence is almost a prerequisite for performing the plays of Samuel Beckett. This is particularly true of his sparer works, in which the Irish-born playwright reduced his theatrical means to a minimum, the better to concentrate his ideas and underscore the echoing emptiness that is forever threatening to swallow his characters whole.

title: Home for the Holidays, Oh Joy
description: Fanny, Annie & Danny may be an unpleasant story about unpleasant characters, but the acting is fabulous. Under Chris Browns direction, an ensemble cast of unknowns works the reunited-for-Christmas-dinner theme beautifully, which is to say, repugnantly.

title: More Detail on Risk Urged for a Contraceptive Label
description: Labels on the popular birth control pills Yaz and Yasmin should be strengthened to include more information about the possibility that the pills could lead to greater risk of blood clots in women, an advisory committee to the Food and Drug Administration said on Thursday.

title: A Trade Edge in China
description: China has a large trade surplus of goods with the rest of the world but is running a growing trade deficit in the service sector.

title: Long Island Gets Big Grant in Cuomos Competition
description: Long Island and three struggling upstate regions were the big winners Thursday in a competition for $785 million in one of Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos signature development initiatives.

title: Air Force Apologizes for Disposal of Remains
description: WASHINGTON  The Air Force expressed regrets Thursday for any grief to surviving family members caused by a previous mortuary practice in which incinerated partial remains of service members were deposited in a landfill.

title: Only the Brain-Dead Know Brooklyn
description: I just got laid off from work, and Im sleepin with my niece, the hot and aggressively unpleasant hero of Red Hook Black announces midway through this awkward drama, helpfully summarizing its plot. His name is Marco (Kyle Fields), he was once a longshoreman and he has exactly two moods  angry and sullen  both of which look the same though one requires a louder voice.

title: 12 With Low State Test Scores Are Put on School Closing List
description: In the first part of a two-step effort at weeding out some of the poorest-performing schools, the Education Department announced on Thursday that it would move to close 12 of New York Citys struggling schools and eliminate middle school grades at three others.

title: Paperback Row
description: SUNSET PARK,  by Paul Auster (Picador, $15.) Unfolding after the economic collapse, Austers novel concerns Miles Heller, a college dropout trashing out foreclosed houses in Florida. His underage girlfriend, Pilar, is mature beyond her years, but the discovery of their relationship forces Miles to flee to New York, where he hides out among a group of young artists and intellectuals squatting in an abandoned house.

title: Anarchist Anthropology
description: The anthropologist David Graeber has a strong claim to being the house theorist of Occupy Wall Street. A veteran of the antiglobalization uprisings in Seattle and Genoa, he helped orchestrate the first General Assembly in New York this summer, and has since become one of the movements most outspoken defenders. For him, the encampments in cities across the country prefigure the kind of anti-hierarchical, stateless society that ought to be our future. In a recent opinion article in The Guardian of London, Graeber proclaimed OWS the opening salvo in a wave of negotiations over the dissolution of the American Empire. For a movement that has attracted an array of political sympathies, his voice reminds us that at its organizational core, Occupy Wall Street cleaves to anarchist principles.

title: David Montgomery, 84, Dies; Chronicled Lives of Workers
description: David Montgomery, a labor historian whose experience as a machinist informed his influential writing about the culture of the factory floor, died last Friday in Philadelphia. He was 84.

title: A Struggling Actor Strays, and Pays
description: Theres no business as disliked as show business in Seducing Charlie Barker, an intermittently interesting but fatally clichd comedy of personal and professional suicide.

title: Chinas 10-Year Ascent to Trading Powerhouse
description: HONG KONG  As China heads into a weekend of speeches celebrating its 10 years as an official member of the global trade community, the rest of the world may want to contemplate the exported $49 microwave oven and the imported $85,000 Jeep Grand Cherokee.

title: Anchor Baby: A Term Redefined as a Slur
description: What does the term anchor baby mean? If you were to look it up in the American Heritage Dictionary, you would find a new definition since last week.

title: Renovation Complete, City Council Goes Home
description: The gilded moldings and the polished mahogany gleamed. The 1903 ceiling murals, depicting civic virtues, were newly free of decades worth of grime. The walls, previously a yellowish cream, were now turquoise, to complement the murals and the woodwork.

title: Honduras: Killings Prompt a Ban on Motorcycles Carrying Passengers
description: After two high-profile killings this week, legislators approved a decree late Wednesday banning motorcyclists from riding with passengers. Alfredo Landaverde, a former antidrug and security adviser to the government, was killed in the capital, Tegucigalpa, on Wednesday. On Tuesday, a radio journalist, Luz Marina Paz Villalobos, and her driver were killed. The suspects in both cases were passengers on motorcycles, who got away. The killings come amid a widening scandal of accusations of police involvement in killings and drug trafficking. Mr. Landaverde was an outspoken critic of police and political corruption.

title: Hotel Video in Strauss-Kahn Case Resolves Little
description: The surveillance images show Dominique Strauss-Kahn striding from an elevator at the Sofitel New York, standing at the front desk and crossing through the lobby to jump into a taxi.

title: A Quest for a Better Life, Interrupted by Sudden Grief
description: Janet Brown is an expert at stealing naps. The drivers seat of her minivan often doubles as a mattress, allowing her to sleep briefly during breaks in her duties as a single mother, a full-time student, a chiropractic intern and a counselor. She sleeps two to three hours each night.

title: Tax Plan Passed, Legislature Faces Smaller Budget Gap
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and lawmakers declared the income tax overhaul that was approved early Thursday to be a victory for millions of New Yorkers, many of whom will enjoy a modest tax cut next year.

title: In a Loss, a Rangers Gesture Leads to a Fight
description: Sniper is a common term for goal scorer, so in that respect perhaps Artem Anisimovs response was fitting after he put the Rangers ahead with a second-period goal: He pointed his stick at the Tampa Bay net and pretended to fire.

title: A Coach Trades Up by Going to a Midmajor
description: Perhaps only in the nonrevenue-producing universe of collegiate mens soccer would Creighton University, a small Jesuit college in Nebraska, be considered a more desirable destination than the University of North Carolina.

title: City Plans Staff Audit With Eye Toward P.R.
description: Called the leaker in chief for his aggressive approach to spinning reporters when he was the White House chief of staff, Mayor Rahm Emanuel is a voracious and careful reader of the news. He has even remarked on the tweeting habits of the City Hall press corps.

title: The Prayerful Young Man Can Also Nail a Jumper
description: A bevy of college scouts and curious fans flocked to the University of Illinois at Chicago Pavilion on Saturday for Jabari Parkers first game of the season.

title: Low Marks for a Medical Training Institute, and the State Lags in Oversight
description: Rebecca Solomon struggled during her brief internship at a womens clinic in Salinas.

title: Single Brand Retail May Get Green Light
description: Wal-Mart might have to wait to enter the Indian retail market  perhaps for years  but Ikea, the furniture and furnishing retail chain, might soon be selling its trademark Billy bookcases here.

title: Inflation Cooling Off in China
description: HONG KONG  Inflation and industrial activity in China cooled markedly in November, according to data released Friday  an important development that raises the likelihood that the authorities in Beijing will seek to inject more momentum into an economy that has become a key engine of global growth.

title: Word of the Day | surreptitious
description: surreptitious \sr-p-ti-shs, s-rp-, s-rep-\ adjective

title: An Unexpected Debut
description: Boyd Lee Dunlop found his musical talent during the Great Depression. But after years of playing in bars and nightclubs, it took a damaged piano in a Buffalo nursing home for him to be discovered.

title: NYT Front Page for 12/09/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 12/09/2011

title: Rhythms Flow as Aging Pianist Finds New Audience
description: BUFFALO

title: City Crackdown Looming as the Dog Population Rises
description: Call it a sign of the times: At food establishments around San Francisco, fliers are popping up with the words No Animals Allowed in bold red letters, and an image of a dog in a circle with a line through it. They are stamped with the official city and county seal.

title: X Factor Watch: Nicole Scherzinger Casts the Nondeciding Vote
description: If youre ever the defendant in a bench trial, pray that Nicole Scherzinger is the judge weighing your fate. Turns out she cant make a decision. Youll get a mistrial for sure.

title: A Behind-the-Scenes Dispute, This Time at the Oscar Factory
description: All season long  all two weeks of it, for us  the Bagger has been wondering if Occupy Wall Street would crop up in our Oscars coverage. After all, the Occupy movement has touched on everything from the foreclosure crisis to cultural institutions to Halloween. Why couldnt there be an Occupy Red Carpets?

title: Live Hip-Hop Music, an Airport Amenity That Can Lure Even Non-Travelers
description: Mark Braun had just landed at San Francisco International Airport after a business trip to Florida. But rather than heading directly back to his home in Burlingame, he found himself lingering. Normally Im ready to get out of here, he said, standing next to his roller bag.

title: Start-Ups Mixing Food and Technology Vie for an Edge
description: Rajat Suri was excelling at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology when he dropped out and became a waiter  not the typical direct path to fame and fortune in the technology industry.

title: News Quiz | Dec. 9, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Illegal Border Crossings Dip Sharply
description: Campaign rhetoric to the contrary, statistics show that the number of illegal immigrants crossing the border is less of a problem now than it has been for four decades.

title: Forget Pujols, Cashman Praises Montero
description: DALLAS  For two days, Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman has been conducting a one-man promotional campaign for Jesus Montero, his precocious 22-year-old catcher. On Wednesday, Cashman compared the development of Monteros catching skills to those of Jorge Posada when he was breaking in back in the 1990s, and on Thursday, Cashman compared Montero to the best hitter in the game.

title: Corrections: December 9
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Questions Surround Unregulated Institutions
description: HURST Sitting in his new office  the sparsely decorated basement of an unassuming 9,000-square-foot building just outside Fort Worth  Christopher Cone cut to the chase during a discussion of academic accreditation.

title: Hey, You Look Familiar. Didnt You Run for Office Before? Didnt You Lose?
description: Maybe the voters didnt mean it. Could be they have reconsidered. It may have been a mistake, or a bunch of them got busy and never made it to the polls. Perhaps they were just as surprised the morning after the elections as the losers were, and maybe now the voters want their former incumbents back.

title: German Vision Prevails as Leaders Agree on Fiscal Pact
description: BRUSSELS  Europes worst financial crisis in generations is forging a new European Union, pushing Britain to the sidelines and creating a more integrated, fiscally disciplined core of nations under the auspices of a resurgent Germany.

title: The New Evangelicals
description: Though public support for both major political parties is very low, one group of voters is usually exempted from this malaise: evangelicals. Its assumed that at least these values voters are getting what they want. But we should look more carefully.

title: GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for the most interesting things to do around the state this week.

title: Anisimov Apologizes for Gesture
description: Like Arron Asham two months earlier, Artem Anisimov momentarily lost his way in the middle of an intense hockey game. After knocking down Washingtons Jay Beagle in a fight on Oct. 14, Asham gestured like he had put Beagle to sleep. After scoring a goal in the second period Thursday to give the Rangers a 2-1 lead, the usually reserved Anisimov pretended to fire his stick toward the Tampa Bay net.

title: Latest Plan for Europe Fails to Wow Investors
description: Financial markets on Friday welcomed Europes grand new plan to bring budgetary discipline to its members but investors were skeptical that it offered any long-term fix.

title: Video Revives Mystery of Missing Former F.B.I. Agent
description: The mystery surrounding the disappearance nearly five years ago of a former Federal Bureau of Investigation agent in Iran was rekindled Friday with the release of a hostage videotape showing him alive as of a year ago.

title: Virender Sehwag Hits for Six Off the Pitch Too
description: For 14 years Virender Sehwag has set cold fear into the hearts of bowling attacks all over the world, culminating in Thursdays brutal yet beautiful innings of 219 against the West Indies in Indore.

title: Dec. 9, 1992 | Charles and Diana Announce Royal Separation
description: On Dec. 9, 1992, Britains Prince Charles and Princess Diana released a statement announcing their separation after 11 years of marriage. The news was made public by Prime Minister John Major, who read the statement in nationally televised address before the British House of Commons.

title: Toyota Cuts Profit Forecast by 54%
description: TOKYO  Toyota Motor cut its annual profit forecast by half Friday after destructive floods in Thailand, a crucial manufacturing hub, hurt production in a year already marred by natural and nuclear disasters in Japan.

title: Test Yourself | English, Dec. 9, 2011
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the Op-Ed column How Garbo Learned to Stand on Her Head, by Maureen Dowd.

title: 94 People Die as Private Hospital in India Burns
description: NEW DELHI  To all appearances, the Advanced Medical Research Institute hospital in Kolkata was state of the art. It had some of the latest, most precise radiation therapy equipment for patients in its cancer center. It offered special deluxe suites for its wealthiest patients. Its trauma surgery unit was said to be one of the best in eastern India, as well as its highly efficient emergency room.

title: A Plea for Robert Levinson
description: The former F.B.I. agent disappeared in March 2007 while on a trip to a Persian Gulf resort.

title: U.N. Peacekeepers Wounded in Southern Lebanon Attack
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A bomb exploded near a United Nations convoy helping patrol southern Lebanon on Friday, wounding five peacekeepers in the third attack on the contingent this year, a United Nations spokesman and security officials said.

title: Kolkata Hospital Fire Kills Dozens
description: A vast inferno ripped through a Kolkata hospital, killing scores of patients who were trapped inside the smoke-filled building as rescue workers struggled to tame the blaze. The fire, which took place at a 161-bed private hospital, broke out in the basement, according to rescue officials, and sent huge plumes of smoke throughout the building. More than 70 people died in the blaze, many due to smoke inhalation, according to television news reports from the scene.

title: Moodys Downgrades Top French Banks
description: PARIS  In another sign of how Europes debt crisis is rippling through the banking system, Moodys Investors Service on Friday downgraded the three largest banks in France, saying there was a very high probability that the French government would step in to support them if conditions worsened.

title: Central Park Soundtrack
description: WHO are Bluebrain?

title: Should the Morning-After Pill Be Sold Over the Counter to People Under 17?
description: The United States secretary of health publicly overruled the Food and Drug Administration this week, refusing to allow emergency contraception known as the morning-after pill to be sold without a prescription to people under 17. (If taken soon after unprotected sex, the pill halves the chances of a pregnancy.)

title: The Beauty and Chaos of the Gods
description: Darshan is a Sanskrit term meaning sight, in the Hindu sense of beholding a deity and making an immediate spiritual connection. Overwhelmingly in India, Hindu gods and goddesses are rendered in paintings or sculpted from stone and clay.

title: Playing With Dedication
description: DIONNE COE has a sweet outside shot and eyes that light up when she sees a loose ball on the court. Shequana Harris has quick hands and an explosive first step to the basket. Both seniors, they arrived at school in September confident that this would be their year  college scouts, scholarship offers, a brilliant star teammate and a chance to lead their school, Murry Bergtraum High School for Business Careers, toward its 14th consecutive city championship.

title: The Real G.O.P. Dark Horse: None of the Above
description: Two of my favorite analysts, Rhodes Cook and Josh Putnam, have a good debate going about just how plausible it is that a Republican who is not currently running for president could enter the race later and potentially win it (probably necessitating a brokered convention). Those of you who follow my Twitter feed will know that I think Mr. Cook has the stronger side of the argument; I think there is a small but nontrivial chance that the Republican nominee could be someone like Jeb Bush, Paul Ryan, Mitch Daniels, Tim Pawlenty or Chris Christie. (In fact, I was speculating about these scenarios as long as a month ago.)

title: Week 14 Matchups: Offenses Tighten Their Belts
description: Texans (9-3) at Bengals (7-5)Sunday, 1 p.m.Line: Bengals by 3

title: Tistos Club Life Finds a New Home on Sirius XM
description: Tisto, long a major figure in European electronic dance music, will begin hosting a music channel on Sirius XM satellite radio early next year, a spokesman for the radio network said. The channel will broadcast dance music in a variety of styles selected by Tisto, the Dutch D.J. who is known for his six-hour live sets and his memorable performance during the opening ceremony of the 2004 Olympics in Athens. A master of trance and progressive house music, he has sold more than 761,000 records in the last decade. His new channel, called Tistos Club Life Radio, will feature Tistos own mixes and music by artists on his label, Musical Freedom, which he started in late 2010. It will be an awesome way to showcase the incredible artists on my own label, play new material of my own as well as other music that Im really passionate about, said Tisto, whose real name is Tijs Verwest. Tisto currently hosts a Saturday show on Siriuss Electric Area channel, but that program will be moved to the new dial setting: Channel 340 on Edge satellite radios and on the Sirius XM Internet radio site.

title: Social Insurance and Individual Freedom
description: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton. He has some financial interests in the health care field.

title: Ford E-Series: Requiem for the Band Van
description: The Ford Econoline, marketed by Ford in its later years as the E-Series, is being replaced by the Transit, a model developed by Fords European division and undergoing tests at the automakers proving grounds in Michigan. But as the Econoline nameplate goes, so goes a legacy steeped in rock n roll  and in exceptional cases, chlorine and pizza sauce.

title: Whimsical Works Join a Museums Menagerie in Paris
description: The Muse de la Chasse et de la Nature (62, rue des Archives; 33-1-53-01- 92-40, www.chassenature.org) is a singular space. Dedicated to exploring mans interaction with nature, it has a permanent collection featuring hunting scene tapestries, ornately carved firearms, curiosity cabinets and taxidermied animals. And now, the museum is juxtaposing its rather sober items with whimsical pieces by the contemporary artist Franoise Ptrovitch, whose works will be on display through Jan. 22.

title: Merger Planned Between Travel-Focused Ad Agencies
description: Two agencies that specialize in campaigns for travel advertisers are combining to create what they describe as the largest travel marketing firm.

title: Refusing to Compete on Price
description: Jessica Johnson knows she must continue to innovate if she wants her business, Johnson Security Bureau, to maintain its impressive growth rate in 2012. This year, the companys annual sales have doubled  just as they did in 2010.

title: Japan Calls for Action Against Citigroup and UBS
description: TOKYO  Japanese financial regulators called on Friday for penalties against Citigroup and UBS, accusing them of trying to manipulate interest rates at which they borrow from each other, broadening an international inquiry into some of the worlds biggest banks.

title: Daily Report: Clinton Pushes for Internet Freedom
description: At the opening of a two-day conference on digital freedom in the Netherlands, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton and other international leaders argued that countries and businesses should fight increasing efforts to restrict access to the Internet by repressive governments and even some democratic ones, reported Steven Lee Myers and Heather Timmons in Fridays New York Times.

title: Next Two Debates Likely to Be Nasty
description: In a political year when debates have repeatedly reshaped the course of the Republican presidential campaign, the next two televised gatherings of candidates, on Saturday and next Thursday, are shaping up to be the most important  and nasty  yet.

title: The True Meaning of the Season: Holiday Movies Wed Actually Watch
description: So many Christmas-theme movies on television, so little time. The next few days bring Christmas Comes Home to Canaan, Christmas Magic, Dear Santa and assorted others, some new, some recycled. You know the ingredients: a single parent, a plucky child or two, a hardship of some kind, a serendipitous meeting that leads to love. Perhaps a little angelic intervention.

title: The Heart That Beats in Albert Nobbs
description: MOST failed auditions are quickly forgotten. Rarely does one generate a part that haunts an actor for three decades, lingering like an unresolved relationship that refuses to be eclipsed by successes across film, theater and television. But a botched stab at the title role was the beginning of Glenn Closes enduring fascination with Albert Nobbs.

title: Opinion Report: New Yorks Tax Code
description: From the editorial page

title: Romney Meets the Press
description: Mitt Romney  buttoned-down and buttoned-up  appears most comfortable in structured situations that he can control, like roundtable discussions about business and industry.

title: Water Transfer to San Diego Is Upheld
description: Eight years ago, Californias Imperial Valley, a blooming desert that has access to more water than any place in the West, agreed to transfer 10 percent of its bounty to San Diego and Los Angeles and other metropolitan areas of Southern California.

title: Letter Bomb Explodes in Italian Tax Office
description: ROME  An Italian anarchist group claimed responsibility for a letter bomb that injured the national director of Italys tax collection agency after it exploded in his hands on Friday, the Italian police said.

title: Fire Kills Dozens in India
description: A fast-moving fire raged through a private hospital in Kolkata on Friday, killing scores of people.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Corzine Defends His Actions at MF Global | Jon S. Corzine, who came to Washington in 2001 as a Democratic senator from New Jersey, made a humbling return on Thursday, defending his tenure as MF Globals top executive and sounding a note of contrition about the brokerage firms startling collapse.

title: Thoma Bravo Acquires Blue Coat Systems for $1.3 Billion
description: An investor group, led by the private equity firm Thoma Bravo, announced on Friday that it had agreed to purchase Blue Coat Systems, a maker of enterprise security and network software, for $1.3 billion in cash.

title: The Summit To End All Summits
description: European stocks are up today, and I have no idea why. Im with Felix Salmon  this looks like a disastrous meeting. More austerity, more posing of the crisis, wrongly, as being all about fiscal deficits; no mechanism for ECB funding. Somehow southern Europe is supposed to deflate its way to prosperity, while everyone runs a trade surplus, presumably against that potentially habitable planet weve discovered 600 light-years away.

title: Imitation Occupation Begets the Real Thing
description: Click to read the updated version of this article that appears in the newspaper.

title: Ex-Philippine Leader Moved to New Location Ahead of Trial
description: MANILA  The former president of the Philippines, Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, was moved through heavy traffic and pounding rain to a government hospital Friday to await trial on charges of election fraud.

title: Peripheral Stories
description: A few notes about things surrounding core Europe.

title: Updates on the European Debt Crisis Talks
description: The Lede followed developments in negotiations over the debt crisis in Europe, where leaders of most  but not all  of the countries in the European Union agreed on Friday to sign an intergovernmental treaty committing their countries to stricter budgetary discipline. The live blog has ended. Check the business and world sections for the latest developments.

title: Will The Real Hari Seldon Please Stand Up?
description: Teresa Nielsen Hayden takes on an article claiming, ludicrously, that Newt Gingrich is playing a role from Isaac Asimovs Foundation novels. As she says, thats ridiculous; Im the one playing that role.

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 9
description: Tanzina Vega writes about Hearsts introduction of Cosmopolitan Latina, which will begin publishing in May. The planned new magazine  with one issue in the spring and one in the fall, and, at first, a print run of 545,000 copies  is a recognition of the growing economic power of Latino women, who number nearly 25 million in the United States, she writes. Latino women account for one in every four subscribers of Cosmopolitan, and the Cosmopolitan Web site will have separate tab for Latino-focused content. The new magazine will be competing with Latina magazine, which just celebrated its 15th anniversary.

title: Sadness and Anger Over School Closings
Walcott: School Choice Is Not Too Much of a Good Thing
The Early Word: Going Head to Head
description: In Todays Times:Redistricting has pitted several incumbent House members against each other next year for redrawn districts, Jennifer Steinhauer writes. In Californias San Fernando Valley, the matchup between the veteran Democrats Brad Sherman and Howard L. Berman is expected to draw in independent political groups with deep pockets, she adds.

title: All Wrapped Up
description: Shopping for holiday gifts can be an exhausting proposition. At least the wrapping part just got a little easier.

title: Where Are the Women Executives in Silicon Valley?
description: Updated 6 p.m.: Clarified the number of women among Intuits highest-paid executives.

title: Motive a Mystery in Killing and Suicide at Virginia Tech
description: BLACKSBURG, Va.  The man who shot and killed a campus police officer at Virginia Tech and then turned the gun on himself was a part-time student at a nearby college who had stolen a car at gunpoint the day before but had no apparent link to the officer, the police said Friday.

title: Israeli Planes Attack Gaza Targets
description: GAZA  Israel carried out more airstrikes in Gaza early Friday, accidentally killing a Palestinian man and his 12-year-old son as militants continued to fire rockets into southern Israel.

title: The Huntsman 2016 Fallacy
description: Jon Chait points out, correctly, that Newt Gingrich should be hoping against hope that a Jon Huntsman surge in New Hampshire cuts into Mitt Romneys support. But then he veers off into implausible speculations about Huntsmans 2016 ambitions:

title: Yahoos Alibaba Quandary
description: As Yahoo explores its future, one of the boards top considerations is what to do about the companys 43 percent stake in Alibaba, the Chinese Internet giant.

title: Ownership of Maple Leafs and Raptors May Change Hands
description: Rogers Communications and Bell Canada, two giant communications firms, said Friday that they would pay more than $1.3 billion Canadian, or about $1.2 billion American, for a controlling stake in Maple Leaf Sports and Entertainment, Canadas largest sports conglomerate. The assets of the conglomerate include the Toronto Maple Leafs of the N.H.L., the Raptors of the N.B.A. and the Air Canada Centre.

title: What Were Reading
description: Details: Why are more and more American men so obsessed with the cleanse? And is a detox diet even good for you?  Jeff Gordinier

title: Morning T | Nicholas Kirkwood
description: Ts Jane Herman talks to the shoe designer Nicholas Kirkwood about his early days in fashion and some of the shoes that have made him a star.

title: Fill-In | Code-Cracking
description: Directions: Fill in the blanks in several paragraphs in this article from the World section, Go Online, Beat a Puzzle and Become a British Spy.

title: Live Blog: MF Global Bankruptcy Hearing
description: MF Global is in bankruptcy court again on Friday, one day after the failed brokerages chief executive, Jon S. Corzine, testified before a congressional panel about the girms demise.

title: Planning Child-Friendly Flights
description: Planning Child-Friendly Flights

title: Former Chairman of Anglo Irish Bank Arrested
description: LONDON  Sean FitzPatrick, the former chairman and chief executive of the bankrupt Anglo Irish Bank, was arrested Friday in connection with an investigation into alleged fraud at the firm, according to a person familiar with the situation.

title: Lindsey Vonn on the Cold and the Cool
description: AFTER learning to ski on tiny Buck Hill in Minnesota, the Olympic skier Lindsey Vonn took her first ski trip to Keystone, Colo., when she was 7 years old. Since then, the gold medalist has gone on to ski all over the world, from her home in Vail, Colo., to the frigid slopes of Finland. Here, excerpts from an e-mail exchange on some highs and lows. DANIELLE MATTOON

title: The Family Ski Trip: Why Do We Do It?
description: SKIING has never been easy. Fun as all get-out, reliably exhilarating, but a hassle. Triple that if you are trying to pull it off as a family.

title: The Oscars Music Mash-Up
description: Its not quite Ice Cube on Eames, but this years music consultants for the Oscars are a bit of an odd pairing: the composer Hans Zimmer and the producer and singer Pharrell Williams will take the audience on a musical journey, the telecasts producers, Brian Grazer and Don Mischer, said in a statement released by the Academy on Thursday.

title: Six Women-Only Ski Clinics Go Way Beyond the Snowplow
description: SKI clinics for women have been around for years, but in past decades the emphasis was more on basic skills than jumping off cliffs, with ample time set aside for shopping or going to the spa. Now women who want to maximize their skills may want to take another look at these multiday programs. In recent years resorts have been adding more and more women-only clinics that are aimed at serious skiers and taught by prize-winning experts.

title: Friday Reading: Cremations Boom in Tough Economic Times
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Holiday Gifts From Your Kitchen
description: Some of my favorite holiday gifts, both given and received, have come from the kitchen. One year I made homemade bread, flavored with cherries and nuts and twisted to look like a candy cane. A good friend of mine regularly gives decadent raspberry chocolate truffles.

title: His Mission: Telling Stories to Grown-Ups
description: NICASIO, Calif.

title: A New Jay Peak, in Vermont
description: SEVEN miles from the Canadian border in northern Vermont, Jay Peak has always been so remote that only the ardent found it. For those who did, the mountains miles of out-of-bounds terrain became a cultlike destination, drawing a loyal, if limited, following that included many Canadians.

title: In Utah, the Canyons Resort Gets a Facelift
