description: The College Cup soccer final is going to be played at Regions Park on Sunday in Hoover, Ala, but regardless of the outcome, the hardware is going back to North Carolina.

title: Trailing After 1 Minute, Barcelona Is in First After 90
description: MADRID  Barcelona and Real Madrid kicked off their match Saturday at 10 p.m. A minute later, it appeared that a dynasty was about to crumble in a most humiliating, and unbelievably quick, fashion.

title: Iowa Republican Debate Blog
description: Six candidates are on stage at Drake University in Des Moines. (Jon M. Huntsman Jr., still lagging in the polls, did not qualify; Herman Cain has dropped out.)

title: On Russian TV, a Straightforward Account Is Startling
description: MOSCOW  Regular viewers of government-controlled television were treated to a curious sight when they tuned in to the evening news on Saturday.

title: Behind the Bars of Supermax, Contemplating Aristotle and Islamic Extremism
description: In the highest-security prison in the United States, known as the federal Supermax, one inmate writes about prison life and his views about Islamic extremism in a year-long written correspondence with a New York Times reporter.

title: Beyond Guantnamo, a Web of Prisons for Terrorism Inmates
description: WASHINGTON  It is the other Guantnamo, an archipelago of federal prisons that stretches across the country, hidden away on back roads. Today, it houses far more men convicted in terrorism cases than the shrunken population of the prison in Cuba that has generated so much debate.

title: Holding Its Ground, Navy Keeps Grip
description: LANDOVER, Md.  As Navy players on the sidelines hopped up and down, pleading for even more noise, sections filled with Midshipmen from the United States Naval Academy yelled for a big and late fourth-down stop, which Navy had not had to do much in the last decade against Army.

title: From Florida to Brooklyn to Care for Her Ailing Sister
description: When Sandra Dorne received a call in 2010 from a niece saying that Ms. Dornes older sister was in desperate need of care, she did not think twice. She packed her life into a small suitcase, left her waitressing job in Orlando, Fla., and three days later booked a $150 one-way plane ticket to Allentown, Pa.

title: Lakers Pursuit of Paul Falls Through Again
description: The Los Angeles Lakers, frustrated in their pursuit of Chris Paul, withdrew from three-team trade talks late Saturday night and turned their focus toward a larger target: Dwight Howard.

title: Baylors Griffin Wins Heisman
description: After Robert Griffin III signed his letter of intent to play at Baylor, Coach Art Briles told him that he would develop into a player worthy of the Heisman Trophy. It might have seemed laughable then that an afterthought like Baylor could produce such a talent.

title: Photo Replay: Dec. 10
description: A look at the day in sports, including sailing in Australia, cricket in India and golf in Dubai.

title: Braun, N.L. M.V.P., Is Said to Test Positive
description: Ryan Braun, the reigning most valuable player in the National League and one of baseballs brightest young stars, has tested positive for a substance prohibited under the leagues drug policy, according to a person with knowledge of the results. He could be suspended for 50 games if his appeal of the result is denied.

title: Barcelona Beats Real Madrid, 3-1, in a True Clsico
description: Barcelona surrendered a shocking first-minute goal to Real Madrids Karim Benzema at the Bernabu on Saturday night, but rallied to post a 3-1 victory that moved it back to the top of the Spanish League standings. Read Jake Applemans article on the game here, and come back to comment.

title: Lottery Numbers
In Anaheim, a Welcome and a Lesson for Pujols
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  He could be forgiven for missing the distinction as he gazed out on another sea of red, after 72 hours that upended the game and redefined his life and career.

title: Bachmann on Newt/Romney
description: Michele Bachmann refutes Newt Gingrichs and Mitt Romneys records, saying she is a true conservative.

title: Gingrich on Romney Losing to Kennedy
description: Newt Gingrich says the only reason Mitt Romney didn't become a career politician was because he lost to Ted Kennedy in 1992.

title: Rick Perry on Fidelity
description: Rick Perry discusses the role of marital fidelity in an election.

title: Mitt Romney Suggests a $10,000 Bet
description: Mitt Romney suggests a $10,000 bet with Rick Perry.

title: Whos Afraid of Egypts Islamists?
description: The Op-Ed columnist Nicholas D. Kristof speaks with a cross-section of Egyptians about the rise of Muslim political parties in the country.

title: Corrections: December 11
description: NATIONAL

title: Race Reshaped, Rivals Target Gingrich in G.O.P. Debate
description: DES MOINES  Newt Gingrich offered a robust defense of his views on the Middle East, his lucrative work after leaving Congress and his conservative credentials during a spirited debate here on Saturday night as his Republican presidential rivals urged voters to take a hard look at his candidacy.

title: Mr. Whiteboy
description: Alex Cutler, a white man from Los Angeles, fell in love with the funk music scene in Rio de Janeiros dangerous slums. Now, as the slums are being cleaned up, he has made them his home.

title: Sarah Weintraub, Jason Rezmovits
description: Sarah Elizabeth Weintraub and Jason Israel Rezmovits are to be married Sunday at the Metropolitan Building, a restored factory in Long Island City, Queens. Rabbi Samuel Fraint is to officiate.

title: Barry Rosenthal, Alan Cohen
description: Dr. Barry Rosenthal and Alan Cohen are to be married Sunday at their Manhattan home. Rabbi Jill Hausman is to officiate.

title: Phoebe Harlan and Joshua Anderson
description: Phoebe Hazelwood Harlan and Joshua Paul Anderson were married Saturday evening at the Wit, a hotel in Chicago. Heath W. Carter, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Nolle Sherber and Ariel Rad
description: Dr. Nolle Starr Sherber, the daughter of Candace Somerall Sherber and Dr. Harvey S. Sherber of McLean, Va., was married Monday evening to Dr. Ariel Niroomand Rad, a son of Lydia N. Rad and Christian N. Rad of Holmdel, N.J. Alan M. Weiss, who was appointed a civil celebrant by the Circuit Court of Fairfax County, Va., for the event, officiated at the home of the brides parents. On Saturday evening the Rev. Charles Vere Nicoll, an Anglican priest, led a religious ceremony at St. Bartholomews Anglican Church in Gustavia, Saint Barthlemy, in the French West Indies.

title: James Li, Richard Dowling
description: James C. Li and Richard William Dowling were married Saturday at S. Dynasty, a restaurant in New York. The Rev. Jason E. Hill, a United Methodist minister, officiated.

title: Eve Oster, Shimshon Wexler
description: Dr. Eve Alyse Oster and Shimshon Wexler are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Yossi Posner at the Birmingham Marriott in Birmingham, Ala.

title: Jung Pak and Jay Habermann
description: Jung Hyun Pak and Jonathan Brewster Habermann were married Saturday afternoon. The Rev. Richard D. Sloan, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Pauls Chapel on the campus of Columbia University in Manhattan.

title: Marcio Hamerschlak, Andrew Koerner
description: Marcio Hamerschlak and Andrew Scott Koerner are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Ayelet S. Cohen at the Manhattan Penthouse, an event space in New York.

title: Miriam Romero and Alexis Wong
description: Dr. Miriam Guadalupe Romero and Dr. Alexis Darryl Wong, both radiologists, were married Saturday afternoon at the Langham Hotel in Pasadena, Calif. The Rev. Alberto V. Cordova, a Presbyterian minister and an uncle of the bride, led a nondenominational ceremony.

title: Emily Straub, Jeremy Sturchio
description: Emily Elizabeth Straub and Jeremy Giles Sturchio were married Saturday evening in the rotunda of the Ohio Statehouse in Columbus. James E. Barber, a judge of the Court of Common Pleas in Fulton County, Ohio, officiated.

title: Beth Sapery and Rosita Sarnoff
description: Beth Sapery and Rosita Sarnoff were married Saturday evening at their home in New York. Judge Jed S. Rakoff of Federal District Court in New York, officiated.

title: Amanda Webb, Kevin Healy
description: Amanda Webb and Kevin James Healy were married Saturday afternoon in New York. The Rev. George M. Witt, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Ignatius Loyola, where he is pastor.

title: Jessica Miely, Brandon Joseph
description: Jessica Lauren Miely and Brandon McKellar Joseph were married Saturday. The Rev. Dr. Richard Effinger performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of Bethesda-by-the-Sea in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: Elisa Jorgensen and Pete Duncan
description: Elisa Mead Jorgensen and Daniel Rowe Duncan were married Saturday at the First Congregational Church in Guilford, Conn. The Rev. Dr. Kendrick L. Norris, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: Kira Shalom, Peter Shankman
description: Kira Dawn Shalom and Peter Howard Shankman were married Saturday evening. Rabbi Norman J. Listokin performed the ceremony with Rabbi Gerald R. Sussman taking part at the Garment Center Congregation in New York.

title: Republicans Debate in Iowa
description: The Republican presidential candidates gathered in Iowa on Saturday night for a near two-hour exchange that mostly focused on Newt Gingrich.

title: Climate Talks in Durban Yield Limited Agreement
description: DURBAN, South Africa  After 72 hours of continuous wrangling, the 17th conference of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change wrapped up early Sunday with modest accomplishments: the promise to work toward a new global treaty in coming years and the establishment of a new climate fund.

title: After $10,000 Offer, Some Bet Against Romney
description: Saturday nights debate will probably be best remembered for Mitt Romney offering a $10,000 bet to Gov. Rick Perry of Texas. Mr. Perry was wise to decline the wager, which concerned the language that Mr. Romney used to describe his support for a health insurance mandate in his book.

title: The Caucus | Debate Wrap-Up
description: Dec. 10, 2011  Jeff Zeleny reports on the latest Republican presidential debate, with Newt Gingrich the clear front-runner and Mitt Romney offering a $10,000 bet to Rick Perry.

title: Fisher Fights; Underwood Cheers
description: Nashvilles Mike Fisher and Anaheims Bobby Ryan came to blows in the third period of the Predators 3-2 victory Saturday. Fisher, who the broadcasters noted was usually pretty evenly tempered, quickly knocked down Ryan, and the players were sent to the penalty box. Fishers biggest fan, his country music star wife Carrie Underwood, was in attendance and cheered him from a luxury box. As the broadcasters said, Everybody has their breaking points.

title: Caucus Video: Debate Wrap-Up
description: Jeff Zeleny reports on the latest Republican presidential debate, with Newt Gingrich the clear front-runner and Mitt Romney offering a $10,000 bet to Rick Perry.

title: Democrats Shift Aim to Gingrich After Debate
description: Who worries the Democratic National Committee after Saturday nights Republican debate?

title: Peru Official Steps Down Amid Fight Over a Mine
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Perus cabinet chief, Salomn Lerner, abruptly resigned Saturday after failing to negotiate a resolution to simmering protests against a large mining project led by an American company, the Newmont Mining Corporation. Perus president, Ollanta Humala, replaced Mr. Lerner with his interior minister, scar Valds Dancuart, a former military officer.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, December 11
description: With the presidential race heating up in Iowa and the payroll tax battle raging on in Washington, the Sunday shows get the latest from five presidential hopefuls and Senate leaders from both parties.

title: A Show in Rome Explores the Citys Role in the Renaissance
description: When it comes to the Renaissance, Florence is usually given top billing, as the birthplace of a movement that spread throughout Europe. But several cities played instrumental supporting roles, including Rome, a new exhibition there makes clear.

title: As Google Preens in Paris, France Briefly Becomes the Focus of Digital Optimism
description: PARIS  Eric E. Schmidt, Googles executive chairman, and President Nicolas Sarkozy of France acted like old friends. Karl Lagerfeld, the head designer at Chanel, introduced a new online-only fashion brand. The Ting Tings gave a private concert at the Louvre for a gathering of the global digerati at the LeWeb technology conference here.

title: Paying for Babies in Nagorno-Karabakh
description: When a couple marries in Nagorno-Karabakh, the government gives them a cash reward of $780. More money comes their way after the birth of their first child  and their second, third and fourth. Families with six children under the age of 18 receive a house.

title: The Silver Foot Award
description: Goes to Mitt Romney.

title: Housekeeping
description: I seem to have a new eruption of spammers, different from the previous one.

title: Debate Reverberates Going Into Final Stretch
description: Mitt Romney has 23 days to confront any political damage from what may become the most memorable moment of Saturday nights debate  the image of him offering to wager $10,000 to settle a bet with Rick Perry over the contents of Mr. Romneys latest book.

title: Face the Nation Plans Shift to Hourlong Format
description: The half-hour Sunday public affairs program on CBS, Face the Nation, will become an hourlong program next spring, matching its rivals on other television networks.

title: New Years Eve Leads Box Office but Trails Expectations
description: The Champagne was flat: New Years Eve was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend with about $13.7 million in ticket sales. But it failed to meet the prerelease estimates of analysts, who had anticipated sales of over $20 million.

title: Boosted by Putin, Russias Middle Class Turns on Him
description: MOSCOW  Hereis the rub for Vladimir V. Putin: The people who stood outside the Kremlin on Saturday, chanting epithets directed at him, are the ones who have prospered greatly during his 12 years in power.

title: Rival Campaigns Seize On Romneys $10,000 Bet
description: Read an updated version of this post.

title: Skating Rink Spurs Residents Latest Fight With Management
description: Updated with correction, Dec. 13 | In the eyes of some longtime residents of Stuyvesant Town in Manhattan, the ruin of their apartment complex has come in stages. First, the developments former managers, Tishman Speyer, opened a green market in 2008, which drew large crowds of nonresidents, and they scheduled noisy music concerts afterward.

title: Z100 Jingle Ball 2011
description: Photos of the concert at Madison Square Garden.

title: Wooing to Reap Revenge
description: The Bollywood film Ladies vs Ricky Bahl has much to recommend it at first, not least its premise. The young, feisty Dimple (Parineeti Chopra), the daughter of a New Delhi land magnate, is smitten with a physical trainer (Ranveer Singh), who wins over her parents before skipping town with some of their money. Dimple learns that Saira (Aditi Sharma), a shy daughter to a fabric dealer in Lucknow, suffered a similar fate with a bookish merchant, as did the hardheaded corporate climber Raina (Dipannita Sharma), with an art dealer in Mumbai. All the men, it seems, were one fellow, whom they call the Bloody Scoundrel. He has victimized 30 women  not with physical seduction but with charm, assumed names and swindles.

title: European Banks Hunt for Ways to Raise Cash
description: LONDON  As Europe continues to grapple with its sovereign debt crisis, many of the Continents banks are facing increased financing costs and limited access to much-needed cash, according to the Bank for International Settlements, an association of the worlds central banks.

title: Reads and Reactions
description: In this edition: Newt Gingrich on the rise, fashionably late G.O.P. candidates and brokered convention conversations.

title: Giants Cruz Already Has Reason to Dance
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Victor Cruz found two large photographs of himself at his locker when he arrived at the Giants practice facility Friday. Someone in the organization was requesting Cruzs autograph, perhaps for friends or family.

title: Israel Acts to Curb Illegal Immigration From Africa
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli government on Sunday announced plans to spend $160 million on efforts to stem the growing number of Africans who enter the country illegally, seeking jobs and political asylum. The money will go toward work on an Egyptian border fence that is already under construction, an expansion of detention centers and increased policing of companies that hire undocumented workers.

title: British Conservative Apologizes for Attending Party With Man Dressed in Nazi Outfit
description: The video captured the camaraderie at a bachelor party earlier this month. The celebrating men sat around a table at a restaurant in the French Alps, making toasts. But something was amiss. One jovial toast appeared to refer to theThird Reich. One man was dressed as a Nazi Waffen SS officer in full regalia. And next to him was a member of the British Parliament.

title: In an England of Certainties, Even in Its Undercurrents
description: The Strangers Child, Alan Hollinghursts fifth novel, opens on a scene in Harrow and Wealdstone, a suburb north of London chosen by the author to represent the middle ground, that is the space between the upper and lower orders  or rather, this being England in 1913, between the orders of lower upper middle and upper upper middle.

title: Marleys Ghost and Other Mash-Ups
description: The director Reid Farrington is a man of the moment. A multimedia collage artist who transcends genres, he makes plays that blend theater and film, drama with art installation. His work is formally impressive and conceptually fascinating, but sometimes its hard to tell if his experiments are a step forward or back.

title: Geraldo Rivera Gets Talk Deal on WABC Radio
description: Geraldo Riveras been called a lot of names in his life. Heres a new one: radio talk show host.

title: Arch-Rebel Turned New-Music Luminary
description: For all that the New York composer John Zorn retains his substantial cachet as a maverick, an outlier and a nose-thumbing rebel  and for all that he might prefer to maintain that impression  a sold-out concert at the Miller Theater of Columbia University on Friday night indicated his actual status. Through durable alliances with performers and concert presenters  as well as dogged persistence and a stream of challenging, edifying works  Mr. Zorn, at 58, is a towering pillar of a new-music universe he has worked tirelessly to foster and enrich.

title: The Winning Strategy of the Player of the Year
description: The diagramed deal occurred during the last round of the Keohane North American Swiss Teams on Dec. 4 at the Fall North American Championships in Seattle.

title: Jets Offense Finds Daylight as Path to Playoffs Opens
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Just wait, the Jets kept saying, telling anyone who would listen  and even those who wouldnt  to beware. Wait until their offense purred. Wait until their defense smothered. Wait until both happened on the same day, miracle of miracles.

title: A Poet Lonely and Adrift in New York
description: Wearing Lorcas Bowtie, a mood piece inspired by the writings of Federico Garca Lorca, features scenes in Spanish and English, but nothing said in either language makes as much of an impact as the quiet images in this impressionistic show.

title: Athhilezar? Watch Your Fantasy World Language
description: At his best friends wedding reception on the California coast, David J. Peterson stood to deliver his toast as best man. He held his Champagne glass high and shouted Hajas! The 50 guests raised their glasses and chanted Hajas! in unison.

title: Rosetta Throne: Learn to Speak Dothraki
description: Viewers of the HBO fantasy series Game of Thrones could be forgiven for thinking that the jagged, vaguely malevolent dialect spoken by the shows Dothraki tribe is just a random assortment of guttural noises. However, such assumptions would be ojil.

title: Central European Shadows
description: It didnt get much media attention, but last months Transition Report from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development devoted a chapter to deteriorating belief in democracy and markets in the transition economies of Europe; theres been a sharp decline in support for democracy, strongly correlated with the depth of economic crisis:

title: Cheeseburgers
description: OK, lets talk about the important stuff. Via Brad DeLong, Waldo Jaquith explains that eating cheeseburgers would have been highly impractical before the coming of modern manufacturing, transportation,refrigeration, and more. Eat your heart out, pin factory!

title: A Tour Alights in Finland and France
description: In an interview with the WQXR host Jeff Spurgeon, quoted on the WQXR blog, the Finnish soprano Karita Mattila said that when giving a recital, the challenge is always to find the intimacy and the contact with the audience, no matter how big the hall is.

title: Does School Choice Improve Education?
description: To the Editor:

title: Fluid States of Tension to Celebrate Connections
description: You might not expect works by Stefan Wolpe, Toru Takemitsu and Charles Wuorinen to share much common ground with Beethovens Diabelli Variations, and few pianists would be able to persuade you that they do. But then few pianists would assemble a program that would even raise the question.

title: Homeland Security Dept., on Immigrant Detention
description: To the Editor:

title: A Family Affair as Old as Oedipus
description: If it was not quite the ick heard round the world, there was a collective shudder that went up the spines of fans of serialized television at the moment it was revealed in the Dec. 4 episode of Boardwalk Empire, the Prohibition-era crime drama on HBO, that Jimmy Darmody, the aspiring young mobster played by Michael Pitt, had had an incestuous relationship with his mother (Gretchen Mol).

title: Of Hume and Bondage
description: Anyone admiring David Hume as I do finds much to cheer, but much to lament in the state of academic philosophy, as this year, the 300th anniversary of his birth, comes to a close. Hume was an anatomist of the mind, charting the ways we think and feel  a psychologist or cognitive scientist before his time. The cheering feature of the contemporary scene is that plenty of people are following in those footsteps. The nature versus nurture battle has declared an uneasy draw, but the human nature industry is in fine fettle, fed by many disciplines and eagerly consumed by the public.

title: Question for Congress
description: To the Editor:

title: A New Primary System
description: To the Editor:

title: Fighting Online Piracy
description: To the Editor:

title: Disabled Host, With the Emphasis on Able
description: Zach Anner is the most engaging personality on a network that needs them badly. The host of the travel show Rollin With Zach, which has its premiere on Monday night on OWN, the floundering Oprah Winfrey Network, with two episodes, hes witty and charming and mildly zany.

title: Its Back, and Even More Disgusting
description: It is probably one of the more unusual phone calls that a meat processing plant has ever received.

title: A Propulsive, Stylized Spectacle, in Which Bodies Lurch Backward
description: Is there a better group of people to finagle into intense audience participation than the Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater faithful? They are always primed for engagement: witness the anticipatory Revelations cheers as the lights dim or the ecstatic midperformance shout-outs. (Forget the path of righteousness; it is usually the Sinner Man section that draws the most raucous response, especially from women.)

title: Visionary Offered Surprises Till the End
description: In its final week of repertory in America, the Merce Cunningham Dance Company, dancing six works in three programs at the Brooklyn Academy of Music from Wednesday to Saturday, kept hitting high after high. The highs kept extending our sense both of these dancers, an exceptionally attractive, diverse and skilled group, and of Cunningham himself.

title: Monday: Poem For The Praiseworthy
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Hes not even completely grown, but my son has already joined the Emergency Room Frequent Fliers club. There was a time when we were on a first-name basis with many of the nurses at our local hospitals E.R., all of whom thankfully had the good taste and training not to keep bringing up the fact that we spent most of our time there. Those of you who have raised children or been responsible for one for any length of time know what Im talking about. Children are innocent creatures, filled with wonderment and the joy of experiencing the world for the first time, so it is completely natural for them to get themselves into predicaments that, had they happened to any normal adult, would have gotten that adult an immediate psychiatric evaluation (Exactly HOW did the vacuum cleaner get stuck on his tongue, Ms. Amlen?)

title: The Brewers Cornerstone Develops Unexpected Cracks
description: Ryan Braun can still tell you the high school class in which he got a B: Advanced Placement Chemistry. Otherwise, Braun said this summer, on the bench before a game in Milwaukee, he got straight As. He attended the University of Miami on a partial academic scholarship and has tried to apply the lessons he learned in the classroom, branching out from baseball to business.

title: Monday Matchup: Rams at Seahawks
description: Rams (2-10) at Seahawks (5-7), 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPNLine: Seahawks by 10

title: Merce Cunningham Dance Company
description: Photos of the company in performance at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Osgood Signs to Stay on CBS Sunday Morning
description: CBS News said on Friday that it had renewed its contract with Charles Osgood, below left, the longtime anchor of CBS Sunday Morning, and had promoted one of the shows contributors, Mo Rocca, bottom left. A CBS spokesman confirmed that Mr. Osgood had signed a new contract but declined the specify the length. This fall, when the correspondent Lee Cowan returned to the network from NBC, he was named a substitute for Mr. Osgood, who has anchored Sunday Morning since 1994. Mr. Rocca, a satirist who has contributed to the program since 2006, will become a full-time correspondent, the network said in a news release. He will also report for other CBS News broadcasts. Separately he will remain a panelist on NPRs Wait Wait ... Dont Tell Me! and the host of the Cooking Channels Food(ography). Last week the evening complement to CBS Sunday Morning, 60 Minutes, named Andrew Cohen to be the programs first legal analyst. CBS said that Mr. Cohen, who will remain the senior legal analyst for CBS Radio, would help 60 Minutes correspondents, producers and executives with law-related stories, including deciphering legal documents, providing sources from the legal community, and otherwise guiding the programs coverage of legal events and issues.

title: For Disney, a Younger Princess
description: LOS ANGELES  The Disney princesses exert a powerful hold on the imaginations of many girls, influencing everything from how they play to what they wear. Some parents think they can also send the wrong message to girls  that life isnt complete without Prince Charming, for instance.

title: A Widows Loneliness After Burying Her Children
description: When Alice Reiser, 89, wants to talk to her husband and sons, she turns to their photographs. They are all she has left of them, besides memories.

title: Fed to Weigh Publishing a Forecast on Rates
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserves decision three years ago to reduce short-term interest rates to nearly zero made a splash, both because the Fed had never pushed rates so low and because it said that it planned to keep rates near zero for some time.

title: At Some N.F.L. Positions, Stereotypes Create Prototypes
description: During a screening of a movie about the Tuskegee Airmen on Saturday, it finally occurred to me why the absence of white cornerbacks in the N.F.L.  or the presence of so many black ones  presents a compelling snapshot of the American condition.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Economic Reports This Week
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data will include retail sales for November and business inventories for October (Tuesday); import prices for November (Wednesday); weekly jobless claims; the Producer Price Index for November; the third-quarter current account deficit; industrial production and capacity utilization for November; the Philadelphia Fed manufacturing index for December and weekly jobless claims (Thursday); and the Consumer Price Index for November (Friday).

title: Barbers Blunders Give Tebow Big Assist
description: Tim Tebows latest comeback might have been his most improbable.

title: Class Matters. Why Wont We Admit It?
description: Durham, N.C.

title: Joseph Chamberlain, 88, Dies; Brought the Stars a Bit Closer
description: Joseph M. Chamberlain, who helped advance astronomical education and entertainment by leading planetariums in New York and Chicago into a new era of technology, instruction and visitor experience, died on Nov. 28 in Peoria, Ill., where he lived. He was 88.

title: Rabbi-Chaplains of the Civil War
description: Rabbi Dr. Arnold Fischel arrived at the White House on the morning of Dec. 11, 1861, prepared to act as a one-man lobby for the constitutional rights of Jews. He had traveled alone from New York, on his own dime, bringing several letters of recommendation from prominent Republicans and one from the Board of Delegates of American Israelites, then just three years old and the countrys only national Jewish organization.

title: American Owners Look to Turn A.S. Roma Into a Global Soccer Brand
description: It all started with some hasty scribbling on the back of a napkin at Stadio Olimpico in Rome.

title: Joe Restic, 85, an Innovator in Football at Harvard, Dies
description: Joe Restic, who devised a complex offense known as the multiflex while coaching in Canada and took it to Harvard, becoming its longest-serving football coach, died on Thursday in Boston. He was 85.

title: Will Congress Ban Corruption in Its Midst?
description: In a rare instance of Congressional bipartisanship, the Senate and House Judiciary Committees have quietly approved badly needed measures to tighten the anticorruption laws applicable to members of Congress. These laws have eroded across a decade of court decisions, and it remains to be seen whether the full Congress will tighten bans on fraud and bribe-taking by those in its ranks.

title: As Kindle Fire Faces Critics, Remedies Are Promised
description: The Kindle Fire, Amazons heavily promoted tablet, is less than a blazing success with many of its early users. The most disgruntled are packing the device up and firing it back to the retailer.

title: Noriega Is Sent to Prison Back in Panama, Where the Terror Has Turned to Shrugs
description: PANAMA  Nearly 22 years ago an American military plane whisked the de facto leader of this nation, Gen. Manuel Antonio Noriega, off to Florida to face trial, and ultimately a prison sentence, for drug trafficking.

title: This Time, Pac-12 Expansion Could Be in Another Country
description: Larry Scott, the Pacific-12 Conference commissioner, flew to Beijing on Sunday to start an apparently unprecedented effort by a college sports league to establish itself in a foreign country.

title: Are All Bloggers Journalists?
Bill Tapia, Virtuoso Ukulele Player, Dies at 103
description: In 2001 Bill Tapia took one of his guitars to a Southern California music shop to get it fixed. A woman was buying a ukulele, and Mr. Tapia asked to see it. He began playing it, masterfully, with a distinctive jazz inflection.

title: Romney and the $10,000 Bet
description: HUDSON, N.H.  When Mitt Romney, ever the prepared student, steps to the microphone to chat with reporters, he always has an answer ready for the big question of the day in this case, just what was he thinking when he offered Gov. Rick Perry of Texas a $10,000 wager in Saturday nights debate over his position on health care?

title: North Carolina Makes Lone Shot Count to Take the Title
description: HOOVER, Ala.  Ben Speas was a part of last years Akron team that won the College Cup. This year, he is the reason the University of North Carolina is bringing the N.C.A.A. mens soccer championship back to Chapel Hill.

title: State Takeovers of Other Districts Have Had Mixed Results
description: A state takeover can bring additional resources and expertise to a troubled district, allow for more radical changes, and help deter nepotism, bickering and personal agendas among school board members. But it is usually a last resort because of staunch local opposition.

title: A Romance With Risk That Brought On a Panic
description: Soon after taking the reins of MF Global in 2010, Jon S. Corzine visited the Wall Street firms Chicago offices for the first time, greeting the brokers, analysts and sales staff there.

title: Her Faith Is Rewarded
description: DEAR DIARY:

title: C.I.A. Leaves Base in Pakistan Used for Drone Strikes
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Central Intelligence Agency has vacated an air base in western Pakistan that it had been using for drone strikes against militants in the countrys tribal areas, the Pakistani military said on Sunday.

title: Final: Giants 37, Cowboys 34
description: Brandon Jacobs scored on a 1-yard touchdown in the final minute and defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul blocked a field goal attempt on Dallass final play as the Giants held off the Cowboys, 37-34, on Sunday night.

title: Growing Push in Newark to Retake School Reins
description: NEWARK  For a generation of Newark students, every education decision, including choices on curriculum, spending and superintendent, has been made by state officials in Trenton.

title: Options at Point Guard With Bibby Added
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Knicks finally had enough players for a training-camp scrimmage Sunday, and their practice gym was filled with the squeaking of sneakers and the chatter and cheering of enthusiastic players on two squads, one in white, one in blue.

title: A Second Exit by Odom Leaves Bryant Grumbling
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.  In a dizzying turn that dumbfounded players who were already reeling from the shock of recent events, the Los Angeles Lakers traded the popular veteran Lamar Odom to the Dallas Mavericks for a No. 1 pick and an N.B.A. technicality called a trade exception.

title: Elected Official, 24, Hopes to Interest Peers in Politics
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J.  Three blocks up from the historic brick train station  past the Grid Iron Waffle Shop, the grocer and a flock of quaint two- and three-story buildings  Alex Torpey was working at his desk one recent afternoon in South Oranges Village Hall.

title: Karzai Says Foreigners Are Responsible for Corruption
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  President Hamid Karzai of Afghanistan blamed foreigners on Sunday for the corruption of Afghan officials and demanded that the United States extradite the former chief of the Afghan Central Bank in connection with the collapse of Kabul Bank, the countrys largest financial institution.

title: An Injustice for Women in Uniform
description: Republican Senate leaders have an odd way of showing gratitude for the dedication and sacrifices of the more than 200,000 women on active duty in the military. Late last month, they blocked consideration of an amendment to the National Defense Authorization Act that would have lifted the statutory ban that denies female service members coverage for abortion care in cases of rape and incest. Currently, military health plans pay for abortions only when a pregnancy endangers a womans life.

title: I Am Eggbert, and I Know Your Name
description: NEW WINDSOR, N.Y.  Alexandria Krol, 5, grew wide-eyed as she walked in the darkness up to the strange-looking egg.

title: Summitt Still Inspires, Often in Silence
description: The coach who is most credentialed in her sport to speak her mind and was never shy about expressing herself no longer addresses the news media after a game. Such is the new abnormal for Pat Summitt and her famous Tennessee womens basketball team.

title: Jets Keeping Drive Alive

title: Detainee in Iraq Poses a Dilemma as U.S. Exit Nears
description: WASHINGTON  As United States troops prepare to exit Iraq at the end of the month, the Obama administration is facing a significant dilemma over what to do with the last remaining detainee held by the American military in Iraq.

title: The Unprofitable Skies
description: For travelers facing down another holiday season of crowded flights, American Airlines filing for bankruptcy protection may be more bad news. The companys employees and pensioners are already bracing for job and benefit cuts. Yet the pain brought on by a big bankruptcy is unlikely to transform the industry into a profitable one.

title: To Find the Perfect New York Mayor, Only 2 Years Left
description: It is recruiting season in New York City, but the targets are not investment banking analysts or college athletes. They are potential candidates for mayor.

title: Getting Gas Drilling Right
description: After several crowded and often raucous hearings, Gov. Andrew Cuomo agreed to give the public until Jan. 11 to comment on 2,000 pages of environmental analysis and proposed regulations designed to govern natural gas drilling in deep shale formations in New York State. The extension makes sense. The drilling decision is a momentous one, for the environment and the economy, and it is vitally important to get it right.

title: Depression and Democracy
description: Its time to start calling the current situation what it is: a depression. True, its not a full replay of the Great Depression, but thats cold comfort. Unemployment in both America and Europe remains disastrously high. Leaders and institutions are increasingly discredited. And democratic values are under siege.

title: Among Gingrichs Passions, a Doomsday Vision

description: When the star pass rusher and the starting quarterback were lost for the season, when the best running back and wide receiver missed time, when the backup quarterback broke his collarbone in his first start, this seemed like another doomed season for the Houston Texans.

title: Physicists Anxiously Await New Data on God Particle

title: Disruptions: Privacy Fades in Facebook Era
description: As much as it pains me to say this: privacy is on its deathbed. I came to this sad realization recently when a stranger began leaving comments on photos I had uploaded to Instagram, the iPhone photo-sharing app.

title: Russian Orthodox Church Adds Influential Voice to Calls for Election Reform
description: MOSCOW  The Russian Orthodox Church added its influential voice over the weekend to calls for a just election process in Russia. The step followed demonstrations across the country that called for a recount or a fresh vote, and outpourings from individual members of the churchs clergy, who reflected popular anger at the flawed Dec. 4 election.

title: Election Day Is Calm in Ivory Coast
description: Ballot-counting began on Sunday night in Ivory Coast, in the first legislative election in more than a decade. Results were most likely to shore up support for President Alassane Ouattara as he pushes to overhaul the cocoa industry.

title: Putting a Price on Michael Kors
description: The fashion designer Michael Kors is seeking a luxury price tag on his stock. His companys initial public offering, expected this week, would value it at up to $3.6 billion. The metrics are in line with Prada, which listed earlier this year. But Michael Kors Holdings may struggle to sustain the growth needed to stay in style with investors.

title: Inquiry Set on Hospital Fire in India
description: MUMBAI, India (Bloomberg)  West Bengals chief minister on Sunday ordered a judge-led investigation into the nations worst fire in seven years, Fridays inferno at the Advanced Medical Research Institute hospital in which 94 people died.

title: Scandal Over Mediator, a French Weight-Loss Drug, Prompts Calls for Wide Changes
description: PARIS  In 33 years on pharmacy shelves here, the diabetes drug Mediator was prescribed to an estimated five million French patients, many of them diabetics, many others hoping simply to lose weight. When French authorities ordered the drug off the market in 2009, alerted to possible cardiovascular risks, there were 300,000 active prescriptions.

title: Rob Lowe Lands Another Book Deal
description: One of the unlikely breakout publishing stars of 2011 was the actor Rob Lowe, whose memoir, Stories I Only Tell My Friends, spent months on the New York Times best-seller list and was praised by critics for an intelligence and humor that surpassed that of the typical celebrity book. Seven months after that debut, Mr. Lowe has made another book deal, this time with Simon & Schuster, for Love Life, a book that will focus on topics including sex, marriage, money, work, fatherhood and sports, drawing upon Mr. Lowes own experiences and observations, the publisher is to announce on Monday. The first book proved that Rob Lowe is a great storyteller, Jonathan Karp, the publisher of Simon & Schuster, said in a statement. The second book will prove that he can write about anything and continue to captivate readers. The book is expected to be released in 2013.

Smith declined to answer any questions about Jim Leonhard, who hurt his right knee after a second-quarter interception. Smith did not know the severity of Leonhards injury, he said, so dont bother asking. He did not want to speculate.

title: The Long View: Parliamentary Paralysis
description: For nearly three weeks now, the Indian Parliament has resembled a patient in a coma, its faculties frozen, its strength ebbing, with no flickers of consciousness at all. The doctors profess themselves flummoxed. No business has been transacted in the winter session of the upper and lower houses at all; instead, the opposition has substituted debate with stubborn rabble-rousing, while the government has flailed weakly against a phalanx of internal crises.One news report has estimated that the time lost by disruptions and adjournments has already cost the taxpayer more than Rs 250 million. Improbably, this paralysis has even prompted a member of Parliament  Shashi Tharoor, in an article for Tehelka  to propose doing away with his own institution, a public gesture of limp-handed helplessness if there ever was one.

description: Listening, like other skills, can be developed through practice, or lost if not used regularly. Good listeners focus on what they are hearing. They pause to think about what theyve heard before responding. They ask questions because they want to know the answers, not just to keep the conversation going. Do you often find yourself in the company of good listeners? Would you describe yourself as a good listener? Why or why not?In the op-ed piece The Art of Listening, Henning Mankell writes about what he has learned from living a straddled existence, with one foot in African sand and the other in European snow:

title: New Delhis Controversial Birth
description: Few cities of recent vintage have a history as complicated and contested as New Delhi, which turned 100 on Monday. Now the seat of the worlds largest democracy, New Delhi began in 1911 as a grand imperial showpiece meant to stand for eternal British rule over the Indian subcontinent. But during its two decades of construction New Delhi became the stage upon which Indians gained increasing political advantage over a crumbling Raj.

title: Rumor Fever
description: HONG KONG  China hosts some 300 million microblog accounts (including my own), and officials say that domestic social media put out more than 200 million posts every day. In hopes of getting a handle on this potentially threatening surge of information, the government has started a campaign that aims to quash what it calls rumors  statements that it says threaten the public order but that it has not bothered to define. After a series of public opinion disasters this past year, the Communist Party has been pressuring social media providers to weed out allegations it finds threatening, and state media have tried to whip up fear over their malignant social effects.The partys fever over rumors began in August, following the July 23 high-speed rail collision in Wenzhou. The government took a public opinion beating over the crash, in large part because social media harnessed anger over the bungled rescue effort, the safety of the high-speed rail network and corruption in the Railways Ministry. Once party leaders wrested back control of the story, they pushed all relevant facts into the darkness, leaving only rumors to sate the publics appetite for the truth. And this summer two other embarrassing public opinion defeats for Chinas leadership originally took off on the Internet: the Guo Meimei affair, which exposed irregularities at the government-run Red Cross Society of China, and the massive and well-organized public demonstrations against a chemical project in Dalian.

title: A Year-End Candidate for a 10 Worst List
description: When I was 15, slightly more than a decade or two ago, I went with a friend on New Years Eve to watch the ball drop in Times Square. It wasnt the dumbest thing Ive ever done, not by a long shot. But there are good reasons why, slightly more than a decade or two later, I havent repeated the experience. New Years Eve can be tough enough. Why make matters worse by standing for hours in the cold, packed together with thousands upon thousands of strangers?

title: House Democrats Bullish on 2012 Prospects

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 12
description: The characters in Game of Thrones, the HBO series from the fantasy novels of George R. R. Martin, speak Dothraki, a language with more than 3,250 words. Dothraki was created by David J. Peterson, a 30-year-old conlanger, a person who constructs new languages. (Of course, even real languages are products of invention  for example, my dictionary doesnt have the world conlanger.) The lengths the producers have gone to have a consistent language, Amy Chozick writes, represents Hollywoods growing need to infuse fantasy and science-fiction movies, television series and video games with a sense of believability. It was true for Avatar, which included a robust language, Navi, that was spoken by the giant blue inhabitants of Pandora. The inventor of Navi is developing a Martian language called Barsoomian for John Carter, a science-fiction movie from Disney.

title: Russian Mogul Joins the Race Against Putin
description: MOSCOW  There were no balloons or streamers at the hastily arranged news conference on Monday where Mikhail D. Prokhorov announced that he would challenge Vladimir V. Putin in this springs presidential elections: just Mr. Prokhorov on the podium, looking grave.

title: Monday Reading: How to Find Bargain Lift Tickets
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

description: LONDON  Whitehaven Coal has agreed to buy another Australian coal company, Aston Resources, in an all-stock deal worth about $2.8 billion.

title: Quick Look | Architecture, ASAP
description: Tina DiCarlo, Danielle Rago and Silvia Franceschini are on a mission to change the way people think about architecture. They are the curators of the Archive of Spatial Aesthetics and Praxis, or ASAP, an online archive that was founded by DiCarlo in 2010 with the goal of collecting and exhibiting architecture as part of a broader social, political and aesthetic discourse.

title: No Draghi Ex Machina
description: So last week European leaders announced a plan that, on the face of it, was pure nonsense. Faced with a crisis that is mainly about the balance of payments, with fiscal crisis as a secondary consequence, they supposedly committed everyone to severe fiscal austerity, which would guarantee a recession while leaving the real problem unaddressed.

title: Leading Off: Comebacks Are All in the Believing
description: After the N.F.L. produced not one, but two breathtaking comebacks with season-rattling implications, it was hard not to marvel at the quarterbacks who made them happen. Yes, both men got a lot of help. Eli Manning would not be king of a saved Giants season had Jason Pierre-Paul not blocked a field goal attempt in the final second that would have sent the Cowboys to overtime, and Tim Tebow would not be doing another victory/prayer lap had Matt Prater not kicked a 59-yarder to get the Broncos to overtime.
