Glenn CollinsWNBC: Cilantro has been recalled in New Jersey and six other states because of salmonella.  Nick Fox

title: Obamas Take on Wall Street Prosecutions
description: President Obama, in an interview with 60 Minutes, talked extensively about unemployment, the economy and his approach to making policy. One of the more interesting moments in the wide-ranging CBS News interview came when Steve Kroft asked Mr. Obama about the lack of prosecutions related to the financial crisis.

title: Three Excerpts from 'Christmas Remixed'
description: Listen to an excerpt of 'It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year (A Shrift Remix)' from 'Christmas Remixed' by Andy Williams.

title: Samurai Shopper  | Give Greece a Chance
description: Much as I long to live in a blinkered bubble of my own devising, the Samurai Shopper cannot ignore the endless news loops of Mitts and Newts, unemployment statistics, and the imminent collapse of the Eurozone due to fiscal laxity and mounting sovereign debt that will topple the civilized world and also America.

title: Just a Man Singing About a Muppet Whos Singing About a Man
description: Am I a man, or am I a Muppet? If Im a Muppet, then Im a very manly Muppet.

title: The Caucus Click: Occupy Iowa?
On Our Radar: An Environmental Watch List
description: Vermont Law School posts its annual watch list of environmental issues, led by Republicans attacks on the Environmental Protection Agency in Congress and on the presidential campaign trail. [Vermont Law School]

title: In Prison, Remnants of Military Life
description: For many veterans, military custom never really fades, even long after returning from the battlefield. An article in Mondays Times looks at efforts by several states to use aspects of military service to help incarcerated veterans.

title: Philippine Chief Justice Is Impeached
description: MANILA  The Philippine House of Representatives on Monday impeached the chief justice of the Supreme Court, alleging corruption and biased judgments in favor of former President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, who appointed him to the post.

title: Debasing The Dollar, Not
description: Hmm. I was looking at the Thomson Reuters/Jefferies commodity price index, which has been trending down since the spring:

title: New Royal Caribbean Ad
description: "The Sea Is Calling," is the theme of a new advertising campaign for Royal Caribbean.

title: Court to Weigh Arizona Statute on Immigration
description: WASHINGTON  In the space of a month, the Supreme Court has thrust itself into the center of American political life, agreeing to hear three major cases that could help determine which party controls the House of Representatives and whether President Obama wins a second term.

title: The Trouble With Debates
description: Since my Sunday column takes on the idea that the Republican Party needs a candidate (i.e. Newt Gingrich) who can out-orate and out-debate the president, I should highlight Fred Barnes piece making the case that the unprecedented number of G.O.P. debates has contributed to the policy unseriousness of the campaign to date:

title: What to Give the Teacher for the Holiday
description: Will you give something to your childrens teachers this holiday season? My wholly unscientific survey says that you will  or that if you dont, youll feel guilty about it. These are the weeks when schools send out gift policies, classroom parents take up collections and parents start weighing the options for showing beloved teachers how much they mean to a child (or for checking another obligation off the list, depending on your kid and your perspective).

title: Rethinking the Timeless Colorado Plateau
description: To many of the hundreds of thousands of visitors who travel each year to the red rock country of the West and to national parks like Arches and Bryce Canyon, the landscape can feel timeless. The strange wind- and water-carved formations speak of ages past, presented to the modern tourist as a finished work, often cast quite literally in stone.

title: Romneys Heated Exchange With a Veteran
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  A question about same-sex marriage from a Vietnam veteran led to a heated exchange with Mitt Romney on Monday morning as Mr. Romney was making the rounds at a restaurant here.

title: Martin Marietta Materials Makes $4.8 Billion Hostile Bid for Vulcan
description: 7:53 p.m. | Updated

title: Are We Suffering Global Gadget Fatigue?
description: Are people suffering from gadget overload? Are they exhausted by the consumer equivalent of the brain fatigue  information overload  that is caused by a constant updates of devices and online media?

title: The Loaves of New York
description: New York magazine has a great roundup of the glories of New York bread baking. Rob Patronite and Robin Raisfeld pick their 13 favorite breads from bakeries (La Boulangerie, Nordic Breads) and restaurants (Robertas, Vandaag). Theres a name-that-loaf (and knot)  slide show, a short primer on the  qualities of good bread, a timeline  back beyond the Hessian-fly infestation of the 1780s, and a profile of Sullivan Street Bakerys Jim Lahey, uncensored.

title: Amazon Denies It Has a Small-Business Problem
description: For years  since its inception  Amazon has been at implicit war with local brick-and-mortar stores. Last week, the implicit seemingly became explicit when Amazon began a promotion that encouraged customers to check out prices at local retailers and use a specially designed Price Check smartphone app to report what they found back to Amazon. Customers who then purchased the same item from Amazon received a 5 percent discount, up to $5. (The deal was available only from Friday night through Saturday, and only for certain kinds of products.)

title: Riders, Tigers and a Drill Sergeant at Long Beach Motorcycle Show
description: LONG BEACH, Calif.  Over the weekend, the Progressive International Motorcycle Show brought out celebrities and the prospect of imprudent speed to the Long Beach Convention Center.

title: How to Get Real About Risk
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah. His sketches are archived here on the Bucks blog. His new book, The Behavior Gap, will be out in January.

title: Numberplay: Tanton Wordless
description: There are patterns all around us  treasures to explore. Take a simple 5-by-5 grid. If you start at a corner you can trace an unbroken line through the remaining 24 squares in the grid without going through any square more than once.

title: Really? The Claim: Shoveling Snow Raises the Risk of a Heart Attack
description: THE FACTS

title: The Simplest Roast Duck
description: Melissa Clark, A Good Appetite columnist, demonstrates a simple way to get a roast duck with crispy skin.

title: Obama and Iraqi Premier Signify Shift to a Postwar Partnership
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, welcoming Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki of Iraq to the White House on Monday, said that after nearly nine years of war, Iraq had become a sovereign, self-reliant and democratic country that could serve as a model for aspiring democrats across the Middle East.

title: Street Style: Velvet and Velour
description: The best of readers street style for the week of Dec. 5.

title: The Simplest Roast Duck
description: Despite its reputation as a complicated bird, crisp-skinned, juicy-fleshed duck is nearly as easy to achieve as chicken, but it is far more festive and flavorful. This video shows what is just about the easiest way I know to roast one: just prick the skin all over with a knife, season liberally and roast until the surface is burnished and crackling. Its perfect to serve for the holidays and all winter long.

title: New Head of Theater at Bard Will Also Program Arts Center
description: 12:09 p.m. | Updated

title: Sununu Disputes Gingrich Account of Tax Fight
description: LONDONDERRY, N.H.  The rivalry between the surging Newt Gingrich and Mitt Romney in Mr. Romneys backyard bastion of New Hampshire took a new twist Monday over competing memories of events surrounding the elder George Bushs breaking of his no new taxes pledge.

title: Winehouses Father Against Planned Biopic
description: Amy Winehouses father, who has made it plain he intends to be the steward of her posthumous image, says he will not allow the singers former boyfriend to use her songs in a film about her life, The Daily Mail reported.

title: Wilson Sonsini Adds 10 Partners
description: Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati said on Monday that it had added 10 new partners to its practice.

title: Military Detention: Not Only Legally Flawed, but Inefficient and Expensive
description: Ever since President George W. Bush decided to militarize the detention and prosecution of Islamist terrorists, supporters of that decision have claimed that dealing with terrorists as prisoners of war is tougher than using F.B.I. agents, Justice Department prosecutors and federal courts.

title: Ronald J. Gorsky: Have Passion for Every Student
Fte After Fte | On the Hunt for Holiday Dresses
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: The Many Virtues of Tyson Chandler
description: In Tyson Chandler, New York has a perfect complement to Carmelo Anthony and Amare Stoudemire. Chandler is an elite back line defender, and his presence alone will go a long way toward revamping what was the leagues 22nd-ranked defense last season.

title: Few at Putin Partys Rally, and Even Fewer Willingly
description: MOSCOW  Increasingly assailed by charges of electoral fraud, Russias governing party, United Russia, held a rally in Moscow on Monday apparently meant as a show of strength after a big anti-Kremlin protest over the weekend.

title: Critics Picks: Pulp Fiction
description: A. O. Scott looks at structure and craft in Quentin Tarantinos seminal film.

title: Think of Rango as a 3-D Movie Without the Glasses
description: With a slew of critics groups recommending it, Rango is quickly becoming the leader of the pack for the animation Oscar. Directed by Gore Verbinski (the first three Pirates of the Caribbean), the story of a chameleon adrift in a frontier town is a richly detailed, clever western full of film references and adult jokes. As the first feature-length animated movie from the effects wizards at Industrial Light & Magic, its also a rare 2-D contender in a field increasingly dominated by 3-D films (The Adventures of Tintin, Arthur Christmas).

title: Vegetable Soups, Smooth and Hearty
description: Pured vegetable soups satisfy my craving for comfort food and prove the point that a dish doesnt have to be rich, heavy or meaty to be comforting and filling. The classic French model is a rich affair, usually finished with cream, crme friche or a bchamel. But a potato or a half cup of rice added to the soup with the vegetables is just as efficient a thickener.

title: When Care Is Worth It, Even if End Is Death
description: Twenty years ago, I helped save a mans life.

title: When Pap Smears Are No Longer Needed
description: Many women past 65 can stop getting annual Pap smears to screen for cervical cancer, medical panels agree.

title: As Syria Urges Local Voting, U.N. Puts Toll From Clashes Past 5,000
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The death toll in the Syrian uprising has exceeded 5,000, a United Nations official said on Monday.

title: An Interview With Gideon Rosen
description: Gideon Rosen is a professor of philosophy and chair of the Council of the Humanities at Princeton University. He is the author, with John Burgess, of the 1997 book, A Subject With No Object (Oxford University Press). We interviewed him in Princeton, N.J. in March 2011.

title: Youve Got Jail Mail
description: Michael A. Kimelman, a hedge fund trader on the outer edge of Raj Rajaratnams enormous insider trading conspiracy, reported to the Federal Bureau of Prisons on Monday, surrendering at the United States Penitentiary in Lewisburg, Pa.

title: Want Unemployment Benefits? Well Need a Urine Sample
description: If you follow Congress (and who could blame you if you gave up on that years ago) its important to look out for normal-seeming bills that are, in fact, filled with poisonous little bits of legislative mischief making.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Q: (Reader)

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Ariad Custom Communications, Toronto, hired an employee and promoted two others. Neil Woodley joins the agency as a creative director; he had been associate creative director at Launch, part of CIM. Also, Rob Ciancamerla and James Palmer, art directors, were promoted to creative directors.

title: Brookfield Deals With Protesters Again, but Not at Zuccotti
description: Updated 3:25 p.m. | At least 17 Occupy Wall Street protesters were arrested on Monday at the World Financial Center, whose owner, Brookfield Properties, also owns Zuccotti Park, the public space where the protesters maintained an encampment for two months before being cleared by the police in mid-November.

title: The Year in Media | Comedys Comeback on TV
description: Staff members of The Timess media news department are highlighting the most significant developments this year in the industries they cover.

title: Ads Urge Consumers to Dial S for Shellphone
description: A new campaign takes advantage of the omnipresence of cellphones to encourage consumers to unplug and get away from it all.

title: The Giving Spree | Narciso Rodriguez
description: Who: The designer Narciso Rodriguez

title: Final Rules Set for Insurers on Spending Ratios
description: If an insurance company is not spending $4 of every $5 of a consumers premium on medical care, a health plan subscriber will not only get a rebate beginning next year, but it will be tax free, according to final rules out on so-called medical-loss ratios that are part of the health care legislation.

title: St. Anns Warehouse Signs Lease for New Space in Dumbo
description: St. Anns Warehouse, the Brooklyn theater that has provided a home for highly regarded productions including Black Watch and Misterman, will itself continue to have a home in Dumbo, not far from its current location in that neighborhood. The theater said on Monday that it had signed a three-year lease for a new space at 29 Jay Street, where it plans to open next fall after leaving its longtime base of operations at 38 Water Street following the conclusion of its current season in May.

title: Congo President Kabila Denies Reports of Election Fraud
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Rejecting widespread criticism of the recent presidential election here, the incumbent, Joseph Kabila, said Monday that there was no reason to doubt he had been fairly re-elected.

title: AT&T and Justice Dept. Ask Judge to Stay T-Mobile Case
description: AT&T and Deutsche Telekom requested a stay of proceedings in the Justice Departments lawsuit to block AT&Ts $39 billion takeover of T-Mobile USA, as the two telecommunications giants weigh their options for the deal.

title: Pondering a Dire Day: Leaving the Euro
description: LONDON  It would be Europes worst nightmare: after weeks of rumors, the Greek prime minister announces late on a Saturday night that the country will abandon the euro currency and return to the drachma.

title: Long Safe, Marinos Mark Is in Danger
description: Finally on Sunday, the N.F.L. stopped Aaron Rodgers at something.

title: Auditor Faults Overcapacity of European Fleets
description: Europes efforts to limit overcapacity in its fishing fleet have been a costly failure, an official auditor said Monday in a report that raised serious questions about the blocs ability to manage its marine resources.

title: U.S. Judge Grants Delay in Challenge to AT&T Deal
description: WASHINGTON  AT&T has one month to tell a Federal District Court judge and the Justice Department whether it will pursue its proposed $39 billion acquisition of T-Mobile USA in its current form, in a modified structure, or if it will drop the deal altogether.

title: For Sale (Again): the Orson Welles Oscar
description: LOS ANGELES  The Orson Welles Oscar is back on the block. The Nate D. Sanders auction house here says it is selling the screenwriting Oscar that was awarded to Welles in 1942 for his work, with Herman J. Mankiewicz, on Citizen Kane. The statuette was best known in recent years as the subject of a court fight in which Welless daughter  having recovered it from a cinematographer who said Welles had given it to him as a gift  defeated an effort by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences to block a sale.

title: Id Be Happy to Share My Thoughts and Experiences as We Go Down
description: On Dec. 10, 2009, I was sitting at my desk, reading this blog  I think it was a post by Jay Goltz. My business was not doing well. His was struggling, too, but clearly he wasnt as close to the edge as I was. I sent the following e-mail to the editor of this blog:

title: An Extension, and a Move, for Venus in Fur
description: The Broadway production of the David Ives play Venus in Fur, starring Nina Arianda and Hugh Dancy, will take a break after ending its run at the Manhattan Theater Clubs Samuel J. Friedman Theater on Sunday and resume performances at the Lyceum Theater on Feb. 7, 2012, for a limited engagement through June 17.

title: The Life Report: Ann Bless
description: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

title: The Twice-Victimized of Sexual Assault
description: Nearly every woman I know can recall one or more instances in which she was sexually assaulted, harassed, threatened, inappropriately touched or even raped.

title: Intel Expects Lower Revenue Because of Drive Shortage
description: Intel has announced that it expects revenue in the fourth quarter to be 7 percent less than expected, or $1 billion.

title: Critics Picks Video: Pulp Fiction
description: This week, A.O. Scott looks back at Quentin Tarantinos seminal 1994 feature, Pulp Fiction. Using interlocking stories to recount the lives and travails of a selection of Los Angeles criminals, the film defined, for a new generation, how a movie could be cool, Mr. Scott says. Mr. Tarantino, a devoted film fan and former video-store clerk, used his encyclopedic knowledge of cinema to pay homage to the movies he loved, while also creating an original style that would become influential to many filmmakers.

title: Iran Is Asked to Return U.S. Drone
description: President Obama said on Monday that the United States had asked Iran to return an American surveillance drone that the Iranians say they captured on Dec. 4. It was Mr. Obamas first public comment about the drone, a remote-controlled spying aircraft, in a case that has raised American tensions with Iran.

title: Gingrich Endorses Marriage Pledge
description: Newt Gingrich became the latest Republican candidate to endorse the so-called marriage pledge, a controversial document put forward by an influential evangelical group in Iowa that opposes same-sex marriage and abortion.

title: Google Acquisition of Motorola Delayed in Europe
description: BRUSSELS  European antitrust regulators have suspended their investigation into Googles acquisition of Motorola Mobility, a maker of smartphones, until Google provides additional evidence in the case, the European Commission said Monday.

title: In Debate About Fighting in Hockey, Medical Experts Weigh In
description: The determination that the hockey enforcer Derek Boogaard had a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated hits to the head when he died in May at 28 has fueled a debate among medical experts over whether the sport should ban fighting.

title: Two Die in Suspected Murder-Suicide in Chelsea
description: Two men were fatally shot in a public housing building in Chelsea on Monday morning, the police said. The police said the shooting appeared to be a murder-suicide.

title: Rethinking Your Approach to the Tooth Fairy
description: In the Styles section of The New York Times this weekend, Bruce Feiler goes after the tooth fairy. What could be wrong with the tooth fairy? Plenty, he argues.

title: Meryl Streep, Cover Girl
description: Youd think by this point Meryl Streep would have accomplished every possible feat in her professional life. But early on Monday afternoon, Ms. Streep added one or two more. She was a trending topic on Twitter (at least in New York), off the news of another first: her first Vogue cover, at age 62. Photographed by Annie Leibovitz, shes sitting in the surf on a beach and later striding through a crop of organic broccoli sustainably farmed in upstate New York, according to the accompanying story. In it, she talks about feminism, politics and campaigning for a National Womens History Museum, for which she donated $1 million.

title: Romney-Gingrich Skirmishing Intensifies
description: LONDONDERRY, N.H.  Newt Gingrich and Mitt Romney both campaigned hard in New Hampshire on Monday, and the two Republican leaders in the polls looked like they could go 15 rounds before the day was finished.

title: Crosby Sidelined Indefinitely by Return of Symptoms
description: Sidney Crosby, the N.H.L.s biggest star, said Monday that he was experiencing concussion symptoms again and that he would sit out indefinitely.

title: Lens: Maggie Taylor
description: Lens: Maggie Taylor

title: What Goes With Glogg? Swedish Gingersnaps
description: When I heard that the talented Swedish photographer Marcus Nilsson was shooting the still-life for my column on glogg, I knew hed get it just right: he grew up with glogg, after all. He also grew up with pepparkakor  the spicy, buttery gingersnaps that often accompany glogg  and offered to share his moms recipe. I was born in spring 1972, and she started making gingersnaps that Christmas, Nilsson told me. Since then, he said, she has used the same recipe every year. Theyre amazing.

title: Acura Prepares Product Blitz, Including NSX Concept, for Detroit Auto Show
description: Acura, a brand that has largely been overlooked by luxury buyers wooed by products from Lexus, Infiniti and the German manufacturers, intends to become a player again.

title: Ray Eames: How She Dressed
description: To design aficionados the name Charles Eames conjures an image of the screen-idol handsome design visionary, studiedly natty in his tweed coats and bow ties. The figure of Ray, his wife and collaborator, is somewhat more elusive. But now a new documentary, Eames: The Architect and the Painter, brings Ray into sharper focus, the filmmakers Jason Cohn and Bill Jersey training their sights on her personal style, a quirky composite of diffidence and daring.

title: Some Holiday Cheer for Homeless Families
description: On the Sunday between Black Friday and Cyber Monday, 60 Minutes broadcast a story called Hard Times Generation. Homeless teens Arielle and Austin Metzger described living in their dads van, brushing their teeth in service stations and doing what they can to get by with touching self-possession and gratitude for what they did have  school, their dad, and one another. Younger kids, gathered in small forum at a local school, discussed living without a permanent home  staying up all night in the back seat to watch over a sleeping mother to keep her safe; moving into a hotel (and agreeing to repaint all of its rooms) for shelter.

title: Modern Warfare 3 Passes $1 Billion in Sales in 16 Days
description: Modern Warfare 3, the first-person shooter video game, passed $1 billion in sales in just 16 days, according to Activision Blizzard, the games distributor. Modern Warfare 2, an earlier installment of the game, took 60 days to reach the same milestone.

title: Learning How to Kill Trees
description: Scientists trying to understand the future of forests on a warming planet have a strange problem: They do not know how to kill trees.

title: Asked & Answered | Andr Saraiva
description: The French graffiti artist, night-life impresario and hotel entrepreneur Andr Saraiva this year turned his talents to filmmaking, released a CD with Kitsun, teamed up with Levis to create a jacket for MoCAs Art in the Streets exhibition, became creative director of LOfficiel Hommes and opened a London location of his Paris nightclub, Le Baron. With all this going on, its little wonder New York is still waiting for its version of Saraivas famously hedonistic club  my Christmas present to New York  rumored to be opening on Mulberry Street before the end of the year. The Moment grabbed Saraiva for a few minutes to get the lowdown on what makes a Le Baron party.

title: Photo Replay: Dec.12
description: The world sailing championships continued off Fremantle, Australia, and the Arab Games continued in Doha, Qatar.

title: The Evangelical Bloc in Iowa
description: Divisions among Iowa's social conservatives are providing an opportunity for their least favored candidate, Mitt Romney.

title: Class Parent: Mama, What Is Our Culture?
Protest Reaches 900 Principals, and Climbing
The Big Sleep
description: Q. Ever since childhood, I have needed more sleep than most. Why do some people need so much more sleep than others?

title: Another Deal for Hornets Chris Paul Is Off
description: 3:55 p.m. | Updated LOS ANGELES  After 24 hours as the new front-runner in the hunt for Chris Paul, the Clippers fell by the wayside Monday.

title: Solar Walk: The Best  Maybe Only  Reason to Get a 3-D TV
description: To date, I still dont get 3-D TV. I mean, I understand it, but I fail to see the appeal.

title: Iowa Evangelicals Split Over Caucus Endorsement
description: DES MOINES  Bob Vander Plaats, president of the Family Leader, a conservative advocacy group popular with evangelical Christians here, has been saying supportive things recently about Newt Gingrich, suggesting that social conservatives are open to looking past his extramarital affairs and two divorces as they make a choice in the Republican presidential race.

title: James & Richard
description: In this homemade video, James Li and Richard Dowling discuss how music brought them together at Yale University 25 years ago.

title: Jets Leonhard Out for Season Once Again
description: Jim Leonhard accepted words of encouragement from his teammates Monday in a crowded training room at the Jets facility in Florham Park, N.J. He seemed upbeat and in good spirits, Antonio Cromartie said, though no one could fault Leonhard for wondering just what he had done to deserve this.

title: Division IIs Football Cinderella: Wayne State
description: In one of those magical, improbable playoff runs that helps renew faith in the joy of sports, Wayne State Universitys football team has pushed itself to the Division II national title game, after having never made the playoffs before this season.

title: Drawing Dance: The Cunningham Company at the Kennedy Center
description: The Brooklyn artist Kenneth E. Parris III is on tour with members of the Merce Cunningham Dance Company, documenting, through a series of drawings and paintings, their two-year legacy tour. After 58 years the company is scheduled to disband on New Years Day 2012. This is the 22nd in a series of graphite drawings that Mr. Parris plans to create from the road, providing a front-row seat to the final weeks of the companys journey. This weeks entry is from the Kennedy Center in Washington.

title: Young Adult and the Path Not Taken
description: Some of the funnest pit stops on the promotional circuit so far this season have been the ones involving the Young Adult crew. Since their collaboration on Juno, the writer Diablo Cody and the director Jason Reitman have had a sardonic but sweet vibe; they dont take themselves too seriously. And theres a buddy comedy waiting to happen in the rapport between the films stars, Charlize Theron and Patton Oswalt.

title: Compare-Contrast, Cause-Effect, Problem-Solution: Common Text Types in The Times
description: Update | Sept. 2012: Well be exploring the new Common Core State Standards, and how teaching with The Times can address them, through a series of blog posts. You can find them all here, in the lesson plan category Common Core.

title: A Final Farewell to Franois Lesage
description: Suzy Menkes speaks to designers, from Karl Lagerfeld to Anne Valrie Hash, about the master embroiderer, whose name became synonymous with craftsmanship.

title: Unwanted Homes, Unwanted Workers
description: Once upon a time, housing looked like a rare, highly valued asset; now, the market has been flooded with unwanted homes. And as I wrote in an article Sunday, economic forces have helped reallocate those excess houses to more productive (and non-residential) uses, like a park, work of art or marijuana garden.

title: Imagining 2076: Connect Your Brain to the Internet
description: The future, it turns out, starts in 2020.

title: Bloomberg Criticizes Decision on Morning-After Pill
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Monday that the Obama administration was wrong not to legalize over-the-counter sales of an after-sex contraception to girls under 17.

title: I Solemnly Pledge to Be Good as Can Be
description: Weve reached that phase in the primary season when the candidates start intensely publicizing their private lives. (Usually this comes right before the phase where they berate news organizations for covering their wives and children.) This rite of passage is considerably more comfortable for some candidates than others (and by others I mean Newt Gingrich).

title: Unpivoting Obama
description: I learned much of what I know about the political economy of the Second Gilded Age from Tom Edsall. Writing for Campaign Stops, Edsall has some important things to say about how economic narratives will play next year. He argues that the polling data

title: Tax Policy Blowing in the Wind
description: If you want something from Congress, there are probably only about four shopping days left until Christmas, because most members of the House and Senate seem likely to go home on Friday. One big item on the green list is an extension of the production tax credit for wind energy, and the industrys trade association, the American Wind Energy Association, released a dire study on Monday about what will happen without it.

title: The Joy of Feeding, Without All the Parental Angst
description: Back before computers moved into our exam rooms, I tended paper growth charts ritually at every checkup. Pink for girls, blue for boys. Age on the X-axis, weight on the Y-axis. I paid particular attention to the charts of infants, plotting weight and length and head circumference with my pen month by month to show parents how their babies were growing, to reassure them when they worried that there wasnt enough breast milk or because their babies were spitting up a little.

title: Fairy Tale May Be Ending for ABC; Sunday Night Football Rolls On for NBC
description: Is it possible that television viewers are no longer entranced by Once Upon a Time on ABC? The fantasy drama had a strong premiere and averaged 11.9 million viewers over its first four episodes, but the numbers have steadily dropped over the last month, culminating in series lows in total viewers (8.9 million) and in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic on Sunday night. The series will take a holiday breather and hope to reverse the trend starting Jan. 8.

title: Damascus on the Edge
description: A young writer living in Syrias capital city has agreed to share some observations of the uprisings and subsequent crackdowns happening across the country. Damascus so far has avoided much of the conflict, but hints of the ongoing instability taunt its citizens. We have withheld the writers name for security reasons.

title: Brewers, Potentially Leaking Sluggers, Sign Ramirez
description: 10:13 p.m. | Updated

title: Power Savings on Auto Pilot
description: Most hotel chains delayed significant energy conservation moves during the economic downturn, but now one, Marriott International, has signed a deal to reduce its hotels energy use, particularly during times of peak demand.

title: The Limits of Bigger Penalties in Fighting Financial Crime
description: President Obama, in a speech last week, called for strengthened oversight and accountability of financial firms by increasing the punishments that can be imposed for criminal violations. This comes on top of a recent proposal by Mary L. Schapiro, the chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, to ratchet up the available civil penalties for violating the securities laws.

title: S.E.C. Accuses Stiefel Labs and Its Ex-Chief of Fraud
description: 7:40 p.m. | Updated

title: Is Manning the Leagues M.V.P.?
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  Brandon Jacobs cracked a few jokes in the interview room late Sunday night, laughing about how he isnt so young anymore and chuckling over his decision  which turned out well in the end  to try and hurdle over a would-be tackler on one of his runs.

title: Snakebite: Experts Seek New Emphasis on Quiet Killer
description: Snakebite isnt exactly a neglected disease, but since many victims die for lack of the right medicine, the World Health Organization recognized it as such two years ago.

title: TimesCast | Protests at Goldman Sachs
description: Occupy Wall Street protesters picket Goldman Sachs.

title: Politics and Protest in Papier-Mch Heads
description: Peter Schumanns Bread and Puppet company, a staple of the Off Off Broadway calendar for 40 years, is a refreshing reminder of the vitality and power of street theater. Part carnival, part protest, all pageant, Bread and Puppet productions express political outrage and satire, sometimes coarse and raw.

title: Why Some People Sleep More Than Others
description: Excessively long nights of sleep can be a sign that something is wrong. But in some people who are otherwise healthy, a need for unusually long amounts of sleep may simply be a genetic predisposition, writes C. Claiborne Ray in this weeks Science Times.

title: Prevention: Trial Vaccine for Norovirus Shows Promise
description: An experimental vaccine has been shown in a small study to protect people from norovirus, infamous for sickening hundreds in outbreaks aboard cruise ships.

title: Patterns: Coffee May Help Cut Cancer Risk in Women
description: More good news for coffee drinkers: A large new study has found that women who drink four or more cups of coffee a day are at reduced risk of endometrial cancer.

title: Regimens: Aspirins Benefits Before Heart Surgery
description: Current guidelines recommend that people preparing for surgery stop taking aspirin at least a week before the operation, because the drug can increase the risk for bleeding. But a new analysis suggests that in heart surgery, aspirins benefits substantially outweigh its risks.

title: Beware of Raw Cookie Dough
description: Turns out mom was right: Keep your hands off the raw cookie dough.

title: Bentleys New V-8 Will Growl With a German Accent
description: Bentley Motors announced Monday that it would introduce a 500-horsepower twin-turbo V-8 engine for its Continental GT coupe and GTC convertible models at the Detroit auto show in January. Both automobiles will retain the W-12 engine as a higher-priced option.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Russia, Bulgaria and Spain.

title: Detroit Rerouted Off Broadway for New York Debut
description: Though at one point talked up for Broadway, Lisa DAmours Detroit, a finalist for the 2011 Pulitzer Prize in drama, will open the 2012-13 season at Playwrights Horizons, officials at the Off Broadway theater said on Monday.

title: Drug Scarcitys Dire Cost, and Some Ways to Cope
description: When Jenny Morrill, who has been battling ovarian cancer since 2007, went to the hospital for her scheduled chemotherapy treatment in June, the nurse greeted her with both good news and bad.

title: Talking to Parents About Fat Babies
description: Obesity in teenagers and adolescents is a major concern for pediatricians. But the discussion gets tricky when it turns to a weight crisis in infants. As Dr. Perri Klass explains in this weeks Science Times, experts on child nutrition are debating whether some of the standard infant feeding practices and attitudes may be in need of revising, particularly the notion of getting infants to eat as much as possible.

title: After a Fainting Spell, Learning to Fly Again
description: A FEW years ago, I was working on a proposal for a wedding while I was traveling. My seatmate was a young woman who had this huge accordion folder on her lap. There must have been a million files in it, all related to her wedding.

title: TimesCast | Billionaire Challenges Putin
description: Russian billionaire and NBA team owner Mikhail D. Prokhorov makes a surprise challenge to Vladimir Putins presidential run.

title: Top Earners Not So Lofty in the Days of Recession
description: WASHINGTON  Hold the condolence cards, but the recession cost the rich.

title: A Measure of Restraint
description: A STATEMENT black leather belt can be the quick fix you need this holiday season. With tailored high-waist trousers and a sheer blouse or crisp button-down, a bold belt will cinch the whole look, said the stylist Kathryn Typaldos. If youre heading straight out from work, Ms. Typaldos suggests adding a black belt to a tunic or a dress with a waistline. The belt will add structure and refinement, she said. These three styles  a wide corset wrap, a belt with a quirky feather trim and a patent leather one with a playful origami animal head  capture just the right amount of flare. Add lipstick and youre off.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Russia, South Korea, Spain and Britain.

title: Uganda-Canada Game to Happen After All
description: Organizers hoping to send the Canadian team to play the Ugandan team that was kept from the Little League World Series because the players visas were denied have announced they have raised enough money to make the trip happen.

title: For Bridge Built Long Ago, No End to Repairs
description: On Monday, the Henry Hudson Bridge  that triumphalist crossing over the Harlem River, a steel archway slicing through a verdant vista of water, trees and cliffs  celebrates its diamond anniversary, the 75th. And like many older citizens of New York City, the bridge has had its share of wear-and-tear.

title: A century at the South Pole, the gift of giving and the dangers of using your head.
description: A century at the South Pole, the gift of giving and the dangers of using your head.

title: A Post-Pollution Path to Global Climate and Energy Progress
description: Some hard realities are being acknowledged as diplomats, scientists, scholars and others ponder next steps following the indeterminate Durban climate negotiations  the latest failed attempt to limit climate risk using pollution-style restrictions on carbon dioxide under a global treaty.

title: Fox News Anchor Pushes Paid Family Leave
description: Megyn Kelly, a Fox News anchor, is proudly and unabashedly a working mother. As Pamela Paul wrote in the Sunday Styles section, the new generation of female news anchors juggles career and family life full-throttle in front of millions of viewers, and Ms. Kelly has become a surprising ambassador for working mothers. When Mike Gallagher, a conservative radio talk show host, mocked her three-month maternity leave, calling it a racket, Ms. Fox invited him onto her program and confronted him.

title: Chairman of Credit Suisses Investment Banking to Leave
description: Marc D. Granetz, the chairman of Credit Suisses investment banking department and a longtime mergers banker, is leaving the firm for another opportunity outside deal-making, according to an internal memorandum reviewed by DealBook.

title: Deconstructing the Bouffant and the Bland
description: The title of Ann Beatties new book, Mrs. Nixon: A Novelist Imagines a Life, suggests that the author might be trying to channel Pat Nixon or conjure up her life with Dick, much the way Curtis Sittenfeld channeled a Laura Bush-like first lady in her 2008 novel, American Wife.

title: Executive Shuffle in Microsoft Mobile Group
description: Steven A. Ballmer, the chief executive of Microsoft, has replaced the head of the companys mobile phone group as it seeks to translate the critical success of its mobile software into strong sales.

title: Q&A: Seeking a Picture-Perfect Tablet
description: Q.

title: Drug-Testing and Probable Cause, a Response to Readers
description: My post today about a proposal to allow drug testing of anyone collecting unemployment benefits produced a few comments along these lines: I had to submit to a drug test for my new job. Whats the difference?

title: Time-Travel Tip for Constantinople: Pack Daggers
description: And when the game studios come before you, you shall judge them by their sequels.

title: Chiefs Fire Coach, and Then Dolphins Follow Suit
description: The day after the N.F.L. regular season ends is known as Black Monday, because it is a bleak day when failed head coaches are sent packing. Black Monday came three weeks early this season, with the Kansas City Chiefs firing Todd Haley and the Miami Dolphins following a few hours later by dismissing Tony Sparano.

title: YouTube Creates Separate Site for Schools
Out-of-School Time Program Faces Deep Cuts
On a Long Train Trip, Rare Pleasures Return
description: I TRAVELED from Tampa, Fla., to Manhattan over the weekend. What a pleasure! Nobody hollered at me to sit down or turn off my electronic devices. Nobody warned me to obey all instructions from crew members.

title: Jazz Musicians Start a Pension Push
description: New York Citys musicians union has begun leafleting outside a major jazz club, the first salvo in what union leaders say is a campaign to gain pension benefits and a minimum wage for jazz artists.

title: Seeking Art in Clumsiness, or Sticking Out Tongues
description: Around 2008, foundations began throwing money at Chris Elam and his Misnomer Dance Theater: $150,000 here, $1 million there. Most of this windfall, however, wasnt intended to honor or support Mr. Elams choreography directly. The money was meant to finance his projects for connecting with audiences online, particularly one called the Audience Engagement Platform.

title: U.S. National Team Performance Review: A Seven-Game Snapshot
description: The composite player ratings (CPR) we introduced a few weeks back are not rocket science. In fact, they are not science at all.

title: Metal, Doom and Gloom Included
description: St. Vitus, a new metal club, opened in the late spring near the northernmost point of Greenpoint, Brooklyn, a block from the Pulaski Bridge. Outside, a black unmarked door. Inside, the Age of Enlightenment: local craft ales, a bun bar, a small square room with a stage in back. What more could you want? reads a recent comment on the bars Yelp page. Youre standing there watching sludge metal like COFFINWORM live and munching on a vegan sausage bao ... its like living the DREAM.

title: Rarely Heard Offerings From Busoni and Liszt
description: In the 19 years he has conducted the American Symphony Orchestra Leon Botstein has been at his best when his programs have been built around unusual works that deserve to be heard more often. With that as a goal, its easy to run off the rails: works that seemed promising on paper, or even in rehearsal, can turn out to have been neglected with good cause. Others may have been worthy but failed to make their mark because inadequate rehearsal time, or other technical issues, made it impossible for the orchestra to show the scores at their best.

title: Gambian Will Lead Prosecution in Hague
description: A lawyer from Gambia, Fatou Bensouda, was named the new chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court on Monday, making her the future public face and chief strategist of the tribunal responsible for investigating the worlds grave atrocities.

title: Amazing Race to the Bottom of the World
description: One hundred years ago, on Dec. 14, 1911, the Norwegian Roald Amundsen and four companions trudged through fog, bitter cold and lacerating wind to stand at the absolute bottom of the world, the South Pole. Nowhere was there a trace of their British rival, Robert Falcon Scott. No Union Jack mocked them, no ice cairn bespoke precedence. The Norwegians had won the race.

title: Nine Is the Magic Number for Prokofiev
description: The Russian pianist Boris Berman is particularly associated with the music of Prokofiev. He has recorded all the Prokofiev solo piano works for Chandos, written a book on the Prokofiev piano sonatas and produced an annotated edition of those nine works. It is only natural that students at the Yale School of Music, where Mr. Berman is chairman of the piano department, would absorb some of his passion for Prokofiev.

title: Chanel Marries Sumptuous India With Couture Detail
description: The Paris-Bombay collection by Chanel is a celebration of both India and the craftsmanship of the petites mains of France.

title: Straddling Two Worlds in Search of Selfhood
description: So, the good parts first. The story of Pinocchio is deeply buried in Kyle Abrahams autobiographical exploration of what it takes to become a real boy, Live! The Realest MC. For the new dance, seen at the Kitchen on Friday evening, Mr. Abraham offers a coming-out tale  his own  showing the difficulty of growing up black and gay in a hip-hop world. Theres no Disney tune in this piece that is mainly set to industrial and electronic music; and though it features an ensemble, he is clearly the star.

title: More Good Newt
description: In response to my column, The Good Newt, the incoming missiles are divided so far between readers on the right upset that I support a comprehensive reform of our immigration laws, and those on the left, appalled that I would say anything nice about Newt Gingrich. Also, some flak from readers who see a national ID card  which Gingrich and I consider a prerequisite for seriously enforcing our immigration laws  as the first step toward a police state.

title: Is the Kremlin Loosening Its Grip?
Cash-Poor Mets Given $40 Million Bank Loan
description: The owners of the Mets, needing cash and unable to turn to Major League Baseball for more financial help, received a $40 million loan from a major bank in the past six weeks.

title: Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifas Collaborative Album
description: SNOOP DOGG & WIZ KHALIFA

title: E-Books, Shmee-Books: Readers Return to the Stores
description: Facing economic gloom and competition from cheap e-readers, brick-and-mortar booksellers entered this holiday season with the humblest of expectations.

title: Add Quakes to Rumblings Over Gas Rush
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  Until this year, this Rust Belt city and surrounding Mahoning County had been about as dead, seismically, as a place can be, without even a hint of an earthquake since Scots-Irish settlers arrived in the 18th century.

title: The Fill in the Blanks Court Game of Indefinite Detention
description: WASHINGTON  Think of them as Mad Libs, Gitmo edition.

title: Pay Data Sought for For-Profit Colleges
description: With for-profit colleges coming under increased scrutiny, a leading Democrat sought detailed information on Monday about the salaries and bonuses for top executives at 13 of the biggest schools.

title: A New District Anchored Around Aurora
description: Auroras new congressional district.

title: In Pursuit of the Perfect Gift? Its a Lot Closer Than You Think
description: Traditionalists and etiquette mavens are complaining, but the rest of us can thank social scientists this season. They have come up with experimental evidence to support three revolutionary rules for people who hate shopping for holiday gifts:

title: Speed of Light Lingers in Face of New Camera
description: More than 70 years ago, the M.I.T. electrical engineer Harold (Doc) Edgerton began using strobe lights to create remarkable photographs: a bullet stopped in flight as it pierced an apple, the coronet created by the splash of a drop of milk.

title: High-End Sound With a Price to Match
description: The trouble with compact music systems is their compact sound. JBL has taken a shot at the laws of physics by packing quality sound into a relatively small package, the JBL OnBeat Extreme.

title: From Finland, an Intriguing School-Reform Model
description: Pasi Sahlberg, a Finnish educator and author, had a simple question for the high school seniors he was speaking to one morning last week in Manhattan: Who here wants to be a teacher?

title: A Roach With the Reach of a Grasshopper
description: Cockroach haters beware: scientists have discovered a roach that jumps.

title: Eyes of an Ancient Predator Had 16,000 Lenses
description: Anomalocaris was a squidlike predator with grasping claws that lived more than 500 million years ago.

title: Key Innovation Driver (1 Letter)
description: To the Editor:

title: Technology No Cure-All (2 Letters)
description: To the Editor:

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,834 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American on Monday:

title: Yes, Theres Hockey Without Fighting
description: The recently concluded series of New York Times stories by John Branch on the life and death of Derek Boogaard contains a Large Hadron Colliders worth of information, but at its core is an examination of the way too many hockey players are developed as fighters in the N.H.L. Still, fans are less and less enamored of fighting, in part because staged fights are the norm, and in larger part because we know the game can be so much better.

title: Money Raised for Youths Trip
description: Organizers hoping to send a Canadian team to play the Ugandan team that was kept from the Little League World Series because the players visas were denied say they have raised enough money to make the trip to Uganda happen in January.

title: Israel: Footbridges Closing Draws Ire
description: Israel on Monday closed a rickety footbridge leading to the holy compound revered by Jews as the Temple Mount and by Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary after a city engineer determined that the wooden walkway posed an immediate danger of fire or collapse. Though it is used only by non-Muslim visitors and Israeli security forces, Palestinian and Muslim authorities condemned the closing, calling it a provocation and a prelude to demolition and construction of a sturdier ramp. Palestinians object to Israels carrying out any work at the site in Jerusalems Old City on grounds that it is in occupied territory, captured by Israel from Jordan in the 1967 war. Any change in the status quo there has the potential to set off unrest. The bridge, known as the Mugrabi ramp, was erected as a temporary measure in 2004 after an older ramp collapsed. Muslims enter the compound, which houses Al Aksa Mosque, through different entrances.

title: Canada: Government Bans Veils at Citizenship Ceremonies
description: New Canadians must remove face coverings, including niqabs and burqas, at citizenship swearing-in ceremonies, Jason Kenney, the minister of citizenship and immigration, said Monday. He said the new rule would take effect immediately. Frankly, I found it bizarre that the rules allowed people to take the oath with a veil on, the Conservative minister said in Montreal. Face covering, particularly by Muslim women, has become a controversial practice in Canada lately.

title: Clive Robbins, Developer of a Method of Music Therapy, Dies at 84
description: Clive Robbins, a developer of an influential brand of music therapy designed to help people with various disabilities meet the physical, mental and social challenges that are facts of everyday life, died on Wednesday at his home in Jersey City. He was 84.

title: Window Fixtures of Rougher Days Come Down
description: During his 15 years in the South Bronx, Nilo Montalvo says, he has lived in a neighborhood behind bars: vertical rods, child guards, wrought-iron fencing  all wedged into the windows of ground-floor apartments, like his, in a housing project on East 144th Street. You feel like youre in prison, Mr. Montalvo, 64, said.

title: No Hit Toy to Brighten Retailers Christmas
description: With Christmas less than two weeks away, the toy industry has no runaway hit  leaving many toy shoppers bored and complicating how stores sell holiday inventory.

title: Canada Announces Exit From Kyoto Climate Treaty
description: OTTAWA  Canada said on Monday that it would withdraw from the Kyoto Protocol, the 1997 treaty to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Huntsman and Gingrich Square Off in Unmoderated Debate
description: MANCHESTER, N.H.  If Newt Gingrich is the Republican nominee and President Obama accepts his famous challenge to seven three-hour Lincoln-Douglas-style debates, viewers might find them only on C-SPAN and should plan to have plenty of black coffee on hand.

title: At Front of Republican Pack, Skirmishes Escalate
description: WINDHAM, N.H.  For much of this presidential primary season, New Hampshire has been perceived as being in Mitt Romneys back pocket. He has a house in Wolfeboro, N.H., and was governor of neighboring Massachusetts, where the news media made him a constant presence in New Hampshire living rooms.

title: Paying For Health Reform
description: Ive noticed an odd thing in comments whenever the subject of Obamacare comes up. Many commenters scoff when I say that the Obama health reform was fully paid for; not only that, but some of them confidently assert that the Congressional Budget Office says that the reform will increase the deficit.

title: Win That Could Save Giants Season Reveals Flaws That Could End It
description: The Giants season appeared doomed before it even started. The roster lost several familiar names to free agency in the off-season. Others disappeared because of injuries, and all the while, the Philadelphia Eagles were stockpiling talent.

title: Romneys Run Puts a Spotlight on Private Equity
description: On Wednesday, Mitt Romney, the Republican candidate for president, will attend fund-raisers in Manhattan given by his former private equity peers and Wall Street bankers, putting the spotlight on the private equity industry and Mr. Romneys role in it.

title: Inside Look at N.H.L. That Even the Players Families Want to See
description: As production crews for the HBO documentary series 24/7: Road to the N.H.L. Winter Classic record every move of the players and coaches on the Rangers and the Philadelphia Flyers, their lives are open books. The sanctity of the locker room is gone.

description: PARIS  The market euphoria over last weeks deal by European leaders to shore up the euro currency union succumbed to a darker mood Monday.

description: To the Editor:

title: Should Supreme Court Proceedings Be Televised?
description: Editors Note: Because of a production error, the following two letters were omitted from the online version of the Sunday Dialogue, in which readers debated whether to put cameras in the Supreme Court.

title: With N.B.A. Apparently Wanting More, the Clippers Halt Talks for Paul
description: LOS ANGELES  The hunt for Chris Paul, also known as the journey to nowhere, was back where it started on Monday, when the Los Angeles Clippers broke off talks about acquiring him.

title: MF Global Inquiry Shifts to Two Trusted Deputies
description: 8:57 p.m. | Updated

title: Teaching Law
description: This week marks the last sessions of my Yale law school class on law, liberalism and religion. In the course of the semester my students have learned how to read religion clause cases against the background of long-standing debates in philosophy and theology about the relationship between religious imperatives and the obligations of democratic citizenship. They have become adept at recognizing the arguments behind the arguments the justices are making explicitly. They can see how a case ostensibly about vouchers or school prayer or Christmas trees on courthouse steps is really about whether principle or history should inform a courts decisions. They can see how a case about head coverings or beards in the military (a topic that has surfaced once again) turns on the distinctions set down in John Lockes Letter Concerning Toleration (1689), a tract the justices may never have read. They can see how the majority and dissenting opinions in a free exercise case often reflect a tension between negative and positive liberty as these terms are defined by Isaiah Berlin, an author the justices will likely not have referenced. They can see how the entire history of religion-clause jurisprudence at once illustrates and is an extended critique of John Rawlss attempt in Political Liberalism to devise a form of government that will be fair to religion while at the same time keeping it at arms length.

title: Campaign Sends Romney to the Rescue. Ann Romney.
description: DES MOINES  Ann Romney switches off shrill TV coverage of the presidential race all the time. She is exasperated by the hyperpartisanship of the moment. As for the debates? Listen, she said in a rare interview here, I dont even want to go to the debates.

title: Toward War, Not Improvement
description: In Sadr City, Sadeq Rathi sees no bright future.

title: Not a Democracy
description: In central Baghdad, Safi Abed believes the U.S. isnt leaving Iraq with a real democracy.

title: Unusual Move by Christie in Feud Over Judgeships
description: Caught in a power struggle with the State Senate, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey took an unusual tack on Monday, moving the states attorney general into a top job at the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, but only until she can be confirmed as a judge in Essex County.

title: Lottery Numbers
Guantnamo Forever?
description: IN his inaugural address, President Obama called on us to reject as false the choice between our safety and our ideals. We agree. Now, to protect both, he must veto the National Defense Authorization Act that Congress is expected to pass this week.

title: In Dark Brooklyn Doorway, Officer Confronts Gunman, and Dies
description: The 911 caller reported a robbery in progress early Monday, and the first officers who arrived at the Brooklyn basement apartment found a tenant bloodied from a beating. They had no idea that the robbers were still there, hiding in a dark room behind them.

title: German Official Backs Tax Vetoed by Britain
description: Germanys foreign minister said Monday that he would like to see a new financial transactions tax imposed on markets in the European Union despite objections from Britains government, which vetoed changes in the European Union treaty at the economic crisis summit meeting last week partly in an effort to protect the London-based financial services industry from paying such a tax.

title: Amid Paeans to Cuomo, Some Less Lofty Notes
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is enjoying his Emperor Hadrian moment. His many legislative victories come accompanied by festive celebrations and loud huzzahs.

title: Marylands Mens Track in Danger of Elimination
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md.  Lap splits and training programs are usually Andrew Valmons daily concerns. But in recent weeks, fund-raising and the search for possible endowment money have been added to his to-do list as the University of Maryland track coach.

title: In California, Indian Tribes With Casino Money Cast Off Members
description: COARSEGOLD, Calif.  The six-page, single-spaced letter that Nancy Dondero and about 50 of her relatives received last month was generously salted with legal citations and footnotes. But its meaning was brutally simple. It is the decision by a majority of the Tribal Council, the letter said, that you are hereby disenrolled.

title: The President and the Generals
description: Washington

title: Zombie Borders
description: June 13th, 1990, was a historic day for weather forecasting in Germany. For the very first time, the weather map on the Tagesschau [1] showed the newly reunited countrys international borders.

title: Premiers Actions in Iraq Raise U.S. Concerns
description: BAGHDAD  Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki has moved swiftly to consolidate power in advance of the American military withdrawal, offering a glimpse of how Iraqs post-American identity may take shape, by rounding up hundreds of former Baath Party members and evicting Western companies from the heavily fortified Green Zone.

title: Reid Vows to Keep Republicans in Town
description: In league with President Obama, the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, served notice to Congressional Republicans late Monday that he will prevent final votes on a must-pass bill to finance government operations until Congress approves a measure to Democrats liking that extends a payroll tax cut and unemployment assistance.

title: G.O.P. Bill Would Benefit Doctor-Owned Hospitals
description: WASHINGTON  The House Republican bill to hold down payroll taxes and extend unemployment benefits, coming up for a vote on Tuesday, offers a special dispensation to doctors who invest in hospitals.

title: Amazons Jungle Logic
description: Camden, Me.

title: Koch Is Backing Quinn in 2013 Race for Mayor
description: Two years before the next New York mayoral election, former Mayor Edward I. Koch said Monday that he was supporting Christine C. Quinn, the speaker of the City Council, to succeed Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg.

title: An Italian Chocolatier Revives Its U.S. Campaign
description: PERUGINA, the Italian chocolate maker best known for its Baci line of foil-wrapped, bite-size hazelnut chocolates, once enjoyed prominence with American consumers, with the brand advertising nationally on television and in magazines from the 1960s through the mid-1980s.

title: Turkish Border Businesses Miss the Syrian Neighbors
description: GAZIANTEP, Turkey  In the old bazaar of this ancient city, long entwined with Syria, the loud chatter of Syrians bartering in Arabic has given way to unfamiliar silence.

title: Helping Lift a Daughter From Illness
description: On a brisk afternoon, a mother and daughter scaled a jungle gym, crossed a bridge and took off down a pair of slides in Evergreen Park, in Ridgewood, Queens.

title: Cardinal John P. Foley, 76, Vatican Spokesman, Dies
description: Cardinal John Patrick Foley, who heeded Gods whisper, as he put it, to become a priest as well as his own inclinations to go to journalism school at 31, then combined the roles as the Vaticans communications director for almost a quarter-century, died on Sunday in Darby, Pa. He was 76.

title: Hearing on Terror Suspect Explores Miranda Warning
description: Almost two years ago, a Federal Bureau of Investigation agent was in Nigeria to question an Eritrean man who was in custody on suspicion of supporting terrorism. The suspect, Mohamed Ibrahim Ahmed, had already been interrogated by other American officials for intelligence-gathering purposes, without having been read his rights.

title: Slain Officer Was Devoted to His Daughters
description: Officer Peter J. Figoski worked the midnight shift in one of New Yorks most dangerous precincts, apprehending robbers in and around East New York, Brooklyn, with the instincts of a 22-year veteran. Then he would go home to Long Island to drive his daughters to school.

title: Whom Do You Trust?
description: Peoples faith in Congress continues to sink like a rock.

title: Jon Huntsmans Path to Victory
description: Longtime readers will know that I was initially very skeptical about Jon M. Huntsman Jr.s chances of winning the Republican nomination. Mr. Huntsman, in my view, had two fundamental challenges that would be very difficult for any candidate to overcome.

title: S.E.C. Files Suit to Recoup Losses in Stanford Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday sued the Securities Investor Protection Corporation in an effort to help customers who lost money to the Stanford Financial Group file claims for reimbursement.

title: When Cost Cuts Make Merger Sense
description: A rumble in the rock garden may presage more hostile mergers and acquisitions. Thats one way to read the unsolicited $4.6 billion offer that Martin Marietta Materials has made for its larger rival, Vulcan Materials. The all-stock deal probably wont succeed without some more back-and-forth. But the lesson is clear: if profits cannot be mined from the ground, they can still be found by cutting costs.

title: Tuesday: Put Down Some Chips
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  We havent seen Jonathan Gersch around these parts for quite a while, but hes back with a smooth Tuesday grid that made me smile. I was a bit old for Sesame Street when it made its debut in 1969, but, ahem, I remember keeping my younger sister company while she watched it, and then doing the same favor for my own kids. Purely to explain the intricate nuances of what was going on, mind you. Not because it was extraordinarily entertaining, even by adult standards.

title: Trying to Shine in the Shadow of a Neighbor
description: AURORA, Colo.  Second Banana. Tonto to the scene-stealing Lone Ranger. Name the pejorative of disrespect or neglect and this sprawling city, forever in Denvers shadow as the gawky suburb that outgrew its britches, has probably endured it.

title: Prokhorovs Candidacy Doesnt Faze the N.B.A.
description: Mikhail D. Prokhorovs foreign roots, business practices and playboy reputation did not prevent him from buying controlling interest in the Nets last year. His political aspirations will not pose an issue to the N.B.A., either.

title: Targeting the Unemployed
description: The House Republican leadership managed to get one thing right in its bill to extend the payroll tax cut and unemployment benefits. The bill does, indeed, extend the payroll tax cut for another year, but, beyond that, there is a lot to dislike. To help pay for the package, for instance, the bill would cut social spending more deeply than is already anticipated under current budget caps without asking wealthy Americans to contribute a penny in new taxes.

title: Yankees Look to Lock Up Young Players
description: The Yankees announced on Monday that they would offer contracts to every unsigned player on their 40-man roster, ensuring that key players like Phil Hughes, Dave Robertson, Russell Martin and Brett Gardner will be under their control for another year.

title: Keystone Claptrap
description: The Keystone XL oil pipeline has become the House Republicans weapon of choice in their fight with President Obama over jobs and taxes. Mr. Obama has said he will not make a decision on the pipeline until 2013. The Republicans are insisting that he approve it now and have attached an amendment to a bill extending the payroll tax cut in hopes of forcing his hand.

title: The Abu-Jamal Case
description: After nearly 30 years, prosecutors in Philadelphia decided last week to end their fight to execute Mumia Abu-Jamal, who was convicted in 1982 of the murder of Daniel Faulkner, a police officer. Decades of legal proceedings have proved that Pennsylvanias death penalty machinery is unconstitutionally flawed and should be stopped.

title: Knicks Plan: Speak Softly and Sign a Big Man
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.

title: Amundsen at the South Pole
description: When Roald Amundsens ship, the Fram, left Norway on Aug. 9, 1910, it carried, in Amundsens words, nineteen men, ninety-seven dogs, four pigs, six carrier pigeons, and one canary. The ship was nearly 20 years old, and the expedition leader, Amundsen, was 38. He was already a formidable polar explorer, but this voyage to Antarctica and the South Pole made him one of the greatest explorers who ever lived.

title: Members of Overhauled State Ethics Panel Are Named
description: ALBANY  Four months after Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo signed into law a much-heralded overhaul of ethics enforcement, he named the Westchester County district attorney, Janet DiFiore, the first leader of a new state ethics commission.

title: Libyan Army Clashes With Militia in Tripoli
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Efforts by Libyas transitional government to assert its authority over the capital were marred over the weekend, after members of a powerful rebel militia exchanged fire with soldiers in the fledgling army, leaving two people dead.

title: Corrections: December 13
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Tabloid May Not Be Behind Deleted Messages, Police Say
description: LONDON  The tabloid newspaper that Rupert Murdochs media empire shut down amid a hacking scandal may not have been responsible for a prominent episode in the scandal, the deletion of voice mail messages from a missing schoolgirls cellphone, a police lawyer said on Monday.

title: Time, Distance and Clarity
description: Above Romes pale yellow and dusky orange buildings, the sky somehow looks bluer than it does almost anywhere else. Did I take proper note of that when I saw it all the time? When it was the canopy over my waking, my working and the all-consuming, all-distracting tedium of daily life?

title: Sandusky Scheduled to Face Several of His Accusers
description: BELLEFONTE, Pa.  Jerry Sandusky, the disgraced former assistant football coach at Penn State, is scheduled Tuesday to face the public testimony of at least half of the 10 boys he is accused of sexually molesting.

title: Lagging in Performance: Pennsylvania Online Schools
description: Pennsylvania was one of the first states to allow full-time online schools and it now has the third-largest enrollment in such schools. But test scores at online schools lag.

title: At School in Cyberspace
description: Costly to taxpayers, do virtual schools get the job done?

title: Profits and Questions at Online Charter Schools
description: By almost every educational measure, the Agora Cyber Charter School is failing.

title: How a Robbery Led to a Killing
description: The police provided an account of the shooting that led to the death of an on-duty officer.

title: Millionaires on Food Stamps and Jobless Pay? G.O.P. Is on It
description: WASHINGTON  Its an image many Americans would find rather upsetting: a recently laid-off millionaire, luxuriating next to the pool eating grapes bought with food stamps while waiting for an unemployment check to roll in.

title: One of the Pentagons Top Women Is Stepping Down
description: WASHINGTON  Michle A. Flournoy, the chief policy adviser to Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta and one of the highest-ranking women in the history of the Pentagon, said on Monday that she would step down from her job early next year to rebalance her personal life and spend more time with her three school-age children.

title: Art World Star Doesnt Change His Spots
description: LONDON  Just as the financial markets were heading for disaster in 2008, the British artist Damien Hirst snubbed his dealers and persuaded Sothebys here to sell 223 primarily new artworks. There were dead animals  sharks, zebras, piglets and even a calf  floating in giant glass tanks of formaldehyde; cabinets filled with diamonds; and cigarette butts. And paintings galore: spin paintings, spot paintings, paintings with butterflies pinned under glass.

title: Hezbollah Station Identifies 10 Supposed C.I.A. Officers
description: WASHINGTON  The militant group Hezbollah has stepped up a public campaign against the Central Intelligence Agency in Lebanon, using a television broadcast to name 10 people who it said were C.I.A. officers who worked from the American Embassy in Beirut in recent years.

description: precipitate \pri-si-p-tat\ verb and adjective

description: The Mets let go of catcher Ronny Paulino and outfielder Mike Baxter on Monday night before baseballs midnight deadline for offering contracts to arbitration-eligible players.

title: A Decade Later, Security Top Notch in Indias Parliament
description: On Dec. 13, 2001, a heavily armed suicide squad of five men, carrying grenades, AK-47s with multiple magazines and explosives drove into the six-acre Parliament grounds in a white Ambassador car with a red flashing light on the roof and a fake entry pass on its windscreen.

title: News Quiz | Dec. 13, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: A Way Forward for Mourinho
description: Toppling Barcelona was a challenge that almost broke Jos Mourinho last season. The psychological strain on the Real Madrid manager permeated into his touchline manner, or rather lack of manners; into his relationship with Spains famously difficult soccer news media; and most worryingly, into his professional judgement.

title: Dec. 13, 1981 | Poland Cracks Down on Solidarity Movement
description: On Dec. 13, 1981, authorities in Poland imposed martial law in a crackdown on the pro-democracy Solidarity labor movement, which had made numerous strikes since August 1980 that challenged the Communist Polish government.

description: Maggie Taylor had never been comfortable photographing people. She was so content shooting still lifes of stuff that she collected, that for 10 years she hadnt even taken her 45 camera beyond her garden.

title: Do You Discuss Religion With Friends?
description: Seizing on the holiday season as an opportunity to talk about spirituality, an Op-Ed writer argues that few people discuss religion in everyday life. He asserts that only devout believers and die-hard nonbelievers raise the subject in conversation. Do you agree? Do you talk about religion with friends? Why or why not?In the Op-Ed article Americans: Undecided About God? Eric Weiner laments the sad state of our national conversation about God:

title: European Commission Chief Assails Britain Over Treaty Veto
description: LONDON  A senior European official said on Tuesday that Britains demands for measures to protect its financial services industry at last weeks summit meeting were impossible to meet and directly responsible for the collapse of a Europe-wide agreement meant to help save the euro.

title: Realistic India Through Western Eyes?
description: When my husband, Mahir, and I turned on our television in Manhattan one November evening, we were surprised to see his violin teacher from Mumbai, Jini Dinshaw, flash across the screen.

title: Who Counts as Rich? Continued
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take..

title: Rob Gronkowski, and the Year of the Tight End
description: When the postscript is written on the 2011 season, Aaron Rodgers may be remembered as having the best season a quarterback has ever had. We dont need to wait much longer to acknowledge the same at another position.

title: Bullfighting Gets a Closer Look in Prague
description: Anyone who has seen a matador in action knows that bullfighting is an art. But the creativity it inspires is not restricted to the ring  artists from Picasso to Dal to the Czech artist Emil Filla have created works using the sport as a theme. One hundred fifty such pieces are now on view in Prague through April 9 at the Tauromaquia exhibition at Obecni dum.

title: Doing It the Evliya Celebi Way
description: ISTANBUL  Whenever I set out to tour Turkey with my wife, I understand exactly what Diana, Princess of Wales, meant when she complained about there being three of us in her marriage. My rivals name is Evliya Celebi, and he spent much of his life on a horse. He was born 400 years ago and Unesco decided to celebrate his birth this year. I cant compete.

title: The TV Watch: Chelsea Clinton Finally Embraces Her Celebrity
description: Chelsea Clinton gave a perfectly honed and utterly unsatisfying explanation on Monday for why she has made her debut as a special correspondent on NBCs magazine show Rock Center WithBrian Williams.

title: Before Tebow, There Was Blanda
description: Tim Tebows late-game performances are already the stuff of legend. He has captivated the nation with a string of last-minute heroics, leaving the public wanting more.Tebows statistics arent very impressive, but he is a flavor best enjoyed without serious thought. You have to see it to understand it. And that makes his run reminiscent of an improbable stretch that took place over four decades ago.

title: In Lower Manhattan, a Light Show Looms
description: It sounds like a scene straight out of Las Vegas or Orlando: streets magically illuminated by an interactive light show, complete with 3-D effects and lights that respond to kinetic pedestrian motion.

title: Can a Small Retailer Compete Online With the Big Boys?
description: Little Dudes and Divas is a small business with some very big competition. Started seven years ago by Steve and Susan Karasanti, husband and wife, the company has three employees and sells clothes and accessories for infants and toddlers. Ninety percent of the sales come through the Web site, the rest through a newly opened brick-and-mortar store in Rockaway Park, N.Y., where the company is based.

description: For months a group of names has swarmed around the creative directors job at Dior, with the industry joining the buzz. Among the names mentioned early on were Marc Jacobs, Riccardo Tisci, Nicolas Ghesquiere, Alber Elbaz. Then in November it was Alexander Wang, Jason Wu and Raf Simons. Today, Womens Wear Daily, quoting industry sources, said Mr. Simons is in discussion for the Dior job.

description: It sounds almost like science fiction: A parasite manipulates a fishs behavior to make it seek out warmer water, probably by altering its brain chemistry. In the warmer environment, the parasites growth  and its capacity to infect other hosts  kicks into overdrive.

title: Daily Report: Intel Sees an Opportunity in Drives Shortage
description: Intel, the worlds largest maker of semiconductors, said on Monday that its revenue this quarter would fall to $13.7 billion, from $14.7 billion, because floods in Thailand had sharply cut the worlds supply of disk drives. Without the drives, manufacturers will make fewer personal computers and computer servers, which means fewer semiconductors will be needed.

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 13
description: Bookstores have reported an unexpectedly strong beginning to the Christmas shopping season, lifted by an unusually vibrant selection, Julie Bosman writes. It has been a strong year for nonfiction, some booksellers pointed out, starting with the Steve Jobs biography by Walter Isaacson. However, the increased business is also a product of the closing of the Borders Books chain, whose customers are visiting other stores to do their book shopping. Overall sales will take a hit from the loss of Borders.

title: An Officer Falls
description: Police Officer Peter J. Figoski never stood a chance. He didnt even have time, the Police Department said, to pull his gun before a man described as a career criminal killed him in Brooklyn Monday morning with a bullet to the face.
