title: Judge Criticizes Fox in Dodgers Rights Case
description: The federal bankruptcy judge who last week ruled that the Los Angeles Dodgers could accelerate a plan to sell their future TV rights elaborated on his decision Thursday. He criticized Fox Sports, whose Prime Ticket channel has a contract to show Dodgers games through 2013, for trying to prevent the team from selling the TV rights before the end of their 45-day exclusive negotiating period on Nov. 30, 2012.

title: Lee Bontecou: Recent Work: Sculpture and Drawing
description: Freedman Art

title: Allison Schulnik: Mound
description: ZieherSmith

title: Winter Wonders | Streamlined
description: Mild temperatures this fall and winter have driven women to keep layers light and cold-weather accessories (hat, scarf, mitten, muffs) in the closet. Here, the model Hilary Rhoda throws a biker-style shearling jacket over a clean sweater-skirt combination; the actress Sandra Bullock tightens a beautifully unembellished look with a bowed rope belt; and the J. Crew president Jenna Lyons opts for a tailored one-button coat and tricolored palette (black, white, camel; what could be easier?).

title: Spare Times for Dec. 16-22
description: Around Town

title: How Chris Paul Will Make DeAndre Jordan Better
description: Chris Pauls influence alone will make the job of every single Clippers player significantly easier, a fact that is likely to translate into notable increases in production across the board. Thats good news for the already stellar Blake Griffin (who now has legitimate All-N.B.A. potential), but its even better news for the 22-year-old DeAndre Jordan, whom the Clippers recently re-signed (via an offer sheet from the Golden State Warriors) to a deal worth $43 million over four years.

title: 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL-Class embedded slide show
description: 2013 Mercedes-Benz SL-Class embedded slide show

title: A Lad and a Geezer Bond Over a Tractor
description: The theatrical adaptation of Michael Morpurgos childrens novel War Horse employs maximalist stagecraft, including dazzling puppetry, in the service of emotionally expansive storytelling. Farm Boy, the two-man, one-tractor play based on Mr. Morpurgos quasi sequel, is its minimalist opposite, a gentle tale of connection across generations, recounted with old-fashioned earnest simplicity.

title: Elevator Was Serviced Just Before Accident
description: Electrical maintenance work was being performed on an elevator just hours before it malfunctioned, killing an advertising executive in Midtown, a spokesman for New York Citys Buildings Department said Thursday.

title: Now Onward Into Action: Crash! Thud!
description: When I hear the name Elizabeth Streb, one image always comes to mind first: this choreographer, dirty and bedraggled, dodging all manner of harmful obstacles as she arduously pulled herself through a short stone tunnel in Fort Jay, on Governors Island.

title: Judge Dismisses Twitter Stalking Case
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In a case with potentially far-reaching consequences for freedom of expression on the Internet, a federal judge on Thursday dismissed a criminal case against a man accused of stalking a religious leader on Twitter, saying that the Constitution protects uncomfortable speech on such bulletin-boardlike sites.

title: Jazz Snapshots
description: Photos from the book Blue Notes in Black and White: Photography and Jazz, by Benjamin Cawthra.

title: Sounds of Diaspora, Updated
description: BROADLY defined, Jewish music typically evokes the wild fury of klezmer or  and this is particularly unfortunate  tuneless elementary school renditions of The Dreidel Song, complete with fudged lyrics and ill-timed handclaps. The weeklong Sephardic Music Festival, now in its seventh year, should put to rest those notions with its eclectic lineup of traditional and contemporary artists, including many dedicated to fusing disparate sounds or bridging new and old.

title: Spare Times: For Children for Dec. 16-22
description: Superheroes Who Are Super!

title: They Put the Face on an American Sound
description: Benjamin Cawthras Blue Notes in Black and White: Photography and Jazz is not entirely, or specifically, about its subtitle. That would be a book with a lot more images, or at least with more concentrated information on the history of all kinds of jazz photography over the last century, in newspapers and magazines and in the promotional campaigns of record companies.

title: Facebooks New Timeline: What Do You Want to Know?
description: So this new Facebook Timeline  whats it all about?

title: Good Addresses, Circa 1830
description: THE Greenwich Village Society for Historic Preservation is pushing landmark designation for part of the South Village, along with much of its east-west spine, Bleecker Street. Although now a noisy stretch of tenements and nightclubs, Bleecker was an elite address two centuries ago. Three blocks eschewed even the prestige of Bleecker for more exclusive names, DePau Row, Carroll Place and Leroy Place.

title: A Workout Where Youd Least Expect It
description: TWO out-of-the-ordinary events happened on Saturday, Oct. 29, at Chelsea Market. One was the snowstorm outside. The other: a raucous cycling party inside.

title: After All This Time, Americans Still See the World as a Glass Half-Full
description: That, at least, might be the conclusion from a new poll  from the Allstate Corporation and National Journal. Although 70 percent of Americans believe the country is generally on the wrong track, and more people say their financial situation is in only fair or poor shape than say it is in good or excellent shape, 60 percent said they were still living the American dream.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Facebook Timeline and a Steve Jobs iPhone Case
description: Heres what the tech reporters and editors picked out on the Web on Thursday.

title: Q & A
description: Virtual Meetings Are Allowed

title: Celebrating a 70th Birthday With Spirited Romanticism
description: The Bolivian-born violinist Jaime Laredo has performed often at the 92nd Street Y, where he has been artistic director of the Chamber Music at the Y series since 1974. So it seemed a fitting hall for this distinguished musician to celebrate his 70th birthday on Wednesday evening, joined by several rising and established colleagues.

title: Helping Homeowners Dig Out
description: WITH interest rates at historic lows, the expansion of a federal refinancing program could help more homeowners who owe more than their property is worth move out of higher-rate or adjustable loans into something more affordable and stable.

title: Long Road to August Hall Makes a Pianist Feel Free
description: Christian Zacharias has been a regular visitor to New York in recent years, conducting and performing as piano soloist with the Orchestra of St. Lukes at Carnegie Hall last year and offering a solo recital at the Rose Theater in 2008. But this distinguished German musician, now 61, had to wait until Tuesday evening to make his Carnegie recital debut.

title: Critiques Persist of Police Marijuana Arrests
description: This week, a question: How many marijuana arrests are too many?

title: Candor, and Complaints, as Show Ends
description: When the cable channel HLN announced in November that it was going to end the comedian Joy Behars 10 p.m. talk show, she played along, releasing a simple statement about how proud she was of the two-year-old program. No one at the channel dared to utter the dreaded word canceled.

title: Is the Web Selecting for Copiers Over Creators?
description: The Edge.org Web site of the intellectual impressario and literary agent John Brockman is once again offering provocative fare, this time a hypothesis from Mark D. Pagel about a big potential downside of humanitys fast-expanding interconnectedness.

title: Cookie Takedown and Yule Ball at Bell House in Brooklyn
description: Work obligations and daily discipline have been abandoned. Holiday brain has officially set in. The Miser is making a list of appropriately frivolous activities.

title: Dutchess County Joins the Dance
description: IN sharp contrast to Westchester these days, Dutchess County is awash in new home construction  fueled mainly by young families in search of rambling colonials, large backyards and low property taxes.

title: Holmes and Watson, but Is There Mystery?
description: Robert Downey Jr. is currently carrying two movie franchises  the Marvel Iron Man proto-Avengers thing for Paramount and the brawling steampunk Sherlock Holmes series for Warner Brothers  so it is perhaps understandable that he is showing a touch of fatigue. In the new Holmes adventure, A Game of Shadows, his imperiousness is hard to distinguish from boredom, and he seems to be in a hurry to spit out his lines, take his lumps, throw his punches and collect his paycheck.

title: Eternal Youth Still Defying Pull of Gravity
description: Curmudgeons (that is, theater critics) may scoff at the mere mention of its name, but young eyes will be wide in wonder throughout Cathy Rigby Is Peter Pan, the perennial favorite that is once again sprinkling handfuls of glitter  sigh, make that fairy dust  at the Theater at Madison Square Garden. Starring Ms. Rigby, 21 years after her Broadway debut in the title role, this likable, well-oiled musical only occasionally misses a beat, more often because of its script and staging than its cast.

title: A Jewel Box for Translucent Treasures
description: In light of the glass-box atrium plugged into the J. P. Morgan Library & Museum a few years ago, New York cultural custodians might have been understandably alarmed to learn of plans for architectural intervention at another great institution of Gilded Age ancestry. They need not have worried. The Frick Collections transformation of an outdoor colonnade into an indoor exhibition space, now called the Portico Gallery, is as subtly noninvasive as the Morgans addition is conspicuously anachronistic.

title: Americans Still (Mostly) Welcome Immigrants, Survey Finds
description: Immigration may be a hot button issue but you would not know it from the latest public opinion survey, which shows Americans sharply critical of government policy but still welcoming of legal immigrants.

title: Brooklyn District Attorney Defends Judge
description: The Brooklyn District Attorney, Charles J. Hynes, on Thursday dismissed Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs criticism of Brooklyn Criminal Court Judge Evelyn Laporte, who released the suspected killer of a New York City policeman without bail on a drug possession charge in November.

title: Stand Clear of the Ghosts
description: Most of us, while visiting the New York Transit Museum, will not care too much that in the 1930s large coiled tubes containing liquid carbon tetrachloride were used as fuses to protect the citys subway system from short circuits. Many of us approach this subject so lightly that we might think a label on an electrical contraption  Edison Bipolar Dynamo  is missing a colon after the name of the inventor, who may not have been bipolar but was certainly a dynamo.

title: A Bracing Wind, Propelling a Dynamic Comeback
description: There were heavy gales blowing from the stage at the Jazz Standard late Tuesday night: fast, roiling, tenacious. They embodied the focused effort of the tenor and soprano saxophonist Azar Lawrence, leading an assembled quintet. But effort didnt feel like the impression Mr. Lawrence was trying to foster. Throughout his generously proportioned second set, he played as if plugging into a life force. He seemed committed to the idea of the self as a vessel; those winds were whipping through him.

title: A Musical for Shakespeare, if He Knew a Little Yiddish
description: The easily disoriented title character of Shlemiel the First sets out on a multiyear sojourn, only to return to his town a few hours later. The musical bearing his name, Robert Brusteins slight but pleasurable adaptation of Isaac Bashevis Singers folk tales, has seen a lot more of the world.

title: Mercedes-Benz SL Unveiled Ahead of Formal Debut at Detroit Auto Show
description: Mercedes-Benz has made its SL roadster lighter and more powerful for the 2013 model year. Ahead of the cars debut in January at the Detroit auto show, the automaker revealed product information and photos on Thursday.

title: Decking the Halls, Carlyle Style
description: 6:45 p.m. | Updated

title: Madoffs Ex-Controller Expected to Plead Guilty Next Week
description: 8:25 p.m. | Updated

title: Season to Shine for Concierges
description: AT a cozy multicultural party earlier this month in the clubroom of the Residences at Vail Mansion in Morristown, condo owners exchanged holiday cookies and recipes. The event had been arranged by the concierge service.

title: Abandoning the Single Life
description: WITH much of the Island built out, single-family homes arent likely to be knocked from their pre-eminent position. But new rental and for-sale communities are increasingly being built in clusters: attached town houses, semi-attached houses and condominium and rental units in town-house-style complexes.

title: A Holding-Pattern Home
description: DARA KASS grew up in Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn, in an attached two-family house. (Her grandparents lived downstairs.) Her husband, Michael, grew up in doorman buildings on the Upper West Side.

title: What if You Could Meet Yourself as an Adult? These Children Do
description: Since The Nutcracker in all its many versions is always a tale of transformation, theres a well-established tradition of making its little heroine grow up to become the adult heroine who dances the Sugar Plum pas de deux. Usually, though, this involves a grown-up dancer playing the little girl in the party of the first scene, which means that, right at the start, we have to suspend disbelief. The central marvel of Alexei Ratmanskys Nutcracker  new last year and returning now to American Ballet Theater repertory at the Brooklyn Academy of Music  lies in its vision of adults as the transformed potential future of the children who carry the story.

title: Why Building Blogs Are District Boosters
description: WHEN Lori Ordover was hired to market a condominium building at 20 Pine Street in the financial district, she immediately set up a blog about the neighborhood.

title: U.S. Support for Israel
description: To the Editor:

title: From Popping Flowers To Dropping Snowflakes
description: Momixs Botanica returned to the Joyce Theater on Tuesday night, pruned. A tour through the seasons that lasted two hours in 2009 is now 90 minutes, winter to winter. But even trimmed, the work still has at least 20 sections. This is Short Attention Span Theater.

title: Universal Health Mandate
description: To the Editor:

title: Everything in Its Right Place
description: Infinite Line, Sarah Szes midcareer solo show at Asia Society Museum, promised a new angle on Ms. Szes mesmerizing, minutely detailed installations. And it delivers one, though the art  much of it made for the occasion  doesnt always rise to the challenge.

title: Hedy Lamarrs World War II Adventure
description: On a sweltering Paris evening in June 1926, a 25-year-old pianist and composer from Trenton stepped out onto the stage of the Thtre des Champs-lyses, which was crowded with an array of pianos, bass drums, xylophones, electric bells and electric fans (later to be substituted by enormous airplane propellers), as well as a hand-cranked siren. He nodded to the conductor, and the stuffy air in the hall suddenly began pulsing and throbbing, banging and wailing with a loud and persistent mechanical cacophony. Within a few minutes, according to one eyewitness, the concert had degenerated into a shouting match: Above the mighty noise of the pianos and drums arose catcalls and booing, shrieking and whistling, shouts of thief mixed with bravo.  The audience, which included Eliot, Pound, Joyce and Diaghilev, was in an uproar.

title: Athletic Trainers
description: To the Editor:

title: What Iraqis Think of the American Withdrawal: Mosul and Basra
description: As American forces pulled out of Iraq, we asked Iraqis around the country three questions:

title: Deadly Rider in the Tax Bill
description: To the Editor:

title: Venus Rising From Her Pretty Prison
description: How many of the worlds problems would be solved, or at least greatly reduced, if women had true parity with men? Just think how having equal rights before the law, equal access to education and reproductive autonomy would affect womens ability to fulfill their potential worldwide. Then consider, as various writers have maintained, how this might increase the worlds collective brain power and economic resources. There would also be benefits if men could be freed of misogyny and the debilitating self-hatred that it, like all bigotry, masks.

title: A Call for Climate Solutions
description: To the Editor:

title: Cuomo Hints at More State Money for Schools Next Year
Not Without My Pet
description: WHEN Nell McCaffery started looking for a rental apartment in New York City, she had three main concerns: living in a good school district for her twin 9-year-old boys; being close to the No. 1 train to ease her husbands commute to Riverdale; and finding a building that would accept the family dog, a 70-pound mutt with Rottweiler markings.

title: Amid Claims of More Captured Drones, a Report on Their Vulnerability
description: After flaunting its capture of a sophisticated American spy drone on national television last week, Iran is said to be planning to invite local reporters and foreign diplomats to an even more spectacular display of pilotless hardware in the near future.

title: City Jobless Rate Rises, Exceeding the Nations
description: New York Citys unemployment rate edged up to 8.9 percent in November despite a surge in preholiday hiring at stores, hotels and restaurants, the State Labor Department reported late on Thursday afternoon.

title: Film Fables Spun in Japan
description: Imagine being a lover of animation who grew up without access to most of the movies made by Pixar  who still has Toy Story and The Incredibles to look forward to. Or who has been kept from seeing classic Disney: no Fantasia, no Bambi.

title: Like Facebook? Count Them Out
description: To the Editor:

title: Live Blogging the Fox News Debate in Iowa
description: Seven candidates take the stage tonight in Sioux City, Iowa, for the final debate before the Jan. 3 caucuses.

title: The King of the B-Movie and His A-List Following
description: Near the end of Alex Stapletons affectionate and informative documentary Cormans World: Exploits of a Hollywood Rebel, Martin Scorsese laments that young people these days are unaware of Roger Cormans work and influence. Mr. Scorseses complaint is apt, and also kind of funny, since usually when people bemoan the cultural ignorance of the young they mean that the kids arent reading great literature or listening to classical music. Rarely will anyone express concern that our youth is insufficiently acquainted with Caged Heat, The Cry Baby Killer or Monster From the Ocean Floor.

title: A Store Where Toys Must Be Kosher
description: In this toy store, Batman and Spider-Man are not heroes.

title: Romney Ku Klux Klan Report Backfires on Media
description: Dont just repeat it. Report it.

title: Falling Off Skyscrapers Sometimes Hurts a Bit
description: What makes Tom Cruise run  run harder and run faster, leaping from one building and dangling off another, the worlds tallest  as he does to exhausting, unnerving effect in Mission: Impossible  Ghost Protocol, his latest exercise in extreme performance? The fourth in the franchise, this Mission has a solid cast, including a notable new co-star in Jeremy Renner; a new director, Brad Bird; and a story thats as nonsensical as any in the series. Mostly, though, it has Mr. Cruise hurtling through the movie as if his life depended on it, which, to judge by the hard line of his jaw, his punishingly fit body and the will etched into his every movement, may be whats at stake.

title: Questioning The Benefit Of Curbing Short Sales
description: Blame the shorts.

title: Cellphones Are the New Junk Food
description: Teenagers with itchy typing fingers are shooting out text messages more than any other demographic in the United States, and as a result theyre talking on the phone a lot less, too, according to a survey by Nielsen, the media research firm.

title: Shipwrecked, and Landing New Personalities
description: There is chipmunk gambling. There is seductive dancing by Chipettes wearing only towels. There is a musical gag involving the lyric whip my tail back and forth. How Alvin and the Chipmunks: Chipwrecked ended up with only a G rating is a mystery.

title: Juggling Two Women Is Never Easy
description: Is there anything more cloyingly irritating than watching young singles playing a drinking game? Its the height of sophistication for those who think swapping swallows of booze is the pinnacle of human evolution, but for everyone else its just tedious.

title: Fresh Climategate Patter
description: The blogosphere is abuzz with rumors that the British police investigation into the 2009 release of private e-mails between climate scientists has taken on new life.

title: Addicts, a 6-Year-Old and an East Texas Meth Lab
description: Cook County opens on a shot of white powder and its maker, Bump (Anson Mount), informing his fellow addicts of the public service hes providing. Flexing biceps no druggie deserves and drawing out his vowels with the deep-throated groan of a creaky barn door, Bump is one of the more despicable cinematic creations of recent years. Worshiping bong, crystals and powder equally, holed up in his isolated East Texas meth lab, hes the epitome of backwoods sleaze and strung-out self-delusion.

title: Youve Got Application Questions? Well Have Answers, on Facebook
description: Are you a high school senior brimming with questions about those college applications youre trying desperately to finish? The Choice blog would like to offer you some help  and some answers  in a series of live chats.

title: Bahrain Activists Arrest Caught on Video
description: A blogger and human rights activist who called Bahrain a dictatorship in an interview with The New York Times this week was arrested on Thursday during a protest.

title: Jacobss Downhill Runs Put Giants on Upswing
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  For the past two seasons, Brandon Jacobss relationship with the Giants has been unsettled and seemingly changing all the time. He has moved to backup from his role as a starter. After flashes of success came periods of inconsistency. He has routinely found a way to upset the Giants order with his words and his actions.

title: The Whitefishs Burden
description: AS the first chill of winter descends on the Northeast and the traditional cold-weather codfish run starts in earnest, fishermen and scientists are again at odds, debating whether the once fantastically abundant North Atlantic codfish populations are finally rebuilding  or hurtling inextricably toward collapse.

title: Law Extends Its Reach in Bid to Halt Cockfighting
description: Lt. Joel Caldwells animal protection career began 12 years ago, when, as a deputy sheriff in Harris County, he responded to a call about a cat with an arrow through its body in a Houston trailer park.

title: Moral Responsibility Is Theme of New Romney Ad
description: Though Mitt Romney has yet to specifically attack Newt Gingrich, the former speaker of the House, for any past transgressions (see: his three marriages, his ethics violations in Congress), the title of Mr. Romneys new television ad  Moral Responsibility certainly seems to hint at a contrast between the two men.

title: By Choosing Arms Over Diplomacy, America Errs in Asia
description: Washington

title: Premier League: 19,964 Goals and Counting
description: The meter will be running this weekend, counting up toward the 20,000th goal scored in the 20th season of the English Premier League.

title: Candidates Engage Ahead of Debate
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  The lights wont go on at tonights Fox News debate until 9 p.m. Eastern, but the Republican candidates have already spent the day in a rhetorical sparring match as the clock ticks toward voting day in less than three weeks.

title: A Congressional Conflict of Interest
description: Imagine buying stock in a company and then being in position to help change the law to enhance its value. Welcome to the United States Congress. A fuel subsidy proposal, if passed, would enrich Representative Nancy Pelosi of California because of her stake in a green firm that stands to benefit. Its the latest sign that Congressional trading rules are in desperate need of an overhaul.

title: Perfect Storm of Events Led to Wheldons Death, IndyCar Report Says
description: IndyCar, still reeling from a disastrous end to its season, said Thursday that a perfect storm of events, many of them unforeseeable, led to the death of Dan Wheldon, one of the racing circuits most talented and popular drivers, two months ago at Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

title: U.S. Sues Businesses It Says Helped Hezbollah
description: The federal government on Thursday escalated its campaign to stanch the flow of what it says is dirty money to the Shiite militant group Hezbollah. Prosecutors filed a civil suit aimed at financially punishing American and Lebanese businesses that the government charges were behind a Hezbollah-controlled global network that laundered huge sums in South American cocaine proceeds.

title: Politics in Your Pocket and Music in the Air
description: Sarah Wheaton and Jonathan Ellis of The Times discuss the new Election 2012 app for the iPhone, and Pedro Rafael Rosado takes a look at AirPlay gear for wirelessly streaming media.

title: Seeding Chinas Start-Up Scene, With a Nod to Silicon Valley
description: BEIJING  When Gary Rieschel moved to China in 2005, he was looking to take a break. He had spent two decades bouncing between Silicon Valley and Asia, most recently managing technology investments in the aftermath of the dot-com bust.

title: University of Texas President Ends Tough Year With Yet Another Battle
description: For William C. Powers, 2011 has been a year full of upheavals.

title: Kinders Major Bet on a Boom in Fracking
description: HOUSTON  The oil and gas business is full of gamblers who drill deep and often, praying for gushers but frequently ending up with dry holes.

title: President of Florida A&M Faces Suspension in Hazing
description: MIAMI  Gov. Rick Scott called on Thursday for the president of Florida A&M University to be suspended until the completion of a criminal investigation into the death of a marching band member who collapsed in November, possibly after a hazing-related beating.

title: Years Later, Still Waiting for a Second Chance
description: HENDERSON, Nev.  Over the past 25 years, 14 men have led New York-area professional teams to a championship game or series. Twelve are still with their team or were hired to comparable head coach or manager positions with other franchises. Only two were not.

title: Please Stop Sharing
description: Last week, there came from the dispiriting clutter of the nations capital an extraordinary tale of our times. It concerned aides to Representative Rick Larsen, Democrat of Washington, who broadcast via Twitter how cool it was to be sitting in the seat of power at midday while drinking Jack Daniels and watching Nirvana videos on the taxpayers dime.

title: A Lucky Attorney General and Redistricting
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: Britain: Arrest in Police Payoffs Inquiry
description: A 37-year-old woman was arrested on Thursday as part of an investigation into illegal payments to the police by employees of Rupert Murdochs News of the World tabloid, Scotland Yard said Thursday.The British news media reported that the woman was Lucy Panton, a former crime editor for the tabloid. A report in The Guardian newspaper suggested that Ms. Panton was married to a Scotland Yard detective, and a public register of meetings with police officers shows that she and the newspapers editor met with John Yates, a senior officer who subsequently resigned over links to The News of the World, in November 2009. A spokesman for the Metropolitan police declined to discuss the reports.The arrest is the seventh in the Scotland Yard inquiry into payments to officers.

title: Court of Appeals Rules That State Can Seek Full Cleanup of Superfund Sites
description: In a decision affecting some of New Yorks most toxic sites, the Court of Appeals ruled Thursday that state environmental regulators could seek to require companies responsible for the pollution to restore the areas to the condition they were in before the contamination occurred.

title: Paying a Sports Tax, Even if You Dont Watch
description: Are you ready for some football?

title: The Mississippi Alligator Hunt
description: The alligator hunting season consists of four Fridays and Saturdays a year in Mississippi, where the limit is two and the permits are hard to get.

title: Politics Over Principle
description: The trauma of Sept. 11, 2001, gave rise to a dangerous myth that, to be safe, America had to give up basic rights and restructure its legal system. The United States was now in a perpetual state of war, the argument went, and the criminal approach to fighting terrorism  and the due process that goes along with it  wasnt tough enough.

title: A Formal End
description: It is a relief that the American role in the misguided Iraq war is finally over. It came to an official close on Thursday with an appropriately subdued ceremony in Baghdad. We mourn the nearly 4,500 American troops and tens of thousands of Iraqis who lost their lives.

title: Times Chief Is to Retire at Year-End
description: Janet L. Robinson, who served as chief executive of The New York Times Company during a time of rapid change and uncertainty in the newspaper industry, will step down at the end of the month, the company announced Thursday.

title: Look for the Glowing Eyes, Then Watch Your Fingers
description: GAUTIER, Miss.  It was around midnight when Jeremy and JoAnna Mitchells spotlight caught the reflective eyes of the alligator. Judging from its head, Whac-a-Mole-like on the surface of the water, it was a large animal, maybe a 10-footer.

title: After Stints in Hospital, a Struggle With Bills
description: This May, when James Connolly, a slim New York City native with a slight stoop and a shock of white hair, started life anew, he took the downtown E train, carrying bags of his clothes and all the history books he could fit.

title: Picket Lines
description: The Nov. 30, 1861, issue of Harpers Weekly featured a poem destined to become one of the essential texts of the Civil War, Ethel Lynn Beerss The Picket-Guard. Beers, a 34-year-old native of Goshen, N.Y., said later that she wrote her only famous work in a single morning, after a boardinghouse breakfast at which one of her fellow residents relayed a newspaper report of all quiet along the Potomac, as usual. Beers had answered by reading aloud the sub-headline, except a poor picket shot. Her versified elaboration on the dispatch, in which a lonely guard is killed by a sniper early one morning, posed moral questions about the culture of war-making that have proved far more durable than her sentimental literary style.

title: Fords Home Team Chooses New York as Site for Lincolns Boutique Agency
description: AS the Ford Motor Company seeks to reinvent its Lincoln luxury-car brand, WPP, the giant agency holding company that works for Ford Motor, is reinventing its model for creating campaigns for Lincoln.

title: Russell Hoban, Father of Frances
description: Its hard to write a book. Its harder to write one with living characters, clever scenes, warmth and wit. And its harder still when the people youre writing for cant read, or read only a little, when the words you choose must be simple, short and sweet. And if not always sweet, at least short.

title: News Flash: Progress Happens
description: The benefit of writing a column about solutions is that it provides an alternative lens through which to view the world. The daily news tends to be dominated by daunting challenges (unemployment, climate change, the polarization of Congress) and flashpoint events (the killing of Osama bin Laden, the tsunami in Japan, the Penn State scandal). These stories are vital to cover. However, people often come away from the news with a lot more information about problems than about how society is dealing with them.

title: Lottery Numbers

title: G.O.P. Monetary Madness
description: Apparently the desperate search of Republicans for someone they can nominate not named Willard M. Romney continues. New polls suggest that in Iowa, at least, we have already passed peak Gingrich. Next up: Representative Ron Paul.

title: For Some Egyptian Women, a Fear of Losing Equal Rights
description: Mayy el Sheikh, 24, was recently hired as a reporter and researcher in The Timess Cairo Bureau to help cover the first parliamentary elections since President Hosni Mubarak was forced from power. The second of three rounds of voting for the lower house of Parliament was completed Thursday. It is expected that Islamists will dominate the new legislature.

title: The Knicks Are Short on Outside Shooters
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  As the Knicks scrimmaged to conclude practice on Thursday, two things stood out.

description: WASHINGTON  Jon S. Corzine, the former chief executive of MF Global, on Thursday denied claims that he had known the brokerage firm was improperly tapping customer funds to stave off collapse.

description: Newt Gingrich predicted that Mr. Obama will not have a leg to stand on trying to defend a record that is terrible and an ideology that is radical.

description: To hear Michael R. Bloomberg tell it, a judge put a dangerous criminal back on the streets because she couldnt be bothered to make a simple phone call. Its not a lot of work to do to protect the public, Mr. Bloomberg said Wednesday.

title: 2 Executives at Amgen Plan to Retire
description: The chief executive and the head of research and development at Amgen will retire next year, both after more than a decade on the job, the company said Thursday.

title: Friday: Last Article in the Constitution
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Hoo boy. This was a tough one, and Im normally on Doug Petersons and Barry C. Silks wavelength. How did you fare?

title: More Liu Donors Said to Be Examined in Fund-Raising Inquiry
description: The federal inquiry into the campaign finances of New York Citys comptroller, John C. Liu, a possible mayoral candidate in 2013, appears to be widening, with people knowledgeable about the matter saying Thursday that there has been an increased focus on seeking information from his supporters in the Chinese-American business community.

description: LOS ANGELES  And the winner of the competition for Chris Paul is ... the Los Angeles Clippers?

description: The director of the National Park Service, after blocking Grand Canyon National Parks attempt to ban the sale of small plastic water bottles, will now allow such bans, but under a restrictive set of conditions, the park service announced on Thursday.

description: Joe Simon, a writer, editor and illustrator of comic books who was a co-creator of the superhero Captain America, conceived out of a patriotic impulse as war was roiling Europe, died on Wednesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 98.

description: St. Jude Medical said on Thursday that its Riata defibrillator leads, which the company stopped selling last year, had been recalled by the Food and Drug Administration because of their potential to injure or kill patients.

description: HOUSTON

title: After Takeover of Union Local, a Rebellion in the Tugboat Ranks
description: Joe Dady has been plying the waters of New York Harbor since 1976, when he followed his father and five older brothers into the tugboat trade. He started as a deckhand, moved up to mate, and became a captain  a throttle jockey in tug lingo  in 1992. He knows the tides, the currents, the eddies and the inlets the way a veteran cabby knows the back streets to La Guardia Airport. A major part of his seamans creed, Mr. Dady said, stemmed from his faith in his union  Local 333 of the United Marine Division, International Longshoremens Association  to steer him and his mates safely.

description: When is the final Saturday before Christmas? Dont bother consulting a calendar if youre shopping at Macys, Sears or J. C. Penney.

title: Sony Keeps Its Wager on Game Consoles With Vita

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,838 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans this week:

title: Italys Leader Offers Tax Increases, but No Deep Reforms
description: ROME  Prime Minister Mario Monti came into office last month with a mandate to restart Italys economy and restore Europes confidence in the country amid an intractable debt crisis. But the package he will put to a vote in Parliament on Friday consists primarily of tax increases, not the structural changes to the economy that many experts say are necessary to restart healthy growth.

title: The Day Tyson Chandler Took Over Twitter
description: The tsunami of instant information that the Twitter era of sports journalism provides isnt good for a person with an addictive personality.

Salo, the Trojans mens and womens coach and a member of the United States 2012 Olympic staff, has earned a reputation as a breaststroke whisperer for his success working with swimmers with different backgrounds and disparate styles.

description: PARIS  In his dark comedy of 1893, A Woman of No Importance, Oscar Wilde has Mrs. Arbuthnot, a respectable woman with a secret past, remark knowingly: A kiss may ruin a human life.

As Hansen recalled, the instructor turned to his mother and said: Maybe your son should do something else. Hes not really getting this.

description: Newt Gingrich defended his record on abortion.

description: Melena Ryzik looks at the trend toward Hollywood nostalgia in this years Oscar race, and talks to the stars of Hugo and The Artist.

title: Edie Stevenson Dies at 81; Wrote Lets Get Mikey Ad

description: BEIJING  The actor Christian Bale was assaulted by government-backed guards on Thursday when he tried to visit a blind lawyer who has been illegally confined to his home in eastern Shandong Province.

title: Behind the Primaries
description: Most national candidates, and too many political commentators, miss the mini-primaries that lead up to the real events. In coalition parties, which the Democrats have been since F.D.R. and the Republicans have been since Nixon, campaigns are formed by creating personal coalitions around the various candidates. And for grassroots campaigns, of the sort I constructed for myself in 1983-84, it is even more basic than that. It is about finding key people in key primary states who combine a high reputation, organizational skill and a network of political contacts to form a campaign nucleus around which the rest of the state can be organized. I was once asked how many people I needed to win New Hampshire and I said, Six.

description: inured \i-nurd, -nyurd\ adjective

title: Ruling Against Iran in Sept. 11 Case

title: Christopher Hitchens, Polemicist Who Slashed All, Freely, Dies at 62
description: Christopher Hitchens, a slashing polemicist in the tradition of Thomas Paine and George Orwell who trained his sights on targets as various as Henry Kissinger, the British monarchy and Mother Teresa, wrote a best-seller attacking religious belief, and dismayed his former comrades on the left by enthusiastically supporting the American-led war in Iraq, died on Thursday in Houston. He was 62.

title: Rethinking How the Law Is Taught
Underpayment Can Be a Norm at Small Businesses
description: In 2005 Carlos Ruiz lost part of a thumb when it was caught in machinery at Little Village Car Wash, where he had worked since coming to Chicago from Mexico City in 2000. After the accident, he moved to washing cars by hand, and for six years he worked 12-hour shifts three days a week, earning about $40 a day.

description: Protests against land seizures continue in the small fishing village of Wukan, in Chinas Guangdong Province.

description: There was no rescue Thursday night for the oft-rescued Marcus Canty, and the final three on The X Factor were made official: Josh Krajcik, Melanie Amaro and Chris Rene will compete for that $5 million recording contract when the season ends next week.

title: Contractor on Oil Spill Has Settled With BP

description: When we first came up with the idea for FantasyPros, I have to admit that I had nightmares about fantasy experts hunting me down because of the accountability were creating in the industry. We knew fantasy players would love it, but how would the experts react?

title: Swedens Vattenfall to Sell Energy Assets for $2 Billion
description: LONDON  The Swedish energy company Vattenfall agreed on Friday to sell its Finnish electricity distribution and heat businesses to a consortium of investors, including the British private equity firm 3i, for $2 billion.

description: LONDON  Apollo Global Management agreed on Friday to buy Taminco, a Belgian chemicals company, from a rival private equity firm, CVC Capital Partners, for $1.4 billion.

title: As Indonesia Grows, Discontent Sets in Among Workers
description: JAKARTA  As a flare-red sun set, a group of laborers in their 20s and 30s gathered on the bare floor of a battered house wedged beneath power lines in an industrial part of Jakarta. They were members of a confederation of multi- sector workers, one of the largest trade unions in Indonesia, whose slogan is Young, brave, militant.

title: United Rentals to Buy RSC Holdings for $1.87 Billion
description: United Rentals agreed on Friday to buy RSC Holdings for about $1.87 billion in cash and stock, seeking to combine two of the countrys big rental equipment providers.

title: This Is Not Your Fathers Company
description: Most family businesses dont survive beyond the founders generation. Bari Jay, in its second generation, and Johnson Security Bureau, in its third, are two exceptions. Both companies are thriving largely because of the efforts of two of our business group members, Susan Parker and Jessica Johnson, respectively. Each woman stepped in after her fathers death, and remade aspects of the business, often taking steps that their fathers never would have considered  or endorsed. During our latest meeting of the group, Ms. Johnson and Ms. Parker talked about what their fathers might think if they were to see how things run today.

title: Beijing Imposes New Rules on Social Networking Sites
description: BEIJING  Officials announced new rules on Friday aimed at controlling the way Chinese Internet users post messages on social networking sites that have posed challenges to the Chinese Communist Partys propaganda machinery.

title: Japans Prime Minister Declares Fukushima Plant Stable
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda of Japan has declared an end to the worlds worst nuclear crisis since Chernobyl, saying technicians have regained control of reactors at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant.

title: New Beacon of Scotland's Identity

title: Oh for the Early Days of  Film (and Film Promotion)
description: If youre reading this blog, youre probably familiar with the For Your Consideration ads that studios flaunt during awards season, a tradition that goes back to at least 1955, when one such promo for The Man With the Golden Arm appeared in a Hollywood trade publication. (It worked, to some extent anyway: the movies star, Frank Sinatra, was nominated for an Oscar, though he didnt win.) The Bagger discovered these and other treasures  like For Your Consideration: Best Actor, Michael Jordan  as we investigated the history of vintage film promotion and why Hollywood is so enamored with the dawn of cinema in new pictures like The Artist, which led the Golden Globe nominations on Thursday, and Hugo, which picked up a few nods as well. Watch and learn. Roll tape!

title: Carlyle Sells Diversified Machine to Platinum Equity
description: 9:44 a.m. | Updated The Carlyle Group announced on Friday that it had sold Diversified Machine, a maker of car parts, to Platinum Equity after a six-year effort to expand the business.

title: Credit Agricole to Sell Private Equity Unit
description: The clearance sale of European bank assets continues.

title: Romney Holds Fire Against Gingrich in Debate
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Mitt Romney came into the debate Thursday night armed by his campaign with plenty of ammunition to unload on his chief rival here, Newt Gingrich.

title: Private in WikiLeaks Spying Case Goes to Court
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  A defense lawyer for Bradley Manning, the Army private accused in the most famous leak of government secrets since the Pentagon Papers, began a frontal attack during Private Mannings first court appearance here on Friday morning, claiming that the Armys investigating officer at the evidentiary hearing was biased and should recuse himself from the case.

title: Monti Wins Confidence Vote in Italys Lower House
description: ROME  Prime Minister Mario Monti of Italy won a confidence vote in the Lower House on Friday, speeding up the parliamentary passage of the 30-billion-euro budget bill aimed at restoring market confidence in the Italian economy and restarting its sluggish growth.

title: Fed Up With Putin
description: MOSCOW  Once a year the Russian leader Vladimir Putin engages in a bizarre ritual: he holds a marathon question-and-answer session broadcast live on Russian television. Year after year, he beats his own record for the length of time spent in front of the camera in one sitting. The questions are pre-screened, as they are during Putins other annual political ritual, his press conference. These two yearly events represent the sum total of Putins direct communication with the public.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Corzine Denies Knowing That MF Global Was Tapping Client Money| Jon S. Corzine, the former chief executive of MF Global, on Thursday denied claims that he had known the brokerage firm was improperly tapping customer money to stave off collapse.

title: No, Reagan Did Not Author the Republicans 11th Commandment
description: As the voting in Iowa draws closer, Republican candidates have sharpened their attacks on each other, drawing a rebuke of sorts from Fox News moderator Bret Baier last night at their debate.

title: Opinion Report: The War Is (Not) Over
description: From the editorial page

title: A Call for Parent Power. Real Power.
Just One Look | Diane von Furstenberg
description: I think the thing about pre-fall is that its all great pieces, says the designer Diane von Furstenberg about how she revisited some of her labels most iconic shapes and cuts for this collection. You love them and they stay your friend forever. Memory lane took von Furstenberg to the wrap dress print archives (which translated to punky gingham skirts and jackets, with thoughtful details on things like the interior linings) and vibrant solids (like this color-blocked lime robe coat and burnished boucl skirt). I love pieces; even a dress is a piece. Another great piece? A pony-hair spotted patent leather duck boot.

title: Regulator Wants to Curb Use of Customer Cash
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission recently reined in the brokerage industrys risky investments with customer money, a crackdown that followed the collapse of MF Global and the firms misuse of roughly $1 billion in client money.

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 16
description: The announcement that the National Football League had struck an extraordinary long-term deal with the major networks  $27 billion over nine years  is good news for the league but most likely means the average cable bill will rise again soon, Brian Stelter and Amy Chozick write.

title: Lumire | Paris All Decod Out
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Daily Report: Research in Motions Endless Struggles
description: Tech journalists are picking apart the latest bad news from Research in Motion, maker of BlackBerry phones. On Thursday the company said that a new line of smartphones that it hoped would turn around its flagging fortunes would not come to market until late next year, Ian Austen reports.

title: Sowing Zyngas Riches
description: Zyngas initial public offering didnt quite hit the $20 billion valuation widely expected earlier this year, but dont pity Mark Pincus. The chief executive and other owners have done quite well. At $10 per share, Fridays offering values Zynga at $7 billion  not shabby for a four-year-old company that sells digital livestock and emerald ponies. Heres a look at the early investors and their Zynga holdings.

title: Supreme Court Grants Assange Right to Appeal
description: LONDON  Julian Assange, the founder of the WikiLeaks, won a new reprieve on Friday when the Supreme Court here agreed to hear his appeal on an order extraditing him to Sweden to answer accusations of sexual misbehavior.

title: Friday Is Draw Day in Switzerland
description: Friday was a busy day for UEFA in Nyon, Switzerland, as the draws for the next rounds of the Champions and Europa leagues were held.

title: Journalist Is Shot Dead in Russias North Caucasus Region
description: MOSCOW  A prominent journalist from Russias violence-plagued North Caucasus region was shot to death late Thursday as he left his newspaper, adding to a rising toll of journalists and human rights workers killed in the region in recent years.

title: Commodities Companies Help Lift Markets
description: Stock indexes were mixed on Friday as gains among commodity producers helped overcome debt-crisis concerns prompted by Fitch Ratings warning that it might cut ratings of European nations.

title: Whats Next? A Top 10 on Art Shows?
description: David Letterman would be the first to admit that his taste in art is pretty malleable, if he admits to having one at all.

title: Trader in UBS Scandal Drops His Lawyer
description: LONDON  Kweku M. Adoboli, the former UBS trader charged with fraud and false accounting, has dumped his law firm days before his next court hearing where he was expected to enter a plea.

title: The Pre-K Underground
description: It was 6 p.m. on a Friday in early June, and my childrens dinnertime coincided with the moment the New York City Department of Education posted acceptance letters online for 4-year-olds seeking prekindergarten spots in public school.

title: Pulling Oohs and Aahs Out of Thin Air
description: Xavier the Magician does not think rabbits are exciting.

title: Scandals Test the N.C.A.A.s Top Rules Enforcer
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Nearly two weeks after sexual abuse allegations surfaced last month against a former Penn State assistant football coach  and after myriad law enforcement officials and the Department of Education announced they were investigating the matter  the national governing body for college athletics sent a letter to the university requesting information about the charges.

title: And on This Floor, a Cross-Cultural Whos Who
description: The blond divas are neck and neck on the awards path: in the last few days both Meryl Streep and Glenn Close have picked up key nominations for their performances as, respectively, Margaret Thatcher (The Iron Lady) and a woman passing as a man in Victorian Dublin (Albert Nobbs). The films had simultaneous screenings and afterparties on Tuesday.

title: W.T.O. Grants Russia Membership
description: GENEVA  Global trade ministers on Friday approved Russias bid to join the World Trade Organization, giving Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin a victory on the international stage at a time of rising domestic opposition to his hold on power.

title: A Shocking Arrest in the N.F.L.
description: Perhaps its a good thing that the sports news still has the capacity to surprise and amaze us, even if the bad part is, it takes a whopper of a story to accomplish that. After all, once youve absorbed the child sexual abuse apocalypse at Penn State, the bar is raised a bit. But the story out of Chicago that Bears receiver Sam Hurd was charged Thursday with dealing a rather massive amount of cocaine and marijuana as an alleged sideline to his $2 million-a-year N.F.L. job, well, that still has the ability to drop a few jaws.

title: What Were Reading
description: Outside the Beltway: Some musings on the late Christopher Hitchens and his approach to the art of drinking.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Friday Reading: Today Is Free Shipping Day Online
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: With Loss of 2 Arts Leaders, the End of an Era
description: One of them found a tiny old theater on a grungy stretch of the Bowery. The other mortgaged her home to buy a 19th-century coffee barge and haul it to the Fulton Ferry Landing in Brooklyn.

title: Pride and Prejudice and Murder
description: Aspiring writers take heart: one of the most beloved novels of all time was rejected when it was fluttered in front of publishers in 1797  or so the historical record suggests. Called First Impressions, it was written by a country girl whose father was so impressed by his daughters sage and vivacious creation that he sent a letter of inquiry to a publisher, who refused even to look at the manuscript. Never mind. Sixteen years later, the book appeared under a different title. Perhaps youve heard of it: Pride and Prejudice.

title: Sondheim on Sondheim
description: Stephen Sondheim claims to dislike most opera, and I guess I believe it. He also says he avoids serious fiction, and I suppose I believe this, too, even if his new book, Look, I Made a Hat, which collects his lyrics for the musical theater written from 1981 to 2011, does conclude with a quotation from James Joyces Ulysses.

title: The Voices in Philip K. Dicks Head
description: In 1979, I visited Philip K. Dick for a profile I was writing. In a modest apartment he shared with dusty stacks of books, deteriorating furniture, a vintage stereo system and a couple of cats, he took the opportunity to go public about a singular experience dominating his life. For the past five years, he told me earnestly, he had been receiving messages from a spiritual entity. It invaded my mind and assumed control of my motor centers, he said. It set about healing me physically and my 4-year-old boy, who had an undiagnosed life-threatening birth defect that no one had been aware of. It had memories dating back over 2,000 years. . . . There wasnt anything that it didnt seem to know.

title: Fiction Chronicle
description: THE BETRAYAL  By Helen Dunmore.  Black Cat. Paper, $14.95.

title: Harry Bosch Returns
description: Michael Connellys antic Lincoln Lawyer legal mysteries are great fun to read in the sun. But a Harry Bosch police procedural like THE DROP (Little, Brown, $27.99) is best saved for a dark, rainy night. Like maybe tonight.

title: Julian Barnes and the Diminishing of the English Novel
description: The narrator of Julian Barness acclaimed novel The Sense of an Ending is told by Veronica, a girlfriend from his university days, that he just doesnt get it. Then, after more clues have come his way, she tells him that he still doesnt get it. There are so many things he doesnt get that he even considers using the line as his epitaph: Tony Webster  He Never Got It.

title: The Channeling of the Novel
description: One day last April, Jennifer Egan found out that her fourth novel, A Visit From the Goon Squad, had won the Pulitzer Prize. A couple of days later, she got more good news  HBO wanted to turn the book into a television series.

title: And So It Goes
description: To the Editor:

title: Immortal Raiders
description: To the Editor:

title: Bread Alone
description: To the Editor:

title: Leaving Iraq
description: As other American forces shipped out, a handful of units stayed behind to help wind up the bases.

title: Getting to Know Charles Dickens
description: A couple of years ago, I played Charles Dickens in an episode of the British sci-fi series Doctor Who. As the doctor takes his leave of Earth, Dickens asks whether his books will still be read in the future. Yes, the doctor replies. For how long, Dickens wants to know. Forever, says the doctor, disappearing into cyberspace.

title: Daniel Handlers Teenagers Out of Love
description: Its not you, its me  youre great. Im so sorry, but this just isnt working out. I think we should see other people. Whether it was the boy who dumped you in the sandbox for that kid with the bright red fire truck or the girl who abruptly stopped answering your notes during algebra, no one makes it through life without exposure to that miserable condition known as the breakup. And now we have Daniel Handler (who also writes as Lemony Snicket) giving us the lowdown on the rise and fall of one dissolution in particular in Why We Broke Up.

title: Congress Approves Pipeline Safety Bill
description: A bill doubling the maximum fines that pipeline operators face for safety violations easily cleared the House and Senate this week along with other provisions intended to strengthen rules on oil and gas pipeline safety that critics have faulted as weak.

title: Dancing Out of China
description: These days, reality TV shows like American Idol inundate us with the sad stories of talented hopefuls, most of them eventually let down. Featured in condensed clips, orchestrated with sound bites, their stories never inspire true reflection, but we watch anyway. We are enthralled by the idea of someone emerging from obscurity to achieve stardom. Making your dream come true  your own individual dream versus that of the collective  is the equivalent of the individual pursuit of happiness.

title: The Giving Spree | Jeffrey Eugenides
description: Who: Jeffrey Eugenides, the author, most recently, of The Marriage Plot.

title: The Limits of Make-Believe
description: Ill never let you go, Lizzie. No matter what happens to me, Ill never ever let you go. This refrain, which runs through Without Tess, contains a dark double message about the bonds and boundaries of sisterhood. Following up on themes raised in her well-received first novel, Freak, in which a teenager distances herself from a bullied younger sister, Marcella Pixley continues to explore the complexities of sibling loyalty; this time, a girls separation and loss as she comes to terms with her sisters suicide.

title: A Pit Bull Plays Cupid
description: According to legend, the Random House co-founder Bennett Cerf once said that to guarantee a best-selling book, you should title it Lincolns Doctors Dog. In these dog-crazed times, you could probably skip both the president and the doctor  especially if you throw an adoring retriever or a bug-eyed terrier on the cover. Think of The Dogs of Babel, Marley & Me, You Had Me at Woof; the list goes on.

title: Nissan Recalls 28,000 Jukes and 34,000 Sentras for Possible Stalling Problems
description: In two actions, Nissan is recalling about 62,000 vehicles for stalling problems, the automaker told the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: Bookshelf: Snow
description: Childrens books set in wintry landscapes.

title: Waging a One-Man War on American Muslims
description: During the mid-1990s, after hearing about the harassment of gay students, the principal of Largo High School in Florida created a support group for them. Over the next year or two, the meetings also drew sympathetic friends, evolving into a club called the Gay Straight Alliance. For a while, it operated in comfortable obscurity.

title: The Year in Media | Making a Multicultural Pitch
description: Staff members of The Timess media news department are highlighting the most significant developments this year in the industries they cover.

title: Substance and Spectacle
description: YOU can complain all you want about the art-world money-go-round and the celebrity circus spinning in its widening gyre. Prices are up; so are mentions of Art Basel Miami on Page Six. Artworks seem only to get bigger and shinier, and spectacle  participatory or not  is becoming the new normal at museum exhibitions of contemporary art. Note the record crowds lining up to gawk at Maurizio Cattelans career immolation at the Guggenheim or whiz down Carsten Hllers tubular slide at the New Museum.

title: Complacency Butts Up Against Game Changers
description: THERE was a lot of painting on view in Zuccotti Park this fall, in the form of Occupy Wall Street protest posters, free for the taking. And there was a lot of painting on the walls of New York art galleries, most of it post-M.F.A. eye candy with hefty price tags. The physical distance between Lower Manhattan and the Chelsea art zone is short, but the mental and moral gap felt immeasurable. The park was about light-on-its-feet, change-the-game politics. Chelsea  leaden and inbred  was about cash and caution.

title: Bookshelf: Voyages
description: Childrens books about remarkable journeys.

title: Bookshelf: Snow
description: MAKING A FRIEND  By Alison McGhee.Illustrated by Marc Rosenthal.  40 pp. Atheneum. $16.99.(Picture book; ages 2 to 5)

title: Paperback Row
description: COMMON AS AIR: Revolution, Art, and Ownership,  by Lewis Hyde (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $16.) From the Human Genome Project to Bob Dylans musical roots, Hydes critique of the privatization of knowledge draws on the vision of founders like Franklin and Jefferson  who made their own works freely available  and enthusiastically argues for the necessity of a cultural commons.

title: Editors Choice
description: LIFE UPON THESE SHORES: Looking at African American History, 1513-2008,  by Henry Louis Gates Jr. (Knopf, $50.) More than 700 images, along with short essays, illuminate the sweep and diversity of African-American experience and culture.

title: Travel Day
description: In midair mostly, so no posting until possibly late.

title: Up Front
description: The multi-hyphenate British actor-author-director Simon Callow, still best known to many Americans for his roles in Four Weddings and a Funeral and Shakespeare in Love, says writing was his first ambition. In Britain, his second memoir was released last year and his new book on Charles Dickens will be published early next. His first, Dickens Christmas, was for children.

title: Bookshelf: Voyages
description: AROUND THE WORLD  Written and illustrated by Matt Phelan.  235 pp. Candlewick Press. $24.99.(Middle grade; ages 9 to 12)

title: Gingrich Steps Off the Campaign Trail for the Weekend, Says Hes Pacing
description: OMAHA  With the final presidential debates of the year behind him, Newt Gingrich did not make his case to Iowa voters on Friday, but returned home to spend the weekend off the campaign trail.

title: Miniature Magazine by a Young Charlotte Bront Fetches $1.1 Million at Auction
description: A miniature handwritten magazine created by Charlotte Bront when she was 14 years old was sold to a Paris museum for nearly 700,000, or $1.1 million, at an auction at Sothebys in London on Thursday.

title: The Latest in Yoga, From Paris
description: Paris may have it all over New York for croissants, bike-sharing and availability of unfiltered cigarettes, but yoga classes?

title: Spending An Afternoon in Christopher Hitchenss Hospital-Room-Turned-Office
description: In October I flew to Houston to interview Christopher Hitchens in his hospital room at the MD Anderson Cancer Center. When he greeted me his shirt was open and, I couldnt help noticing, there was a plastic tube sticking out of his chest. Hitchens, who died on Thursday at the age of 62, was matter of fact about it, as he was about everything having to do with his illness. Cancer was an inconvenience, he gave me to understand  big inconvenience, probably a terminal one  but it wasnt going to keep him from doing what he loved most, which was to write.

title: Patriots-Broncos, Victor Cruz, Andrew Luck: Answers for Readers
description: Judy Battista, who covers the N.F.L. for The Times, answers readers questions:

title: Shea Hembreys Artists
description: Works from Hembreys obscure biennial exhibition, Seek.

title: Grabbing Life by the Horns
description: When I was a child, my mother told me that everyone in the world hated me. They hated me, she said, because I was a Jew.

title: Clues That Lead to More Clues That Add Up to Nothing
description: Imagine that a laboratory rat has just been introduced to a maze. We know that rats will navigate mazes for a reward  a pellet of food, say, or a dose of cocaine  but what if the reward of this particular maze is only the promise of a mystery pellet of unknown origin?

title: Michael Stipe Is Not Grumpy
description: A member of R.E.M. once said that in the early days you guys drank a lot and took a lot of speed. Listening to the older songs on your new retrospective, Part Lies, Part Heart, Part Truth, Part Garbage, I was unable to stop bouncing my leg. Is it the speed Im hearing?  That certainly contributed. Peter Buck developed a style of guitar playing that was, at the time, very unpopular, picking rather than playing punk-rock power chords. Mike Millss favorite band was the Ramones, and with that you got that hyperanimated 16th note and 32nd note. And with speed and beer you get speed. I slowed down my vocal to try to counter the speed and inadvertently developed the vocal style that is still with me.

title: One Hundred Artists Rolled Into One Man
description: You could be forgiven for not knowing about the artist Mart Meyer, who lives in Dallas and photographs what he sees almost moment by moment. Or for not having heard of the Chinese artist Ju Hu, who created a large-scale work examining the malleable flow of time as he camped out in an autumnal forest and tried to tape every fallen leaf back onto its tree. Almost certainly, youre not acquainted with the art made by Rosalie Starr, who died in 1969 but whose sculptures were recently discovered in the attic of a Georgia boardinghouse, or the guerrilla feces paintings  quite beautiful, really  that have been popping up on the walls of public restrooms in New York and four other states and attributed to an artist known only as the East Coast Swiper.

title: Sand Blast
description: The sand dunes of Glamis, Calif., are a majestic expanse of pristine sand and sky. Until the dune buggies arrive, that is.

title: An Old-Fashioned Shark Hunt
description: While his children slept on the sand during the final hour before daybreak, Path Ndong packed a canister of diesel and an icebox full of knives for the day ahead. In Mbour, a shantytown on Senegals Atlantic coast, everyone is a fisherman in disguise, including this father of nine, his face obscured by a Western Union baseball cap and a pharaonic goatee. On mornings like this one, the carpenter becomes a knife-wielding Ahab. When I asked Ndong what he was out to catch, his 43-year-old eyes flared. Gainde guedj, he said in Wolof. The lion of the sea.

title: Grocery Shopping on Speed
description: Grocery shopping was once a relatively genteel pastime. Stores had pressed-tin ceilings and employees in white aprons. Patrons called in orders and had them delivered free. The notion that you might want to palpate your own cantaloupe was absurd.

title: My Brother, My Bully
description: My 40-year-old brother is successful but has no friends or social skills. On his best days, he is monosyllabic. On his bad days, hes belligerent, baiting our family into snapping at him or each other. He calls this Zach Galifianakis humor. My parents think, Thats just the way he is. I think he has Aspergers syndrome. My question: Whats the ethical way to behave toward a close family member who has serious psychological issues and possibly a disability? I could ride it out for the few holidays we see him. Though I have had no success suggesting therapy, I feel I should be actively helping him. My husband wants to punch his lights out. This is also tempting. ANONYMOUS, AUSTIN, TEX.

title: Waking Chris
description: As a graduate student in neuroscience who studies patients with disorders of consciousness, including some who respond to zolpidem, I commend the author for accurately capturing both the desperation and the hope associated with recovery from brain injury. But I strongly object to the articles title as it appeared on The Timess Web site: A Drug That Wakes the Near Dead. Patients with disorders of consciousness like the ones profiled in the article are not near death. Such a label conflates brain injury with brain degeneration. Further, it trivializes the often heartbreaking end-of-life decisions that families make. While the article made this point, the title you chose unfortunately reinforces a false stereotype of these very much alive patients.

title: Inside the List
description: THE GIFT LIST: Do bankers give money for the holidays? Do designers give clothes? I dont know  but I do know that, just like you and me, rich and famous authors often give books. Sometimes they even give best sellers. Exhibit A is Janet Evanovich (at No. 6 on the hardcover fiction list this week with Explosive Eighteen), who will hand her husband a copy of Walter Isaacsons biography of Steve Jobs (at No. 1 on the hardcover nonfiction list). Evanovich, inset, also plans to give Mario Batalis new cookbook, Molto Batali, to her foodie son-in-law, and Dr. Seuss How the Grinch Stole Christmas! to her grandson. Hes named Max, just like the Grinchs beleaguered dog.

title: Building a Better Mitt Romney-Bot
description: The problem with Mitt is that he is a dime-a-dozen Northeast manager. For the bottom line, he will do anything. Who gets taken care of: Wal-Mart, G.M., big pharma, foreign companies/donors, Chinese businesses, lobbyists. Who loses: seniors, I.T. workers, American taxpayers, honest and dedicated public servants and the military.

title: In a Time of Giving, Learning When to Say No
description: THIS is the time of year when you are asked for all sorts of donations. I always find the process moderately stressful, but not because my wife and I are agonizing over how much to give.

title: For Zyngas I.P.O., Pomp and a Slump
description: 8:14 p.m. | Updated

title: Visiting a Forest at Its Most Elemental
description: See a larger version of the forest from this week. Compare with the enlarged version of last weeks image.

title: Pod Cars Are Poised to Transform an Indian Citys Streetscape and Skyline
description: ULTra Fairwood, an engineering company in India, announced this week that it reached an agreement with the Punjab government to build a personal rapid transit system in Amritsar, an Indian city of 1.5 million about 40 miles from the Pakistani metropolis of Lahore. The system would be based on the pod-car technology of ULTra Global PRT, which recently completed a proof-of-concept at Heathrow Airport in London.

title: Introducing the Events API
description: This past November, The New York Times launched the Arts & Entertainment Guide, an interactive guide to noteworthy cultural events in and around New York City. The application lets you browse through a hand-selected listing of events, customizing the view based on date range, category and location.

title: Buying Toys This Christmas? Try Renting Them Instead
description: IF you want to avoid spending a lot of money this year on things that wont last, like Christmas trees and toys, you dont have to buy. You can now rent them, enjoying the items in your house but sending them back when you dont want them anymore.

title: A Columnist Steps Away After More Than Three Decades on the Beat
description: This is a column about a column.

title: Newt Gingrich at the Airport
description: Jeff Zeleny caught up with Newt Gingrich at the airport as he planned to take a day off from his campaign.

title: Hell No, They Wont Go
description: BAGHDAD  From the potato, cucumber and land-mine-friendly soil of Abu Ghraibs farmland there can be little doubt that the American military is leaving Iraq in huge numbers: squatting shepherds thumbing prayer beads no longer even glance up at the rumbling of the latest thousand-ton caravan of heavy armor heading south toward the desert into Kuwait.

title: Same Exhibition, Just Not as Great
description: As a title, the Great Designers was provocative, but perhaps it was a bit misleading.

title: Amid New Clashes in Cairo, Civilian Advisory Council Suspends Its Work
description: CAIRO  Egypts military rulers suffered a major embarrassment on Friday when a new civilian advisory council designed to bolster their legitimacy suspended its operations in protest over the militarys deadly but ineffective treatment of peaceful demonstrators.

title: A Busy Day for Romney
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Mitt Romney headed toward a weekend sprint across South Carolina on Friday as he collected the endorsement of the governor, Nikki Haley, in the hopes of beating back the recent surge in support for his rival, Newt Gingrich.

title: Bark If You Love People
description: What are the 10 dog breeds best suited to life in a New York City apartment? We didnt think it was a tough question. We were wrong. Three dog lovers rose to the challenge.

title: Who Would Have Thought?
description: WE music lovers go to many performances with a pretty clear idea of what to expect. Yet looking back at the years musical highlights I am struck by how many took me by surprise.

title: How Our Primary Forecasts Work
description: Today were officially launching the FiveThirtyEight polling-based forecasts of the upcoming presidential primaries and caucuses. This article will explain, in modestly but not excruciatingly technical detail, how they work.

title: The City as Chew Toy
description: CERTAIN charms of New York City living  the infinite brunch options, the 24-hour bodegas, the Museum of Modern Art  are no doubt lost on many pets. Even so, plenty of owners believe that the city is ideal for dogs, offering endless opportunities for socializing and sniffing at dog runs, hydrants and doggy day care centers. Working late? Dog walkers abound. Square footage is tight? More opportunity for canine-human bonding.

title: At Lincoln High, the Path to College Is Through Renee Schoenfeld
Ristretto | Tokyo Coffee
description: When I tell people that I went to Tokyo to check out the coffee, I get two reactions. One is bewilderment  as if I went to Denver for the surfing. The other is fascination: those who pay attention to coffee know that Japan is the worlds third-largest importer (after the United States and Germany), with obsessive buyers who regularly land the winning bids at Cup of Excellence auctions, and that it produces the coffee gear everybody wants.

title: Senate Leaders Agree on 2-Month Extension of Payroll Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON  Senate leaders said on Friday night that they had reached a deal that would extend a payroll tax cut for two months  falling far short of the yearlong extension they had been seeking. The agreement would also speed the decision process for theconstruction of an oil pipeline from Canada to the Gulf Coast, a provision necessary to win over Republicans who opposed the tax break.

title: Highlights From the Year in Dance
description: A slide show of images of some of the best performances this year.

title: Grand Entrances and a Long Goodbye
description: ALTHOUGH it was evident that the final year of the Merce Cunningham Dance Company would be historic, there was no knowing which of his dances in 2011 would prove most rewarding in performance. Who would have known that Quartet (1982) would reveal itself to be an enduring masterpiece at the companys Joyce Theater season in March? Robert Swinston, the companys director of choreography, now dancing the role once inextricably linked to Cunningham himself onstage, kept the dramas ambiguities alive on many levels.

title: Metropolitan Museum Provides a Trove of Images for Google Goggles
description: Over the past year visual-art obsessives have been having a field day with the feature of the Google smart-phone app called Google Goggles, which allows a user to shoot a picture of something  a painting, a photograph, a poster  and in seconds see an identification of the image and a list of search results for more information about it.

title: 2011 in Rhyme and Headlines: The Year in Rap and Our Annual News Quiz
description: The Year in Rap: 2011 from Flocabulary

title: Off the Charts: Few Are Fired, or Hired
description: The number of private sector workers who were laid off or discharged over the last 12 months is the lowest for any similar period since the government began collecting the statistics in 1990. The rate of hiring also remains low, but has improved since the recession ended in 2009. The number of workers quitting their jobs  a sign of confidence that they can do better elsewhere  has also risen. The number of job openings relative to the number of unemployed workers is down from the peak, but remains far above prerecession levels.

title: A New Generation Comes Into Focus
description: ONE evening at a performance by American Ballet Theater at City Center this fall, the dancers took their places. But as the curtain rose on Twyla Tharps In the Upper Room, the fog part of what gives this galvanic work its heavenly setting  was thick enough to create white-out conditions. Still, within the haze was a body that danced like a ribbon.

title: Moments to Cherish, Filled With Discovery And Somber Farewell
description: ITS been almost a year since I saw Sarah Michelsons Devotion at the Kitchen in January. But her searing dance, a collaboration with the New York City Players artistic director Richard Maxwell, shines more brightly in my mind than most of the work Ive seen since.

title: The Driver Market and a Roundup of Other Racing News
description: The so-called silly season in Formula One, where the teams name their drivers for the following season, used to happen in the summer. This year it was delayed until after the season ended, and a couple of seats have just been claimed.

title: The Driver Market and a Roundup of Other Racing News
description: The so-called silly season in Formula One, where the teams name their drivers for the following season, used to happen in the summer. This year it was delayed until after the season ended, and a couple of seats have just been claimed.

title: Disregard That Past Due Invoice From the College Board
description: At a time when the College Board is already under scrutiny, as in the SAT testing fraud investigation on Long Island, the organization that oversees the high-stakes college entrance exam has inadvertently raised students anxiety on another front.

title: The Clipper Makes Her Rounds
description: Youd be amazed at what people walk around with, said Serena Merrill.
