Ive asked this before; however, commentary drops off markedly on those days (I dont know how many people actually are doing the puzzles and just not commenting on the blog) and for the life of me, I dont know why. I was not a Variety puzzle solver when I started this job, and now Im absolutely hooked on them. Theyre worth a try, and if you want to read a particularly good explanation on what it takes to construct these puzzles by my partners-in-noir-fiction, Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon, read Jim Hornes new post here. Then come back and try one of these devilish masterpieces of construction. You might find yourself similarly hooked.

title: Perry Ad Casts Gingrich as a K Street Man
description: The advertising assault on Newt Gingrich by his Republican opponents is getting louder, with the latest commercial from Gov. Rick Perry of Texas taking aim at the former House speakers career as a (dont say lobbyist!) Washington power broker after he left public office.

title: Father and Daughter Edit Their Relationship
description: The clunker title isnt the only nonworking part in Close Up Space, a new play by Molly Smith Metzler that opened Monday night at City Center. Aside from the appealing work of a cast led by David Hyde Pierce, playing a more dour variation on the dithery persona he perfected in his years as a star of the sitcom Frasier, this wan comedy about (yawn) the troubled relationship between a book editor and his daughter has little to recommend it. Unfortunately it is the second dud in a row from Manhattan Theater Club at its Off Broadway space, after Zoe Kazans similarly undercooked We Live Here.

title: After Drugs and Dark Times, Helping Others to Stand Back Up
description: SMYRNA, Del.  The taste of cocaine and the slow-motion sensation of breaking the law were all too familiar, but the thrill was long gone.

title: Deep Pockets, Deeply Political
description: A tiny number of wealthy Americans are playing an ever-increasing role in financing our politics. This is not a good thing for a democracy.

title: Brooklyn Senator Expected to Plead Guilty in Corruption Case
description: State Senator Carl Kruger was expected to plead guilty on Tuesday to federal corruption charges that he accepted at least $1 million in bribes to finance a lavish lifestyle, including a large home in Mill Basin, Brooklyn, where he lived with two gynecologist brothers and their mother, according to several people briefed on the case.

title: Police Arrest a Suspect in Bizarre Queens Shooting Case
description: The circumstances of the crime were as mysterious as they were unnerving.

title: The Middle-Class Agenda
description: Earlier this month, President Obama delivered his first unabashed 2012 campaign speech. Unlike his opponents, Mr. Obama acknowledged the ravages of income equality, the hollowing out of the American middle class. There is no hyperbole in the urgency he conveyed about a make-or-break moment for the middle class, and for all those who are fighting to get into the middle class.

title: Nets Announcer Shows Flair and Hair
description: Enveloped in a cloud of pungent smoke, David Diamante puffed on a custom-blend cigar, hand-rolled in the Dominican Republic, while ticking off the various jobs he has held and hobbies he has pursued. Motorcyclist, D.J., surfer, boxing announcer. Diamante, 40, was sitting amid the leather chairs and ashtrays of his cigar bar in the Fort Greene neighborhood of Brooklyn, a few blocks from where he will perform his next adventure.

title: Protesters Deserve to Be Thrown Into Hitlers Ovens, Egyptian Military Adviser Says
description: As my colleague David Kirkpatrick reports, a general from Egypts ruling military council insisted on Monday that soldiers had not used force against peaceful protesters after a weekend of such attacks that were witnessed by journalists, captured on video and broadcast across the Internet and on satellite television.

title: In Protests, Syrians Find the Spark of Creativity
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  You could call it the dance-athon to dislodge a despot.

title: Bleeding Green: Inspirational Beginnings
description: Brian Bassett is the founder of SNYs The Jets Blog. You can follow him on Twitter at @Brian_Bassett. He and Ed Valentine of Big Blue View will be writing about the Jets and the Giants in the days leading up to the Giants-Jets game on Saturday. Leading off: Brian explains how he became a Jets fan.

title: Syria Agrees to Allow Outside Observers, but Activists Remain Wary
description: CAIRO  The Syrian government, bowing to international pressure to end its violent crackdown on protests, signed an Arab League initiative on Monday that would send outside observers to the country within days.

title: Here Come the Helpmates
description: Before we travel any further down the 2012 campaign trail and hear any more about what a rosy and essential mirror of the candidate his (or her) spouse provides, lets brush up on history. We need go back only four years, to John and Elizabeth Edwards.

title: Dyed in Blue: Wincing With Ups And Downs
description: Ed Valentine is the editor of Big Blue View, a Giants blog. He and Brian Bassett of The Jets blog will write in the days leading up to the Giants-Jets game on Saturday. Leading off: How he became a Giants fan.

title: Coping With Addiction and a Mood Disorder
description: In the latest installment of the Lives Restored series, about people coping with mental illness, Benedict Carey reports the story of Antonio Lambert, 41, a self-taught ex-convict turned mental health educator who has had personal battles with crime and drug use.

title: Palin Says Its Not Too Late for Folks to Jump In
description: Just as the Republican presidential field is looking particularly unsettled, Sarah Palin is back in the news.

title: New Focus on Incendiary Words in Pauls Newsletters
description: Emerging as a real Republican contender in Iowa, Representative Ron Paul of Texas is receiving new focus for decades-old unbylined columns in his political newsletters that included racist, anti-gay and anti-Israel passages that he has since disavowed.

title: The Sidney Awards, Part I
description: Every year, the Sidney Awards, named for the renowned philosopher Sidney Hook, go out to some of the best magazine essays of the year. Anybody interested in being a better person will click the links to these essays, and read attentively.

title: For Exiles, Iraq Beckons and Repels
description: BAGHDAD  Ali al-Subiahi returned from his familys self-imposed exile in the United States to reclaim a sense of himself in a new Iraq.

title: Should Teenagers Get High Instead of Drunk?
Going After Gingrich
description: More than $600,000 has been spent over the past 10 days on television ads in Iowa criticizing Newt Gingrich.

title: Louis C.K.: Anatomy of a Bit
description: Jason Zinoman analyzes Louis C.K.'s narrative technique in his latest Internet-only comedy special.

title: Bank of America Back Below $5
description: Bank of Americas stock price fell.

title: Rangers Win Bid to Negotiate With Darvish for $51.7 Million
description: In successive off-seasons, the Texas Rangers watched as the aces of their pitching staff left them in free agency; first Cliff Lee, then C. J. Wilson. But now Texas is in a position to strike back with a bold international signing that could restore some punch and flair to its rotation.

title: Louis C. K.s Blue Collar in First Class
description: The ascension of Louis C. K. from comics comic to show business saint (a description used by more than one of his legion of admirers) brings with it what the comedian himself might call white-people problems.

title: Corrections: December 20
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Man Accused in Officers Death Fights With Officers at Rikers Island
description: Lamont Pride, the man accused of fatally shooting a New York City police officer last week, got in a scuffle with correction officers at Rikers Island on Monday, the Department of Correction said.

title: Word of the Day | alchemy
description: alchemy \al-k-me\ noun

title: Seattle Bans Plastic Bags, and Sets a Charge for Paper
description: SEATTLE  The City Council here voted unanimously on Monday to ban plastic grocery bags and charge a 5-cent fee on paper bags  and this time city leaders hope the ban actually takes effect.

title: Finding Fault in the Palestinian Messages That Arent So Public
description: JERUSALEM  A new book by an Israeli watchdog group catalogs dozens of examples of messages broadcast by the Palestinian Authority for its domestic audience that would seem at odds with the pursuit of peace and a two-state solution.

title: NYT Front Page for 12/20/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 12/20/2011

title: Pecan Theft in Georgia
description: Nut theft has long been a reality in Georgia, where a pound of pecans  30 nuts or so  can be cashed in for as much as $1.50 at the local buying station.

title: Pecan Thieves in Georgia Enjoying a Windfall, at $1.50 a Pound
description: FORT VALLEY, Ga.  To an enterprising thief, or even a casual dabbler in crime, the fallen pecans that cover thousands of acres of unpatrolled Georgia nut orchards might as well be a carpet of nickels.

title: Iran Admits Western Sanctions Are Inflicting Damage
description: Irans veneer of stoicism toward the Western sanctions that have disrupted its economy showed some new strains on Monday, as the deputy oil minister acknowledged a decline in domestic petroleum production because of dwindling foreign investment, and four-year-old talks between the Iranians and Polands biggest natural gas developer collapsed.

title: Decision to Investigate Anti-Army Memo Is Delayed in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans Supreme Court on Monday put off a decision on whether to investigate a controversial memo in which a Pakistani diplomat purportedly sought American help to constrain the Pakistani military. The court called on the government here to provide more details in the case and set the next hearing for Thursday.

title: In North India, an Annual Struggle With the Cold
description: Northern Indias cold temperatures will continue for several days, with fog plaguing Delhi and other cities through the week, weather forecasters say.

title: In Philippines, Concern Grows Over Flood Survivors
description: MANILA  As the death toll from flash floods over the weekend soared to more than 900 on Monday, officials in the southern Philippines turned their attention to the survivors and the threat of disease in crowded evacuation centers.

title: New Prime Minister Vows to Fix Spains Economy
description: MADRID  Mariano Rajoy, the new conservative prime minister of Spain, pledged on Monday to reduce the size of the countrys public sector, clean up its troubled banks and introduce corporate tax breaks to get Spains budget deficit down and revive investment.

title: Afghanistan: Pakistani Liaison Officers Returning to Army Coordination Centers
description: Pakistani military officers have begun returning to coordination centers in Afghanistan, NATO said on Monday, calling it a sign that tensions were easing, nearly a month after American airstrikes killed 24 Pakistani soldiers. But Pakistan has not reopened the supply lines for NATO forces in Afghanistan that run through its territory. The supply lines were closed by Islamabad in the wake of the airstrikes, on Nov. 26, which infuriated Pakistani officials and put more strain on Americas troubled alliance with Pakistan. NATO forces generally get about two-thirds of their supplies in other ways, but the land route through Pakistan remains vital, and NATO asked again on Monday for the roads to be reopened to supply convoys. Pakistani officials did not immediately respond to the request. A Pakistani military spokesman, Maj. Gen. Athar Abbas, said that liaison officers were returning to the coordination centers, which are meant to ease communications among the Afghan and Pakistani armies and the NATO coalition, all of which operate near the border.

title: Japan Picks Lockheed to Build Its Next Fighter Jet
description: TOKYO  Japan said on Tuesday that it had chosen Lockheed Martins F-35 jet as its next main fighter, a lift for the American defense contractor and for Tokyos relations with the United States amid heightened fears of instability on the Korean peninsula after the death of Kim Jong-il.

title: Britain: Report Faults Police Response to Riots
description: The initial inadequate response by the police to last summers riots in London, Birmingham, Manchester and other places allowed the vandalism and looting to spread out of control, according to a parliamentary report released Monday. The report, by the home affairs committee in the House of Commons, said that the police in many areas, particularly London, had failed to take charge of the situation quickly enough, creating an absence of a police presence and the sight of police officers apparently standing by and allowing criminal behavior to occur. A spokesman for the Metropolitan Police in London said that it had already acknowledged its failures and developed new plans for dealing with future riots.

title: Four Reasons Why Shashi Tharoor Is Wrong
description: Shashi Tharoor has set the cat among the pigeons by re-opening the old debate about whether we should abandon our Westminster-style parliamentary system and move to an American-style presidential system instead. In a long and well-argued essay in Tehelka, he carefully identifies the maladies that plague our current dispensation, most vividly on view recently in the governments about-face on FDI in retail.

title: News Quiz | Dec. 20, 2011
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper.

title: Dec. 20, 1946 | The Debut of Its a Wonderful Life, at New Yorks Globe Theater
description: On Dec. 20, 1946, the Frank Capra film Its A Wonderful Life had a preview showing for charity at New York Citys Globe Theater, a day before its official premiere.

title: Son Among Mourners as North Koreas Kim Lies in State
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Kim Jong-un, catapulted into prominence after Kim Jong-ils sudden death, paid respects at his fathers glass coffin on Tuesday, as the regime stepped up a campaign to portray the impoverished country as standing behind its young new leader.

title: Surprising Sources of Delhis Air Pollution
description: Delhis choking air pollution has caught the attention of politicians and newswires in recent weeks.

title: Test Yourself | English, Dec. 20, 2011
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Cowboys Find Another Agonizing Way to Lose.

title: Papua New Guineas Impasse Seems to End
description: SYDNEY, Australia  A political standoff in Papua New Guinea that left the country with two prime ministers and cabinets for more than a week appeared effectively over on Tuesday, after the governor general reversed course and threw his weight behind the government of Peter ONeill.

title: China Exerts Influence Nurtured Over Decades
description: BEIJING  China, North Koreas foremost ally, appears to be moving quickly to try to ensure stability in a crippled and isolated nation now facing a leadership transition fraught with dangers.

title: Kwaku Alstons Rebirth in Venice
description: Kwaku Alston savored success at an early age. He photographed celebrities, legendary African-American women and even the Obama family. His schedule was packed, but his spirits were low. He thought about how to get back to basics.

title: Taking Stock Before Iowa
description: WHO are the remaining seven contenders for the Republican presidential nomination?

title: Dexia to Sell Luxembourg Unit to Qatari Fund for $952 Million
description: LONDON  Dexia, the Belgian-French bank that has been bailed out twice in three years, agreed on Tuesday to sell most of its Luxembourg operations to a Qatari investment group.

title: Have You Ever Interacted With the Police?
description: A new study shows that approximately one-third of Americans have been arrested by age 23. And a black college student wrote an Op-Ed about being stopped by the police multiple times and how, he says, racial profiling has affected young people. What kinds of experiences have you and others you know had with the police?

title: The Early Word:  Rejection
description: Todays Times

title: A Guide to Holiday Sweets in Madrid
description: In a nation collectively obsessed with the enjoyment of food, Spaniards make no exception for Christmas, especially those harboring a sweet tooth. With the holiday season in full swing, children and adults alike seek traditional Christmas sweets in Madrids bakeries.

title: Cutting the Corporate Tax Rate Is No Economic Panacea
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of the coming book The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Plurality of Voters in Poll Fault Cuomo on Tax Deal
description: A plurality of New York voters said Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo broke campaign promises to oppose tax increases and bring an end to Albanys tradition of secret deal-making when he overhauled the states tax code earlier this month, according to a new poll released on Tuesday.

title: The Envelope, Please: Eight High School Seniors Blog Their College Searches
description: One attends a Minnesota public high school and dreams of becoming a veterinarian. But she wont be studying at Cornell University or the University of California, Davis, at least as an undergraduate. She crossed those schools off earlier rough drafts of her college wish list at least partly because, she says, her parents have agreed to pay only the equivalent of in-state tuition at a Minnesota public university.

title: Who Am I? Can I Get Back to You on That?
description: Last Friday, I was taking my second trip to the campus of University of Wisconsin, Madison, to help with the seemingly impossible decision of where to go to school. My dad, an alumnus, had used his contacts at UW to request a few meetings with professors, so that I could get a feel for the academic life there. The first professor on the list was typical  well, a typical, middle-aged, horse-loving animal science professor. She was enthusiastic, but she warned me sternly that I may need to change my career goal.

title: Relatively Average, Nothing Special and Worried About College
description: Right off the bat, let me tell you: I am a relatively average student. Nothing special. I dont have a 90+ GPA. If you want someone like that, consult my friends. I enjoy the liberal arts, English and history over the sciences  but not to the point that I stay up all night reading history textbooks in my free time.

title: Mass March by Cairo Women in Protest Over Abuse by Soldiers
description: CAIRO  Several thousand women demanding the end of military rule marched through downtown Cairo on Tuesday evening in an extraordinary expression of anger over images of soldiers beating, stripping and kicking female demonstrators in Tahrir Square.

title: A C.P.A. Figures Out What Business Owners Really Want
description: A few weeks ago, I received the above postcard in the mail. It didnt hit me at first. As the owner of an advertising agency, I see a lot of in-your-face marketing efforts. But after spending a few minutes with it, I started to admire the way this service business  a certified public accountant, no less  was trying to differentiate itself from the pack.

title: On Our Radar: Reports of Power Plant Protest in China
description: Residents of Haimen, in Guangdong Province in China, report clashes with the police in an environmental protest against the expansion of a power plant. [Agence France-Presse]

title: Is Republican Infighting Helping Obama?
description: Has Republican squabbling given President Obama a chance to recover his political footing just as his re-election year begins?

title: Lost in Translation
description: Notes from the newsroom on grammar, usage and style. (Some frequently asked questions are here.)

title: Lost in Translation
description: Notes from the newsroom on grammar, usage and style. (Some frequently asked questions are here.)

title: Playoff Contenders, and Super Bowl Blueprints
description: We often think of the Super Bowl winner as a dominant team that had an inevitable rise to power, but thats not often the case. In fact, last season, the Packers surprised everybody  well, almost everybody  by winning the Super Bowl as a No. 6 seed.

title: No Plan B for T-Mobile
description: LONDON  Deutsche Telekom of Germany still faces long-term problems with its American subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, after the proposed $39 billion takeover by AT&T was scrapped on Monday.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: AT&T Ends $39 Billion Bid for T-Mobile | AT&T on Monday ended its effort to buy T-Mobile USA, acknowledging that it could not overcome stiff opposition by the Obama administration to form the nations biggest cellphone service provider.

title: Fannie Freddie Follies
description: Joe Nocera gets it right.

title: Opinion Report: Death of a Dictator
description: From the editorial page

title: Jefferies Reports $39 Million Profit
description: The Jefferies Group reported a $39 million profit for the fourth quarter on Tuesday, as it grappled with choppy markets that have crimped once highly lucrative trading operations.

title: Gross Confusion
description: People have been asking me for reactions to this op-ed by Bill Gross, arguing that low interest rates are hurting the economy  an argument that hes been making for a while now. The short answer is that I dont understand his argument, and I suspect that he doesnt either.

title: Tuesday Reading: GPS Watches Can Be Unreliable Running Partners
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Vice President of Iraq Voices Sunnis Anger as He Denies Ordering Killings
description: BAGHDAD  As Iraqs Sunni vice president on Tuesday angrily rebutted the governments accusations that he had been running death squads, many people in Iraqs Sunni minority dismissed the charges as politically motivated, underscoring how deeply alienated they have become from the Shiite-led government.

title: Should Kids Miss School for Family Opportunities?
Six Hours of State Tests Coming This Spring
British Tax Office Assailed for Cozy Ties With Big Companies
description: LONDON  Goldman Sachs, Vodafone and other big businesses were treated too favorably by British tax officials, potentially costing the nation billions in lost revenue, according to a government report released Tuesday.

title: Great Escape | Winter in Tuscany
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: CNN Talk Show Host Is Questioned in British Inquiry
description: LONDON  The CNN talk show host Piers Morgan declared on Tuesday that as the editor in chief of two British tabloids from 1994 to 2004, he knew no one who hacked phones or paid police officers for information.

title: Markets Jump in U.S. and Europe on Positive Economic Data
description: Stocks surged on Tuesday, partly a result of positive economic data on the housing sector in the United States and brighter signals from the euro zone.

title: Politifact, R.I.P.
description: This is really awful. Politifact, which is supposed to police false claims in politics, has announced its Lie of the Year  and its a statement that happens to be true, the claim that Republicans have voted to end Medicare.

title: T-Mobile and AT&T: Whats $2 Billion Among Friends?
description: You say po-TAY-to, I say po-TAH-to. But in the case of the T-Mobile USA deals breakup fee, its a very big root vegetable.

title: Friend Me, Follow Me or Google Me?
description: It sometimes feels like it was easier to exchange contact information with someone before the Web came along. You really had two options: handing out a business card or scribbling down a phone number.And although the Web promised to make this transaction simpler, it feels more confusing than ever.

title: A Sentence for Stealing From Bloomberg That Doesnt Compute
description: The wages of sin is death. It says so right there in Romans 6:23, questionable grammar and all. Death may be a tad harsh for most sins. But the concept prompts a question as to how to weigh a sin like stealing against the penalty meted out. A political consultant named John F. Haggerty Jr. brings it to mind.

title: Daily Report: Apples Victory in Patent Ruling Hits Google
description: Patent battles have engulfed the cellphone industry for years, reflecting the heated competition. An important ruling by a federal agency, United States International Trade Commission, on Monday is described as one of the most significant so far by Nick Wingfield of The New York Times. Apple won a partial victory over the manufacturer HTC that could could force changes in how Googles Android phones function.

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 20
description: New voting rules for the Academy Awards could help the movie Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close, which will be released in Los Angeles and New York on Christmas and wont play around the country until next year, Michael Cieply writes. The movie was shut out by Golden Globes voters, who were shown a screening at the beginning of the month; the voters said in interviews with Mr. Cieply that they were sharply divided on the movie, with some hating it, some loving it. That kind of polarity didnt work at the Golden Globes, but it might now prove an advantage in the Oscar contest after changes in balloting for best picture have put a premium on first-place votes.

title: Drawing Dance: The Merce Cunningham Dance Company in Paris
description: The Brooklyn artist Kenneth E. Parris III is on tour with members of the Merce Cunningham Dance Company, documenting, through a series of drawings and paintings, their two-year legacy tour. After 58 years the company is scheduled to disband on New Years Day 2012. This is the 23rd in a series of graphite drawings that Mr. Parris plans to create from the road, providing a front-row seat to the final weeks of the companys journey. This weeks entry is from Paris.

title: Talbots Rebuffs Buyout Offer From Sycamore
description: Talbots, the womens fashion retailer, has rejected an unsolicited buyout offer from a private equity firm as too low. Instead, the company said on Tuesday that it would explore strategic alternatives, essentially putting itself on the block.

title: Rabbis Followers Blame Aide for Missing Millions
description: Six years ago, an Orthodox rabbi and mystic who traces his lineage to King David moved to New York from Israel and amassed a notable following. Real estate titans fetched him at the airport. Members of Congress attended his Hebrew classes. Even LeBron James, who is not Jewish, borrowed a friends yacht to consult the rabbi in private.

title: Wanted: A Ron Paul for Policing
description: I dont support Ron Paul and I cant imagine how his libertarian philosophy could possibly work, especially at a time when the crippled economy is crying out for effective government. But I appreciate the novelty he has brought to the Republican primaries, and the way he sometimes breaks with right-wing orthodoxy. When the other presidential aspirants compete to out-tough each other on foreign policy, for example, I think its useful to have Mr. Paul jump in and sayas he did at the last debatethat the greatest danger is a president who will overreact.

title: American Jailed in Peru Returns to New York
description: She has captivated New Yorkers for 16 years, the daughter of Manhattan academics convicted in Peru of aiding a leftist terrorist group, famous for a fist-waving rant to television cameras that cemented her reputation among Peruvians as a dangerous radical.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Economist: An ambitious analysis of how a small, unremarkable country came to dominate the world of beermaking. That would be Belgium. Crammed with statistics, including how many different beers (1,131), the most expensive ($800 per case for Westvleteren) and how much beer Belgians consume (84 liters per year).  Glenn Collins

title: Martin Sheen, Family (Filmmaking) Man
description: Forget about the 10: Officially speaking, 265 features are in contention for the best picture Oscar, as the Academy announced Monday. One you may not have heard much about is The Way, a family drama written and directed by Emilio Estevez and starring his father, Martin Sheen.

title: Karachi Chatter
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  The phone calls and text messages began just after sunset on Sunday. His royal highness will be returning to his palace by the sea, so you better get off the roads, messaged one friend.

title: The Unity Is Gone
description: CAIRO  For the last several days in Egypt, theres been only one question on my mind: what on earth is going on here?

title: What to Do About Asian Carp? Great Lakes States Cant Agree
description: CHICAGO  The leaders of the Great Lakes states had come to a moment of calm, glassy waters. It was 2008, and after years of negotiation, politicians in the eight states around the lakes had reached agreement on a compact that would protect their (and their Canadian counterparts) precious fresh water from what they saw as one of the Midwests biggest threats: tapping from other, water-hungry regions.

title: Former Gingrich Aide Joins Pro-Newt Super PAC
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa  A day after Newt Gingrich forcefully denounced the proliferation of outside money into the Republican presidential race, one of his longtime aides announced that he was joining a group to help Mr. Gingrich win the partys nomination.

title: New Leader for Urban Institute
description: Sarah Rosen Wartell, a housing expert and economic policy analyst, will become the president of the Urban Institute in February, the Washington-based research organization said Tuesday.

title: Wheelies: The Out of Range Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Dalton Trumbos Screenwriting Credit Restored to Roman Holiday
description: The whimsical secret of Audrey Hepburns royal status may be the heart of William Wylers Roman Holiday, but for years the romantic comedy concealed another more troubling truth: the film was missing the screenwriting credit of Dalton Trumbo, the blacklisted writer and its original author, and instead attributed his work to Ian McLellan Hunter. Now, nearly 60 years after the 1953 release of Roman Holiday, the Writers Guild of America, West said it had restored Trumbos credit following the efforts of Trumbos and Hunters sons.

title: Provincial Officials Meet Leader of Protesters Who Took Over Chinese Village
description: WUKAN, China  Senior officials from the coastal Guangdong Province in southern China met on Wednesday morning with a leader of the protesters who have taken control of this fishing village, ratcheting up efforts to resolve an incendiary dispute over secret land sales that forced the villages administrators to flee 10 days ago.

title: Jefferies Crows Over Surviving a Tough Fourth Quarter
description: Shares of the Jefferies Group surged nearly 23 percent on Tuesday as stronger-than-expected fourth-quarter results helped restore confidence in the investment bank after it had been whipsawed in recent months by worries over its exposure to Europe.

title: Lego Goes After Girls
description: How gender-specific are the gifts youve bought for your kids this holiday? I give myself a B in this category this year. As usual, I set out to choose gifts for each child based on his or her interests and expressed desires  and, as usual, looking back over the list of whats getting wrapped, I see that my oldest daughter has only one thing that you wouldnt find in the pink section of any toy store, and while my tomboy younger daughter has only gifts you could easily give to any 6-year-old (except for the colorable cardboard princess castle her sister chose for her), Ive still given the building toy that either of my youngest children would have liked to their brother without really thinking about it  until now.

title: Barbecue Diplomacy, North Korea and the United States
description: HACKENSACK, N.J.  Diners were chewing on pulled pork and baby back ribs here at Cubbys barbecue restaurant on Sunday night when the owner, Robert Egan, learned that the North Korean leader Kim Jong-il, had died on Saturday of a heart attack.

title: Judge Again Delays Plea in UBS Trader Case
description: LONDON  The case of Kweku M. Adoboli, the former UBS trader facing fraud charges related to a $2.3 billion loss, was postponed by a month on Tuesday after his new lawyer said Mr. Adoboli needed more legal advice.

title: Answers to Reader Questions About Law School
description: On Sunday, The Timess David Segal concluded a series of articles about the economics of law schools, with an article on the cover of Sunday Business, For Law Schools, a Price to Play the A.B.A.s Way. The article notes that the American Bar Associations rules for accreditation are a significant factor in the costs of legal education, which may in turn limit the availability of low-cost legal services.

title: NBC Will Stream Super Bowl
description: 2:14 p.m. | Updated NBC announced Tuesday that it will stream Super Bowl XLVI live on Feb. 5 from Indianapolis, as well as its two wild card playoff games on Jan. 7 and the Pro Bowl on Jan. 29.

title: One on One: Gary Shteyngart, Author of Super Sad True Love Story
description: Gary Shteyngart is the author of the novel Super Sad True Love Story, a love story set in the near future that has been weirdly prescient. Mr. Shteyngart, who was born in Leningrad, often writes about American culture with a comical and satirical bent. The following is an edited version of our interview.

title: 49ers Show Theyre Contenders
description: The first glitch came when viewers realized Monday Night Football was staging a game they might actually want to watch. (And more stunningly, this will happen two weeks in a row. What, the Rams already had plans for next Monday?) Considering this incredible upset, ESPN hoped viewers did not tune in while Candlestick Park had gone black. Twice. It gave the distinct impression the N.F.L. did not want an appealing game to be staged Monday night and pulled a plug. Either that, or Jon Grudens relentless sunniness melted the fuses.

title: Republican Candidates Have Presidential Pedigrees
description: Former Gov. Mitt Romney of Massachusetts has been called the establishment candidate of the Republican presidential primary and is dominating the endorsement race so far. A look at his family tree may explain his perceived place among the presidents: he is related to six former commanders in chief.

title: Finding a Safe Harbor in Male Identity
description: Such a sweet little man, remarks a guest at a shabby-genteel Dublin hotel, referring to a waiter named Albert Nobbs. One of Alberts co-workers describes him, less kindly, as a freak, and there is certainly something odd about this elfin, diffident, ginger-haired fellow, who attends to his duties with fastidious care. He is not, indeed, a fellow at all, but a woman who has lived most of her life disguised as a man. And not just any woman: this self-effacing, cautious character, whose name is also the title of Rodrigo Garcias lively and touching new film, is played by the dazzling and infinitely resourceful Glenn Close.

title: Mad as Hell
description: Ellen Goodman, the Boston Globes Pulitzer Prize-winning former columnist, now retired, is busy these days with something called the Conversation Project, one of many nascent efforts to make the rigors of caregiving and advanced old age into a kitchen-table issue  not just a topic for policy wonks and health care professionals.

title: Hitchens and Hell
description: Remarking on the various Christians (myself included) who expressed a hope that Christopher Hitchens would be pleasantly surprised by his journey to the undiscovered country, HotAirs Allahpundit asks a reasonable question:

title: Vander Plaats Endorses Santorum
description: DE WITT, Iowa  Rick Santorum, who was the first Republican presidential hopeful to visit all 99 Iowa counties in a quest to gain traction for the partys nomination, received a lift on Tuesday by collecting a highly coveted endorsement from Bob Vander Plaats, one of the most visible leaders of the Christian conservative movement.

title: Yale and Columbia Reimburse Gay Employees for Extra Taxes
description: Two Ivy League universities will soon begin reimbursing some of its gay and lesbian employees for the extra taxes they incur when their partners are covered by their health insurance.Both Columbia and Yale University will begin covering these extra costs on Jan. 1.

title: Standoff Over Payroll Tax Cut Leaves Wake of Uncertainty
description: WASHINGTON  After defiantly rejecting a Senate compromise to extend a payroll tax break and jobless pay, Speaker John A. Boehner stood before the television cameras on Tuesday enveloped by scores of House Republicans. Even as a group, they seemed very much alone.

title: The Year in Media | Putting the Oscars Back Together Again
description: Staff members of The Timess media news department are highlighting the most significant developments this year in the industries they cover.

title: Sharing the Rat-Infested Bounty
description: Yesterday morning began with an alarming call from our mail room. They said they couldnt deliver a package addressed to me because it had been chewed open by rats at the Post Office. Several other packages arrived at The Times yesterday in similarly ratty condition. So I alerted Andy Newman, our City Room bureau chief, who wrote this investigative piece.

title: Arctic Methane: Is Catastrophe Imminent?
description: In my article over the weekend about the climate risks from buried Arctic carbon, I omitted any discussion of one issue that sometimes appears in the news: methane deposits under relatively shallow seawater near the coasts of Siberia, Canada and Alaska. It was a purposeful omission because my piece focused on carbon buried on land, which presents a climate risk if it eventually emerges as methane or carbon dioxide.

title: The Adventures of Spielberg: An Interview
description: This years holiday movie season brings with it a double dose of family film fare from a director well-seasoned in the genre. Steven Spielberg, long the wearer of many hats in Hollywood, is one of the few filmmakers who could potentially find both box office and awards-season success with two films released within a week of each other. The first is his digitally animated adaptation of the Belgian comic book series The Adventures of Tintin, which opens Wednesday. The second is his adaptation of the childrens novel (and Tony Award-winning play) War Horse, opening Christmas Day.

title: Weinstein Company Moving Ahead With Finding Neverland Musical, Its First
description: The Weinstein Company, heavyweight producers in Hollywood, is moving ahead with development of its first stage musical, Finding Neverland, after staged readings of the script and score in London last week that executives deemed a success. Rob Ashford, the Broadway director and choreographer (How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying) who is directing the work, said in an interview that the story and structure of the musical was in much stronger shape than at the last reading about a year ago.

title: Men Change (Products Do, Too)
description: NOT long ago, Thomas Sullivans beauty routine began and ended with Irish Spring. But as Mr. Sullivan, an entrepreneur, actor, film producer and restaurant owner, approached 40, he realized his livelihood might benefit from a bit more personal maintenance.

title: Back to Lori Berenson
description: This morning, Lori Berenson returned to New York after 16 years abroad, much of it spent in Peruvian prisons after she was convicted of aiding terrorist groups there. Last August, after she was released on parole and adjusting to life outside prison with her infant son, the novelist/journalist Jennifer Egan traveled to Lima to profile her for the magazine.

title: More Hungary
description: Kim Lane Scheppele sends me an update on the political situation, shown below the fold.

title: In Richmond, a London Day Trip That Fits the Frugal Bill
description: A scheduling quirk had handed me 36 hours to kill in London while en route from Oxford, England, to Portugal  a happy proposition for anyone with deep pockets. Perhaps the braised rabbit at Michelin-starred St. John and an orchestra stall seat at the Royal Opera House before retiring to a suite at the Covent Garden?

title: Pain on Dalal Street as Markets Sink
description: The mood on Dalal Street, Indias Wall Street, has been particularly dismal since Monday, when the Sensex index on the Bombay Stock Exchanges sunk 112 points to 15,379  its lowest level in approximately 28 months.

title: Pathetic Plutocrats
description: One of the disadvantages of being very wealthy may be that you end up surrounded by sycophants, who will never, ever tell you what a fool youre making of yourself. Thats the only way I can make sense of the farcical behavior of the wealthy described in this new report from Max Abelson:

title: Riffs: The Year in Film: Bonus Materials
description: The magazine recently featured a roundup of short Riff essays on the year in film (mini-Riffs? Lil Riffs? Riffkins? O.K., well stop now). But, as with all good things, we collected more random and curious reflections on the year past than we could ever jam into our pages. So we present these Riffs as kind of DVD extras: Bonus Materials for you to enjoy.

title: Have N.F.L. Questions? Judy Battista Has Answers
description: Do the Eagles have momentum? What has happened to Ryan Fitzpatrick and the Bills? Is Kyle Orton better than people think? Judy Battista, the N.F.L. reporter for The Times, will answer questions from readers. Use the comment field below for your questions. Answers will appear Thursday on The Fifth Down.

title: Successful Spanish Debt Auction
description: PARIS  Spains borrowing costs plummeted Tuesday at a debt auction, helping to lift the euro and stocks, as the European Central Bank began rolling out a new lending program that could encourage banks to buy euro-zone government bonds.

title: Vain Glorious | Last Minute Man Gifts
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Eagles Poor Start Was Only a Flesh Wound
description: In the classic Monty Python sketch Upper-Class Twit of the Year, a group of bumbling aristocrats compete on an obstacle course full of challenges both athletic (leaping over books of matches) and misanthropic (kicking beggars, insulting waiters). The competitor Oliver St. John-Mollusc, thought by many to be this years outstanding twit, somehow runs himself over with a convertible midway through the race. John Cleese, as the play-by-play announcer, later says of Oliver, Hes dead, but hes not necessarily out of it.

title: Tacos With Roasted Vegetables and Chickpeas in Chipotle Ranchera Salsa
description: These winter vegetables sweeten with roasting and contrast beautifully with the chipotle-spiked cooked tomato salsa. Its another easy do-ahead dish that can be reheated when the crowds are hungry.

title: All 5 Aboard Plane Die as It Crashes on an Interstate in New Jersey
description: A single-engine plane on its way to Atlanta spun out of control over northern New Jersey and crashed onto a busy highway on Tuesday, killing all five people aboard  two investment bankers, and the wife and two children of one of the bankers.

title: Classic Stage Snaps Up Christina Ricci for A Midsummer Nights Dream
description: If the idea of Christina Ricci joining Bebe Neuwirth in Classic Stage Companys coming production of A Midsummer Nights Dream isnt sufficiently tantalizing on its face value, think of it as the coming together of extended members of the Addams Family.

title: Cracker Barrel Claims Victory Over Activist Investor
description: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store announced on Tuesday that all of its directors had been re-elected, claiming victory over Sardar Biglari, the activist investor who had sought one seat on the board.

title: Students and Staff Say Washington Irving Was Set Up to Fail
Students Win for Turning Lady Liberty Green
Reminder: The Choice Will Be Live on Facebook Tonight (and Wednesday and Thursday)
description: Are you a student (or parent of a student?) who is still scrambling to meet the Jan. 1 deadline at many colleges? Or, are you trying to determine how best to respond to (or recover from) an early admission ruling from last week? Youve come to the right place.

title: Soft Tacos With Mushrooms, Cabbage and Chipotle Ranchera Salsa
description: Two nutrient-dense vegetables combine forces in this delicious filling. Mushrooms are an excellent source of vitamins and many minerals, particularly selenium, copper, potassium, phosphorous, zinc, and manganese  and they contain a powerful antioxidant called L-ergothioneine. Theyre used medicinally throughout Asia for their immunity-boosting properties. They also contain more protein than most other vegetables, and their meaty texture makes them a perfect choice for vegetarians. Cabbage possesses phytochemicals like sulforaphane, which protects the body against cancer-causing free radicals, and indoles, which help metabolize estrogens. Its also an excellent source of vitamins K and C, and a very good source of dietary fiber, vitamin B6, folate, manganese and omega-3 fatty acids.

title: As City Closes In on 50 Millionth Visitor, British Couple to Be Feted
description: Updated 4:42 p.m. | Spending an hour or so with Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg in Times Square was not part of the plan that Craig Johnson and Lucy Foulger had laid out for their wedding day.

title: As Deutsche Telekom Ponders Options, a New Deal Is Expected
description: BERLIN  Deutsche Telekom could move quickly to seal a new alliance with another American telecommunications operator for its T-Mobile USA subsidiary following the collapse of its planned sale to AT&T, analysts said on Tuesday.

title: Early Line on Early Admissions
When a Small Retailer Shoots Itself in the Foot with a Weak Web Site
description: Last week, my post asked whether a small retailer can compete online with the big boys.

title: Stonyfield Farm to Open Chelsea Piers Restaurant
description: Stonyfield Farm is about to make a leap from its well-established spot in the dairy aisle to a restaurant at Chelsea Piers. The prominent organic yogurt and milk company already has one cafe in Maine, and in April its new riverside location, at West 22nd Street, will open with mac and cheese, salads and flatbread sandwiches with ingredients from farms in New York State.

title: Looking to Streamline Airport Security Screenings
description: Travelers in the midst of another holiday season of shuffling shoeless through seemingly interminable airport security lines may find it difficult to imagine a future where screenings are not only speedy but thorough.

title: Two Earth-Size Planets Are Discovered
description: In what amounts to a kind of holiday gift to the cosmos, astronomers from NASAs Kepler spacecraft announced Tuesday that they had discovered a pair of planets the size of Earth orbiting a distant star.The new planets, one about as big as Earth and the other slightly smaller than Venus, are the smallest yet found beyond the solar system.

title: Greenhill Says 2 Executives Died in Plane Crash
description: 5:51 p.m. | Updated

title: Tolerance for Intolerance Bruises Lowes
description: Poor Lowes. The do-it-yourself chain made room in their budget for TLCs All-American Muslim, a reality show about life in the Muslim American community in Dearborn, Mich., but the company ended up catching some focus for supporting a show that depicted Muslims as something besides terrorists. As it turned out, the protest was hardly broad based, with most of it coming from one guy. Still, the Florida Family Association, as David Catons Web site is called, claimed 65 companies agreed to stop advertising on All-America Muslim. That didnt turn out to be precisely true.

title: Listen: SNY.tv Metro Hockey Podcast
description: The Slap Shot contributor Christopher Botta talks New York area hockey with Brian Compton of NHL.com and the agent Jay Grossman from The Puck Agency in the SNY.tv Metro Hockey Podcast.

title: Lady Gaga and Mary J. Blige Make Oscars Cut, but Not Madonna
description: Its not quite a musical year-end best-of, but the Academys shortlist of 39 songs that could go on to win the Oscar has enough indie, pop, country, R&B and classical stars to make critics from Pitchfork to Pazz and Jop happy.

title: HBO Renews Enlightened but Cancels Three Other Shows
description: A pair of Golden Globe nominations for the HBO comedy Enlightened may have helped it earn a second season, but three other shows on that channel  Hung, Bored to Death and How to Make It in America  will not be ascending to another plane and have been canceled.

title: Landmarks Commission Approves Puck Building Penthouse
description: After three months of back-and-forth negotiating with the landlord Jared Kushner, the Landmarks Preservation Commission gave its unanimous approval on Tuesday morning to Mr. Kushners proposal for a residential penthouse atop the Puck Building, at Houston and Lafayette Streets.

title: Have N.H.L. Questions? Slap Shot Has Answers
description: Are the Canucks as good as they were last season? Can the Flyers maintain their momentum? What do the Rangers need to remain competitive? Will Coach Randy Cunneyworth make a difference in Montreal? Jeff Z. Klein, the N.H.L. reporter for the The Times, and Slap Shot contributor Christopher Botta will answer questions from readers. Use the comment field for your questions, and answers will appear on Slap Shot later this week.

title: Q. and A. With William Berloni: Which Doggy in the Window?
description: Over the weekend, readers of Elissa Gootmans recent article offered up their suggestions for the best dogs for apartment living. People expressed great affection for their dogs breeds. There was even a mini-ode. Reader advice ranged from corgis to greyhounds to, of course, cats.

title: A 50-Year Racing Career, With No Checkered Flag in Sight
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.  The driving habits of senior citizens is a favorite conversation starter among Floridians. But those exchanges tend not to include the likes of James Harvey Hylton, 77, who borrowed a friends Ford on Sunday morning and drove it 175.634 miles per hour and later apologized for not going faster.

title: TimesCast | December 20, 2011
description: Images of a woman beaten by Egyptian soldiers sparks protests | A sectarian political rift in Iraq | Newt and Callista Gingrich's production company

title: Polls Find G.O.P. Electorate in Flux
description: Two polls released on Tuesday further underscore the lack of commitment among many Republicans toward a particular presidential candidate, with results once again highlighting how unsettled this contest remains two weeks before Iowans cast the first votes.

title: In Iowa, Gingrich Calls for an End to Negative Ads
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, Iowa  Newt Gingrich again sought to beat back the barrage of attack ads eroding his lead in Iowa by trying to shame his rivals into pulling them from the air.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: The Future of Books
description: To the Editor:

title: Ratings for Fear Factor Fall but Still Help NBC
description: Maybe the holidays arent the season for bug eating, after all.

title: Fed Proposes New Capital Rules for Banks
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve on Tuesday proposed rules that would require the largest American banks to hold more capital  and to keep it more easily accessible  to protect against another financial crisis.

title: Elizabeth Taylors Final Legacy
description: After the last diamond-encrusted bauble had been snatched up, the last item of Dior couture sold, the last Fendi handbag handed on to a new owner, the sale of Elizabeth Taylors vast collections netted$156.8 million. The four days of sales at Christies became the most valuable private jewelry sale in history ($137.2 million) and the most valuable private collection of fashion ever sold ($5.5 million). The first online-only Christies sale drew 57,000 bids and reaped $9.5 million. The complete collection sold out, a testament to both the stars magnetism and the quality of the merchandise.All the proceeds benefit the Elizabeth Taylor Trust, which manages the Taylor estate. Taylor was well-known in her later years for her fund-raising and activism for AIDS research. A portion of the profit generated by Christies sale of exhibition tickets (58,000 people saw the exhibit in its internationaltravels), event sponsorship and the ongoing sales of select publications, will be donated to the Elizabeth Taylor AIDS Foundation. The auction house also raised $170,00 through the sale of a deluxe limited edition boxed set of the catalogs on the first evening of the auction, which will also go to the foundation. Some highlights from the later sales: those Vuitton trunks, with the violet-colored tags reading Mine! sold for $245,500, the top figure for the accessories sale. The Andy Warhol lithograph signed and dedicated by the artist went for $662,000. A (quite hideous) beaded Versace bolero jacket featuring rhinestone images of Taylor in some of her famous roles fetched $128,500. Even rocks Taylor never actually wore went for big sums: a large gray scholars rock netted $386,500, more than 30 times its estimate of $8,000 to $12,000.Christies will complete the dispersal of the Taylor collections in the new year with sales of her Old Master paintings (Jan. 25 in New York), including a Frans Hals portrait (not of Taylor), and her Impressionist and modern art collection (London, Feb. 7 and 8).Chris Wilding, Taylors son and a trustee of the foundation, said, My mother always acknowledged that she was merely the temporary custodian of the incredible things she owned. Today, I think she would be happy to know that her collections will continue to enrich the lives of those who have acquired pieces.

title: The Romance of Iowa
description: Why should the Iowa caucuses, two weeks from tonight, be the first political event of 2012?

title: What Iraqis Think of the American Withdrawal: Diyala Province
description: As American forces pulled out of Iraq, we asked Iraqis around the country three questions:

title: A Shady American in the Nanjing Massacre
description: Eventually, it seems, every senseless waste of life gets its own gauzy tear-jerker. Thats about the only way to justify The Flowers of War, in which the veteran Chinese director Zhang Yimou revisits the Nanjing massacre of 1937 by making something resembling a backstage musical, with breaks for the occasional ghastly murder or rape.

title: The Giving Spree | Bill Powers
description: Who: Bill Powers, who is the co-owner of Half Gallery and a judge on the Bravo reality show Work of Art: The Next Great Artist.What Hes Giving: I bought this Rebecca Kolsrud painting for my wife, but it will probably wind up hanging in my daughters room. I saw it at Karma on Downing Street in a small exhibition called Yackety Yack Girls. It reminds me of early John Currin paintings and it hints at Martin Kippenberger somehow, too.

title: Caucus Click: Perrys Expanded Message
description: When Gov. Rick Perry of Texas entered the Republican presidential race four months ago, his bumper-sticker message (and the slogan painted on his bus) was Get America Working Again. Two weeks before the Iowa caucuses, his campaign bus, parked outside the historic Decker Hotel in Maquoketa, Iowa, on Tuesday, reflected how faith was central to his closing argument.

title: After Resigning, Tearful Senator Pleads Guilty to Accepting Bribes
description: In the annals of municipal corruption in New York City, the themes of graft, greed and betrayal have been familiar running mates from one century to the next, accompanying the fall of the Tammany boss William Tweed in the 1870s, the resignation of the popular mayor James J. Walker in 1932, and the bribes, appetites and suicide of Donald R. Manes, a former Queens borough president, in 1986.

title: Romney Says Super PACs Have Been a Disaster
description: Visit msnbc.com for breaking news, world news, and news about the economy

title: Revisiting North Koreas Hunger Crisis
description: The death of the North Korean leader Kim Jong-il comes not only at a time of political uncertainty, but also against a hunger crisis caused by storms and floods. This year, the Reuters photographer Damir Sagolj was part of a group of journalists invited by the government  itself a rare step  to document the emergency facing the countrys farm region. As Lens republishes his images today from a post in October, we asked him for an update.

title: You Talking to Moi? Its the French Travis Bickle
description: Every major filmmaker seems to be delivering his own ode to classic cinema this season and Michel Gondry is no exception. The French director of Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind and The Green Hornet has paid homage to Taxi Driver by remaking it, DIY-style. In other words, sweding it  a phrase and a concept borrowed from his own 2008 film, Be Kind Rewind.

title: Battlefield Earth
description: Have you ever had one of those days when the news is so disturbing it makes you want to sit quietly in a darkened room? Or if youre a liberal, make a donation to Doctors Without Borders? Or if youre a Republican, play golf? Thats how I feel today.

title: Ohio State Receives One-Year Bowl Ban
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Ohio States football team will not play in the postseason next year, and the program will lose nine scholarships over the next three years as a result of a scandal that cost Coach Jim Tressel his job in the spring.

title: Forcella in NoHo, Pizza, Fired and Fried
description: GIULIO Adriani is still trying to make his mark on New York. Mr. Adriani, an Italian pizzaiolo, seemed ready to teach the city a thing or two about authentic Naples-style pizza when he appeared on the scene last year  here was a man with four pizza world championships under his belt, a blistering-hot wood-burning oven and a chefs coat with his name stitched on the back just in case you forgot who was working the peel.

title: Mixing Hanukkah and Christmas
description: It seemed like a good idea at the time, it really did. Nine years ago, when my oldest son was about 18 months old, my mother gave us a menorah shaped like a train, and I bought candles, and insisted to my husband that we light them.

title: Mulled Wine Fumigates a Foul Recollection
description: LOVE might be blind, but that doesnt mean it holds its nose. At least, not in the case of me, my then-boyfriend, a bloated can of surstromming (fermented herring) and a Christmas party so many years ago.

title: Turkey Detains Dozens Accused of Having Links to a Kurdish Group
description: ISTANBUL  The police detained at least 38 people, many of them journalists, in dawn raids across Turkey on Tuesday as part of an investigation into a network accused of being the political wing of an outlawed Kurdish separatist rebel group.

title: Anne Seversons Gingersnaps
description: Time: 45 minutes, plus at least 2 hours resting and cooling

title: Easy Christmas Pudding (Without the Rum)
description: Adapted from Marguerite Patten

title: Beef Short-Rib Adobo
description: Adapted from Memories of Philippine Kitchens: Stories and Recipes From Far and Near, by Amy Besa and Romy Dorotan (Stewart, Tabori & Chang; 2006)

title: Judge Rules Against Backer of Crash in Suit Over Payments
description: 6:05 p.m. | Updated LOS ANGELES  A judge here came down with a boom! last week on the financier behind Crash, which won the best picture Oscar in 2006.

title: Baklazhannaia Ikra (Poor Mans Caviar)
description: Adapted from Recipes: Russian Cooking (Time-Life Books, 1969)

title: McDyess and Stojakovic Call It Quits
description: Two of the N.B.A.s better players since the mid-90s, the sharpshooter Peja Stojakovic and the big man Antonio McDyess, are ending their careers.

title: Samsung Hard Drives Now Belong to Seagate
description: Seagate Technology, a major maker of hard drives, said Tuesdaythat it had closed on the acquisition of the hard drive business of Samsung Electronicsfor $1.4 billion.

title: The Get | Stella McCartney Hawaiian Print Jeans
description: As part of her Hawaii-inspired resort collection, Stella McCartney is introducing a number of denim pieces subtly printed with tropical palm trees, the effect of which is similar to  but much more innovative and exciting than  acid wash or tie-dye. Available in early January when the designer is scheduled to open two new stores, one in Miami at the Bal Harbour Shops and the other on Greene Street in Soho, the jacket and blue jeans seen here are as ready for sunny South Beach as they are the chilly streets of the Northeast. Denim is something thats already ingrained in everyones wardrobe, says McCartney, so we played with it to give it a new twist. Aloha!

title: Vevo, a Music Video Web Site, Wants to Get Into Television
description: In yet another example of the muddying of media categories, Vevo, the music video Web site set up by the two largest record companies is in talks with cable carriers to become a TV channel.

title: Benton Harbor: An Addendum by Chris Savage
description: While I was in Benton Harbor, Mich., reporting this weeks cover article, I met a guy named Chris Savage and his wife one night for some pizza and beer. (We also went the beach and watched a pretty spectacular sunset on Lake Michigan.)

title: BrightScopes Top-Rated 401(k) Plans for 2011
description: Retirement would be a lot easier if all companies were as generous as Southwest Airlines is to its pilots.

title: Miso-and-Apple-Glazed Baked Ham
description: Adapted from Paul Kahan

title: Losing Friends on Facebook
description: Wondering why a friend or acquaintance defriended you on Facebook?

title: The Benefits of Incorporating Abroad in an Age of Globalization
description: Michael Kors Holdings not only sells fashion that people crave, it has also offered shares that were a hit with investors. The companys shareholders, including the designer himself, sold about $944 million worth of stock last week in an initial public offering that valued the company at about $4 billion.

title: Pictures of the Day: North Korea and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from North Korea, Egypt, the Philippines and India.

title: Vera on Ice
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Sleep Problems in Police Officers Take Heavy Toll
description: More than a third of police officers have a sleep disorder, and those who do are more likely to experience heart disease, problems with job performance and rage toward suspects and citizens, a new study suggests.

title: Magic and Marvel on Broadway
description: Magic/Bird has its Magic. The actor Kevin Daniels will play Earvin Magic Johnson, the Los Angeles Lakers point guard, in Eric Simonsons basketball-themed play Magic/Bird, which is aiming to open in the spring of 2012 at a Broadway theater still to be determined.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, North Korea, Philippines and India.

title: Two Lonely People Fumbling for Love
description: Kissing Sid James is a very funny 80-minute play. Trouble is, it runs nearly two hours. A comedy about a lonely man and woman who spend a weekend together, the script hits its mark early and often. Yet shortly into the second act the humor begins to get recycled, and even the excellent cast cant keep you from wishing that the writer had wrapped things up while his audience was laughing away.

title: New York Plans Greener Zoning Rules
description: Next month community boards around New York City will ring in the year by holding hearings on a proposal that city officials say will give buildings more freedom to increase their energy efficiency and produce their own power.

title: Reviewing Lupa
description: Most of the time for me, its all about the food. I can tolerate a fair amount of discomfort, indignities or inconvenience if a restaurant is serving food that is good enough, and unusual enough, to make it worth my while.

title: Former Bishop Will Meet With Irish Abuse Victims
description: DUBLIN  A senior Roman Catholic prelate in Ireland said Tuesday that the church would arrange for victims of clergy sexual abuse in one diocese to meet with the bishop who was in charge of it when hundreds of abuse complaints were kept secret.

title: An Osteria Competes With Its Past
description: ITS dinner time, yet entering Lupa, the Roman-style osteria opened in 1999 by the team of Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich, is about as joyous an experience as trying to squeeze onto the subway at rush hour. You know you will be bumped and jostled, but you dont know which direction it will come from.

title: Seagate and Western Digital Reduce Warranties for Some Hard Drives
description: Seagate and Western Digital, which supply hard drives to most of the major computer brands, will soon reduce warranty coverage on several of their storage devices.

title: First-Place Flyers Are Coping With Various Head Injuries
description: PHILADELPHIA  A standing-room-only crowd had already been forced to absorb an uncharacteristically merciless drubbing of the beloved Philadelphia Flyers on Saturday afternoon when a jarring replay flashed on the big screens above the ice late in the second period.

title: With a Nod to Nowitzki, Durant Makes a Move
description: On Sunday night, in an otherwise pedestrian preseason game against the Dallas Mavericks, Kevin Durant saw an opportunity to showcase a new toy. After a switched screen pitted Durant against the far smaller Delonte West in the right midpost, Durant went to work with a familiar move:

title: The Caucus Click: An Unconventional Endorsement
U.S. General in Afghanistan Says Troops May Stay Past 2014
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The senior American commander in Afghanistan suggested Tuesday that American forces could remain in the country beyond 2014despite previous signals from President Obama that the bulk of troops would be withdrawn by then. The commanders remarks amounted to the most emphatic signal to date that the United States military intended to secure a presence here, possibly for years.

title: Gingrich Heads to Virginia for Ballot Push
description: The Virginia presidential primary is not until March 6, but Newt Gingrich is suddenly veering off the campaign trail and heading there Wednesday with urgent business: get on the ballot. The deadline is Thursday.

title: Survey Suggests Tough Economy Is Claiming Another Victim: Regular Car Maintenance
description: Car owners who are delaying automotive maintenance have plenty of company, according to a recent poll by Consumer Reports.

title: Last-Minute Holiday Loot for the Drinking Sort
description: I nearly set to weeping when I found a copy of the gorgeous, lavishly illustrated 1933 edition of The Savoy Cocktail Book at my favorite used bookshop (Dog Ears, in Hoosick Falls, N.Y.) last month. The $50 price was right (Ive seen it listed for much more), but still a splurge, by my standards. So I considered it an early Christmas present  to myself. Any cocktail lover would be thrilled to receive such a gift, but there are easier gets that are also sure to delight.

title: Channel Surfing: Whos Still Standing?
description: Sure, its the season of joy and giving, but cant we also spend a few moments cheering like Romans in the arena hoping to see someone plummet through the floor to a grisly, ignominious end?

title: Chasing Sarah Palin
description: Heres our story so far: Sarah Palin is picked to run for vice president, builds up a big fan club of disgruntled, right wing Americans and loses. She returns briefly to Alaska, but then finds the job of running a state that lives off federal dollars and oil revenue too taxing and not nearly lucrative enough. She quits, writes a smash best seller, charges who knows what for public appearances, and keeps her celebrity going by pretending for a while to be thinking about running for president.

title: A Learning Curve as Developers Do Business in China
description: With the slowdown in commercial building in the United States, some American developers are planning projects in China, hoping to capitalize on an immense, increasingly urbanized market with a rising middle class. In recent years, annual consumer spending has been growing by about 18 percent.

title: Protesters in Wukan Insist on Rights
description: Senior officials from coastal Guangdong Province in south China plan to meet Wednesday morning with protesters who have taken control of Wukan village.

title: TimesCast | Iraq's Political Rift
description: December 20, 2011 - Days after the American withdrawal, Iraq's Sunni vice president denies he ordered political assassinations, attributing the accusation to sectarian political divide.

title: TimesCast | Anger Over Tahrir Beating
description: December 20, 2011 - Thousands of women march in Cairo, sparked by the weekend beating of female protester in Tahrir Square.

title: Sex, Drugs and E Chords While Seeking Remission
description: It would be possible to praise Joshua Codys memoir, [sic], without talking about how teeming it is with what Kingsley Amis liked to call E.S.D.  explicit sexual description. But why would you want to?

title: Perry Dismisses Gingrichs Complaint of Negative Campaigning
description: DE WITT, Iowa  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said Tuesday that he was not concerned by a complaint from a Republican rival, Newt Gingrich, that the tenor of the presidential primary race had grown too negative and indicated that he had no plans to stop drawing contrasts in the final two weeks before the Iowa caucuses.

title: Liverpools Surez Suspended and Fined
description: Luis Surez, Liverpools top scorer this season in the English Premier League, was suspended eight games and fined $62,000 Tuesday by the English Football Association. The F.A. found Surez guilty of racially abusing Manchester Uniteds Patrice Evra on Oct. 15 in a game that ended in a 1-1 tie at Liverpools Anfield stadium.

title: Intrepid Boy on the Trail of Mysteries
description: Before Indiana Jones cracked his bullwhip for some old-fashioned Hollywood fun, Tintin circled the globe in the name of European divertissement. The pen-and-ink creation of the Belgian cartoonist Georges Remi (1907-83), known better as Herg, Tintin is the charming boy reporter and adventurer who, with his white fox terrier Snowy close at heel, has traveled the world since 1929 in action-packed yarns with titles like Cigars of the Pharaoh. It was only a matter of time before Tintin went Hollywood. And, yowza, has he hit it big and hard in The Adventures of Tintin, a marvel of gee-wizardry and a nights entertainment that can feel like a lifetime.

title: Mozarts Renovations to Handels Messiah
description: Bringing freshness, let alone novelty, to a performance of Handels Messiah is a challenge. But the Oratorio Society of New York, under its music director, Kent Tritle, certainly did so on Monday night at Carnegie Hall with a vibrant performance of the piece in the seldom-heard arrangement by Mozart. How this fascinating version of the work came to be says much about the general attitudes toward past masters in Mozarts day. There are lessons in this story and in Mondays performance for hard-liners in the early-music movement.

title: Oh Danny Boy, the Pipes, the Pipes Are Failing
description: A new report by the American Society of Civil Engineers takes a dim view of the state of the countrys 54,000 community-based drinking-water systems and its 15,000 public wastewater treatment facilities. The systems are rusty, aging and seriously inadequate for meeting future needs, the study warns.

title: Specialty REITs, Exploiting Niche Categories, Outperform the Mainstream Players
description: Real estate investment trusts, or REITs, have largely outperformed other investment vehicles in the sluggish economy of the last few years. But one subset  specialty trusts that invest in real estate other than the four major groups of office, retail, residential and industrial  has been exceptionally solid.

title: Councilmans Aide in a Santa Suit, Wearing a Punk-Rock Past
description: Santa had a few minutes to kill before a holiday party the other evening, so he pulled up his sleeves and showed off some of his tattoos: a dragon, a sailboat and, inked across the nape of his neck, the phrase, Meat Is Murder.

title: Brooklyn Student Stabbed in Head With Scissors
description: A 16-year-old student was in custody on Tuesday after the authorities said he repeatedly stabbed another student in the head with a pair of scissors in a Brooklyn high school gym.

title: Beauty Spots
description: The holidays make it especially difficult to avoid sweets. Here are three ways to enjoy the essence of chocolate, without the calories.

title: The Campster | Gifts for Campers
description: Jeff Thrope, who stakes out sublime weekend excursions in The Campster, recommends holiday gifts for city-dwelling campers.

title: Songwriters Group Backs Village People Singer in Rights Case
description: The Songwriters Guild of America has entered a legal battle between Victor Willis, the lead singer of the Village People, and the publishing company that owns the copyrights to the groups songs, saying the case is an important test of a songwriters right to regain control of his or her work after 35 years.

title: Reviewing Forcella
description: With only an oven, Giulio Adriani established his reputation as a pizzaiolo in Italy and at Olio Pizza e Pi in Greenwich Village. Now, at Forcella, Mr. Adriani has a fryer, too. With it, he creates his montanara pizza, a margherita with a crust flash-fried before being finished in a wood-burning oven. The crust has a crisp airiness, not to mention a thin coat of oil that has the naughty pleasure of street food; the oven gives it color and adds a little smoke. Other pizzas on the menu arent up to the montanaras caliber, but youll do well with the classics.

title: Piers Morgans B-Sides
description: Piers Morgan, appearing somewhat magisterially on video from Los Angeles before the Leveson Committee of the British Parliament, spent a rugged hour getting grilled. Mr. Morgan proved to be a good witness on his own behalf, answering narrowly and carefully about what he knew about hacking and when he knew it.

title: China Chow, With a Look of Her Own Making
description: IF China Chows eyes were a little glazed over during a walk-through of the Maccarone gallery in the far West Village last week, it wasnt because she had had her fill of art babble this fall as the host and a judge of Work of Art: The Next Great Artist on Bravo.

title: Epicurious Offers 75 Random House Cookbooks Online
description: The digital cookbook has been given a new format that makes consulting it closer to handling a printed book, going page by page instead of the kind of flowing format provided for some eBook readers.

title: Informations Deadly Price: A Dangerous Year for Journalists
description: This is the time of year when you will read a lot of roundups of media news, but one thing that usually doesnt make those lists is the high price of getting some of the toughest stories.

title: Seeing Terror Risk, U.S. Asks Journals to Cut Flu Study Facts
description: For the first time ever, a government advisory board is asking scientific journals not to publish details of certain biomedical experiments, for fear that the information could be used by terrorists to create deadly viruses and touch off epidemics.

title: Gingrich Calls Romney Dishonest on PAC Ads
description: OTTUMWA, Iowa  Newt Gingrichs counteroffensive against the negative ads that have eaten away at his surge in the polls reached a new level of intensity Tuesday afternoon when he called Mitt Romney purely dishonest.

title: Live Music to Return to a Storied Theater
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y.  In the early-1970s heyday of the Capitol Theater here there were appearances by the likes of Traffic, Jefferson Airplane, Pink Floyd and Santana. The Grateful Dead logged 18 shows over an 11-month period, and Janis Joplin played her next-to-last show at the Capitol on Aug. 8, 1970, two months before she died.

title: A Rhetorical Return for YOYO Economics
description: Just in time for the presidential campaign season, youre on your own economics  a k a YOYO  has returned to the rhetorical landscape.

title: Concert Ranges From Happy to Happier
description: This year, my career took an interesting turn, the soprano Lauren Flanigan said from the stage as she greeted an admiring throng at Symphony Space on Monday evening. Rather than murder my numerous husbands onstage, I murdered a child. The ensuing ripple of laughter from the hall had an uncertain edge. I know, Ms. Flanigan continued. I wasnt drunk, either. I did it all by myself.

title: A Second Home in the Dry Valleys
description: Alia Khan, a graduate student at the University of Colorado, Boulder, writes from the McMurdo Dry Valleys in Antarctica, where she is studying ephemeral glacier-fed streams.

title: Q&A: Turning On Windows Update
description: Q. Where do I check to make sure Windows 7 is set to automatically download and install all the new software updates from Microsoft?

title: Climate Change and the Environment
description: To the Editor:

title: Men Aging Gracefully
description: To the Editor:

title: Jack Foster
description: Mr. Foster, 54, is a managing director and head of Franklin Templeton Real Asset Advisors, which is based in New York and invests in real estate stocks and funds. Real Asset Advisors is a division of Franklin Resources, based in San Mateo, Calif. Mr. Foster joined Franklin Templeton in 1987.

title: Less Likelihood of War?
description: To the Editor:

title: Chinas High Trade Barriers
description: To the Editor:

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Counting Google+ and Facebooks New Home
description: Heres what the reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web. For the full list, look over to the right-hand column.

title: Overhauling the George Washington Bridge
description: To the Editor:

title: Nurses Accuse Equity Firm of Cutting Patient Care
