title: Republican Presidential Candidates Embrace Granting Legal Rights to Human Embryos
description: The personhood amendment, granting legal rights to human embryos, might have seemed to be a political nonstarter after voters in Mississippi, arguably the most conservative and anti-abortion state in the nation, rejected such a proposal last month. But the idea has not faded in the Republican primaries.

title: Bank Official in Europe Says Outlook Is Darkening
description: LONDON  The outlook for financial stability in Europe has worsened since September as Europes debt crisis started to affect the financial system and economic growth prospects, Mervyn King, the vice chairman of the European Systemic Risk Board, said Thursday.

title: TimesCast | December 22, 2011
description: Coordinated bombings rock Baghdad | Italians react to deep government spending cuts

title: Year in Media | Phone-Hacking Scandal Rattles the Murdochs
description: Staff members of The Timess media news department are highlighting the most significant developments this year in the industries they cover.

title: Senators in Italy Pass Plan for Budget
description: ROME  Italys Senate voted overwhelmingly to give final approval on Thursday to a $40 billion austerity and growth package aimed at eliminating Italys budget deficit by 2013 and stimulating the economy as part of a broader plan to stabilize the euro.

title: Signs May Be Allowed Into Public Atrium Used by Protesters
description: A lawyer for Deutsche Bank, the landlord of a public atrium in the Financial District that Occupy Wall Street organizers were using to hold meetings, described in a letter an apparent refinement of a policy forbidding signs in the atrium, which some critics had called unconstitutional.

title: A Christmas Adventure, With an Entourage, for the Romneys
description: LANCASTER, N.H.  Mitt and Ann Romney entered the politically perilous realm of shopping for Christmas gifts with the national media in tow on Thursday morning  and they took all the necessary precautions.

title: 5 Tips for Teachers to Navigate Facebook's Features and Risks
Turkey Lashes Out Over French Bill About Genocide
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey halted diplomatic consultations and military dealings in a major rupture with France on Thursday after the lower house of the French Parliament approved legislation making it a crime to deny that the Turkish Army committed genocide against Armenians in the early 20th century.

title: For Baylor, Experience Is Paying Off
description: Krista Pirtle of The Lariat at Baylor University will file reports about the top-ranked Baylor Lady Bears throughout the season for The Quad.

title: Romney Says He Wont Release Tax Returns
description: 4:17 p.m. | Updated Mitt Romney, who is one of the wealthiest men ever to seek the presidency, said on Wednesday that he had no intention of releasing his tax returns if he became the Republican presidential nominee, breaking with a long tradition in both parties.

title: In Europe, Juggling Image and Capital
description: LONDON  Stung by souring loans and troubled government bond portfolios, many European banks are being forced by regulators to raise money to build up their cash cushions against future losses.

title: How Smart Is This Bird? Let It Count the Ways
description: By now, the intelligence of birds is well known. Alex the African gray parrot had great verbal skills. Scrub jays, which hide caches of seeds and other food, have remarkable memories. And New Caledonian crows make and use tools in ways that would put the average home plumber to shame.

title: Biodiversity in Turkey, at Risk Yet Largely Ignored
description: A new paper by biologists in Turkey and the United States warns that while Turkeys rich biodiversity is unique and globally important, it remains poorly researched and faces growing threats, especially from development.

title: For Saab Owners and Would-Be Buyers, What to Expect of Warranties, Recalls and Fire Sales
description: The bankruptcy of Saab Automobile leaves owners, dealers and would-be customers with plenty of questions and some unpleasant answers.

title: A Call to Protect Humble Fish, for Seabirds Sake
description: When people talk about the environmental effects of salmon aquaculture, they usually focus on water pollution and the spread of disease to wild fish stocks. But there is another big problem: It takes more than a pound of fish to produce a pound of salmon.

title: Brussels: The Chocolate Trail
description: CHOCOLATE  like fashion, wine and finance  has become a complex cultural phenomenon. There is basic chocolate for the masses, artisanal chocolate for purists and avant-garde creations for connoisseurs. In Brussels, a polyglot city at the geographic and cultural crossroads of Europe, you get it all.

title: Sampling the Chocolates of Brussels
description: Exploring the citys pralines, chocolatiers and cacao history.

title: Candidate-Peeping in New Hampshire
description: IN a presidential campaign dominated by televised debates and YouTube videos, theres one place where you can still find old-fashioned retail politics in action: New Hampshire. As the states Jan. 10 primary approaches, candidate-peepers will have plenty of chances to see presidential hopefuls up close as they visit town halls, school gyms and American Legions from Nashua to North Conway.

title: Week 16 in Fantasy Football: Favorable and Unfavorable Matchups
description: Jason and Justin Sablich are here to help you with your fantasy football team. The Sablich brothers will provide fantasy football advice throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter (@5thDownFantasy).

title: Life in Hotels
description: To the Editor: Regarding My Life in Hotels (Dec. 4), add one more tip to your excellent piece. This from a friend and hotel executive: hotel blankets are not cleaned with each change of sheets. Strip the bedspread, stow it, call housekeeping and request an additional sheet to top sheet your bed. A little gratuity to the housekeeper usually ensures that your bed will be freshly top-sheeted when the room is serviced.

title: Parental Quandary Resolved: When a Friends Child Hits Yours
description: The real quandary last week wasnt, perhaps, what a parent should do when a friends child hits yours and that friend has more excuses than actions, but how a parent should do what obviously must be done: stop the hitting. Isabel and Sharon (not their real names  all names in quandaries are changed and identifying details changed) became friends when their kids were quite young, and as they grew, Isobel saw Sharons kids (both boys, aged 4 and 6) bullying her 4-year-old daughter, with hitting and pushing and even a shove off a bike.

title: N.B.A. Season Preview
description: The Knicks have improved, the defending champion Mavericks have not, but in the end, N.B.A. reporter Howard Beck believes that the Thunder and Heat will meet in the finals.

title: Elder Bush Tells Paper Romney Is Best Choice
description: Former president George H. W. Bush offered an informal endorsement of Mitt Romney in remarks published Thursday, saying that Mr. Romney is the best choice for us.

title: Parts of Immigration Law Blocked in South Carolina
description: ATLANTA  A federal judge on Thursday blocked the most controversial parts of South Carolinas new immigration law from taking effect next month.

title: Video: N.B.A. Season Preview
description: The Knicks have improved, the defending champion Mavericks have not, but in the end, N.B.A. reporter Howard Beck believes that the Thunder and Heat will meet in the finals. Beck sits down with reporter Lynn Zinser to discuss the 2011-12 season.

title: A Youngster With a Key, a Word and a Quest
description: In the years since Sept. 11, that day has been revisited infrequently on American screens and with a circumspection that can feel like reluctance. Some moviemakers have probably shied away from the subject for fear of offending viewers; others, like Michael Moore, who directed Fahrenheit 9/11, havent worried about alienating a general audience because theyve played to a specific constituency, giving their viewers what they wanted to see and hear. Extremely Loud & Incredibly Close, a new Sept. 11 movie, takes a different tack from most of its predecessors by treating that day not as an occasion for personal sacrifice, for national mourning or reflection, but as kitsch.

title: Nazareth as an Eating Destination
description: THE bartender at Misk, a new restaurant and concert space in Nazareth, Israel, hurriedly scrolled through YouTube videos. His search was projected on a large screen, a new addition to the Ottoman-era white stone building. At last, he found a dance remix of an Arabic birthday song, and as the frenetic opening chords filled the room, a waitress strode out holding a cake fizzing with 18 sparkler candles.

title: The Republican Cul-De-Sac
description: There are any number of things Id rather be doing 72 hours before Christmas than writing about the payroll tax debate, but its an important window into the continuing policy dysfunction afflicting the Republican Party. The problem, to be clear, doesnt lie in the particular stance that the House Republicans have taken over the last week, insisting on a full-year extension of the payroll tax cut rather than two-month extension agreed to in the Senate. (On the merits, the House is right to want a full-year extension, the Senates punt was an embarrassment, and the compromise that may be in the offing looks like better policy than a purely short-term deal.) Rather, it lies in the fact that weve been having drawn-out negotiations about the issue at all. Republicans should have just taken yes for answer, embraced a bipartisan tax cut, declared victory and gone home for Christmas. Instead, a Republican Party that blithely voted to extend the Bush tax cuts without any offsets suddenly became very, very concerned about paying for a far more modest measure, and a G.O.P. thats supposedly committed to the lowest possible middle class tax burden decided that it needed to extract concessions from a Democratic president in exchange for supporting  a middle class tax cut.

title: Joe Cipolla, Milan, Italy
description: Its not quite a pairing to rival the spaghetti western, but its not far off: In Navigli, a trendy neighborhood in Milan, one of the most popular restaurants is an American-style steakhouse. With red-and-white-checkered tablecloths, walls crowded with black-and-white photos and a butcher counter up front, the five-year-old Joe Cipolla approximates a vintage meat-and-potatoes joint.

title: Justice Dept. Approves Merger of NYSE Euronext and Deutsche Borse
description: The Justice Department approved on Thursday the proposed merger of NYSE Euronext and Deutsche Brse, but required the sale of the German exchanges stake in Direct Edge Holdings within two years.

title: Looking Again at Police Arrest Data
Lundqvist, the Wild and the Canucks: Answers for Readers

title: In  New Oscar Math, Think Top 8, not 10
description: This could be bad news for Bridesmaids: as Oscarologists test the new Oscar math, the expert statisticians are predicting a field of, at most, 8 best-picture nominees  not 5 or 10, as in years past.

title: As New Gingrich Takes Center Stage, Old Reputation Lurks in Wings
description: FAIRFAX, Va.  Not long ago Newt Gingrich placed a call to Jack Nicklaus, the golf legend, seeking advice on how to pace himself.

title: Mets Sign Veteran Catcher as Backup
description: The Mets have signed Rob Johnson, a veteran catcher, to a minor league contract and had extended to him an invitation to spring training, the team announced Thursday.

title: American Horror Story Will Scare Up a New Cast and New Haunted Home for Season 2
description: While we dont want to spoil the surprise for viewers who havent yet seen the American Horror Story finale by revealing which characters lived or died, Ryan Murphy, a creator of that FX series, had another surprise up his sleeve, announcing on Thursday that none of characters from its first season, living or otherwise, will return in Season 2, nor will the creepy Los Angeles mansion that was the setting for the show.

title: If Car Companies Were Run Like Tech Companies
description: As we plow into 2012, it has become clear that the technology industry is like no other. Its changes come faster. Its marketing hits us more deeply. Its business models would look absurd in any other industry. Can you imagine what the world would look like if another industry worked like the tech industry? Like, say, cars?

title: European Banks That Must Raise Capital
description: Many of Europes largest banks will have to raise billions of euros to meet the new capital requirement of 9 percent of total assets.

title: In Ostia Antica, Italy, Clues to Past Glories
description: I ARRIVED in Ostia Antica from Rome, where Id been squinting at the grand ruins and trying to envision plutocrats in togas, grand processions of conquering generals and tyrants with 100-foot-tall statues of themselves.

title: For Juniors: Homework for Thursdays Facebook Chat (and Holiday Break)
description: Greetings from California. Im looking forward to jumping into the conversation and responding to your questions on The Choice blogs Facebook page, beginning at 8 p.m. Eastern time on Thursday. If you want to get your question in early, you can submit it now using the comment box below.

title: In Turkey, Western Companies Find Stability and Growth
description: LONDON  Turkeys split personality has often left it caught between two worlds. Some European nations have vocally opposed the countrys attempts to build closer ties with the West. And many of its Middle Eastern neighbors have been wary of the avidly secular state.

description: As it heads for its climax, the news for Foxs X-Factor looks well short of x-cellent.

description: CAIRO  The prime minister named by Egypts military rulers complained in a news conference on Thursday that other civilian political leaders had shunned him as though he were the agent of a foreign occupation.

description: In any other week, in any other city, in any other building, the sale of a three-bedroom apartment for $24 million  the most expensive transaction of the week, according to city records  would not go unnoticed.

title: Death Penalty Death Watch: Rhode Island and the Rest of the World
description: Governor Lincoln Chafee of Rhode Island is an independent who used to be the sort of Republican the party leaders hates moderate in many areas and even liberal on some social issues. He is also the kind of career politician currently in short supply: The kind whos willing to take principled stands. He was the only Republican in the Senate to vote against the war in Iraq and against extending the Bush tax cuts in 2005. He went to blacksmith school in Montana. (This has nothing to do with this article, but its interesting, isnt it?)
