title: The 'Super Heroes' Are Already Here
On a College Path, and Traveling Together
A Short Winter Break on The Choice
description: Like many of you, The Choice blog is going to take a few days off to spend time with family during the holidays. Well still publish any big admissions news should it break  and well keep updating our early-admission acceptances chart, in the event any more data flows in. Weve also got at least one essay scheduled for the week after Christmas, intended to provide some holiday food-for-thought for seniors who might be contemplating a gap year.

title: Opera Boston to Shut Down
description: Opera Boston, a small company known for innovative works, is shutting down because of financial problems, the board said in a statement on Friday, according to news media in Boston. The company this season had scheduled three productions, Berliozs Beatrice and Benedict in October and Tippetts The Midsummer Marriage and Bellinis I Capuleti e I Montecchi in the winter and spring. The company commissioned the opera Madame White Snake from the composer Zhou Long, who was given the 2011 Pulitzer Prize in music for the work. The company faced an insurmountable budget deficit, the board said. We find ourselves in a financially untenable situation, and the responsible thing is to work with our creditors and cease operations. The company will close Jan. 1.

title: X Factor Leads to $42 Million Payday for Simon Cowell
description: For one of the most hyped television shows of the year, The X Factor may have had disappointing ratings, but the show still turned out to be a big payday for Simon Cowell, its creator.

description: ONE afternoon over the summer, eight people gathered in an office at the Corcoran Group to brainstorm names for a 29-unit condominium scheduled for completion in mid-2012.

title: A Low-Slung District With a Very High Perch
description: JON PAUL LUPO grew up not far away in Marine Park, but thinking back, he figures the most interaction he had with Sunset Park in those days was driving past it on the Gowanus Expressway. For his wife, Melanie, the area was even less familiar  she is from South Dakota.

title: Living In | Sunset Park
description: The neighborhood stretches north past Green-Wood Cemetery, and south to 64th Street, and from Eighth Avenue to New York Harbor.

title: Manhattan Forest, Now Barren, Is Far From Lifeless
description: See a larger version of the forest from this week. Compare with the enlarged version of last weeks image.

title: Describe Your School
This Familys Attic Is Full of Motorcycles
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y.  When it comes to assessing the motivations of a motorcycle collector, it is never clear exactly where to draw the line between a hobby and an obsession.

title: TimesCast | Syrian Suicide Bombings
description: December 23, 2011  Suicide bombers strike Syrian government facilities, killing dozens.

title: New Frontiers in Economic Barbarism
description: Ive written quite a lot about the way much of the macroeconomics community has descended into a Dark Age, forgetting the things they used to know. I was originally set off by the way some economists were propounding Says Law  the idea, refuted 75 years ago, that all income must be spent and hence that supply creates its own demand  as a profound insight, somehow missed by three generations of economists.

title: On Syrian State Television, Bombings Are Called Qaeda Plot Directed by U.S.
description: Updated | 6:08 p.m. As my colleague Kareem Fahim reports, Syrias official news agency claimed on Friday that two bombings in Damascus appeared to be the work of Al Qaeda.

title: Your Best Meals of 2011: The First Batch
description: We asked; youre answering. Below are just a few readers tweets with their best meals of the 2011, and well continue to feature them here. Share yours by tweeting us @nytimesdining, using the hashtag #bestmeal2011.

title: Best Buy Cancels Some Online Orders
description: 12/24/11 | Updated Adding new statement from Best Buy.

title: Rush to Buy New Sneakers Leads to Arrests
description: Oh, the joys of holiday shopping: the eve of Christmas Eve, Air Jordans and the sting of pepper spray in the eye.

title: The Giving Spree | Doutzen Kroes
description: Who: The model Doutzen Kroes

title: Friday Night Music: The Queen and the Soldier
description: Yes, I know its not quite evening yet. But Im declaring an early closing.

title: Spaetzle: A Blank Canvas for Hearty Meals
description: THE first spaetzle noodles I ever tasted were the ones I made myself.

title: Is It Bigger Than a Breadbox?
description: A HALF-CENTURY ago, a guy given a watch for the holidays would have torn off the wrapping paper to find a modest box containing a timepiece about the size of a quarter. This season that same package is more likely the size of a hamper, with inside it a hunk of bristling, steel-studded hardware and gears.

title: Marianne Faithfull, Once a Pop Star Princess
description: Photos of the former British pop star during her prime.

title: Wedding Etiquette
description: Going Down the Paperless Trail

title: Marianne, as Years Go By
description: MARIANNE FAITHFULL is still restless after all these years, taking puffs midsong on a forbidden Marlboro Light. She is still preening, tucking her shoulder-length hair behind her ears, a childish tic she has never quite abandoned.

title: Christmases Past
description: Im going on vacation next week, so The Loyal Opposition will go on vacation too. The next time you hear from me Ill be in Iowa, where Ill be covering the caucuses with David Firestone from the editorial board, and Juliet Lapidos, the editor for this blog.

title: Gingrich Criticizes Paul on Newsletters and Foreign Policy
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Newt Gingrich said Friday that Representative Ron Paul of Texas had to answer for political newsletters that included racist, antigay and anti-Israel passages that Mr. Paul has since disavowed.

title: Yahoo Board to Pursue Sale of Asian Assets
description: Yahoos board decided on Friday to proceed with negotiations to sell the bulk of its shares in the Alibaba Group and Yahoo Japan to its Asian partners, according to a person with knowledge of the matter. A deal, which involves a complicated asset swap with Alibaba and Softbank, values the holdings at roughly $17 billion.

title: Showdown in New York for Jets and Giants
description: The Jets and Giants are set to meet on Saturday, with both teams needing a victory to bolster their playoff hopes. William C. Rhoden dropped in on both teams this week.

title: T Exclusive Video | Sound Check With Bradford Cox of Atlas Sound
description: A film by Harrison Boyce and Nathan Brown of Boyce & Brown.

title: Video: Jets and Giants Set for a Showdown
description: The Jets and Giants are set to meet on Saturday, with both teams needing a victory to bolster their playoff hopes. William C. Rhoden dropped in on both teams this week.

title: Hostesses Slip Into Something a Little Practical
description: WHITHER the hostess gown? Archaeological study of this now-defunct garment, popular from the 1930s to the 1970s (according to the Vintage Fashion Guild), reveals that the American lady of the house used to greet her dinner guests not in Lululemon yoga pants and a clammy tank top, but a billowing, brightly colored maxi-dress, often with a forgiving waistline, or no waistline  sort of a cross between an evening formal and a bathrobe.

title: More About Spaetzle Makers
description: To make this weeks casserole, there are several types of spaetzle makers on the market, and though my experience is limited to the two I own, I vastly prefer one over the other. This is the model that I recommend.

title: Reviewing the BMW 6 Series
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, Lawrence Ulrich reviews the BMW 6 Series coupe and convertible, a grand tourer that underwent a major redesign for the 2012 model year, its first since the previously dormant series was resurrected in 2004.

title: A Very Merry Un-Christmas to You
description: IN the backyard, revelers gathered around a vat of boiling oil and counted down from 10. All eyes were on the 12-pound turkey, suspended by a rope. At One! the bird plunged into the fryer and everyone cheered.

title: After Skirting the Sun, Comet Lovejoy Provides a Cosmic Show
description: Several days after newly discovered Comet Lovejoy streaked through the Suns atmosphere (see video above), it provided a glorious pre-holiday display for astronauts aboard the International Space Station. NASA has posted an informative description of the comets journey and its discovery earlier this month by Tom Lovejoy, an amateur astronomer in Australia.

title: One More Life We Loved
description: For this years Lives They Lived Issue, we asked readers to send in photographs and short accounts of their own loved ones who died this year. We had no idea how wonderful and inspiring this would turn out to be, and we are so grateful to everyone who participated. Personally, I have a last-minute addition  just after we finished the issue, I lost my father, and in the spirit of the readers submissions, I offer this brief remembrance:

title: Tahrir Square, Walled In
description: CAIRO  Almost 11 months to the day after the start of the revolt that ousted Hosni Mubarak, the landscape of downtown Cairo offers its own portrait of the frustrated state of the Egyptian revolution.

title: Virtual Realms That Merit More Visits
description: So many games; so little time.

title: Food Links for the Solstice
description: First up, a terrific post by Andy Bellatti: 2011: The year in food. Also, the year in food scandals from HuffPo. And the top ten health stories of the year, from the Atlantic, including contaminated cantaloupes, cancerous cell phones and the link between autism and vaccines finally being severed.

title: Week in Pictures for Dec. 23
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include the return of a Christmas tradition, the killing of a police officer and the death of a woman in an elevator accident.

title: Happy Holidays From Wheels
description: Wheels will take a short break and return to our regular coverage on Tuesday, Dec. 27. If youre on the move this weekend, the editors and contributors at Wheels wish you safe and happy travels.

title: Subprime mortgages, the euros troubles, and the next crisis for American banks
description: This week  the podcasts last waltz  features Jeff Sommer with Gretchen Morgenson on subprime mortgages, Floyd Norris on the euros troubles, and Tyler Cowen on the next crisis for American banks.

title: Russia Unexpectedly Reduces Its Interest Rate
description: Russia unexpectedly reduced its benchmark rate on Friday, suggesting that policy makers believed that a global economic slump posed greater risks than inflation to the country, the worlds biggest energy exporter.

title: All-Star Lineup of TV Walk-Ons
description: Its been a spunky year for cameos and guest spots on television series. The Office had Jim Carrey. NCIS had Bob Newhart. Glee had Chewbacca.

title: Podcast: Mortgage Crisis, the Euro and the Fed
description: The subprime mortgage crisis dominated the Weekend Business podcast when it started in 2007.

title: Countdown to 2012
Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Syria, Iraq, West Bank and Egypt.

title: For Santorum in His Iowa Bid, Never That Moment in the Sun
description: OSCEOLA, Iowa  One of two things is certain to happen in the next few weeks to Rick Santorum, after making more than 300 campaign stops in Iowa and draining his personal bank account. Either he will finally catch fire (and there are signs he may be gaining some ground). Or he will become the sole major Republican candidate to never have been among the Iowa front-runners this year (outside of Jon M. Huntsman Jr., who did not really try).

title: Stimulus Oversight Board Gets a New Leader
description: President Obama has appointed a new leader of the board overseeing the winding down of the federal governments $787 billion stimulus program, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. announced Friday.

title: Sexism Onstage, With a Twist
description: Female playwrights historically have not found Broadway a welcome home to their new plays, but this season has been a surprising exception. Along with a darkly comic one-act from the veteran Elaine May, Katori Hall and Lydia R. Diamond are making their Broadway debuts, and Theresa Rebeck, a Pulitzer Prize finalist, has her second Broadway production to date, the comedy Seminar, now at the Golden Theater.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Syria, Iraq, West Bank and Egypt.

title: The Agreement on the Payroll Tax
description: To the Editor:

title: Teaching Students Online, for Profit
description: To the Editor:

title: Atheists and Meaning
description: To the Editor:

title: The Value of Old Age
description: To the Editor:

title: The Week in Culture Pictures, Dec. 23
description: A slide show of photographs of cultural events from this week.

title: After an Earlier Delay, the Fulton Street Transit Center Finally Rises
description: For a moment, Uday R. Durg, who directs Lower Manhattan projects for the Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys capital construction unit, looks out of place in his hard hat and reflective orange safety vest. He is standing just a few yards from a construction zone at the Fulton Street Transit Center, but he is surrounded by ordinary straphangers in ordinary street clothes.

title: Reindeer Are Fading Into Holiday Myth
description: Toronto

title: Healthful Dishes in the Ottoman Tradition
description: BOSPHORUS brings new flavors to the county with a compendium of dishes reflecting cooking traditions from far-ranging regions that were once part of the vast Ottoman Empire.

title: Judge Halts Dodgers Sale of TV Rights
description: A federal district court judge Friday granted a request by Fox Sports to stop, for now, the Los Angeles Dodgers sale of their TV rights and wrote that a lower court might have erred in letting the process begin.

title: Broadway Hits Gold in Buffalo
description: BUFFALO  The Addams Family musical will close on Broadway next Saturday without earning back its $16.5 million capitalization during its 22-month run, a disappointment to the producers. Yet the national tour production of The Addams Family was a hit this month at Sheas Performing Arts Center in Buffalo, grossing $995,000 in a week, more than most shows pull in on Broadway  including The Addams Family, which hasnt earned that much money in a week since April.

title: The Next Russian Revolution?
description: Oxford, England

title: A Crime Fighter Draws Plaudits, and Scrutiny
description: CIUDAD JUREZ, Mexico

title: Ligety Skis to Victory, With Party Included
description: ANDALO, Italy  With the towering and jagged limestone peaks of Italys western Dolomites as a spectacular backdrop, the bottom of the race course at Paganella Ski Area quickly morphed into a high energy rock concert on Friday. It was a festive yet slightly chaotic atmosphere in a typically serene region of natural wonder.

title: Justice Dept. Cites Race in Halting Law Over Voter ID
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department on Friday blocked a new South Carolina law that would require voters to present photo identification, saying the law would disproportionately suppress turnout among eligible minority voters.

title: Historical Type
description: The exhibition Printing for Kingdom, Empire & Republic at the Grolier Club.

title: Italian Cuisine, Guided by a Native
description: IT sounded so intriguing. Margherita Aloi, the daughter of a winemaker and farmer from a small town in the Piedmont region of Italy, who attended the Culinary Institute of Barolo, was chosen by the New York restaurateur Pino Luongo to cook at his new, wildly successful Manhattan restaurant, Le Madri. It was 1989 and she was just 18. Mr. Luongo had the novel idea of staffing Le Madri, which means the mothers, with a rotating cadre of Italian women, each cooking her regional specialty. The young Ms. Aloi was hired as the fresh-pasta maker.

title: Crennels Career Gains New Life as Chiefs Cling to Slim Playoff Hope
description: It was 48 hours before kickoff at the Super Bowl when Romeo Crennel began a defensive meeting for New England with a startling announcement: he wanted to make a change in one of the coverages the Patriots planned to use against the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Types With Plenty of Character
description: There was a day when type had weight. Not as in bold or extra bold; as in 7 pounds 8 ounces.

title: Remember the Alamo
description: Well, what a relief.

title: Looking Up, Detroit Faces a New Crisis
description: DETROIT  For a city that some have declared dead again and again, the talk of late here was of renaissance  of auto industry jobs growing, new companies moving into empty buildings downtown, urban gardens blooming in vacant lots.

title: Young and Connected, Office Plankton Protesters Surprise Russia
description: MOSCOW  On Friday afternoon, Denis Terekhov gathered together his employees for an impromptu staff meeting.

title: Giants at Jets: Matchups to Watch
description: Giants (7-7) at Jets (8-6), 1 p.m. Eastern, Fox

title: Amid the Fish Tanks, 60 Kinds of Dim Sum
description: I HAD modest expectations of Wonder Seafood Restaurant, which is nondescript in appearance, verging on the utilitarian. Yet on two visits, this Hong Kong-style Cantonese place lived up to its ambitious name  for two very different reasons.

title: Wage Floor Is Increasing in 8 States in New Year
description: Eight states will ring in the New Year with a higher minimum wage, under state laws that require wage floors to keep apace with inflation. San Francisco, one of the few cities that sets its own minimum wage above the federal level, is also raising wages for the lowest-paid workers in the new year. It will become the first big city in the country to require companies to pay their workers more than $10 an hour.

title: The Big Lie
description: So this is how the Big Lie works.

title: Fewer to Celebrate Christmas in Sudan After Souths Split
description: KHARTOUM, Sudan  Hanging from the wall of Bishop Ezekiel Kondos living room  a few blocks from a silver-coated dome marking the tomb of Sudans 19th-century Muslim leader, the Mahdi  are a cross, pictures of fellow clergy members and a photo of him with the former archbishop of Canterbury above a small plastic Christmas tree.

title: Not Exclusively Chinese, but Mostly
description: A FAMILY sits around a table in a Chinese restaurant on Christmas in the climactic scene from the 1983 movie A Christmas Story. It is a scene that is repeated every year on Long Island and elsewhere: for those who do not celebrate the holiday  or who do, but who have had enough of it  theres not a lot to do on this day but go to the movies or have a meal out. And just try to find a non-Asian restaurant open on Christmas.

title: U.S. Reverses Decision to End Farming Reports
description: The government is back in the business of counting sheep. And mink and goats and catfish and lots of other things that are raised on farms.

title: Egypt: Protests Against Military Spread Beyond Cairo to New Cities
description: Protests calling for an end to military rule broadened from Cairo to other cities on Friday as thousands turned out in anger at widely circulated images of soldiers beating and stripping female demonstrators during a crackdown last weekend. It was the biggest outbreak of demonstrations outside the capital since the current wave of protests against the ruling military council began Nov. 18. Several thousand protesters gathered in Tahrir Square in Cairo, and significant protests were reported in Alexandria, Suez, Luxor and elsewhere.

title: The Race to the Right
description: The toxic effects of right-wing extremism in Washington were vividly on display during the payroll-tax fiasco  even to the right wing. On the campaign trail, though, those lessons are being ignored. The leading Republican presidential candidates are overtly competing for the title of Most Conservative, distorting their own records and advocating increasingly radical positions.

title: Cuba: 2,900 Prisoners Pardoned
description: Cuba has pardoned 2,900 prisoners and may release dozens of foreigners serving jail sentences as a humanitarian gesture, President Ral Castro said Friday.The amnesty will not include Alan Gross, an American contractor whose arrest two years ago has strained relations between Cuba and the United States. Cubas vice foreign minister, Josefina Vidal, told The Associated Press that Mr. Gross was not on the list. The prisoners, who were pardoned by the Council of State, Cubas highest governing body, include women, the ailing and people over 60, Mr. Castro said in a speech to Parliament. Those released would also include some convicted of crimes against the state who had served a large part of their prison sentence with good behavior. He said the government would also release 86foreign prisoners from 25 countries, provided that their governments agreed to repatriate them.

title: Gov. Cuomos Next Big Task
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomos success on big issues like same-sex marriage shows that he can get things done. His top priority now should be to clean up Albanys pay-to-play culture, beginning with a thorough overhaul of the campaign fund-raising system.

title: Rehberg and His Broad Push to Help the Mining Industry
description: Representative Denny Rehberg, Republican of Montana, has collected large amounts of campaign contributions from the mining industry, following a series of steps the congressman has taken to help this industry.

title: At Choir Practice, Fiddling While Drums Boomed
description: We had a backstage pass for a rehearsal for one of the most celebrated birthday concerts of the year: Midnight Mass at St. Patricks Cathedral. On Wednesday, we were invited to slip between the pews and ride up in a hidden elevator to a loft to watch the choir prepare.

title: An All-American Misstep
description: It is incredibly sad that one person with his own one-man hate group can tap into anti-Muslim sentiment and lead reputable companies to make foolish judgment calls.

title: Mining Companies Back Friends Bid for Senate
description: NYE, Mont.  The violation notices keep coming in: broken safety equipment, underground roof collapses, dangerous levels of carbon monoxide  each a hint of the federal enforcement blitz set off more than a year ago by a series of deadly mining accidents across the nation.

title: Deck the Halls With Boughs of Nutty
description: You may see this as a companion to my last years bittersweet Christmas entry. Some found that one a bit too poignant.

title: A What-If as Two Teams Square Off in New York
description: The Von Zedtwitz Double Knockout is an annual event organized by the Greater New York Bridge Association.

title: This Eclectic Season
description: Surely there is a Christmas tree, somewhere in this land, decorated with zombie ornaments or figurines from Battlestar Galactica. Just as surely, someone will be celebrating the holiday traditionally, with real candles burning on a real tree, in Scandinavian fashion. In some houses, Bob Dylans Must Be Santa is playing in a loop with Rosemary Clooney, Asleep at the Wheel and the choir of Kings College, Cambridge. On Christmas Eve, some will read the Grinch aloud, some will read David Sedaris and many will re-read the first verses of the second chapter of Luke, only to be moved by their beauty all over again.

title: Lottery Numbers
Cafe Owner Found Killed Was Facing Money Woes
description: Joshua Rubin once started an Internet campaign to raise money for his dream Brooklyn coffee shop, which he hoped would be a nexus for the areas creative minds.

title: Expectations Start to Build as Knicks Get Acquainted
description: He endured the payroll purges and the roster churn, the Stephon Marbury drama and the LeBron James flirtation. He coped with Eddy Curry, tolerated Nate Robinson and made the most of Chris Duhon.

title: Bankruptcy Filing Raises Doubts About a Bond Repayment Pledge
description: People who own what is considered the safest type of municipal bond may be in for a surprise.

title: Different Teams, Exclusive Club
description: One is the photogenic bachelor with an impish sense of humor, as much a marketing commodity as the face of a franchise. The other comes from a family of quarterbacks, his boyish countenance belying veteran leadership and a steely demeanor. For all their differences, these two men share an unusual perspective: they are quarterbacks in New York.

title: Biometric Passwords
description: Nasir Maman, a professor at Polytechnic Institute of NYU, demonstrates a system where a tablet recognizes the unique movement of a user's fingers.

title: The Netherlands: Court Upholds Fine for Dumping Waste in Africa
description: An Amsterdam appeals court on Friday upheld a criminal fine of 1 million euros, about $1.3 million, for Trafigura, one of the worlds largest commodity traders, for the Dutch portion of an episode that ended with a shipload of toxic waste being dumped in the open in Ivory Coast. At least 16 people were killed and thousands near the dumping areas were sickened, the Ivory Coast government said. The court found Trafigura guilty of concealing the dangerous nature of the sludge, a mix of oil-products waste and caustic chemicals, when its ship, the Probo Koala, delivered its load to the Netherlands in 2006 for treatment and disposal. After deciding it would be cheaper to dispose of the load elsewhere, Trafigura then illegally exported the waste to the Ivory Coast, the court said. The company, which has denied wrongdoing, has paid Ivory Coast a settlement of close to $200 million. A spokesman for the company called the decision disappointing but did not say if the company would appeal to the countrys highest court.

title: Logging In With a Touch or a Phrase (Anything but a Password)
description: Passwords are a pain to remember. What if a quick wiggle of five fingers on a screen could log you in instead? Or speaking a simple phrase?

title: Same Old Celtics? Not Quite
description: BOSTON  The team that sent the Knicks home for the summer at the end of the 2010-11 season will be the one they see when they open the truncated 2011-12 season on Christmas.

title: Finding the Unique in You to Build a Better Password
description: Sophisticated hackers can now crack into an account in one second. Using automated password-cracking software, hackers can crack 1,000 accounts in 17 minutes, according to Imperva, a data security firm.

title: A Lively Nativity Scene With Roots in Italy
description: TUCKAHOE, N.Y.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: Municipal retirees in a Rhode Island city agree to a possibly precedent-setting pension cut, merchants slash prices in what may be a desperate effort to move excess inventory and security experts are at work in both airline screening and electronic identification.

title: More Retailers Pull Formula From Shelves
description: Kroger, Safeway and Walgreen joined retailers removing Enfamil Premium Newborn formula from stores as regulators tested whether the product caused the death of a newborn. Mead Johnsons stock fell 5.1 percent to $65.29, after plunging 10 percent on Thursday when Walmart pulled the formula. Supervalu also has withdrawn the formula, a spokesman said. Officials screening samples of the formula and water used to prepare it said results might not come until next week. The newborn tested positive for Cronobacter sakazakii, an environmental bacterium that can be fatal. Another child infected with the bacterium in Missouri had also been given formula, though officials said on Friday that the baby, who survived, ingested other types of products as well. The brand of formula given to the second baby was not disclosed.

title: As Nets Try to Fill Hole in the Middle, the Coach Puts On a Happy Face
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  As Nets Coach Avery Johnson sat down in a chair after practice Friday, a reporter asked him a simple, ice-breaking question: how are you feeling?

title: Willis Reed Tunnel Is Gone; Jersey and Memory Stay
description: Willis Reed had heard a few weeks ago that the Madison Square Garden tunnel he made famous in 1970 by merely walking through it was gone. He isnt mad, or in mourning.

title: Clash Over Regional Power Spurs Iraqs Sectarian Rift
description: BAQUBA, Iraq  The governor has fled this uneasy city. Half the members of the provincial council are camped out in northern Iraq, afraid to return to their offices. Peaceful protesters fill the dusty streets, though just days ago angrier crowds blockaded the highways with burning tires and shattered glass.

title: Saturday: Where the Show Must Go On
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  If you are skilled enough to start a Saturday puzzle at 1 Across (as opposed to just looking for any toehold), you might have been surprised by the entry there today. Weve seen a clue like X-ed or X-ed out many times before, but always clued in some way that refers to something being crossed out, or perhaps as a rudimentary signature. Weve never seen it clued as SPREADEAGLE. What a way to wake up on a Saturday.

title: Gathering to Mourn the End of a Show That Celebrated Brooklyn
description: The show did not pander, fans said. It did not condescend. It showed Brooklyn, they insisted, for what it was  a place, apparently, with unlicensed private detective work, armies of baby strollers and a bearded superhero whose most salient superpower, acquired after a below-the-belt run-in with the third rail of a subway, cannot be described in a family newspaper.

title: Deflections and Lundqvist Send Rangers Past Flyers and Into Division Lead
description: Stu Bickel played the third game of his N.H.L. career Friday night, dressing as a defenseman for the Rangers, a team that has been running low on defensemen. He ended the game without a goal, and his face was battered and bloody.

title: After Losing Longtime Roommate and Home, a Man Finds His Dream Job
description: Every time a new roommate walked into Iking Littles apartment in the Bronx, he thought he had found someone to help him hold on to the only home he had known for more than a decade.

title: Newt Gingrich and Rick Perry Fail to Qualify for Virginia Primary Ballot
description: 3:09 a.m. | Updated Newt Gingrich will not appear on the Virginia presidential primary ballot, state Republican Party officials announced Saturday, after he failed to submit the required number of valid signatures to qualify.

title: George Bailey, in Living Color and on the Radio
description: Dear devoted fans of a certain 1946 Frank Capra holiday movie: Relax. The holiday production at Long Wharf Theater has done absolutely no harm to the original. In fact, it has added another layer of nostalgia.

title: They Fume and They Bicker While Running City and State
description: They fume about each others egos, moods and stunts. They have not appeared together at a single news conference all year. Each of their successes, real or perceived, can provoke envy or resentment in the other.

title: Diverging Paths of Victims Can Hit Dead Ends
description: I would know it, Esther Davis told me back in May, a few days after thieves had made off with her wrought-iron gate that squeaked open and shut on Vanderbilt Avenue in Brooklyn for almost all of her 53 years. Adding to her frustrations was the fact that the thieves stole a bunch of gates that day; she was one of many victims standing in front of brownstones, shaking their heads.

title: Art Institute Moves to the Fast Track
description: ASBURY PARK, N.J.

title: Interview Was Clean, F.B.I. Agent Testifies
description: In December 2009, Maged Sidaros, a special agent with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, flew to Nigeria to question an Eritrean man being held on suspicion of supporting terrorism.

title: From a Tiffany, Treasures on Canvas
description: AS a teenage aesthete, Louis Comfort Tiffany started making trips abroad to paint in the 1860s, paid for with his inheritance from the family jewelry business. For six decades he regularly took long vacations to sketch. In the Middle East, he painted camel caravans, pyramids and mosque doorways. On trips around America, he set up his easel at Long Island cow pastures, Yellowstone canyons and Pacific Northwest redwoods.

title: Corrections: December 24
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Slowly Circling a Hallowed Patch
description: Nelson Corporan arrived at Rockefeller Center 20 years ago as a teenager looking for work. Since then, Mr. Corporan, 38, who emigrated from the Dominican Republic at age 15, has been entrusted with perhaps the citys most cherished stretch of ice: the centers skating rink. On Christmas Day, as on most Sundays, Mr. Corporan will drive his white Oldsmobile to Midtown before trading it in for a Zamboni. He lives in Washington Heights with his wife, Kamalich, 37, who works in a beauty salon; their children, Brian, 14, and Brianna, 11; and two parrots.

title: Citys Taxi Fleet Violates Disabilities Act, Judge Rules
description: New York Citys fleet of taxi cabs violates part of the Americans With Disabilities Act by not sufficiently providing for customers who use wheelchairs, a federal judge ruled on Friday.

title: Where the Hot Chocolate Does a Triple Axel
description: Madonna was not careening around the outdoor skating rink at the Standard Hotel  shes more likely to materialize upstairs at the Top of the Standard, the celebrity magnet formerly known as the Boom Boom Room  but she and her ilk are well-represented on the piped-in soundtrack. On a recent Friday night, the mood was festive at the Kaffeeklatsch, the pop-up Alpine snack hut and rinkside cafe, at 848 Washington Street, where the shrieks of amateur skaters skidding, sliding and occasionally going boom, were also part of the entertainment. Admission is $12, rental skates are $3, heat lamps keep the crowd warm, and aprs-ski couture capped by furry hats is the prevalent attire. Grandmas hot chocolate is served with a twist: fortifying shots of bourbon, brandy, whiskey and whatnot  Dutch courage for skittish skaters.

title: Medicaid Cuts Are Part of a Larger Battle in Maine
description: AUGUSTA, Me.  At a town hall meeting in the rural western part of the state last week, a woman asked Gov. Paul R. LePage if he could confirm a worrying rumor she had heard: that poor out-of-staters flock here because the public benefits are so generous.

title: Cache That Trash
description: Q. Coming from Boston, where the sanitation trucks pull in between buildings to make pickups, I am mystified at why people enjoying an evening out in New York have to share the sidewalks of this sophisticated city with great mounds of garbage bags and the rats they attract. Thats what alleys are for. Why are there so few of them in much of Manhattan?

title: Bloomberg Predicts Fair Deal if Health Insurer Gets For-Profit Status
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said Friday that he expected an agreement would be reached to satisfy the citys concerns about a plan backed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to allow a major nonprofit insurer to be converted into a for-profit company.

title: John Lawrence, Plaintiff in Gay Rights Case, Dies at 68
description: John G. Lawrence, whose bedroom encounter with the police in Texas led to one of the gay rights movements signal triumphs, the Supreme Courts 2003 decision in Lawrence v. Texas, died at his home in Houston on Nov. 20, his partner said on Friday. He was 68.

title: James Ramseur, Wounded in 84 Subway Shooting, Dies at 45
description: James Ramseur, one of four teenagers who was shot by Bernhard H. Goetz, the so-called subway vigilante, in one of the most highly charged and widely publicized criminal cases of the 1980s, died Thursday in the Bronx. He was 45.

title: Only Questions Follow the Arrest of a Decorated Soldier in the Murder of a Stranger
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  In a completely random act of violence, the police say, Staff Sgt. Dwight L. Smith drove into a stranger as she was walking her dog in a stately Wilmington neighborhood on Monday morning, put the woman into his vehicle and then killed her with blows to the head, according to the criminal charges.

title: For Me, a Beer. For My Phone, Some Juice.
description: APP goCharge Finder

title: Obama Challenges Provisions in Budget Bill
description: WASHINGTON  When President Obama signed a budget bill on Friday, he issued a signing statement claiming a right to bypass dozens of provisions that placed requirements or restrictions on the executive branch, saying he had well-founded constitutional objections to the new statutes.

title: Racing in Bars, Going Nowhere Fast
description: THE bicycle swung wide left under Alexander Barouh as he furiously pedaled to the end of his 500-meter sprint, bringing gasps from the crowd standing only a few feet from his front wheel.

title: With Paul on the Rise in Iowa, Gingrich Takes Aim
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  Newt Gingrich turned his fire on Representative Ron Paul of Texas on Friday, saying that his Republican opponent had to answer for political and investment newsletters that included racist, anti-gay and anti-Israel passages that Mr. Paul has disavowed.

title: Did You Give the Doorman Enough?
description: In recent years, New Yorkers fortunate enough to indulge worries over domestic compensation have been besieged with more and more advice and debate every December  from newspapers, magazines, parenting blogs, real-estate blogs  on how much to tip the people who take care of our children, open our doors, adjust our radiators, park our Priuses. And yet there is little to suggest that this mountain of charts and bullet points has eased the tension. What economists cite as the vexing information asymmetries central to these transactions appear to have been rectified hardly at all.

title: Wenger Says Hes Considering Adding Henry on Loan; Lindpere Talks Europe
description: Thierry Henry was in London two weeks ago to be honored as part of Arsenals 125th anniversary celebrations. But could he be going back next month for a longer stay?

title: Sounding Quiet Dissent About a Holiday Perennial
description: Bil Browning and his boyfriend were homeless. To protect the identity of the boyfriend (now ex-boyfriend), Mr. Browning will not say specifically where, just that it was in southern Indiana, about 20 years ago. But he is very explicit about who refused to give them shelter.

title: Highlights From the James Kalm Report
description: The painter Loren Munk, working under the alias James Kalm, has made more than 900 videos documenting the New York art world. Here are some selections.

title: Via YouTube, Leading Tours of the Citys Art Scene
description: WHEN Loren Munk began furtively filming New York City gallery and museum openings in 2006  working undercover, as he put it  he was regularly kicked out by security guards and threatened with legal action for copyright infringement.

title: Newswallah: Bollywood Edition
description: Raj Kapoor: From Jan. 6-16, The Museum of Modern Art in New York will showcase one of Hindi cinemas most iconic filmmakers, Raj Kapoor. An exhibition titled Raj Kapoor and the Golden Age of Indian Cinema will screen new prints of eight Raj Kapoor films, including Awaara (1951), Barsaat (1949) and Bobby (1973). The exhibition is curated by Noah Cowan, artistic director of TIFF Bell Lightbox. He tells us about Raj Kapoors enduring legacy.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: Farooq Abdullah, the federal minister for new and renewable energy, on Wednesday accused the media of creating China phobia. He was responding to a question about reports suggesting that China was building bunkers along the Jammu and Kashmir border. (Kashmir Live)

title: Harlems Maestro of Gospel Music
description: IT is no idle boast for Edgar Kendricks: The man can sit at any piano or organ in Harlem and summon a legion of church ladies in big hats to fill the pews and serve as his choir.

title: Events in Westchester
description: Seasonal

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Bleeding Green: Protecting the Outside Is the Jets Bright Side
description: Brian Bassett is the founder of SNYs The Jets Blog. You can follow him on Twitter at @Brian_Bassett. He and Ed Valentine of Big Blue View will be writing about the Jets and the Giants in the days leading up to the Giants-Jets game on Saturday.

title: Dyed in Blue: Alive Until the End? Thats the Giants Way
description: Ed Valentine is the editor of Big Blue View, a Giants blog. He and Brian Bassett of The Jets blog will write in the days leading up to the Giants-Jets game on Saturday.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,839 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American on Friday:

title: North Carolina: Edwards Legal Team Asks for Delay
description: Lawyers for former Senator John Edwards asked a federal judge on Thursday to delay his criminal trial because he had unexpectedly encountered a medical issue and they needed more time to prepare his defense. Jury selection was scheduled to begin next month in Greensboro. Mr. Edwards is accused of violating campaign finance laws by using donors money to support his pregnant mistress during his 2008 presidential campaign. The lawyers did not explain the nature of the medical issue publicly, but said they had filed confidential information to the judge. Prosecutors filed a response, asking the judge, Catherine Eagles, not to delay the trial.

title: A Fateful Christmas Meeting
description: On Christmas morning 1861, the steps of all three Lincoln sons could be heard pounding on the floorboards of the White House. The eldest, Robert, had recently arrived home from Harvard, to join his brothers, 8-year old Tad and 11-year-old Willie. The reunion of the Lincoln clan was a bright spot on what was proving to be a less than cheery Christmas. The Union had lost several key battles, while the Confederacy seemed no closer to collapse. Then, before the president could sit down to Christmas dinner with his family, he had yet another matter to attend to: deciding whether the Union could risk war with Britain.

title: Car Bomber Kills Soldiers in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A suicide car bomber drove a vehicle packed with explosives into a building used by paramilitary forces in northwestern Pakistan early on Saturday, killing at least six soldiers and wounding 11 others, police officials said.

title: Bill Cunningham | New York on Display
description: During New York City's holiday shopping season, there is more on display than just fashion. The major department stores showcase their artistic talents through their window displays.

title: The Weekend Word: Blocked
description: Todays Times

title: Calculating Playoff Odds for Jets and Giants
description: Theres some more important things that go into it, because basically, youre out of the playoffs if you lose this game, either team is.  Rex Ryan, Jets coach, earlier this week.

title: Vast Rally in Moscow Is a Challenge to Putins Power
description: MOSCOW  Tens of thousands of citizens converged in Moscow on Saturday for the second huge antigovernment demonstration in a month, an early victory for activists struggling to forge a burst of energy into a political force capable of challenging Vladimir V. Putins power.

title: Kim Jong-il Son Cleared as Top Military Commander
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea broadcast television footage on Sunday of the top military brass flanking the countrys young new leader, Kim Jong-un, as they paid their respects to Mr. Kims father, who died of heart attack a week ago, and vowed their allegiance to his chosen successor.

title: Part of the Team
description: The Long Island RoughRiders play sled hockey, a sport developed for wheelchair athletes. This team includes players with intellectual as well as physical challenges. And they're good. Really good.

title: Joe Nocera Gets Mad
description: And its a beautiful thing to see.

title: Plenty of Disgrace and Distress in a Year of Sports Headlines
description: In a sports year unlike any other, success was too often soured by scandal or sadness, upset or injury, litigation or violence.

title: Exchange Rates and Wages
description: A followup to my post about modern Chicago economists forgetting what Milton Friedman knew: recent events have actually given us a dramatic demonstration of the reality of nominal wage stickiness. Heres a graph Ive shown before:

title: TimesCast | 2011: The Year in Media
description: December 23, 2011 - A look back at the growing intersection between social and mainstream media.

title: For Mets, Vast Debt and Not a Lot of Time
description: The finances of major professional sports teams exist largely as the secrets of privately held companies, except for the community-owned Green Bay Packers, who report their profits without a hint of resistance.

title: Fiscal Policy Works
description: Via Brad DeLong, theres a paper by David Romer (pdf) summarizing recent research on fiscal policy, inspired by the crisis and aftermath. And his conclusion is not at all what you hear on the talk shows; it is that there is now overwhelming evidence that fiscal policy does in fact work when its not offset by monetary policy. And since were now in a liquidity trap in which conventional monetary policy has no traction, thats the world were in.

title: New Rules for the Ways We Watch
description: For the last year, media pundits like me have been running around screaming our heads off about falling skies and collapsing paradigms, and yet as 2011 comes to an end, the sky is still there.

title: The Year in Media | A Conversation
description: The signs of social change were everywhere to see in 2011, and new-media tools were instrumental to that change, whether in Cairo or Lower Manhattans Zuccotti Park. But as Bruce Headlam, The Timess media editor, David Carr, and the Media Equation columnist, discussed this week in a video recap of the year, the business of media didnt change quite as quickly. But, theres always next year.

title: Beaten, and Beaten Up, the Packers Try to Cope
description: On NBC last Sunday night, Tony Dungy  who led the Indianapolis Colts to a victory in Super Bowl XLI  said that if he were the coach of the Green Bay Packers, Id be worried right now.

title: A Basketball League Where Steinbrenner and 3-Pointers Started
description: In 1961, the N.B.A. was a far cry from the corporate behemoth that finally opens play on Sunday after bickering for months over billions in revenue. The league was 15 years old but still trying to find its way in a landscape dominated by baseball, football, boxing and college sports. That season, the Philadelphia Warriors star Wilt Chamberlain scored 100 points against the Knicks in Hershey, Pa., in front of barely 4,000 people, with no television crew, not even reporters from The Philadelphia Inquirer or any New York newspapers.

title: For Miami Heat, High Hopes but Lower Volume
description: The official restart of the Miami Heat begins on Sunday with far less noise than a year ago, when a team constructed on superstar intrigue evoked breathless predictions and sputtering vitriol in equal measure.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: N.B.A. Should Honor Its History and Learn From It
description: After a long and avoidable delay, the N.B.A. finally opens its 2011-12 season Sunday. The new season brings two anniversaries worth noting. One you will probably hear quite a lot about: the 50th anniversary of the 1961-62 season. The other, the 35th anniversary of the Oscar Robertson Rule, maybe not so much.

title: Mapping Your Drive And the Odd Stops on It
description: Ever get to the end of a road trip and realize you were just a few miles away from the shoe of the worlds tallest man but you missed it? Maybe not, but On the Way, a new online travel site for road trippers, was designed to help find such unusual attractions. When you enter your start and destination, the program will populate a map of your route with restaurants, museums andless traditional tourist sites using programming interfaces like Google Places, Foursquare, Yelp and Lonely Planets Points of Interest. It can help you find a Starbucks between New York and Washington, but its better forlocal alternatives like Miss Shirleys Cafe in Baltimore.

title: Gingrich Ballot Failure Highlights Challenge to Campaign
description: Newt Gingrich had declared confidently the other day that he would get his name on the ballot for the Republican primary in Virginia. In fact, he said he already had the requisite 10,000 signatures plus an additional few thousand for safetys sake and would probably collect even more at events in Arlington and Richmond.

title: Capital Holiday
description: Many lawmakers have made their way home for the holidays, but that hasnt stopped the nations capital from putting on its seasonal best.

title: Playing on Sleds, With Just as Much Heart
description: When the Long Island RoughRiders play hockey, they use two sticks, wear no skates and keep their faces three feet from the ice.

title: Before Recruiting in Ivy League, Applying Some Math
description: The Ivy League, which is experiencing an athletic revival with several teams ranked nationally, is a doggedly atypical N.C.A.A. Division I sports conference. For starters, the eight members are virtual heretics in the landscape of American big-time college sports for fielding about 280 teams in 35 sports without athletic scholarships. The league also restricts activities like off-season practices, discourages weekday games and prohibits postseason play in football.

title: Pauls Influence Doesnt Just Depend on Him
description: Ron Paul is quite clearly capable of winning the Iowa caucuses. But if Mr. Paul wins Iowa, what happens next?

title: Deconstructing Santa
description: In Brent Clarks series Seasons Greetings, Dec. 25 is an excuse for over-the-top consumerism characterized by excessive decorating, sometimes whimsical, at other times verging on the surreal.

title: Variety: Puns and Anagrams
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  The Puns and Anagrams puzzles by Mel Taub are, to me at least, like a palate cleanser between dinner courses: They are a pleasant, refreshing break in between the Saturday brain-breaker and the big Sunday grid, and Im kind of fond of them, but Im glad they dont come up too often. I dont believe Id want to make an entire meal of them. As always, your mileage may vary.

title: Sydney to Hobart With a Teenager at the Helm
description: James Spithill was the first Australian helmsman in nearly 30 years to win the Americas Cup, at the helm of BMW Oracle Racing in 2010. He is perhaps the finest match racer in the world, a hard-driving competitor who is quick to embrace the risks that go with maneuvering one rich mans expensive toy at high speed within arms length of another rich mans expensive toy.

title: Gingrichs Ballot Miss Could Shake Voters Confidence
description: Newt Gingrich declared confidently the other day that he would get his name on the ballot for the Republican presidential primary in Virginia. In fact, he said he already had the requisite 10,000 signatures and an additional 2,000 to 3,000 for safetys sake and would probably collect even more.

title: Assad Trades Blame With Protesters for Bombings in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Thousands of people attended funerals in Damascus on Saturday for the victims of two powerful bombs that exploded outside government security buildings the day before, as human rights activists reported a large-scale assault on a restive city by government troops.

title: Pentagon Finds No Fault in Ties to TV Analysts
description: A Pentagon public relations program that sought to transform high-profile military analysts into surrogates and message force multipliers for the Bush administration complied with Defense Department regulations and directives, the Pentagons inspector general has concluded after a two-year investigation.

title: For the Parents, Simple Pleasures
description: Like a lot of dutiful adult sons and daughters, my friend Margaret braved the airport this week. She and her family are spending Christmas with her elderly parents in South Carolina.

title: Murder Cases Put Questionable Evidence to Test
description: Undigested bits of mushrooms and tomatoes from Christine Mortons last meal a celebratory birthday dinner she had with her husband  were still in her stomach when the medical examiner performed his autopsy in 1986.

title: The Unspeakable: A Canadiens Coach Not Knowing French
description: Of all the professional sports teams in North America, probably none have the political resonance of the Montreal Canadiens. Beyond their more than 100 years of tradition and their 24 Stanley Cups, the Canadiens are the standard-bearers of a people, a culture and a certain idea about Quebec. Anything involving le club de hockey Canadien can easily end up being about French and English.

title: A Quake-Scarred Nation Tries a Rural Road to Recovery
description: PAPAYE, Haiti  For months after the earthquake that struck the capital, Manel Laurore pulled shattered bodies from his neighbors homes, hunkered in fetid refugee camps and scrounged for food and water.

title: Getting a Helping Hand After Giving Back to the City
description: Sami Steigmann gave the Australians fair warning. He told them that he grew up in Transylvania.

title: Silent Night? Not With Us
description: PIVOTING from a life less loud into all the talk at my familys Christmas gathering is like stepping off a plane from the wintry north into the heat of the tropics. Im shocked for a second or two. Disoriented for several more. Then warmed and thrilled. Those are the feelings that last.

title: Leadership Lessons From the Shackleton Expedition
description: A HUNDRED years ago this month, the Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen and four teammates became the first men to reach the South Pole, arriving in triumph five weeks ahead of Robert Falcon Scott. The Amundsen crew would return safely to its base, but, heartbreakingly, Scott and his four British companions died on the return journey.

title: A Victorian Christmas
description: WASHINGTON

title: Neediest Cases | Where Are They Now?
description: Before receiving help from The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, Andrs Zambrano kept his love of literature and theater a secret.

title: A Boom for Bourbon
description: Sales of bourbon are rising rapidly, helped by premium small-batch and single-barrel products and flavor infusions like honey, cherry and spice.

title: Bourbons All-American Roar
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.

title: The Cratchit Tax Credit
description: AT Christmastime, we like to tell stories about resilient families. The Cratchits of A Christmas Carol, for instance, who subsist on love, hope and 15 shillings a week. The Baileys of Bedford Falls, who survive wars, bank runs and bankruptcies because they have friends, one another, and a guardian angel watching out for them. The first couple of the New Testament, who manage to cope with a supernatural pregnancy, a murderous king and the necessity of delivering a child in the bleak midwinter, half-out-of-doors and far from home.

title: Verizons Worrisome Cable Deals
description: AT&Ts decision to drop its bid for T-Mobile is a victory for the Justice Department and the Federal Communications Commission, which steadfastly opposed a deal that would have locked the wireless market into a duopoly and been bad for consumers. But the battle to defend competition in telecommunications is hardly over.

title: Deportation Without Representation
description: In deciding who may stay and who must leave this country, the deportation process for immigrants tolerates unfairness at every turn. Current laws have denied basic due process protections to people held in immigration detention. And now, a new report in the Cardozo Law Review reveals a severe shortage of competent legal assistance for tens of thousands facing deportation. The study examines cases in New York, but New York is hardly unique in this failing.

title: The Miracle and the Means
description: Some years it would be nice if there really were a Santa Claus. Imagine it. No lists, no shopping, no gift-wrapping, no bills, no shipping costs, an extremely low carbon footprint  and on Christmas morning the miraculous appearance of presents that find just the right balance between desire and a sort of disciplinary justice.

title: Injustice in Murder Cases
description: In most American counties, some indigent criminal defendants are represented by a public defender, and others by a private court-appointed lawyer. A new RAND study focusing on Philadelphia exposes a vast difference in how clients fare depending on the kind of lawyer they are assigned.

title: When Regime Change Came With a Whimper
description: On the evening of Christmas Day 20 years ago, my wife and kids went to Moscows Red Square to round out a day of holiday cheer. I had to stay in The Timess office because Mikhail Gorbachev had resigned that morning and was making a televised address in the evening.

title: Foreclosure Relief? Dont Hold Your Breath
description: THROUGHOUT the foreclosure crisis, Washington has done little to help people hang on to their homes. All those programs that were supposed to help  HAMP, HARP, Hope for Homeowners  have mostly failed.

title: Every Team Should Have a Devils Advocate
description: This interview with  Ori Hadomi, C.E.O. of   Mazor Robotics, a medical technology company based in Israel, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: No Progress on H.G.H. Testing
description: The stalemate on human growth hormone testing in the N.F.L. is no closer to being resolved after a proposal by the players union to the league, and a Congressional committee involved in the issue, that would not include testing during the regular season.

title: France Tlcom in Deal to Sell Swiss Mobile-Phone Unit
description: France Tlcom agreed to sell its Orange Switzerland mobile-phone unit to the London buyout firm Apax Partners for 1.6 billion euros, or $2.1 billion, the first major step in the chief executives plan to unload slow-growing European operations.

title: Capital Holiday
description: Many lawmakers have made their way home for the holidays, but that hasnt stopped the nations capital from putting on its seasonal best. More Photos

title: Letters: A.B.A. Standards and Law Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Which Teams Will Have the Stamina for a 66-Game Sprint?
description: One crucial aspect of the lockout-shortened 2011-12 N.B.A. season will be the hectic 66-game pace. Which teams will have the legs to keep up, and which teams will be worn out?

title: Letters: A Students View on E-Textbooks
description: To the Editor:

title: Dont Forget Wingnut Welfare
description: Steve Benen asks why Congressional Republicans were willing to pursue what looked like a suicidal political strategy in the payroll tax fight. But he somehow fails to mention an important factor: reliable conservatives are assured of a safe landing even if they are defeated.

title: If These Moms Cant Find It, They Invent It
description: EIGHT years ago, Tamara Monosoff came up with an invention that she was sure mothers like herself would appreciate: a device that prevents children from unspooling toilet paper from the roll. But she had no idea how to transform the concept into a marketable product.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Reading Books in the Digital Age
description: Readers discuss the choices to be made in the digital age: buy books online or at the local bookstore? Read e-books or paper books?

title: Providing Sustenance in Detroit
description: At Focus:HOPE, a nonprofit has been providing food to the poor for more than four decades.

title: Publishers vs. Libraries: An E-Book Tug of War
description: LAST year, Christmas was the biggest single day for e-book sales by HarperCollins. And indications are that this years Christmas Day total will be even higher, given the extremely strong sales of e-readers like the Kindle and the Nook. Amazon announced on Dec. 15 that it had sold one million of its Kindles in each of the three previous weeks.

title: At Detroit Food Bank, Founders Are Gone, but a Mission Endures
description: DETROIT

title: From the Fed, a Shield Against Europe
description: AS the euro zone mess unfolds, another financial crisis may be coming our way. The conduit could be some spillover effect from across the Atlantic  whether in derivatives or money markets  or maybe some under-the-radar surprise.

title: A Flurry of Changes
description: Nine of these 10 teams made major attempts to reshape their rosters.

title: Menu Misnomers, and Other Grousings
description: FOR the second consecutive year the Haggler steps aside and cedes the podium to the comedian, storyteller, author and ranter extraordinaire, Adam Carolla. If youre not listening to his podcast, The Adam Carolla Show, youre missing out on some peerless, portable entertainment  and the chance to hear a truly original mind complain, muse and theorize for a couple of hours a week.

title: The Finds of the Lost Decade
description: WITH only a week left in 2011, the Standard & Poors 500-stock index has a dubious distinction: its performance has been far worse than that of a basic basket of bonds in the last 12 years. But while betting on a large-cap stock index may not have paid off over that time, it would be wrong to assume that this has been the case for all sectors of the market.

title: First a Prosecutor, Now a Defense Lawyer
description: I DONT know many people whove had one job their whole life. Today, most people change jobs more than once, and usually several times. Maybe they stay in their field, or perhaps they enter a related one. More rarely, they might do something totally different.

title: Forces Loyal to Yemeni President Fire on Protesters
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Government soldiers opened fire on a giant demonstration in Yemens capital on Saturday, killing at least nine protesters in the worst violence since President Ali Abdullah Saleh agreed to give up his post more than a month ago.

title: A New Side of Science
description: MY grandparents emigrated from Japan to California for a better life. My mother was 10 when the Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor, and she and her family were sent to an internment camp. We have a photo of the notice that was posted on a utility pole in their neighborhood, instructing people where to report.

title: The Dear Leader Is Dead, Again
description: Chicago

title: The Caucus Click: The Week in Pictures
description: Photographs from Iowa, New Hampshire and Virginia

title: Protesters Gather in Moscow
description: Tens of thousands gathered on Saturday for the second huge antigovernment demonstration in a month.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Dec. 25
description: The Sunday talk shows will revisit some of the biggest political stories of the year and weigh in on what could come back to haunt  or help  some candidates in 2012.

title: Singing the Gospel, in Harlem Churches
description: Edgar Kendricks has been a staple in Harlem gospel circles for more than 40 years, and still cuts a flashy figure on the street, with his unique wardrobe.

title: Mental Health Centers Are Hit Hard by Cuts
description: Some of Chicagos most vulnerable citizens  those who depend on public financing for mental health services  face a new year that maybring less of something they deeply need: help.

title: Ripple Effects of Center Closings Will Continue for Many Years
description: James Warren writes a column for The Chicago News Cooperative.

title: Stating Their Case and Silencing Jets
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Giants were disgusted to arrive at MetLife Stadium on Saturday morning and see the four Super Bowl logos outside their locker room concealed by black curtains. When their kicker, Lawrence Tynes, pulled back the curtains, someone with the Jets came by to yank them over again.

title: Italy Tries Raising the Social Stigma on Tax Evaders
description: ROME  On a recent morning, Maurizio Compagnone, an employee of Italys internal revenue service, stood before a classroom of middle school students in a leafy neighborhood here, preaching the virtues of paying taxes.

title: The Haves Children Are Healthier Than the Have-Nots
description: Every Monday, Sycamore Valley Elementary in Danville challenges its students to run a Smile Mile together after school. Some parents even run with their children. Photos of the student joggers grinning faces are posted in the cafeteria. On a recent Monday afternoon, there were 41 smiling faces on the wall.

title: Trump Quits G.O.P.
description: Donald J. Trump has withdrawn from the Republican Party to retain the ability to run as an independent candidate in the 2012 presidential election, his political adviser confirmed on Friday.

title: Royalists Step Up Campaign to Stifle Criticism of the Monarchy in Thailand
description: BANGKOK  At the entrance to a neighborhood in Bangkoks garment district, an unambiguous message hangs on an archway decorated with an image of Thailands king.

title: Video of Protests in Russia
description: Updated | Sunday | 2:10 p.m. As my colleagues Ellen Barry and Michael Schwirtz report, tens of thousands of Russians filled a street named for the Soviet dissident Andrei Sakharov on Saturday, demanding fair elections.

title: At Harvard, a Masters in Problem Solving
description: A few years after Mitt Romney graduated from Harvard Business School, he returned to share a simple, timeworn lesson in an unusual way.

title: Wolfgang Oehme, a Free-Form Landscape Architect, Dies at 81
description: Wolfgang Oehme, a landscape architect who drew from a palette of feathery grasses and black-eyed Susans to create what he called horticultural explosions, free-form landscapes that some called exemplars of the new American garden, died on Dec. 15 at his home in Towson, Md. He was 81.

title: Playoff Picture Clear for  Giants, Complex for Jets
description: After a victory over the Jets on Saturday, the Giants have a path to the playoffs that is easy to understand. If they beat the Cowboys next Sunday, theyll win the N.F.C. East and theyre in. If they lose, the Cowboys are in and the Giants are out. (The Eagles were knocked out by the Giants victory.)

title: Notes From Mitt Romneys 1978 Presentation
description: Clayton Christensens notes from a 1978 presentation given by Mitt Romney to a Mormon student group at the Harvard Business School.

title: Robert Easton, Hollywoods Henry Higgins, Dies at 81
description: Robert Easton, a character actor turned accent coach to the stars, who transformed Drew Barrymore into Amy Fisher, Ben Kingsley into Meyer Lansky and Gregory Peck first into Josef Mengele and later into Abraham Lincoln, among other feats of articulatory alchemy, died on Dec. 16 at his home in Los Angeles. He was 81.

title: Paul-Emile Deiber, Actor Who Became an Opera Director, Dies at 86
description: Paul-Emile Deiber, an actor and director with the Comdie-Franaise for nearly three decades who brought his dramatic expertise to a second career as an opera director, died on Dec. 14. He was 86.

title: Sunday: Aint He Sweet?
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  The tree has been decorated, the presents have been opened, the eggs have been nogged, and the wassails have been, well  wassailed. To those who celebrate, I hope you had a very happy Christmas.

title: Life and Death in a Baghdad E.R.
description: BAGHDAD  I did really want to cry, but the tears wouldnt come down.

title: Pupi Campo, Cuban Bandleader and the Rumba Maestro, Dies at 91
description: Pupi Campo, a Cuban bandleader who brought rippling syncopation to Jack Paars Morning Show on CBS television in the early 1950s and to his long career in nightclubs around the country, died on Dec. 12 at a hospice in Las Vegas. He was 91.

title: Image Tarnished by Scandals, Washington Council Overhauls Ethics Rules
description: WASHINGTON  It was a sunny Friday morning when federal agents in bulletproof vests and F.B.I. windbreakers pulled up to the brick home on a quiet cul-de-sac. As spectators watched from across yellow police tape, the agents loaded an S.U.V. and a motorcycle emblazoned with decals onto a flatbed truck and took them away.

title: Many Rules Surround Beekeeping in the Bay
description: When Round Rock Honey decided to expand its Beekeeping Academy beyond Texas, its first stop was San Mateo County. Through Groupon, the company signed up nearly 1,000 new students in just a few days.

title: Manicures and Compassion for Throwaway People in the Tenderloin
description: Scott James writes a column for The Bay Citizen.

title: Brewster/ Rutledge Garden
description: The east slope of Bernal Hill, which was settled in the 1860s by Irish farmers and dairy ranchers, has stayed true to its roots and now has an abundance of community gardens utilizing the steep hillsides, including this 8,750-square-foot spot. There are 35 city-owned community gardens in San Francisco, overseen by the Parks and Recreation Department and run by volunteers.  LOUISE RAFKIN

title: Escape to Hawaii, After a Tricky Week in Washington
description: KAILUA, Hawaii  For President Obama, simply going on vacation these days seems to demand the theatrics of a Houdini-like escape from the padlocked box of Washington.

title: State Still Footing the Bill for Perry Security Detail
description: Gov. Rick Perry was near the height of his popularity when he barnstormed California in September to raise money for his presidential bid and to participate in his first nationally televised debate.

title: U.S. Embraces a Low-Key Response to Turmoil in Iraq
description: WASHINGTON  As Iraq erupted in recent days, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. was in constant phone contact with the leaders of the countrys dueling sects. He called the Shiite prime minister and the Sunni speaker of the Parliament on Tuesday, and the Kurdish leader on Thursday, urging them to try to resolve the political crisis.

title: In the Battle of the Maps, Republicans Win Either Way
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: Florida Looks for Curbs on Some Legless Invaders
description: MIAMI  To live in South Florida is to make peace with flying cockroach behemoths, brigades of lizards that dart across walls (bedroom and otherwise) and frogs the size of cannonballs that loiter on driveways.

title: Female Patrons of State Arts Share Inspirations
description: A lot of female patrons have worked to establish the arts and culture scene in Texas, from Ima Hogg, whose influence was widely felt in the Houston art community, to Velma Fuller Kimbell, who endowed a remarkable portion of her fortune to building Fort Worths Kimbell Art Museum. Six women, all part of the giving program Texas Women for the Arts, continue the tradition. Here they share their early arts inspirations and the museums, collections and venues that travelers should not miss.

title: The Neediest Cases | Sami Steigmann
description: Sami Steigmann, 72, survived a Nazi camp in Ukraine and volunteers as a way of giving back to a city that has helped him.

title: Flop and Then Flip for a Touchdown for Jerome Simpson
description: Jerome Simpsons amazing flip for a touchdown  he somersaulted over an Arizona Cardinal at the goal line and stuck the landing in the end zone  is one of the most dazzling touchdowns in N.F.L. history.

title: Nice View, and the Profits Surpass All Horizons
description: The owners of the Empire State Building like to promote it as the most famous office building in the world.

title: Harsh Political Reality Slows Climate Studies Despite Extreme Year
description: At the end of one of the most bizarre weather years in American history, climate research stands at a crossroads.

title: Coughlin Walks the Walk, Albeit With a Limp
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.

title: Ruling by Justice Dept. Opens a Door on Online Gambling
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department has reversed its long-held opposition to many forms of Internet gambling, removing a big legal obstacle for states that want to sanction online gambling to help fix their budget deficits.

title: Romo Goes Down, and Cowboys Fall
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  His right hand wrapped in a bandage, the Dallas Cowboys quarterback Tony Romo stood on the sideline looking like a prizefighter who had thrown his last punch. Romos throwing hand had crashed into a Philadelphia Eagles helmet shortly after the Giants had beaten the Jets, which actually rendered Saturdays result here meaningless.

title: A Look at Whos on Top as the Season Wraps Up
description: Think of how many dollhouse and train sets were botched in the assembly process by exhausted, irate football players Saturday night. Here is what happened in Saturdays games and what it means for the regular seasons final week.

title: Life on the Tournament Circuit Is Often Off the Beaten Track
description: Traveling is part of the life of a chess player. Sometimes the destination is glamorous  London or Gibraltar  but elite tournaments are often held in out-of-the-way places that do not top many tourist lists.

title: N.F.L. Replay: Week 16
description: A look at games across the league from the penultimate week of the regular season.

title: Jets-Giants Replay: Week 16
description: A look at the Giants 29-14 victory against the Jets.

title: Coughlin Jokes About Injury, and Refuses to Gloat
description: After a week of trash talk from Jets Coach Rex Ryan, Tom Coughlin refused all opportunities to gloat following the Giants victory on Saturday. He said of his sideline injury, I will end up on NFL Films forever. Here are excerpts from his postgame news conference. The full transcript is at Giants.com.

title: Mark Sanchez, Meet Jason Pierre-Paul
description: A capsule look at the Giants 29-14 victory over the Jets:

title: Lottery Numbers
Knicks Make Final Preparations for N.B.A. Opener
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Roughly 24 hours before tipping off the N.B.A. season at Madison Square Garden, the Knicks conducted one final practice Saturday and took stock of the team that they hope will compete for a championship.

title: Dispiriting Showing by Jets Sanchez
description: A capsule look at the Jets 29-14 loss to the Giants:

title: Corrections: December 25
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Metro Pucks Weekly: Holiday Break Grades and Analysis
description: As the metropolitan areas three N.H.L. teams take a three-day holiday break, our weekly recap and analysis runs earlier than usual.

title: Violet Captured for Treatment in Washington Square Park
description: Violet, the red-tailed hawk who has been suffering from a crippling leg injury, was captured for treatment on Saturday in Washington Square Park.

title: Giants Are Far From Perfect, but Defense Makes Them Good Enough
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Giants players have talked all season about wanting a complete game. They have vowed, over and over, that they will deliver a total team effort. They have stressed  even this week, amid the verbal flotsam and jetsam of a Giants-Jets rivalry game  that there is no other way for them to play.

title: After Week of Taunts, Final Word Is Anything but Friendly
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  After a week of breathless banter and rehashed rhetoric, the back and forth between the Giants and the Jets  which by Friday seemed to border on the nonsensical  ultimately reached a nasty conclusion.

title: Sundays Matchup: Bears at Packers
description: Bears (7-7) at Packers (13-1) 8:20 p.m., Eastern; NBCLine: Packers by 13 Packers right tackle Bryan Bulaga (knee) is out. Left tackle Chad Clifton (back) is easing his way back after missing two months; he has been limited in practice and is unlikely to play. The primary backup tackle, Derek Sherrod, is out for the season with a broken leg. Green Bays injury situation became so dire in its loss to the Chiefs that T.J. Lang took snaps at right tackle, a position he had never played, even in practice. Its next guy up, Coach Mike McCarthy said of the injuries, which is all well and good, except that the next guy might be Jerry Kramer. Health problems on the line can easily become health problems for Aaron Rodgers, but the Bears have played so badly in the wake of the Jay Cutler-Matt Forte injuries that the Packers could put a cardboard Rodgers cutout in the pocket and it would make little difference.

title: Andrei Cimpian and Joseph Robinson
description: Andrei Cimpian and Joseph Paul Robinson were married Friday in Auburn, N.Y. Florence M. Riley, a town justice of Sennett, N.Y., officiated at the home of Carmela Spoto, Dr. Robinsons maternal grandmother.

title: Molly Gomolin and David Katz
description: Molly Elyssa Gomolin and David Benjamin Katz were married by Rabbi Kenneth N. Hain Thursday at Carlyle on the Green in Bethpage, N.Y., with Rabbi Elie Weissman taking part.

title: Alison Christie and Joseph Roby IV
description: Alison D. Christie and Joseph Roby IV were married Wednesday evening in an outdoor ceremony at the Gulf Stream Golf Club in Gulf Stream, Fla. David C. Tassell, a Florida notary public and a friend of the brides parents, officiated.

title: Eagles  Look Dangerous, but Its Too Late
description: Im happy for Jason Garrett for having an opportunity to possibly take his football team to the playoffs. And Tom Coughlin. I wish we were there. Andy Reid, Eagles coach, after his team was knocked out of the playoffs.

title: Rome for the Holidays
description: The traditional inauguration of the Christmas season got underway early this month in Rome, but travelers can visit vestiges of those early celebrations, and still take in a few more ceremonies, after the gifts have been opened.

title: Pulling Back Curtain on Ugliness of Giants-Jets
description: They got a big-mouthed coach, a big mouth and a big-bellied coach that talks too much and now its finally time to shut up. Brandon Jacobs, on Rex Ryan.

title: Suicide Bomber Strikes Funeral in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber attacked a funeral in northern Afghanistan on Sunday, killing at least 20 people, officials said, in what appeared to be the Talibans latest strike against Afghans who have ties to the national government.

title: We Like Sheep
Nigerian Group Escalates Violence With Church Attacks
