description: MUSCATINE, Iowa  Mitt Romney drew a standing-room-only crowd, with a line winding out the door, as the sun was still rising outside Ellys Tea and Coffee House here Wednesday morning.

title: A Day With the Bridges
description: The exercise routines and diets of Janice and Adam Bridges, who have lost about 165 and 110 pounds and struggle daily to keep the weight off.

title: One More What-if for Jets Fans
description: The beleaguered, blustery coach of the Jets takes the podium for his midweek news conference, his team coming off a critical loss and facing depressingly long playoff odds of their own making. He faces down the skeptical news media, a glint of defiance in his eyes, firm resolve in his lower jaw, bear claw and stale coffee on his breath. He did not give the following speech, but the world would be a lot more fun if he had:

title: Photographers Without Borders
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Donna Hanover to Make Broadway Debut in Gore Vidals The Best Man
description: As first lady of New York City during much of the 1990s, Donna Hanover  the former Mrs. Rudolph W. Giuliani  surely developed an opinion or two about the ferocity of the City Hall press corps. This spring, in an instance of art imitating life, shell have a chance to show what she thinks of the Fourth Estate when she makes her Broadway debut playing a presidential campaign reporter in the revival of Gore Vidals The Best Man, the producers announced on Wednesday.

title: Pilot Got Permission to Fly Higher Just Before I-287 Crash
description: Updated 4:36 p.m. | Minutes before a single-engine plane crashed onto Interstate 287 in northern New Jersey last week, its pilot radioed air-traffic control to say that he was in icing conditions and requested clearance to climb higher, according to a preliminary report from the National Transportation Safety Board.

title: More Views on Climate Risk and Arctic Methane
description: In trying to clarify whats known, unknown and learnable about the possible contribution to global warming from vast methane deposits beneath Arctic seas, I reached out to a host of scientists working on this question. I also received a lot of reader input, as you can see from the comment threads in the string of posts on this important issue. Heres a roundup of some additional views from the scientific community and one filmmaker focused on question:

title: Apropos Appropriation
description: A key to the photo collage:

title: Leaving Animals Out of the Cosmetics Picture
description: THE actress Kristin Bauer, of True Blood fame, has an annual ritual when she visits her family home in Racine, Wis.: She takes a black marker and scribbles on the sides of specific products and cosmetics, Tested on animals.

title: 5 Businesses That Failed to Survive Trials of 2011
description: It has been another tough year for many small businesses. One in four, according to the National Federation of Independent Business, believes the biggest problem is weak sales. No matter what other challenges they face, said William Dunkelberg, the federations chief economist, the key to everything is cash coming in the front door.

title: TimesCast | December 28, 2011
description: Mark Mazzetti on the death of Osama bin Laden and the impact on diplomacy with Pakistan | Ken Belson on Japan's nuclear disaster.

title: Coming to Detroit Auto Show, a New Model That Mows Lawns
description: Features of the new CTX, to be introduced at the North American International Auto Show in Detroit next month, includes automatic traction control, electronic fuel management, cruise control and a console with cupholders. But its not a car or a truck: its a lawn tractor.

title: At Funeral of Kim Jong-il, U.S.-Made Limos Stand Out
description: Kim Jong-il hated the United States. But an American carried him to the grave.

title: Viacom Told to Pay $383 Million Over Rock Band Video Game
description: Viacom is disputing a decision by court-appointed arbitrators that it pay $383 million to the former shareholders of Harmonix Music Systems, the video game studio behind Rock Band and Guitar Hero.

title: Scheduling Partnership Links Pac-12 and Big Ten
description: In a time of instability and uncertainty on the college sports landscape, the Pacific-12 and the Big Ten announced an innovative scheduling agreement Wednesday that links the two conferences and shows they have no imminent plans for change.

title: Feoktistovs Journal: Christmas, and a Game, in Vermont
description: We spent Christmas Day in Burlington, Vt. There wasnt much to do, of course, as mostly everything was closed. We had another intense two-hour practice on Christmas, preparing for the tougher part of our journey beginning this week with games against three Division I college teams  the University of Vermont on Tuesday, Yale on Wednesday and Northern Michigan on Friday.

title: Tracking Belgian Weapons in Libya
description: Watching the disintegration of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis military and government was in some ways like watching an arms show featuring more than a half-century of conventional weapons. During his decades in power, the Libyan leader and his generals amassed a vast store of weapons, stockpiling them across the desert nation in depots that, as Colonel Qaddafi lost his hold on power, changed hands. All manner of weapons were paraded out. (The colonels militias and military units, while they lasted, held on to much of the choice stock.)

title: Lanterns Show an Industrys Potential
description: KHADODA, India  In sunny India, the ideal would be to harness solar power for both the nations utility grid and for the rooftops of homes, businesses and factories.

title: The Times E-Mails Millions by Mistake to Say Subscriptions Were Canceled
description: 7:02 p.m. | Updated The New York Times mistakenly sent an e-mail on Wednesday to more than eight million people who had shared their information with the company, erroneously informing them that they had canceled home delivery of the newspaper.

title: In Solar Power, India Begins Living Up to Its Own Ambitions
description: KHADODA, India  Solar power is a clean energy source. But in this arid part of northwest India it can also be a dusty one.

title: Magic Owner Breathes New Life Into Dwight Howard Rumor Mill
description: Dwight Howards time in Orlando is fleeting. Although Otis Smith, the Magics general manager, has stressed that theres no urgency to deal Howard, the best big man in the game, its only a matter of time before Howard lands on some other teams roster to cement that teams future and delight its fans. Smith and the Magic will be left to pick up the pieces and reshape a franchise otherwise lacking in elite talent.

title: Yankees Give Former Red Sox Reliever a Shot
description: Hideki Okajima joined the Boston Red Sox in 2007, the same year a far better known Japanese pitcher named Daisuke Matsuzaka became a member of the team. Matsuzaka was 15-12 that season and helped the Red Sox capture a World Series title, but Okajima was a significant contributor, too.

title: Noise Level Rises Over Iran Threat to Close Strait of Hormuz
description: Iran and the United States elevated the belligerent tone between them on Wednesday over an Iranian vow to close the Strait of Hormuz, a vital Middle East waterway for oil tanker traffic, if Western powers attempted to make good on their threat to stifle Irans petroleum exports.

title: Photo Replay: Dec.28
description: A view of the day in sports included muddy cyclists, shadowy skiers and a controversial finish in the Sydney to Hobart yacht race.

title: Agency Smackdown, Round 2: A Critique of  the Nuclear Party
description: The chairman of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, whose four fellow commissioners complained about him to the White House, saying that he had been withholding information from them and wielding too much power, drew a spirited defense on Wednesday from a predecessor at the agency.

title: Latinos Support Obama, Despite Deportation Policies
description: Although Latinos strongly disapprove of President Obamas immigration policies, which have brought high numbers of deportations, they would favor him by wide margins over a Republican candidate in the presidential race, according to a poll released on Wednesday by the Pew Hispanic Center, a nonpartisan research group in Washington.

title: What to Expect in White-Collar Crimes in 2012
description: The career of Robert G. Morvillo, the dean of the white-collar defense bar who died Saturday, highlights how white-collar crime has risen to prominence. His obituary in The New York Times pointed out that in 1973, when he founded a law firm specializing in the defense of executives and corporations in criminal cases, large New York firms shunned the practice because it was considered dclass.

title: 2011: The Death of Osama bin Laden
description: Mark Mazzetti assesses the death of Osama bin Laden and the repercussions for Americas relationship with Pakistan.

title: 2011: Japan's Nuclear Disaster
description: Ken Belson takes a look at Japans failure to contain the Fukushima plant after the Tsunami.

title: Ex-New Mexico Governor Seeks Libertarian Nod
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  Former Gov. Gary Johnson announced Wednesday that he was dropping his bid to become the Republican candidate for president and had decided instead to seek the Libertarian Partys nomination.

title: Same Old Songs Atop Billboard Chart
description: For the obsessives who keep close watch on the music charts, this time of year can be repetitive. Driven by holiday shopping, the same few hits tend to dominate week after week.

title: Crosbys Absence Causing New Concerns
description: Sidney Crosby, the Pittsburgh Penguins star captain, is a stealth presence these days. He is not on the ice at games or practices, and remains quite silent in the news media about what is going on with him. He sustained a concussion from two hard hits over a two-game span at the start of 2011 and was sidelined for nearly 11 months.

title: Occupy in Iowa Vows to Respect States Influential Role
description: DES MOINES  For the people who say they speak for Iowas 99 percent, protecting their states status as a political power broker is paramount.

title: Oysters Rockefeller
description: Melissa Clark demonstrates how to broil oysters with a rich, herbal sauce.

title: Video: How to Make Oysters Rockefeller
description: In this video, I demonstrate how to broil oysters with a rich, herbal Rockefeller sauce. Below is the recipe. If you dont feel like shucking your own oysters but still want all the good, sweet flavors of shellfish swathed in garlic-caper-watercress butter, you can take a shortcut and make what I like to call Cheaters Oysters Rockefeller.

title: Italys Lower Rates Ease Borrowing but Not Governing
description: ROME  Financial market pressure on Italy eased temporarily on Wednesday, with borrowing rates on some government-issued debt dropping by half. But the political pressure on the government of Prime Minister Mario Monti remained high  and was rising.

title: A Look Unanchored to the Past
description: IT takes a lot of moxie to hold your own on the air against a scarlet ibis, but Ann Curry has done just that, entertaining an extravagantly feathered guest earlier this year on the Today show, her own emerald dress a foil for its plumage.

title: Commercial Introduces Gay Marriage as an Issue in the Iowa Caucuses
description: DES MOINES The National Organization for Marriage, a leading social conservative group that is opposed to giving same-sex couples the right to marry, is striking out at Representative Ron Paul with a new television advertisement, a move intended to blunt the Texas congressmans rise in the polls a few days before the Iowa caucuses.

title: Award Time for Ideas That Shine
description: Yes, its the end of the year, and you know what that means: plucking shredded gift wrap off the rug, making New Years resolutions and learning to stop writing 2011 on personal checks.

title: Paul Questions the U.S. Military Presence on Korean Peninsula
description: NEWTON, Iowa  Ron Paul on Wednesday questioned the United States long military presence on the Korean Peninsula even as the death of the North Korean leader Kim Jong-il raised concerns about the regions stability.

title: The Best Parties of 2011
description: The most memorable parties and events of 2011 featured in Scene City.

title: Yankees Were Aware Rodriguez Sought Medical Treatment in Germany
description: When Alex Rodriguez informed the Yankees last month that he was interested in traveling to Germany to pursue a fairly new medical procedure, they were understandably concerned.

title: Political Promotions in Russia Appear to Belie Presidents Promise of Reform
description: MOSCOW  President Dmitri A. Medvedev has responded to the street protests in Moscow with proposals for political reform, but his recent personnel appointments seem to tell a different story: top posts went to former officers in the K.G.B. and long-serving loyalists of his political mentor, Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Problems of Reading Comprehension
description: Oy. David Adolfatto seems so determined to take a swipe at me that he cant actually read straight.

title: Women Shop, Men Stockpile
description: Stylish New Yorkers reflect on their wardrobe hoarding.

title: Hollywood Copyright Dispute Still Flaring
description: LOS ANGELES  Anyone who thought the nasty legal fight between the Penske Media Corporation, owner of the Deadline.com Web site, and Prometheus Global Media, owner of The Hollywood Reporter, wouldnt get nastier just wasnt thinking.

title: U.S. Pulls Public Relations Advisers From an Afghan Government Media Center
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Until this week, a little-noticed part of the United States war effort here included teaching Afghan officials the art of public relations  mainly, how to give news conferences  at an American-financed government information center.

title: More On The Burden Of Debt
description: I suspect that I may have been too cryptic in my post on the real burden of debt. So let me give you a thought experiment that may help clarify matters.

title: A Romantic Journey Through a Vanished Land
description: Maps are supposed to clarify, but the map of East Prussia at the start of Max Egremonts Forgotten Land: Journeys Among the Ghosts of East Prussia is a muddling haze, with place names in German, Russian, Polish and Lithuanian and boundary lines that resemble a palimpsest.

title: Care for Violet, New Friend for an Old Mate
description: Violet the red-tailed hawk is safe, but she is not likely to return to Washington Square Park, said Robert Horvath, a raptor rehabilitator with Wildlife in Need of Rescue and Rehabilitation, the nonprofit organization that is caring for the bird.

title: 2011s Top 10 Apps for Android Phones
description: In 2010, Android apps were rarely in the same league as their Apple counterparts, so beyond the entrants in last years Top 10 list, there was a steep drop-off in quality.

title: President Obama and Hillary Clinton Top the List of Most Admired
description: Four years ago, Barack Obama and Hillary Rodham Clinton were battling each other for the Democratic presidential nomination. Now, Mrs. Clinton is President Obamas secretary of state, and together they top the lists as the Gallup polls most admired woman and most admired man of 2011.

title: Networks on Cruise Control With Post-Holiday Repeats
description: It was another low-key post-holiday night for television on Tuesday as the broadcast networks filled the schedule with more repeats. CBS was the No. 1 network over all in viewers and tied Univision for the top spot in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic.

title: Montefiore Nurses May Strike on Jan. 10
description: In an unexpected move, nurses at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx said Wednesday that they would strike on Jan. 10 if they could not resolve issues involving staffing levels and salaries.

title: Cable Channels Set to Begin Election Year Coverage
description: 5:17 p.m. | Updated Americas trifecta of cable news channels, Fox News, MSNBC and CNN, are just about ready to show off their election year staffs.

title: Early-Adopter Pilots Drive Volts and Leafs
description: The first person to take delivery of a Chevrolet Volt was Jeff Kaffee, a retired airline pilot. Mr. Kaffee was only first in line. A number of other current or former pilots are owners of either the Volt or the Nissan Leaf.

title: Rick Perry's Stump Speech
description: Dec. 27, 2011 - A sample of Rick Perry's final pitch to Iowa voters before the Jan. 3 caucus.

title: Do You Know a Small Business That Failed This Year?
description: Even in good times, the survival rate for small businesses is discouraging  about half fail within five years, according to the Small Business Administration. Unfortunately, 2011 was another tough year. Weve just published an article by Eileen Zimmerman about five businesses that didnt make it. Behind every failed business, theres a story.

title: For Guys, a Great Find Is Often Multiplied
description: WOMEN shop, men stockpile. Thats one theory, anyway, of how men buy clothes differently from women. If women see shopping as an opportunity, a social or even therapeutic activity, the thinking goes, then men see it as a necessary evil, a moment to restock the supply closet.

title: Leaders of New Play Institute Move From Arena Stage to Emerson College
description: In a boost to Emerson Colleges ambitions to be a force in theater, the two leaders of the American Voices New Play Institute  an influential national player in conversations and research about playwriting  will move next year from Arena Stage in Washington to become part of ArtsEmerson, the Boston colleges two-year-old theater programming arm.

title: Ruggiero, Womens Hockey Pioneer, Retires
description: Angela Ruggiero, a four-time Olympian who played more games in a Team USA sweater than any other hockey player, announced her retirement from the United States Womens National Team Program on Wednesday.

title: The Cat Walk
description: Jackson Galaxy, a cat behaviorist and television personality, teaches The Timess Stephanie Clifford how to walk her cat on a leash.

title: Gingrich Ribs Romney at Iowa Chocolate Factory
description: ALGONA, Iowa  Sometimes the gods of campaign scheduling smile on you.

title: Perry Further Refines Position on Abortion
description: INDIANOLA, Iowa  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas on Wednesday clarified his evolving position on abortion rights, saying that while he now favored a ban on abortions in cases of rape and incest, he still supported an exception in cases where a womans life would be at risk.

title: Ready to Address the Hangover
description: AFTER a night of hard partying in Manhattan to celebrate his impending fatherhood, Alex Fleyshmakher woke up the next day with a roaring hangover.

title: RokkCity
description: WHEN Culture Club, the 1980s-themed bachelorette haunt, relocated to Midtown, fans might have expected lots of Debbie Gibson and early Madonna. But Red Hot Chili Peppers and techno? Those are the sounds coming from RokkCity, a separate rock n roll-themed lounge that opened this month underneath the 80s behemoth, in a bid for a younger crowd.

title: Observers Confronted With Anger, Gunshots and a Dead Child in Syria
description: Updated | 8:26 p.m. On its second day of work in the Syrian city of Homs, a team of observers from the Arab League dodged bullets and was confronted by angry residents, who displayed the dead body of a child they said had been killed by government forces.

title: Quail Hybridization in Mexico
description: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near lamos, Mexico, where she is studying Callipepla quail in collaboration with Jennifer Calkins.

title: A Stone Farmhouse With Cottages in the Welsh Countryside
description: Formal gardens with a pagoda and a gazebo, and private fishing rights along a stretch of the River Dee.

title: House Hunting in ... North Wales
description: A RESTORED FARMHOUSE AND FIVE HOLIDAY COTTAGES IN NORTH WALES

title: New Iowa Poll May Understate Pauls Support
description: Im not always a big fan of dissecting individual polls  mostly because there are liable to be a plethora of them in Iowa and New Hampshire over the next several days and their errors will tend to be mitigated as more are added to the average.

title: The 75 Things New Yorkers Talked About in 2011
description: IT was a year in which the words till death do us part took on new, life-changing meaning for thousands of gay New Yorkers and significantly less for one overexposed Kardashian.

title: Pictures of the Day: North Korea and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from North Korea, the West Bank, India and Iowa.

title: App Smart Extra: Top 10 New iPhone Gaming Apps for 2011
description: I love video games as much as the next guy, as long as the next guy doesnt spend hours a day grinding through the upper levels of Call of Duty or the latest Super Mario creation. So for casual mobile gamers, as promised in this weeks App Smart column, heres a list of my top 10 new iPhone gaming apps for 2011.

title: Mayor Says Crime Is Down in 2011, With an Asterisk
description: With only a few days left in the year, major crime in New York City has risen in 2011  up less than 1 percent from the previous year, but up nonetheless, according to the latest Police Department data.

title: Homes for $379,000
description: A two-bedroom condo in Louisville, K.Y., a four-bedroom house in Milwaukee, and a three-bedroom contemporary house in Portland, Ore.

title: What You Get for ... $379,000
description: LOUISVILLE, KY.

title: A Clearance on American Icons
description: GIVE me some sugar, Santamaria Liriano said last Friday, reaching out for a hug. Im going to miss you so much.

title: Deeply Hated, but Present: A U.S. Touch at Kims End
description: Kim Jong-il hated the United States. But an American carried him to the grave.

title: Polonia Closes, an East Village Fixture
description: An East Village staple for 28 years, Polonia has closed after its landlord raised the rent more than threefold.

title: Familiarity Breeds Hollywood Sequels
description: LOS ANGELES  Moviegoers might think of next summer as a test. The results will tell whether Hollywood should bother to have an original thought.

title: Cuts in Grammys Draw Grumbling but Little Action
description: When the group that organizes the Grammy Awards abruptly announced last April that it was cutting nearly a third of the award categories and eliminating trophies for smaller genres like Latin jazz and zydeco, it did not take long for the protests to start.

title: Romney Enjoys the Growing Crowds in Iowa
description: CLINTON, Iowa  Since landing in Iowa, Mitt Romney has been experiencing the problems of a candidate surging in polls  and they are not bad problems to have.

title: Cunningham Fostered Serendipity in Set Design
description: Daniel Arsham was barely aware of Merce Cunningham in 2005, when he got a call telling him that he was being considered as the set designer for the next work by Cunninghams dance company. Mr. Arsham was 25 and just two years out of art school at the Cooper Union. I knew him from my studies, he said recently, but as a passing name. A few months later Mr. Arsham  who at first didnt even know the concept of stage right  was at work on the set for Cunninghams 2007 piece eyeSpace.

title: Could Age Be an Issue for Ron Paul?
description: DES MOINES  Is Ron Paul too old to be president?

title: With Enough Winners, Skip the Esoterica
description: There are some deals, especially when one is looking at all 52 cards, that suggest a complicated line of play when there is a much simpler one available.

title: The Houses of the Hopefuls
description: EVEN in an era of the two-year presidential campaign, with debates that seem to come as regularly as dinner, there remains that nagging question: never mind the packagers, handlers and strategists; what are these candidates really like? The hunt goes on for insights and stories to provide an unfiltered view of their true character.

title: The Candidates Homes
description: Where Newt Gingrich, Representative Michele Bachmann, Mitt Romney and other G.O.P. candidates lay their heads.

title: Onstage Memories: Concert Highs of 2011
description: Recordings are forever. Concerts  even in the era of YouTube and the tour-documentary DVD  are fleeting experiences, subject to many nonmusical variables. But they can transform reputations and careers. Here the pop and jazz critics of The New York Times recap their most memorable performances of 2011, in order of importance.

title: From North Korea, an Altered Procession
description: Postscript | In addition to the European Pressphoto Agency, both Reuters and Agence-France Presse transmitted the altered photograph shown above, at right, on Wednesday. The original Lens post, below, should have noted that E.P.A. was not the only agency to release the image. Both Reuters and A.F.P. issued a kill on the image after the Lens post was published. Reuters strongly suspects that this handout picture from K.C.N.A. was manipulated at source, Reuters noted in a picture kill notice transmitted Wednesday evening. A.F.P. sent a mandatory kill statement over the wire on Thursday. This picture was altered from the source and not by A.F.P., the statement read.

title: Fire Pits
description: Winter is the season of the fire pits, those vessels, often made of ceramic or iron and fueled by wood or gas, that lovers of the outdoors set up in chilly weather for heat and light and charm. Joe Doucet, an industrial designer based in New York City and an admirer of the bowls, owns a house upstate that sits on 10 acres. Hes thinking about incorporating such a pit into the landscape.

title: Shopping for Fire Pits
description: Joe Doucet, an industrial designer, searched for fire pits to set up in chilly weather.

title: Pulls and Knobs With an Artisans Touch
description: Liberty Hardware of Winston-Salem, N.C., is best known for mass-produced cabinet knobs, pulls and hooks that are carried by major retailers. But for its latest collection, called HomeGrown Hardware, the company has joined with artisans on a range of items like the iron rings pictured.

title: In Mexico City, a Design Playhouse
description: When DFC first appeared six years ago, this decorative-accessories company stood out for over-the-top designs that were not traditionally tasteful and did not play to any trends. Now its goods  made in Mexico with age-old techniques that often lead to unconventional results  are on display at DFCs first store, in Mexico City.

title: Nine Lives, One Leash
description: THERE are outdoor cats and there are indoor cats. When I brought home Mac, a 4-year-old orange tabby, from a shelter last year, I realized I had acquired a demanding combination of the two.

title: Sales at Artemide, the MoMA Store and Others
description: Gus Modern will take 15 percent off furniture and accessories in January (the Atwood sectional, pictured, originally $3,199, will be about $2,719; the Carmichael Loft sofa, normally $1,999, about $1,699); gusmodern.com.

title: Ceramics That Are Imperfect on Purpose
description: Ayumi Horie developed a technique for making earthenware pieces without water while she was a student at Alfred University in western New York State. Today, this 42-year-old potter creates plates and bowls using the nontraditional method because it allows for spontaneity and a kind of gestural quality that is harder to get when clay is wet.

title: An Indian Writer Finds His Anchor on the Reservation
description: When David Treuer was offered a teaching job at the University of Southern California last year, he made a promise to himself before accepting and moving his family from Minneapolis to the West Coast: He would keep a home  an anchor, as he put it  on the Leech Lake Indian Reservation in northern Minnesota, where he grew up.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. My apartment has plenty of closets but no room for a desk. Would converting a closet into a home office help me sell the place?

title: Saying Shhh! to a Squeaky House
description: JAPANESE royalty once built homes with floors so squeaky that no intruder could evade detection.

title: A Lamp for Art Lovers
description: Ronan Bouroullec said that the new Piani lamp that he and his brother, Erwan, have designed can draw attention to art the way a pedestal does. I think this could be a lamp for a collector, he said, someone who collects very nice small objects and can display something beautiful under the light. Maybe a small Inuit sculpture.

title: In Costa Rica, Palms, Tiles and Cane
description: Islita, Costa Rica

title: Local Authenticity in a Slice of Costa Rica
description: A Dallas couple used local materials, like dried palm leaves, in their multi-building home on the Pacific coast.

title: Ahead of I.P.O., S.E.C. Pressed Groupon on Accounting
description: Ahead of Groupons highly anticipated initial public offering in November, the Securities and Exchange Commission repeatedly pressed the daily deals giant to defend its business model and its accounting measures, according to comment letters recently disclosed.

title: News Is Good for Santorum and Bad for Gingrich in New Polls
description: New polls in Iowa and New Hampshire suggest that Newt Gingrich is losing support in both states while Rick Santorum is gaining traction in Iowa and Mitt Romney is solidifying his lead in New Hampshire.

title: Baylor Basks in Heismans Glow
description: Robert Griffin III figures that the reality of his winning the Heisman Trophy will truly sink in sometime after Thursday nights Alamo Bowl against Washington. But after he returned to Baylors campus in Waco, Tex., following the award ceremony in New York and watched video montages of the reaction to his victory, he quickly understood that his achievement would reach far beyond the statue.

title: Third-Party Groups Are Gearing Up in Iowa
description: DES MOINES  Iowa mailboxes and airwaves are already thick with advertisements paid for by super PACs closely aligned with individual candidates, like the pro-Romney Restore Our Future and the pro-Perry Make Us Great Again.

title: Romney Turns to Supporters He Considers a Natural: Business Leaders
description: CLINTON, Iowa Kenneth Maass, a farmer in Remsen, Iowa, keeps a busy schedule: monthly meetings for the Plymouth County Farm Bureau, for the Northwest Rural Electric Cooperative and for his church, a Lutheran congregation where he serves as chairman. At each of these get-togethers, Mr. Maass, 75, makes a point of extolling what he sees as Mitt Romneys many virtues.

title: Prediction: You Will Meet Many Jaydens and Isabellas
description: This makes three in a row for Jayden. Two straight (and three out of four) for Isabella. More disturbing news for Michael and Ashley.

title: A Haven for Dissent in Bahrain, Where Lattes and Tear Gas Mix
description: MANAMA, Bahrain  The police cars were lined up across the street, staking out a hub of subversive activity. Their focus was not some underworld hangout, but a coffee shop, Costa Coffee, in a shopping mall.

title: Toxic Coffee in Bahrain
description: A coffee shop serves as a makeshift command center for some opposition leaders of Bahrain's stumbling pro-democracy movement. As a result, police often attack it with tear gas.

title: On Trail, Gingrich Strains to Show Nice-Guy Side
description: DUBUQUE, Iowa  Concluding a luncheon speech here to a Rotary Club, Newt Gingrich held his arms out to his sides and unleashed a most un-Newt-like gesture to his audience: a pantomime of a big group embrace.

title: Jennisons Jayhawkers
description: In a December 1861 letter to his sister, the Union soldier Daniel B. Holmes wrote that he and his fellow members of the Seventh Kansas Cavalry lived quite well, not from what we draw from the commissary but what we jayhawked.

title: Bipartisan Agreement: Obama Isnt Schmoozing
description: WASHINGTON  Air Force One had just landed in Manchester, N.H., on a brisk Tuesday morning last month when President Obama made an admission to Valerie B. Jarrett, his close friend and senior adviser.

title: E*Trades Baby Creates the Most Online Buzz
description: MARKETERS take many approaches to selling their products, from fake talking babies to real rap stars in commercials. But for many, generating the elusive online buzz is the ultimate goal.

title: Violence Flares in Syria Despite Observers Visit
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Violence continued to flare in the Syrian city of Homs on Wednesday, despite the presence of Arab League observers who are supposed to be monitoring a withdrawal of government forces from the city.

title: Despite RIM Takeover Talk, Hurdles Would Be High
description: OTTAWA  For beleaguered investors in Research in Motion, the drastic collapse of the companys share price through 2011 eventually became a cause for optimism. In December, shares of the BlackBerry maker spiked on reports that several technology titans could be suitors.

title: The Year in Live Pop
description: The pop and jazz critics of The New York Times recapped their most memorable performances of 2011.

title: Truth and Facebook
description: To the Editor:

title: Billionaire Shifts Attention From Mets to Dodgers
description: Steven A. Cohen, the billionaire hedge-fund manager, explored buying a minority stake in the Mets earlier this year. Now he wants to buy all of another marquee franchise, the Los Angeles Dodgers.

title: In Challenging S.E.C. Settlement, a Judge in Wisconsin Cites a Court in New York
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge in Wisconsin has challenged the Securities and Exchange Commission over a proposed settlement of fraud charges against a publicly traded company, citing as a precedent the agencys pending case against Citigroup.

title: The Jurys Duty When the Law Is Unfair
description: To the Editor:

title: Homeless Veterans
description: To the Editor:

title: Kirk Douglas on Trumbo
description: To the Editor:

title: Verizons Cable Agreements: A Boon to Competition
description: To the Editor:

title: Gingrich Campaign Says It Has Raised Almost $9 Million
description: LE MARS, Iowa  Newt Gingrichs campaign said on Wednesday that it had raised close to $9 million in the last quarter of the year, a significant improvement over the six-figure sum it raised over the summer, reflecting a flood of small donors who responded to Mr. Gingrichs debate performances and propelled his surge to the top of polls this month.

title: Giants Have Home Field, but Its Been a Disadvantage
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  For the Giants, Sundays prime-time game against the Dallas Cowboys should be a dream scenario: home-field advantage and needing only a win to make the playoffs. Instead, MetLife Stadium could be a setting where Giants fans may be reaching for a bottle of Pepto-Bismol or a stiff brew.

title: Romney Jabs at Paul, Who Strikes Iowa Chord
description: DES MOINES  Mitt Romneys presidential campaign swept confidently through Iowa on Wednesday, beginning a three-day bus tour and raising questions about the national security positions of Ron Paul, whose libertarian-leaning small government message appears to have struck a chord with Republican voters here.

title: Weapons Sales to Iraq Move Ahead Despite U.S. Worries
description: BAGHDAD  The Obama administration is moving ahead with the sale of nearly $11 billion worth of arms and training for the Iraqi military despite concerns that Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki is seeking to consolidate authority, create a one-party Shiite-dominated state and abandon the American-backed power-sharing government.

title: Los Angeles Vote to Decide on Condoms in Sex Films
description: LOS ANGELES  Come June, voters here will have a chance to cast their ballots in the presidential primary. Along with their presidential preferences, they will be asked to decide whether actors in pornographic films should be required to wear condoms.

title: Romneys Iowa Office Draws Protesters
description: Seven protesters were arrested outside Mitt Romneys campaign office in Des Moines on Wednesday afternoon, in the first of what the local Occupy movement says will be a week of demonstrations leading up to the Iowa caucuses.

title: Instead of Work, Younger Women Head to School
description: Workers are dropping out of the labor force in droves, and they are mostly women. In fact, many are young women. But they are not dropping out forever; instead, these young women seem to be postponing their working lives to get more education. There are now  for the first time in three decades  more young women in school than in the work force.

title: On Staten Island, a Team Resurfaces as Relevant
description: Dan Hurley did not give his team much time to savor its first victory over a ranked opponent in 33 years. By 11:30 a.m. Tuesday, Wagners holiday was over and another relentless two-hour practice was under way.

title: China: Strike at a Korean Factory
description: About 8,000 workers at an electronics factory in the southern city of Nanjing have been on strike this week against what they call low wages from their South Korean employers, according to a statement on Tuesday by China Labor Watch, an advocacy group based in the United States. Caijing, a Chinese newsmagazine, reported some details of the strike on Wednesday. The workers are angry that their year-end bonus equals only a months pay, while Korean workers are getting a year-end bonus equal to six months salary, according to the statement from the labor group. The strike began Monday. On Wednesday afternoon, according to Reuters, there were indications that workers might accept an offer by employers of two months salary as a bonus. The factory makes electronics for a unit of LG Group, a South Korean company.

title: What We Think About When We Think About the Court
description: Wherever I go these days, someone is bound to ask me how I think the Supreme Court will rule in the challenge to the Affordable Care Act, set for argument over three days during the last week in March. My response, that I expect the court to uphold the law, predictably evokes an expression of disbelief verging on pity for my display of such navet. Wont the justices just vote their politics? my questioner invariably asks.

title: MF Global Scrutinized on Money Move
description: Federal authorities investigating the demise of MF Global think that the firm began improperly moving customer money to a middleman on Oct. 27, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Russia: Jet Skids Off Runway
description: A Russian-made passenger jet of a type that is known to be accident-prone skidded off a runway and caught fire on Wednesday while landing in fog in Osh, Kyrgyzstan, injuring about 31 people. After another jet of that type, a Tupolev, crashed in Russia last June, killing 44 people, President Dmitri A. Medvedev said most of the airplanes should be taken out of service by Jan. 1.

title: Before a Funeral, Rending Choices on How Best to Tell the Stories of 3 Short Lives
description: In any other context, the choices might seem trivial: purple flowers or pink, this family photo or that one, large teddy bear or small.

title: Jets Upbeat Knowing They Need a Victory and Lots of Help
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Facing one of the most important games of his career  even for someone who has played in two A.F.C. championships  Mark Sanchez on Wednesday summoned his past. From ski cap to warm-up pants, Sanchez wore red and black, the colors of his alma mater, Mission Viejo High School.

title: 14 Muslim Leaders Plan Boycott of Breakfast With Mayor
description: A group of Muslim leaders plans to boycott Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs annual interfaith breakfast on Friday to protest what it calls the unfair surveillance of Muslims by the New York Police Department.

title: Oaklands Mayor Wrestles With Occupy Movement
description: The first woman and first Asian American mayor of Oakland, Calif., Jean Quan, has been criticized for her handling of the Occupy Oakland movement.

title: Oaklands Reins Blister a Mayor Raised on Protest
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Days after Jean Quan was elected mayor in the fall of 2010, the Oakland police put a wheel clamp on her silver Prius while it was parked outside City Hall. She cursed her husband for not paying the familys parking tickets and braced for the embarrassing news articles.

title: City Schools Missing Out on Aid for Special Needs
description: New York City has failed to recover tens of millions of dollars in Medicaid reimbursements for services it provided to special-needs students in recent years, as the Education Department has struggled to adapt to new rules imposed after a devastating federal audit forced the city to return money it received for claims it could not properly document.

title: Oil Prices Predicted to Stay Above $100 a Barrel Through Next Year
description: The United States economy managed to cope this year despite triple-digit prices for barrels of oil. The lessons may come in handy, economists say, because those prices will probably be sticking around.

title: Iraq: Exiles to Leave Camp
description: About 400 members of an Iranian exile group agreed Wednesday to leave a camp in eastern Iraq, another step in international efforts to end a tense, sometimes violent, impasse between Iraqs government and the 3,400 people inside Camp Ashraf. The plan would move the residents to a former American military base in Baghdad, where they would ultimately relocate outside Iraq. The camp is populated by members of the Mujahedeen Khalq, or Peoples Mujahedeen, a group that has fought in years past to bring down the Iranian government. The Iraqi government wants to close the camp. On Wednesday night, three rockets struck the camp, but there were no immediate reports of casualties, Iraqi security officials said.

title: Iowa State Has Found a Stabilizing Presence
description: Early Tuesday night, Iowa State football coach Paul Rhoads peered through the glass panes of a suite at Yankee Stadium and witnessed yet another first in a three-year run filled with breakthroughs. Before a Pinstripe Bowl dinner, his players were given a tour of the majestic ballpark, where they will play Rutgers on Friday.

title: Top Bachmann Aide in Iowa to Support Paul
description: DES MOINES  The top Iowa adviser to Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota announced Wednesday night that he was jumping ship to support the candidacy of Representative Ron Paul of Texas.

title: A Future Memo From Goldman
Lottery Numbers
Scott Stringer to Dennis Walcott on Medicaid
description: Letter from the Manhattan borough president, Scott M. Stringer, to Schools Chancellor Dennis M. Walcott criticizing the city for failing to consistently apply for Medicaid reimbursements.

title: New York City Principals Union on SESIS
description: An article from the principals union December newsletter listing problems with the education departments database for its special education program, the Special Education Student Information System (SESIS).

title: New York State Dept. of Health Letter to Dept. of Education
description: Letter from the New York State Department of Health to the New York City Department of Education alerting of the citys use of the wrong form to apply for reimbursement for speech therapy services.

title: My Dad and I Walked Into a Bar
description: Most regulars at neighborhood bars come by their nicknames through easily distinguishable physical qualities (Goiter Eddie, Curly Pat, Jimmy the Hat, One-Arm Joe). If that fails, a nickname can be created on the basis of ethnic origin (English Billy, Irish Mike), or a profession (Eddie the Actor, Rodger the Dodger  a defense attorney). But in the entire history of nicknaming, there was only one regular called Taras Father, and that was my dad.

title: Corrections: December 29
description: FRONT PAGE

title: The Year in Questions
description: A quiz to test your memory of the memes like the stories that you find in the pages of The Times.

title: Dan Fouts, the Man Before Brees and Marino
description: When Drew Brees completed his final throw Monday night against the Atlanta Falcons to give him 5,087 passing yards this season, he broke Dan Marinos 27-year-old N.F.L. record.

title: Thursday: They Can Be Batted and Rolled
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  When was the last time you sat down to a good game of Scrabble? David Steinberg is back today, and he has a word challenge for us that will make us really think. Im going to reveal it after the jump, so if you are still solving, come back when youre done.

title: Women Departing Labor Force
description: The percentage of young women enrolled in school now exceeds that in the labor force.

title: The Part-Time Job That Left Him Laid Low by Fraud
description: It is hard to imagine John Parker working as a bouncer. He is soft-spoken and easygoing, more teddy bear than bruiser.

title: Getting Ahead in Dharavi
description: As many as a million people live and work in Dharavi, a sprawling slum in Mumbai, India.

title: An Industrial Slum at the Heart of Mumbai
description: Dharavi may no longer be Asias  or even Mumbais  biggest slum, but it is still its most iconic. By some estimates, the slum is home to one million people in an area about two-thirds of Manhattans Central Park. Land that once was on the outskirts of Mumbai has now been swallowed by the city and has been subject to multiple rehabilitation attempts since the 1970s.

title: In One Slum, Misery, Work, Politics and Hope
description: MUMBAI, India  At the edge of Indias greatest slum, Shaikh Mobins decrepit shanty is cleaved like a wedding cake, four layers high and sliced down the middle. The missing half has been demolished. What remains appears ready for demolition, too, with temporary walls and a rickety corrugated roof.

title: Feel Free to Ignore Iowa
description: Only days until the Iowa caucuses! Can you believe it? Less than 8,000 minutes to go!

title: As Winter Classic Approaches, Rangers Slump to Loss
description: WASHINGTON  The Rangers insisted they were not looking ahead to the next weeks Winter Classic. All of those HBO cameras filming their every move had not swelled their heads.

title: Republicans Shake More Hands Using Social Media
description: When Iowans search for information on politics on the Web, Mitt Romneys tutorial on how to caucus pops up.

title: Newest Knick Out to Prove Hes Not Just a Novelty
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Jeremy Lins 18-month ride through the N.B.A. could best be described as exhilarating, emotional, stressful, agonizing and sobering, more or less in that order.

title: Marching Orders for Pauls Volunteers: Do Shave, Dont Tweet
description: DES MOINES  Ron Pauls college-aged volunteer army  a core of the powerful ground organization that is the envy of rivals  is descending on Iowa from around the nation to coax people to the states Republican caucuses as he seeks to pull off what only months ago seemed like an unthinkable victory here on Tuesday.

title: Adrienne Cooper, Yiddish Singer, Dies at 65
description: Adrienne Cooper, an American-born singer, teacher and curator of Yiddish music who was a pioneer in the effort to keep the embers of that language smoldering for newer generations, died on Sunday in Manhattan. She was 65.

title: Justice and Prosecutorial Misconduct
description: Michael Morton was exonerated by DNA evidence this month after being wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and serving nearly 25 years in prison in Texas. In seeking to prove Mr. Mortons innocence, his lawyers found in recently unsealed court records evidence that the prosecutor in the original trial, Ken Anderson, had withheld critical evidence that may have helped Mr. Morton.

title: Satyadev Dubey, Playwright Who Modernized Hindi Theater, Dies at 75
description: Satyadev Dubey, a producer, director and playwright who inspired generations of Indian actors and other playwrights, died on Sunday in Mumbai. He was 75.

title: Another Year for Weapons
description: The F.B.I. reports that gun dealers submitted the names of almost half-a-million customers in the six days before Christmas, with December on its way to surpassing November, which had a record tally of 1,534,414 names submitted for background checks for criminal convictions and mental health issues. Only a little more than 1 percent of buyers are typically rejected by federally licensed gun dealers. No one knows how many more firearms were purchased through the gun-show loophole that enables black marketeering.

title: Whose Welfare?
description: When will the Internal Revenue Service crack down on the secret political money already flooding the 2012 campaign from partisan operatives ludicrously claiming to be social welfare activists under the tax law?

title: About Those Gift Cards
description: As you ponder your holiday haul, it is time to consider the particular oddity of the gift card. Four out of five American consumers bought gift cards this holiday season, according to the National Retail Federation. Spending on the cards jumped to $27.8 billion, a 10 percent gain from 2010.

title: The Caucus | The Ron Paul Army Mobilizes
description: Dec. 29. 2011 - The presidential campaign for the Texas congressman is bringing in volunteers from around the country to organize voters in Iowa.

title: Should Lori Berenson Go Back to Peru?
A Conversation With: Yoko Ono
description: Artist Yoko Ono brings her first-ever show to India in mid-January, a multi-city tour titled Our Beautiful Daughters that is expected to include a live performance and brand-new work created just for India. Ms. Onos last visit to India was in the 1970s, when she came with husband John Lennon.

title: An Indian Government Success: Solar Power
description: While the Indian government has missed many of its development goals in recent years, there is one area where it is on track: harnessing solar power.

title: What We Can Learn From Old Animals
description: It is not hard to argue that we live in a youth-centric culture, one in which young age and beauty are almost synonymous. And that obsession does not end with humans. Puppies and kittens melt hearts; images and videos of baby animals flood the Internet. But rarely does an image of an animal in old age ignite the same interest and adoration.

title: Bloggingheads: North Koreas Choice
description: Heather Hurlburt, left, of the National Security Network and Daniel Drezner of ForeignPolicy.com debate the future of North Korea.

title: Ron Pauls World
description: Earlier this week, Newt Gingrich, the former House speaker, said that he would not vote for his fellow presidential candidate Ron Paul should Paul become the Republican nominee. The immediate cause of this dissension  highly unusual in a party primary  was the repugnant newsletters that Paul published from the late 1970s until the mid-1990s, which contain a raft of bigoted statements. Paul has denied authorship and implausibly claims not to know who wrote them.

title: In Dharavi: Misery, Work, Politics and Hope
description: Jim Yardley examines the multi-layered reality of Indias largest slum, Mumbais Dharavi, in the latest installment of Indias Way.

title: At Huge Rally, North Koreans Declare Kim Their Leader
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The declaration on Thursday that Kim Jong-un is now the supreme leader of North Korea was an emotional turning point for the hermetic country  reaffirming support for the young heir after nearly two weeks of national mourning for his father, Kim Jong-il.

title: NYT Front Page for 12/29/2011
description: NYT Front Page for 12/29/2011

title: Knicks Strengths Vanish, and So Do Hopes of Winning
description: OAKLAND  Carmelo Anthony would have saved the Knicks with a timely jumper, if only he could have made any. Tyson Chandler might have saved them with a timely rebound or blocked shot, if only he could have stayed on the court.

title: From Dharavi, Another View of India
description: For much of the past year, our reporters in India have been doing some deep-dive reporting for a series weve called Indias Way. Today, were publishing a long piece by Jim Yardley about the Dharavi slum in Mumbai. We hope to publish another article in a few days about private education in India, and one or two others early next year.

title: The Year in Questions
description: Like a circle in a spiral, like a wheel within a wheel, never-ending news is spooling off a never-ending reel ... Now a quiz is set to test you and your memory of the memes ...

title: Peace? Process?
description: MOUNT GILBOA, Israel  Having spent Hanukkah seeing more friends this year than usual, I was able to canvass our conversations for a fair number of topics beyond kids, health, real estate and other standard catching-up fare.

title: Q&A: Publishing Your Own E-Book
description: Q.

title: Borghese Treasures Return to Rome
description: When Napoleon acquired 695 ancient statues from the Borghese family collection in 1807, flabbergasted contemporaries called the act an indelible shame. The collection was born two centuries earlier when Cardinal Scipione Borghese, nephew of Pope Paul V, made it his lifes work to bring together the masterpieces available to him. He assembled more than 2,000 pieces, including antique statues, sculptures by Bernini and canvases by Raphael, Caravaggio and Titian.

title: Mike Pereira Is Not a Fan of Jon Gruden
description: When he was the overseer of officials for the N.F.L., Mike Pereira frequently fielded calls from angry coaches who wanted explanations for calls that went against them. Bill Belichick once saw him and sympathetically told him he looked run-down. You never win, do you? Belichick said, according to Pereira.

title: The Early Word: Seesaw
description: In Todays Times:Hundreds of Ron Pauls college-age volunteers descended on the Hawkeye State on Wednesday with barely a week left until the Iowa caucuses. Richard A. Oppel Jr. writes that members of Mr. Pauls army arrived under a cloak of secrecy and with strict rules for comportment as they prepare to coax likely caucus-goers into voting for Mr. Paul, a 76-year-old veteran Texas congressman who is drawing supporters for his libertarian and antiwar views.

title: Week 17 N.F.L. Probabilities: Importance of Seeding
description: The path into the playoffs for the Giants is clear enough. Win and theyre in as the N.F.C. East champion. The Jets path to an A.F.C. wild card is much more complicated, and more dependent on the fortunes of other teams, including the Bengals, the Titans, the Broncos and the Raiders. The only other unsettled playoff berth is the A.F.C. West championship, which will go to the Broncos or Raiders.

title: Recipes for the Semi-Vegan
description: Many vegan dishes, like fruit salad and peanut butter and jelly, are already beloved. However, the problem faced by many of us is in imagining less-traditional vegan dishes that are interesting and not challenging. Here are some more creative options to try.

title: The Electric Current Fizz
description: Vigorously shake over ice:

title: The Perfect Hair of the Dog
description: It is sometimes the case that on the morning of Jan. 1, I arise bleary-eyed from a brief sleep with those famous final words of Becketts Unnamable on my mind: You must go on, I cant go on, Ill go on. Fortunately, Im not reflecting on the whole messy enterprise of life itself. Im concerned with drinking. Can I, should I, really keep going after a season of festive drinking that ended a little too festively?

title: No Meat, No Dairy, No Problem
description: Among your other resolutions  do more good? make more money?  youve probably made the annual pledge to eat better, although this concept may be more often reduced simply to lose some weight. The weight-loss obsession is both a national need and a neurotic urge (those last five pounds really dont matter, either cosmetically or medically). But most of us do need to eat better.

title: The Year When Rock Just Spun Its Wheels
description: Every week since the end of May the band Sublime With Rome has had at least one song, sometimes two, on Billboards Rock Songs chart or its Hot Modern Rock Tracks chart, often both. The most successful have been Panic and Take It or Leave It, both true to the bands mission to reincarnate the band Sublime, whose singer, Brad Nowell, died in 1996, and whose ska-lite Sublime With Rome both covers and, in its originals, shamelessly apes.

title: Carrie Brownstein, Riot Grrrnup
description: Carrie Brownstein, the exuberant pixie rocker, says that if she had to live as one of the characters on her cult-hit sketch comedy series, Portlandia, shed be Toni, the depressed and passively sadistic feminist bookstore owner. This is not an obvious choice. Best known for her guitar heroics in Sleater-Kinney and, more recently, in her third band, Wild Flag, Brownstein, 37, is often found wearing bright red lipstick, a fashionable shag and skinny jeans. Toni, by contrast, favors burlap sacks and never smiles.

title: Stratfor Hackers Claim Another Attack
description: Hackers who said they attacked Stratfor Global Intelligence service, a security research group based in Austin, Tex., over the weekend have claimed a second target: Special Forces, a veterans-owned Web site that sells military-inspired merchandise and gives away a portion of profits to charity.

title: The Puzzle of Rising Methane
description: In an article the other day about thawing permafrost, I mentioned that no signal had emerged in the atmosphere to suggest a sharp rise in methane emissions from the Arctic. But that does not mean all is stable with methane in the air  quite the contrary, in fact.

title: Google+ Gains Traction, Researcher Says
description: Googles mission to compete with Facebook in social networking may be gaining speed.

title: China Proceeds on Plan for Disputed Yangtze Dam
description: BEIJING  The Chinese State Council has removed a crucial roadblock to building one of the nations most contentious hydroelectric dams, dealing a decisive defeat to environmentalists critical of the project  and showcasing the clout of one of the most powerful and ambitious politicians in China.

title: 2 Are Killed by an Afghan in Uniform
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  For the second time in a week, a man wearing an Afghan Army uniform attacked NATO personnel on Thursday, this time gunning down two members of the French Foreign Legion in eastern Afghanistan before being fatally shot.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Occupy Geeks and Electronics in the Air
description: Heres what the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web:

title: The Breakfast Meeting, Dec. 29
description: If at first you succeed.  The list of the top-grossing films of 2011 is, more or less, a list of sequels, starting with the top film, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2, which is the final sequel in a long series. Those results are a product of a flight to financial safety that has been building for a decade, Michael Cieply writes. It appears that 2012 will not be so different, with the major studios planning about 10 sequels or reboots (that is, a familiar series that begins again, from the top).

title: Lokpal in the Rajya Sabha: Who Hates What
description: Deliberations were heated Thursday in Indias Rajya Sabha, or upper house of Parliament, over the Lokpal bill, which would create an anti-corruption body of ombudsmen in India. The United Progressive Alliance, or U.P.A., does not have a majority in the Rajya Sabha, unlike in the Lok Sabha, so the bill will have a more difficult time passing.

title: European Fiscal Zombies
description: Dean Baker is unhappy at seeing yet another article asserting as fact something that is actually just something fiscal hawks imagine: the claim that Europes problem economies were running up government debt before the crisis.

title: Arab League Visit Has Led to More Violence in Syria, Activists Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrian security forces opened fire on demonstrators in a Damascus suburb on Thursday morning, activists said, killing several people and dashing hopes that Arab League observers might help stem the bloodshed.

title: The Best in Mens
How Dallas Should Attack Giants Pass Defense
description: Jonathan Bales is the founder ofDallasCowboysTimes.com, a site dedicated to film study and statistical analysis of the Cowboys.

title: The Best They Have To Offer
description: My Campaign Stops column this week finds something nice to say about every candidate for the G.O.P. nomination:

title: The Unspoken Diagnosis: Old Age
description: Dr. Alexander K. Smith is a brave man.

title: Bucking Solar Predictions, India Surprises Itself
description: When the Indian government embarked on an ambitious solar power project two years ago, I wrote that its goals seemed farfetched. Since then, things have changed significantly, and as I note in Thursdays paper, analysts say the projects goal of having 20,000 megawatts of solar capacity by 2020 seems well within reach.

title: Thursday Reading: Your Body Is Trying to Keep You Fat
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Daily Report: A Legal Battle Over a Twitter Users Identity
description: Twitter once again finds itself at the center of a conflict over the right to anonymity on the Web, this time in a case involving a sympathizer with the Boston offshoot of the Occupy Wall Street movement.

title: A Warm Update to a Chilly Arctic Ballad
description: [On Sept. 3, 2016, the second of the two Franklin expedition ships lost in the Arctic was located in a remote bay.]

title: Turkish Airstrikes Kill Smugglers Mistaken for Kurdish Separatists
description: ISTANBUL  The Turkish military said Thursday that it had accidently killed at least 35 Turkish cigarette smugglers in airstrikes after mistaking them for separatist fighters in the Kurdish border region with Iraq, infuriating many of Turkeys long-oppressed Kurds. Most of the dead were between 17 and 20 years old.

title: What Were Reading
description: Details: Tips from mixologists on how the home bartender can try to master a few of those cocktails made with egg whites.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Bitter Twist in Louisiana Familys Long Drilling Fight
description: ERATH, La.  It began as a landlord-tenant dispute, Louisiana style.

title: Teenage Obesity Linked to Poor Mother-Child Bond
description: Researchers from Ohio State University analyzed data from a study following nearly 1,000 children from infancy through the ninth grade and found that children who were insecurely attached or otherwise showed signs of a poor maternal relationship before age 3 were more likely to be obese at 15.

title: Where Credit Is Due, and Eagerly Taken
description: It is the nature of politicians and bureaucrats to summon microphone- and pencil-holders when they have good news and to content themselves with, at best, a printed statement  issued perhaps at 6 p.m. on a Friday after everyone has gone home  when developments reflect poorly on them. That the public has a stake in tidings both glad and sad is usually ignored as an inconvenient detail.

title: Polarizing Leader Fades Into the Twilight
description: The best thing about The Iron Lady may be that viewers going into the theater with strong views, pro or con, about its subject, the former British prime minister Margaret Thatcher, are likely to emerge in a state of greater ambivalence, even confusion. Those who know or care little about her will also be confused, but for different reasons.

title: In Cheetah Mystery, Florida Sanctuary Stands by Its Chimp
description: A Florida animal sanctuary on Thursday stood by its claim that a chimpanzee that died there over the weekend was featured in the classic Tarzan movies of the 1930s, despite the skepticism of some experts who believed it was unlikely that a chimp could live to be more than 80 years old.

title: Cappuccino, but Maybe Not Support
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa  Newt Gingrichs jobs and growth bus tour is visiting small businesses across Iowa to highlight the economic challenges of entrepreneurs, who the candidate argues will benefit from his calls to repeal Obamacare, the Dodd-Frank financial regulation law and onerous environmental mandates.

title: Iowa G.O.P. on Guard Against Voting Disruptions
description: Although organizers for the Occupy movement in Iowa say there are no plans to disrupt voting during the 1,774 caucuses next Tuesday night, Iowa state Republican officials are not taking any chances.

title: Egypt Raids Offices of Nonprofits, 3 Backed by U.S.
description: CAIRO  Security forces shut down three American-financed democracy-building groups and as many as six other nonprofit organizations on Thursday, in a crackdown that signaled a new low in relations between Washington and Egypts military rulers.

title: South Africas Conscience Reflects
description: The South African playwright Athol Fugard will have four major New York theater productions this season.

title: Impatient? It May Be Hurting Your Credit Score
description: Remember when you were a kid and your parents harped on the importance of delayed gratification to get ahead in life? (You know: Put that birthday money in the piggy bank and save for something nice, instead of blowing it all now on Milky Way bars.)

title: Carrie Brownstein Starter Kit
description: For those who dont already know and love Carrie Brownstein, theres a lot to catch up on. The writer-actress-rocker has two current projects: the TV sketch comedy series, Portlandia, and her new band, Wild Flag. She was also the guitarist for her much-loved former band, Sleater-Kinney. To get you up to speed on her oeuvre, we asked Brownstein to assemble some of her favorite clips.

title: The Provider Will See You Now
description: I cant quite remember when the term provider slipped into the hospital lexicon. It was perhaps 10 years ago, when our hospital started hiring physician assistants and nurse practitioners to share the clinical load. In contrast to the regular staff nurses, who cared for the patients in conjunction with the doctors, physician assistants and nurse practitioners would see patients independently, the way the rest of the doctors did. So there needed to be a term that would include all three groups  physician assistants, nurse practitioners and doctors  who could have primary responsibility for patients.

title: Hotel Restaurant Menus That Dont Grow Stale
description: Hotel restaurants often reinvent themselves to keep up with food trends. At a time when new is the norm, though, some long-standing restaurants are sticking to tried and true.

title: 36 Hours: Trinidad
description: Creole culture, waterfalls and partying galore.

title: Whoops Is the Latest Ad Attacking Gingrich
description: With less than a week before the Iowa caucuses, a super PAC supporting Mitt Romney in the Republican presidential nomination contest is taking another swing at Newt Gingrich, the latest in a weeks-long string of attacks on the former House speaker.

title: Closing In on Africas Bush Meat Trade
description: For people in West and Central Africa, eating just one kind of bush meat might be compared to dining on roast turkey night after night in the United States. People may enjoy eating it on Thanksgiving and Christmas, notes the conservationist John Fa, but its not something I want to eat every single day of my life.

title: 36 Hours: Trinidad
description: TRINIDAD is not pia colada territory. Thats part of its allure: Unlike virtually every other Caribbean island, the oil-rich country seven miles off Venezuela is not driven by tourism  which means that in lieu of sunbathing hordes and Yah, Mon T-shirts, youll find miles of unspoiled beaches and waterfalls visited by locals; a Creole culture with roots in Africa, India, Europe and China; and a bustling capital city offering some of the Caribbeans most electrifying night life. Partying, after all, is a national tradition in Trinidad, home to an annual Carnival that is the regions biggest and, lately, most star-studded (last year, the actors Idris Elba and Malik Yoba showed up). That, along with recent restaurant and hotel openings and trendy Trini ambassadors  from the rappers Nicki Minaj and Theophilus London to the Project Runway winner Anya Ayoung Chee  might just turn Trinidad into the next it island.

title: 36 Seconds in Trinidad
description: A tour of Trinidad, the larger of the two islands that make up the nation of Trinidad and Tobago, in the southern Caribbean.

title: The Top of the Class in Deal-Making
description: It is that time of the year again, when we award the Deal Professor As, the grade for the best deals and deal makers of 2011. Here are the highlights (with a few grades of F as well), in alphabetical order:

title: The Top 10 Reasons to Make (and Love) Top 10 Lists
description: 1. The position of Arts and Entertainment Co-Editor of The Tower Times carries a certain amount of responsibility. When I filled that role at my Wisconsin high school, there was one task that I treasured above all else. I got to write an end-of-year Top 10 list.

title: Wheelies: The TV Commercial Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Marvel Wins Court Battle Over Rights to Ghost Rider
description: A federal judge in New York has ruled that Marvel Entertainment owns the rights to Ghost Rider, a supernatural character possessed by a spirit of vengeance who first appeared in 1972. The character was the subject of a lawsuit by a writer seeking to cash in on lucrative movie rights, according to a report by The Associated Press. United States District Judge Katherine Forrest threw out on Wednesday the four-year-old claims by ruling that Gary Friedrich, a freelance writer, gave up all ownership rights when he signed checks including language-relinquishing rights to the predecessor companies of Marvel Entertainment.

title: Alibaba Taps Lobbying Firm
description: The Alibaba Group, the fast-growing Chinese Internet company, has hired an influential lobbying firm in Washington as it navigates a potential takeover bid for Yahoo.

title: Curtains Up for Chicago Stages
description: WHEN times are tough, the arts suffer more than most. Pinched pocketbooks  both corporate and individual  force institutions to give up ambitious plans to focus on simply staying afloat. But in Chicago, three theaters have recently opened on the north side of the city, seemingly defying economic logic.

title: London Underground | Architecture in Print
description: The last few years have seen a new generation of alternative publications and editorial talent emerge, and London is very much a part of the scene. This month saw the release of the fourth issue of P.E.A.R. (Paper for Emerging Architectural Research). Printed on newspaper stock, this zine (included in Archizines, a show I curated at the Architectural Association School of Architecture) was started by the editorial collective of Rashid Ali, Matthew Butcher, Julian Krueger and Megan OShea, with the designer Avni Patel, in 2009. A few issues in, they have really hit their stride. The paper aims to re-establish the fanzine as a primary medium for the dissemination of architectural ideas, musings, research and works, and to present the complexity and variety of architectural practice, OShea explains. We actively seek to publish thinking that wouldnt ordinarily be seen in the mainstream architectural press, and we are interested in showing that the architectural is concerned with more than just architecture.

title: The Candidates on Executive Power
description: The New York Times submitted a set of questions to each of the major presidential candidates about their views on the scope and limits of the powers they would wield if elected. Here are their answers in full.

title: Red Sox Add a Closer and Some Anxiety
description: In the first real move of the Ben Cherington administration, the Red Sox appear to have secured a top closer, Andrew Bailey, for a reasonable price. But for Boston fans, famous for their worries and complaints, the new object of their obsession will be Baileys right elbow.

title: Criticism of Undercover Operation Aimed at Smartphone Thefts
description: To combat a surge in the theft of handheld electronic devices, which contributed to a high rate of grand larcenies in the city this year, the Police Department devised Operation Take Back, aimed at anyone seeking a stolen iPhone or iPad.

title: Illuminating the Legacy of a Fallen Father
description: BERKELEY, Calif.

title: An L.A. Landmark, Angeli Caffe Is Closing
description: It was just a neighborhood restaurant. But starting in the mid-1980s, from its small perch in Los Angeles, Angeli Caffe helped popularize a new kind of California-Mediterranean cuisine, spawned a cookbook and launched the reputation of its owner and chef, Evan Kleiman.

title: Romney Campaigns Hard in Iowa as Caucuses Near
description: 1:42 p.m. | Updated  DES MOINES  After all the hemming and hawing about whether Iowa would be a critical element of his bid to be the Republican nominee, the question for Mitt Romney is now moot.

title: Occupying the Arts, a Seat at a Time
description: THE Juilliard Schools inviting 275-seat Paul Hall was nearly packed recently for an early-evening concert, a free 60-minute Liederabend program on which four gifted student singers, each paired with a comparably gifted pianist, sang songs by Schumann. Classical music has struggled for a long time to fight the perception  an unfair perception  that it is elitist and inaccessible. But here was a program that didnt even require tickets. People just showed up.

title: TimesCast | December 29, 2011
description: An unlikely command center for Bahrain's antigovernment protest movement | The Beirut bureau chief, Anthony Shadid, on the year of the Arab Spring.

title: From a Marines Side of the Camera
description: When Finbarr OReilly, a Reuters photographer, embedded with my squad of Marines in Afghanistan last October, I strategically positioned myself between him and my men, to keep them out of trouble. I based my decision on experience and preconceived notions regarding combat journalists. On the first night, I questioned him for hours about his upbringing, his background and his political outlook on the war, to get a better feel for who he was. It appeared that he wasnt a bad guy after all. We shared a lot of views. But I remained cautious. You can never judge a book by its cover.

title: Brooklyn Towers, and a Debate Over Preservation
description: From the vantage, say, of Court and Joralemon Streets, Brooklyn feels like the big city it is. This is Downtown, with an upper-case D: tall buildings, crowded sidewalks, public monuments, intersecting lives  seasoned with urgency and purpose.

title: With $30 Billion Arms Deal, U.S. Bolsters Saudi Ties
description: HONOLULU  Fortifying one of its key allies in the Persian Gulf, the Obama administration announced a weapons deal with Saudi Arabia on Thursday, saying it had agreed to sell F-15 fighter jets valued at nearly $30 billion to the Royal Saudi Air Force.

title: Huge Trove of Titanic Artifacts to Be Auctioned
description: Thousands of artifacts salvaged from the Titanics watery tomb in the North Atlantic will be sold in a winner-take-all auction scheduled for April, the centennial of the luxury liners sinking, The Associated Press reported.

title: Unhappy Honda Owner Taking Case to Small Claims Court
description: Heather Peters of Los Angeles is taking a novel approach to addressing her legal grievances against Honda for what she says are the fuel economy shortcomings of her Civic Hybrid. She says she is opting out of a proposed class-action lawsuit settlement and instead is suing the automaker for up to $10,000 in small claims court.

title: The Joy of Quiet
description: ABOUT a year ago, I flew to Singapore to join the writer Malcolm Gladwell, the fashion designer Marc Ecko and the graphic designer Stefan Sagmeister in addressing a group of advertising people on Marketing to the Child of Tomorrow. Soon after I arrived, the chief executive of the agency that had invited us took me aside. What he was most interested in, he began  I braced myself for mention of some next-generation stealth campaign  was stillness.

title: Four Undefeated Basketball Teams Left
description: The number of undefeated teams in college basketball continues to shrink to a precious few, as Indiana and Louisville lost Wednesday. Four teams remain perfect: No. 1 Syracuse is 14-0, No. 20 Murray State and No. 6 Baylor are 13-0, and No. 8 Missouri sits at 12-0.

title: Hollywood-Style Tricks on the Cheap
description: A couple of weeks ago, my 12-year-old daughter sought my advice about a video she wanted to make. Her concept was so elaborate and involved so many scenes, I doubted it was even doable  unless she used a green screen and filmed the whole thing in the basement.

title: New Ad Urges Iowans to Caucus for Palin
description: The underground movement to draft Sarah Palin into the Iowa caucuses has moved onto television, with a group called Sarah Palins Iowa Earthquake running ads across the state.

title: Verizon Wireless Adds $2 Fee for Some Bill Payments
description: 3:47 p.m. | Updated  Adding analyst comment.

title: A Forgotten Prayer, Answered
description: ON a cold March night nearly two years ago, not long after we had learned that the baby I was carrying had all his chromosomes in a sequence that spelled health and wholeness, I was lying in bed next to my husband marveling at this unlikely turn of fortune when I remembered Chimi Lhakhang.

title: Auction Houses See Increase in High-End Contemporary Art Sales
description: Big-box stores may be worrying about their sales on Black Friday, Mega Monday and all the days in between, but sellers of high-end contemporary art seem to have done well this year. On the evidence of some auction results, at least, the market for such art rose significantly as jittery investors put their money into art instead of stocks, Bloomberg News reported.

title: Indias Novel Solar Auctions Fuel Boom
description: When the Indian government embarked on an ambitious solar power project two years ago, I wrote that its goals seemed farfetched. Since then, things have changed significantly, and as I note in Thursdays paper, analysts say the projects goal of having 20,000 megawatts of solar capacity by 2020 seems well within reach.

title: Hotel Review: Mr. C Beverly Hills in Los Angeles
description: UPSHOT

title: Elite Flier Status
description: To the Editor: Re Save your Elite Flier Status While You Can (Practical Traveler, Dec. 18), I was seven segments short on Continental to get platinum status (you need 90 segments or 75,000 miles), so I did a crazy mileage run last weekend to get to platinum.
