description: The article by Bill Keller is an incisive and balanced analysis of what has brought the Pakistan-United States relationship to its low point. Both sides have no clear understanding of the vital interests of the other. For Pakistan, it is not in its interest to antagonize the Taliban, who are sure to come back to power in Afghanistan once the Americans leave, but at the very least, it can prevent the Taliban from attacking U.S. and NATO forces from its soil and not give any support in the planning and execution of such attacks. On the other hand, the U.S. fails to understand how alarming it is for Pakistan, and rightfully so, to see the growing strengthening of the India-Afghanistan axis, both its bitter enemies. Successive Afghan governments since the day that Pakistan was created have maintained a very hostile attitude except for the few years under Taliban rule. Therefore, in order not to have two unfriendly neighbors, Pakistan has chosen to bet on the return of the Taliban.

title: Politics en Pointe
description: I was excited to take my granddaughter, Rachel, to see a local production of The Nutcracker. But this season, the production was being underwritten in large part by David Koch, a billionaire who supports numerous political causes that I think harm our nation. He also supports many worthy medical, educational and arts organizations, but I think those good works buy the complicity of the institutions in question. Im sure my granddaughter would have liked to see the show, but rather than validate this patrons actions and beliefs, I boycotted it. Should those who feel as I do have joined me? EDITH PALMER, BROOKLYN

title: The Self-Contained Snowstorm
description: Like the symphony orchestra, psychoanalysis and much of Western civilization, the snow globe traces its heritage to Europe. The first known record of the venerable paperweight-turned-kitsch-souvenir, writes Nancy McMichael in Snowdomes, the definitive account of the tchotchke, was entered in the 1878 Reports of the United States Commissioners to the Paris Universal Exposition. It tells of seven French contraptions featuring heavy glass paperweights filled with water and white powder, which, when turned upside down, falls in imitation of a snowstorm. Eleven years later, the next exposition showcased both the 986-foot-tall Eiffel Tower and an inches-tall ceramic replica in a water-filled dome.

title: Bob Parsons Doesn't Do Subtle
description: You just sold 65 percent of GoDaddy.com, your Web site domain registry, to a private equity group led by Kohlberg Kravis Roberts for $2.25 billion. Do you think theyll want to tone down your ads featuring extremely busty models? Our advertising isnt edgy because Im an edgy guy. I am, all right, but our advertising is edgy because we stumbled on something that absolutely worked right out of the gate. The guys at K.K.R., Silver Lake and Technology Crossover Ventures are savvy businessmen. They like to do stuff that works. So if our advertising could be softened and still work, theyd be all for it. But none of our tests have ever proved that to be true.

title: Christopher Paolinis Dragon Lair
description: NAME: Christopher Paolini

title: Look of The Moment 2011 | Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Roger Williams: The Great Separationist
description: Should you find yourself in front of the Rhode Island Statehouse in Providence, look up and east, and tip your hat  real or imagined  to Roger Williams. A 35-foot statue of the Protestant theologian (1603?-1683) stands high in Prospect Terrace Park, with right hand extended, as if blessing the city he founded. The beatific image does not quite resemble its cantankerous model, for reasons that John M. Barry explores, if only partly, in his new biography, Roger Williams and the Creation of the American Soul.

title: Remembering Richard Holbrooke
description: In the spring of 1991 Strobe Talbott, who would become deputy secretary of state in the Clinton administration, visited Richard Holbrooke at his weekend home in Connecticut. After playing tennis and going for a swim, they had brunch at a neighbors house. But when Holbrooke saw a trampoline on the far side of a manicured lawn, he excused himself, hopped onto the canvas and insisted that Talbott join him. The result, Talbott recalls, was an exceedingly amateurish blend of gymnastic duet and duel  sometimes semicoordinated, sometimes dangerously competitive and constantly accompanied by talk, most of it coming from Richard. The subject, naturally, was world affairs.

title: How They Learned to Hate the Bomb
description: On the day after a nuclear bomb annihilates Washington, New Delhi, Islamabad, Seoul, Tel Aviv or Moscow, vaporizing and burning to death hundreds of thousands of people, our present complacency about nuclear proliferation will look like daylight madness. Even the chilliest of realists have shuddered at our capability for radioactive massacre. In 1977, the strategist George F. Kennan declared, No one is good enough, wise enough, steady enough, to have control over the volume of explosives that now rest in the hands of this country. Nuclear arms, he concluded, shouldnt exist at all.

title: The Facebook Auteur
description: Short stories are mightily resilient little creatures  like those bacteria they keep discovering in the hearts of volcanoes or at the bottoms of oceans. You can bury them in the dense, lifeless-looking pages of college literary magazines, and they keep flourishing. Or you can fill them with pulpish aliens and gun-toting molls, and they happily motor on, outlasting all those snobbish Pulitzer winners who once sneered at them (not to mention their rarefied panels of judges). Thats because stories dont need much to survive, just a situation worth pursuing, a character worthy of pursuing it and three magical Aristotelian ingredients: beginning, middle and end. Suddenly, youve got a perfectly formed, self-determining little beast on your hands. It breathes. It breeds.

title: Greek Telephone Operator Sells Serbian Stake
description: BERLIN  OTE, the Greek telephone operator controlled by Deutsche Telekom, agreed on Friday to sell its 20 percent stake in Telekom Serbia back to company, a state-owned former monopoly, for 397 million euros, or about $512 million, in cash and dividends.

title: Like Clockwork, Dick Clark Is to Ring in Another Year
description: Dick Clarks countdown to the New Year used to begin before dawn on New Years Eve, when he would appear on Good Morning America and then, by satellite, on dozens of local newscasts and talk shows. Hed head home, eat something and hurry back to Times Square for Dick Clarks New Years Rockin Eve.

title: Talking Bout Meh Generation
description: As copy editors, we see the magazines articles undergo hundreds of changes as they mature from raw text to publication. Some changes clear up the facts a little, some clear up the language  some are so subtle as to hardly be noticeable; others so drastic that, frankly, they are confounding (We have to change dozens to millions  or Lets change Rasputin to the Captain and Tennille. )

title: New Rules for the New Year
description: NEW YEARS resolutions are the original New Rules. Except that resolutions are usually self-oriented: I am going to lose weight this year. My New Years resolution, by the way, is to do the ones from 75; I made a lot of good ones that year. I was 19, and thought I could polish them off by age 20. Alas, Im a little behind.

title: Weekend Fare
description: A New Years Eve dinner will be served on Saturday at most restaurants, with an early seating and a later, usually pricier, one. Following are some restaurants with available seats offering various specials; some have been reviewed in The Times. Many places throw in a complimentary glass of Champagne, but be sure to make a reservation to save a spot.

title: Fugue for History and Memory
description: The Tree of Life, Terrence Malicks fifth feature, the winner of the Palme dOr at Cannes in May, encompasses the entirety of time, from the creation of the universe to a celestial vision of the afterlife. It is hardly surprising that the movies sweep and ambition have figured so prominently in discussions of it, whether as sources of wonder or bafflement. The dinosaurs that appear briefly and memorably about 30 minutes into the film have become conversation pieces and symbols of Mr. Malicks audacity, even as their peculiar grace earned them an honored place in the impressively crowded cinema menagerie of 2011, alongside the loyal terrier of The Artist and the noble steed of War Horse.

title: TimesCast | December 30, 2011
description: Republican presidential candidates head into the Iowa caucuses | A look back at the birthplace of Occupy Wall Street.

title: Gingrich Sheds Tears in Meeting With Iowa Mothers
description: DES MOINES  Newt Gingrich openly cried on Friday morning during an event with a group of mothers in an Iowa coffee shop as he described his own mothers illness.

title: Romneys Son Strays From the Playbook
description: 1:13 p.m. | Updated DES MOINES  One thing about having children campaign for you: They dont always stay on message.

title: Ann Jonas and Scott Ducharme
description: IN March 2008, Ann Jonas moved from Palm Beach, Fla., to Manhattan, newly divorced, 28 and shellshocked. It was not a nasty divorce (It was like, You take that, Ill take this, she said), but it was disorienting.

title: F.C.C. to Look at Verizons $2 Convenience Fee
description: 3:01 p.m. | Updated  Adding analyst comment and lack of response from Verizon Wireless.

title: Alan Bennetts Tales of Vice
description: On Sept. 24, 1986, in one of his published diaries, Alan Bennett  the British dramatist, screenwriter and master of the long short story  sighs over a spate of mixed reviews: Well, one must take it like a man, he supposes. Which means that one must take it like a woman  i.e., without complaint. Admiration for female stoicism abounds in Bennetts work, along with a desire, where possible, to engineer overdue rewards for heroines who have done too much suffering in silence. In Miss Fozzard Finds Her Feet, he makes sure his main character gets more than pedestrian relief from her new podiatrist. And in The Clothes They Stood Up In, he nudges the uncomplaining Mrs. Ransome toward rejuvenation after a mysterious performance-art burglar snatches and then reassembles, in some other place entirely, every single object from the flat she shares with her tiresome husband.

title: Campaigning Continues in Iowa
description: Most of the Republican candidates campaigned across Iowa before the Jan. 3 caucuses, while Jon Huntsman concentrated on New Hampshire.

title: Appeals Court Upholds C-Murders Murder Conviction
description: The rapper C-Murder has failed to convince a Louisiana appeals court that his conviction on a second-degree murder charge was flawed, The Associated Press reported. In 2009 a jury found C-Murder, whose real name is Corey Miller, guilty of fatally shooting a 16-year-old fan during a fight in 2002 at a nightclub in the New Orleans area.

title: A Family Coming Apart at the Seams
description: AS the Iranian director Asghar Farhadis brilliant fifth film, A Separation, begins, a husband and wife, married for 14 years, squirm uncomfortably in their wooden chairs inside a family court. They are arguing their case for divorce to a magistrate who is heard but not seen. As they gaze into the camera, their faces contorted with anger, the viewer is put in the judges shoes.

title: Christie Warns Iowans to Back Romney
description: WEST DES MOINES, Iowa  Clad only in a suit, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey braved wind, rain and near freezing temperatures to push Mitt Romney, warning, I will be back, if caucus-goers dont turn out for him.

title: Walgreen Girds for Fight Over Customers
description: The Walgreen Company, bracing for potentially hundreds of thousands of customers to switch to another pharmacy when the new year begins on Sunday, is introducing a national plan it hopes will minimize customer disruption from its contract battle with its pharmacy benefits manager, Express Scripts.

title: Jon Banner Returns as Producer of ABCs This Week
description: When George Stephanopoulos returns to ABCs Sunday morning public affairs program This Week in January, one of his former executive producers will be back in his earpiece.

title: Board Named for World Trade Center Sites Planned Arts Center
description: A performing arts center planned for the World Trade Center site has taken a step forward with the naming of a board by the National September 11 Memorial & Museum foundation. On the list are the developers Larry Silverstein and John E. Zuccotti; Christy Ferer, founder and chief executive of the Vidicom video company; Julie Menin, chairwoman of Community Board 1; and Zenia Mucha, executive vice president of the Walt Disney Company.

title: Investigation Into MF Global Expected to Heat Up
description: When customer money disappeared from MF Global over Halloween weekend, it seemed implausible the cash would remain at large come New Years Day.

title: Footsteps to Follow in the Coming Year
description: One of the best, most revelatory money maxims is one that comes from Tim Maurer, an author, radio host and financial planner in Hunt Valley, Md.

title: Henry to Arsenal Is Days Away
description: It is not quite official, but Thierry Henry appears to be only a jersey-fitting away from rejoining Arsenal on a short-term, two-month loan from the Red Bulls of Major League Soccer.

title: Dont Forget: He Acts, Too
description: IF there is one facet of Brad Pitt that could be considered somewhat obscure, it may be  oddly enough  his acting career. For much of his two decades in the spotlight, since his breakthrough as a ripped, sweet-talking grifter in Thelma and Louise (1991) and even more so since Mr. and Mrs. Smith (2005), a movie that spawned a tabloid cottage industry, Mr. Pitt has been a star first and an actor second. His every move  on film sets and red carpets and humanitarian missions, often with a hard-to-miss entourage that includes his partner, Angelina Jolie, and their six children  provides endless fodder for the celebrity media. But the Brad Pitt on screen remains surprisingly elusive.

title: Your Financial Resolutions for 2012
description: In this weekends Your Money column, I rounded up some of my favorite characters from my reporting this year and asked them what they planned to do differently in their financial lives in 2012.

title: A Moderate Official at Risk in a Fracturing Iraq
description: BAGHDAD

title: At Rose Parade, Surfing Dogs and Eight-Wheel-Drive on a Float for the Record Books
description: The Natural Balance Pet Foods float, an entry in the Rose Parade on Monday, is, in theory, a vehicle. But with a beach, a pond, landscaping, an overall length of about 119 feet and approximately 110,000 pounds of heft, it can almost pass for a small country.

title: Photo Replay: Dec.30
description: A view of the day in sports included a skiing tournament in Oberstdorf, Germany, and the semifinals of the Mubadala World Tennis Championship in Abu Dhabi.

title: Alien Laborer in the Hollywood Factory
description: I live on another planet, fortunately, and we do things differently there, Tilda Swinton says over tea and a slight case of the sniffles at the Bowery Hotel in the East Village. Somehow this does not seem a revelatory confession coming from this singular and singular-looking actress. She naturally radiates a certain otherworldliness, as of a creature who has just been zapped to Earth from a distant galaxy and has not yet discovered how to manipulate the tools of ordinary human discourse.

title: A Time to Talk Trash
description: Talk can be cheap, but when it comes to the Giants' Brandon Jacobs, it's a much-needed boost heading into a must-win game against the Dallas Cowboys, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Video: A Time to Talk Trash for the Giants
description: Talk can be cheap, but when it comes to the Giants Brandon Jacobs, its a much-needed boost heading into a must-win game against the Dallas Cowboys, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Those Dang Revenooers: Virginia Agency Unhappy With Discoverys Moonshiners
description: Once again, a reality television show has viewers asking whether its real or unreal. This time, the authorities are answering with a no.

title: A Wig to Match Every Look
description: Born in Bern, Switzerland, Susanne Bartsch has been a night-life impresario in New York since 1986, founding the Love Ball, which raised $2.5 million to fight AIDS and H.I.V. from 1989 to 1992. She currently oversees a Vandam party at Greenhouse nightclub on Sundays. Ms. Bartsch has a son, Bailey, 17, with David Barton, of David Barton Gyms.  BEE-SHYUAN CHANG

title: 3 Experts Weigh In On 2012
description: Predictions for the economy and markets for 2012 have been bleak, and 2011 was much worse than expected. There may not be much to celebrate this New Years Eve.

title: The Winner Is ... Wait! New Rule!
description: LOS ANGELES

title: When Doctors Face Death
description: A telling essay about the way doctors choose to die, as opposed to the way most of their patients will, appeared on a Web site called Zocalo Public Square last month and has been ricocheting around the Internet ever since  to its authors astonishment.

title: Pakistani Panel to Investigate Memo
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans Supreme Court ordered an investigation on Friday into a controversial memo, purportedly drafted by the civilian government shortly after an American raid killed Osama bin Laden, that solicited help in stopping a possible coup by the humiliated Pakistani military.

title: At Mayors Interfaith Breakfast, Some Respectful Dissents
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs annual interfaith breakfast is typically a feel-good event, a chance for the mayor and other city officials to mingle with representatives of many religions.

title: Reservations on Studying in Egypt
description: IN recent years, the Middle East has become an increasingly popular spot for American college students on study-abroad programs, choosing Arab over French or German and the dusty capitals of Damascus and Cairo over Berlin or Madrid.

title: A Second Chance for Christmas Trees
description: The gifts have long since been opened, the turkey leftovers are gone, and the eggnog has been drunk. For those who purchased real Christmas firs or pines, the tree may be looking a bit droopy or thin. How to dispose of it?

title: On Gay Rights, Obama Lets Surrogates Lead
description: HONOLULU  President Obama has long relied on his oratorical gifts to ease him through tricky political situations. But on the emotionally charged issue of gay rights, Mr. Obama has been content recently to let his lieutenants do the talking. And they have said some striking things.

title: Egypt Vows to End Crackdown on Nonprofits
description: WASHINGTON  Egypts military rulers privately signaled a retreat on Friday in a crackdown on organizations that promote democracy and human rights, senior American officials said, even as the authorities in Cairo tried to discredit the organizations with accusations of suspicious activity.

title: Rangers Waive Sean Avery
description: For the second time this season and four days before the Rangers take the stage in the Winter Classic, the Rangers waived the controversial forward and fan favorite Sean Avery.

title: Modestly Performing Repeats on Networks, Moonshiners Makes Gains on Cable
description: A repeat of The Big Bang Theory was enough to give CBS an easy ratings victory (in total viewers and in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic) on Thursday, according to Nielsen data. All of the networks had a full slate of repeats, resulting in lower viewership totals across the broadcast board, but the audience for CBSs geeky comedy has proved to be very loyal, even for previously aired episodes. It still drew 10.2 million total viewers Thursday night, losing less than a third of its fall live audience average of 14.7 million for new episodes.

title: Fisker Recalling 239 Karma Plug-In Hybrids for Fire Hazard
description: Fisker Automotive is recalling all 239 of its 2012 Karma luxury plug-in hybrid cars because of a fire hazard, according to a report filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. Prices on the 2012 model start at $103,000, including the destination charge.

title: New Years Recipes to Bring Good Fortune
Lens: The New Plastic Road
description: Lens: The New Plastic Road

title: Bill Cunningham | Sea Life
description: Bill Cunninghams favorite holiday window was the underwater scene fashioned in mosaic tiles, work of Brett Day Windham. By coincidence, pav mermaid dresses were popular this fall.

title: For Readers, the Neighbors Touched a Nerve
description: IM always intrigued, when looking back over the year, to discover which columns seemed to set off the greatest debate and which touched the rawest nerve. Often the two arent the same.

title: Analyzing the Analysts Investment Predictions
description: IM not the only one who has seen prognosticators through the years make a wrong call  Dow 36,000! Dow 5,000! But I cant recall any of them being asked to explain months later why they slipped up.

title: "Whoops"
description: A 30-second ad by the pro-Romney super PAC Restore Our Future.

title: Paul Voters Not Necessarily Party Voters
description: DES MOINES  With Representative Ron Paul performing solidly in Republican presidential polls  and near the top in Iowa  a recurring question nags at political wise-guys: Will the Texas libertarians corps of loyal and energized supporters be an asset to an eventual Republican nominee?

title: Notes from a Blogging Discomfort Zone
description: As 2011 draws to an end, its worth reviewing my goals for this blog and my view that humanitys fast-spreading web of communication tools  despite plenty of growing pains  is bound to improve the human condition, including the quality of our relationship with our environment. (I use lower case for the word web because I include the explosion of mobile telephone connectivity along with the World Wide Web.)

title: Making Marvels: A World for Hugo
description: WHEN it comes to the design of his films, the director Martin Scorsese is known for detailed clarity. The sets for his recent period films  Shutter Island, The Aviator, Gangs of New York  have each evoked a specific time and place thanks to his collaboration with the production designer Dante Ferretti, who supervises the design and construction of the sets. He has been part of the equation on almost every Scorsese films since The Age of Innocence (1993), recreating bygone eras through meticulous research.

title: Ricardianoid Arguments
description: Well, I wasnt going to say more about Lucas and his smear of Christy Romer, but since Brad DeLong has weighed in, let me make one more entry.

title: Pain in the Periphery
description: Via Philip Lane, a nice paper comparing the crisis responses of Ireland, Iceland, and Latvia (pdf). It develops at greater length some themes Ive been trying to lay out, notably the fact that nobody has succeeded in achieving large nominal wage cuts.

title: State Inquiry Finds Abuse at Center for Disabled
description: Nearly 20 percent of the staff at a prison-like center for the developmentally disabled in upstate New York are on administrative leave amid allegations of abuse or neglect, according to a new report from state Inspector General Ellen N. Bibens office.

title: 2011 Red Carpet Hits, Misses and Risks
description: Here is a rundown of the best, the worst and the risk takers from 2011. Not every risk taken panned out, but all were discussion-worthy.

title: A Man of Many Disguises, and Even More Jokes
description: HBO has had a crush on the Australian comedian and television auteur Chris Lilley for a while now. It showed his mini-series Summer Heights High in 2008 and publicly expressed a desire to work with him directly. Well, mission accomplished: HBO is a producer, along with the Australian Broadcasting Corporation, of Mr. Lilleys latest project, the 12-episode Angry Boys. And as they say, be careful what you wish for.

title: Saying Ciao Bye-Bye to Old Borders
description: WHEN giants like Ingmar Bergman, Federico Fellini and Akira Kurosawa still roamed the earth, foreign-language films tended to adhere to certain guidelines, which helped American audiences know what to expect from them. More often than not directors and screenwriters were working in their native tongues, addressing some aspect of their society or culture, and shooting with a cast that shared their background.

title: The Year Governments Lost Their Credibility
description: For most of 2011, it appeared that the year would be decent, if not particularly interesting, for investors.

title: Obama Waits Before Asking for Increase in Debt Limit
description: HONOLULU  President Obama agreed on Friday to delay a request to Congress to expand the governments borrowing authority by $1.2 trillion, allowing lawmakers time to return from recess and register their views on it.

title: Verizon Drops Plan for $2 Fee on Some Bill Payments
description: 4:05 p.m. | Updated  Adding background and analyst comment.

title: Don Mueller, Giants Outfielder, Is Dead at 84
description: Don Mueller, the New York Giants outfielder who was known as Mandrake the Magician for his ability to slap a hit through an infield hole and who did just that to help set up Bobby Thomsons 1951 pennant-winning homer against the Brooklyn Dodgers, died Wednesday in Chesterfield, Mo. He was 84.

title: Standing Out and Blending In at Stanford
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  John McEnroe joked that he blended in too well as a student at Stanford, arriving as one of the top tennis players in the world and still struggling to meet young women. Condoleezza Rice said it was difficult for her to stand out too much at the university, where she is a political science professor, because another former secretary of state, George P. Shultz, has an office right down the hall. Tiger Woods fondly recalled a friend in his dormitory who built his own computer and the hours of late-night conversation and debate.

title: In Search of Gambels Quail
description: Jennifer Gee, a biologist at the Claremont University Consortium and the University of California, Riverside, writes from the tropical dry forest near lamos, Mexico, where she is studying Callipepla quail in collaboration with Jennifer Calkins.

title: Queens Businessman Guilty of Defrauding Bank
description: Courtney Dupree, a former University of North Carolina basketball player who hosted a 2008 fund-raiser for Barack Obama at his Manhattan apartment, was found guilty on Friday of using accounting tricks to defraud a bank of millions of dollars.

title: Ryan Backs His Offensive Deputy
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  As Rex Ryan sees it, Brian Schottenheimer deserves a head-coaching opportunity this off-season. And if that opportunity never comes?

title: Big Ticket | Sold for $10,800,000
description: A sprawling 4,600-square-foot, five-bedroom condominium overlooking Union Square that sold for $10.8 million was the most expensive transaction of the week, according to city records.

title: When Investors Rush In, and Out, Together
description: It seems that anxious investors in these troubled economic times are seeking safety in crowds.

title: Those Very Models of Modern Outlaws Are Back
description: Long before it became Peter Gelbs practice to ring in the New Year at the Metropolitan Opera with a new production  or even, this year, a world premiere  Gilbert and Sullivans Pirates of Penzance was performed for the first time on Dec. 31, 1879, at the Fifth Avenue Theater in New York.

title: Looking Back at the Year in Sports
description: The womens soccer game cautiously deemed the American sports moment of 2011. The loss of the 1960s Dallas Cowboys receiver-turned-novelist Peter Gent. An unanticipated, un-Canadian riot after a home-game loss in Vancouver. The beard known lovingly as the scruff of legend.

title: Daylong Fire on Russian Submarine Took Hundreds of Workers to Extinguish
description: MOSCOW  The authorities in Russia marshaled more than 400 firefighters and 170 emergency workers to extinguish a fire on Friday that had raged for almost a day on the hull of a nuclear submarine in dry dock near the northern port of Murmansk. Seven sailors and two emergency workers were treated for smoke inhalation.

title: Even in Short Season, Rough Start Doesnt Mean Doom
description: The N.B.A. season has begun with a flurry, and three playoff-caliber teams are still staring at their schedules wide-eyed and winless. The Boston Celtics, the Dallas Mavericks and the Memphis Grizzlies have dropped a combined eight games to start the season, and with just 63 games remaining (or 64, in Memphiss case) before the postseason begins, its logical to say that all three teams would need to find themselves rather quickly.

title: The Nocturnalists Travels
description: A review of the nighttime antics of boldface names of New York as reported by Sarah Maslin Nir and a small army of correspondents.

title: Booming Sales for the Brands Moguls Desire
description: IF you want to stir things up at an Occupy Wall Street encampment, mention that Bentleys and Rolls-Royces are selling like truffle-infused hotcakes. But executives at those storied British brands say their success is not just a 1 percent solution; brisk sales of ultraluxury models, you see, bode well for the masses that drive Chevys.

title: A Year of Solid Gains, and an Outlook for More Ahead
description: DERAILED by a crushing earthquake and tsunami in March, Japanese carmakers will no doubt be glad to put 2011 behind them.

title: Critics Picks of 2011: Making Sense of a More Sensible Year
description: STEADY growth and building momentum may not be the ideal ingredients of sexy headlines, but the cars we drove in 2011 still offered plenty to be optimistic about.

title: Your 2012 Investment Plan
description: Paul Sullivan, in his Wealth Matters column this week, goes back to a group of analysts and advisers who had agreed at the start of 2011 to not only make investment recommendations but also to assess each quarter how they were doing.

title: As Spain Acts to Cut Deficit, Regional Debts Add to Woe
description: FIGUERES, Spain  Facing a wider than expected budget deficit, Spains new government announced a $19.3 billion package of tax increases and spending cuts on Friday and admitted that the countrys finances were probably even worse because of overspending by the autonomous regions.

title: Gary Bass talks about Philip Taubmans book ThePartnership: Five Cold Warriors and Their Quest to Ban the Bomb; Louisa Thomas discusses Some of My Lives, a memoir by Rosamond Bernier; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.
description: This week, Gary Bass talks about Philip Taubmans book ThePartnership: Five Cold Warriors and Their Quest to Ban the Bomb; Louisa Thomas discusses Some of My Lives, a memoir by Rosamond Bernier; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

title: Warmth in a Savory Scone
description: THERES a dichotomy when it comes to cooking in January, a pull between the wintry urge for rich, hearty foods that warm the body and soothe the soul, and the opposing desire for eating lightly, healthfully and penitently after a holiday season of delightful excess.

title: The Fertile Ground of the Garden State
description: A recent article in our magazine discussed the work of the artist Shea Hembrey, who fabricated an astounding catalog filled with the work of 100 artists of his own creation. The article by Sara Corbett discusses Hembreys life, his work and, briefly, his locale while completing the catalog: New Jersey. Frenchtown, to be exact. For me, as a native of the state, this small part of the story filled me with pride. The Garden State is so often mocked for everything from its accent to its aroma that my ears perk up whenever its mentioned without contempt. Perhaps because of this proclivity, Ive noticed a handful of artists projects recently that have been influenced or directly inspired by the state, even if nowhere near it. Here are a few of my favorites:

title: Setting a Scene With Words
description: The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo

title: Ads and 30-Minute Special Will Promote Gingrich
description: 10:03 p.m. | Updated  DES MOINES His cash-short campaign unable to buy much advertising of its own, Newt Gingrichs well-financed allies are coming to his rescue in Iowa, securing large chunks of airtime across the state.

title: Iowa Update: Slow and Steady May Win the Race for Romney
description: Mitt Romney has led Ron Paul in five of the seven Iowa caucus polls released since Christmas. A sixth one has them tied, leaving only one survey that still has Mr. Paul ahead.

title: "Smiling"
description: A 60-second ad from Restore Our Future painting Newt Gingrich as less likely to beat President Obama than Mitt Romney.

title: The Tale of a Fashion Terrorist
description: THE novelist Alex Gilvarry was in the midst of a fashion emergency. Perusing the racks of Oak, a trendy boutique in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, he looked for a sweater to cover up a mustard stain on his plaid shirt. In a few hours, he would speak to M.F.A. students at Hunter College, his alma mater, and he didnt want to look like a slob.

title: "Happy"
description: This 60-second ad attacks Newt Gingrich's tenure as Speaker as well as his time in the private sector.

title: "Too Much"
description: Restore Our Future attacked both Newt Gingrich and Rick Perry in this ad.

title: "Plan"
description: A shorter version of the 60-second "Smiling" ad, "Plan" focuses more directly on Newt Gingrich's "baggage."

title: "Now You See the Problem"
description: Restore Our Future's first ad of the campaign season directly attacked President Obama.

title: 2011: Occupy Wall Street
description: Colin Moynihan, reporter, and Robert Stolarik, photographer look back at the birth of the Occupy Wall Street protests in Downtown Manhattan.

title: A Quick Rabbit Stew to Keep Winter at Bay
description: A STEW or braise is good any time of year, but it is especially welcome during the cold months. You dont mind heating up the kitchen a bit, and a pot gently simmering on the stove or in the oven is somehow reassuring and comforting.

title: Ron Paul's Stump Speech
description: Dec. 28, 2011 - Ron Paul's pitch to Iowa voters six days before before the Jan. 3 caucus.

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Turkey, Serbia, Myanmar and Iowa.

title: A Quick Way to Caramelize Onions
description: Caramelized onions loom large in this weeks column, adding a honeyed flavor to a recipe for savory scones.

title: Video Shows Monitors at Syrian Protests
description: As my colleagues Kareem Fahim and Hwaida Saad report, activists said that the Syrian security forces opened fire on several demonstrations on Friday, killing or injuring protesters in Hama and the Damascus suburb of Douma, despite the presence of Arab League monitors in the country.

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Turkey, Serbia, Myanmar and Iowa.

title: Architectural Eye Candy
description: WHEN it comes to areas awash in well-kept old buildings, Ridgewood, in west-central Queens, might not come to mind as quickly as, say, Brooklyn Heights.

title: Living In | Ridgewood, Queens
description: The neighborhood in west-central Queens is awash in well-kept old buildings.

title: Senate Republican Conferees Chosen
description: The Senate Republican leader announced Friday that he had chosen three of his colleagues to try to thrash out a bipartisan deal on payroll taxes, unemployment benefits and Medicare.

title: A Razor-Thin Decline in Stocks
description: It was a down year for the American stock market, at least by one measure. But the margin was tiny.

title: Looking Back at Occupy Wall Street
description: Colin Moynihan, a reporter, and Robert Stolarik, a photographer, who covered the Occupy Wall Street protests, look back at the the protest movement and its occupation of Zuccotti Park near Wall Street.

title: Book Review: Haitis Tragic History
description: In this Sundays Book Review, Adam Hochschild reviews Haiti: The Aftershocks of History, the new book by the scholar Laurent Dubois about that countrys violent birth and troubled existence . Mr. Hochschild writes:

title: City Rooms Greatest Hits, 2011 Edition
description: As 2011 comes to a close, City Room takes note of the stories that drew the highest number of readers. The scandal involving Representative Anthony D. Weiner, the Occupy Wall Street protests and Cathleen P. Blacks troubles during her brief tenure as schools chancellor figured prominently, as they did in our collection of  posts that attracted the most reader comments. The murder of Leiby Kletzky, an 8-year-old Brooklyn boy, also drew the attention of many readers.

title: Winners and Losers in Gundlach-TCW Face-Off
description: It looked like a war, sounded like a war, felt at times like a war.

title: The Circle Game
description: BE honest: would you rather look at Toby the Lab or the funeral of Kim Jong-il? I thought so.

title: Jerry Garretts Top 10 of 2011
description: Jerry Garrett, a longtime contributor to the Autos section, picks his favorites.

title: James G. Cobbs Top 10 of 2011
description: The editor of the Automobiles section offers his picks for the best models of the past year.

title: Lawrence Ulrichs Top 10 of 2011
description: Lawrence Ulrich, one of our contributing writers, selects 10 memorable cars from 2011.

title: Rising to the Challenge
description: Automakers were hindered by earthquakes and floods in 2011, but as December waned they were still on pace to sell 12.7 million vehicles in the U.S., up 9.5 percent from 11.6 million in 2010.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: An Upper East Side co-op, a Murray Hill duplex and a Brooklyn Heights co-op.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: A four-bedroom Tudor in South Orange, N.J., and a four-bedroom colonial in Harrison, N.Y.

title: A Hunk and His Boyfriend Are Being Split by Women
description: As much as you might understandably resent Clifford Streit  onetime glittering New York talent manager and social operator; producer, screenwriter and now stage director and playwright; and, according to his new plays program, the inspiration for the character Stanford Blatch on Sex and the City  you have to hand it to the man: his Him, at the Cherry Lane in the West Village, is largely one tasty bonbon.

title: Gingrich Hit Hard by Iowa Mailers
description: DES MOINES  A prevailing headline from Iowa has been the decline of Newt Gingrich, who attributes the fall in his standing to a barrage of negative advertisements from his Republican rivals and their allies. The criticism on television is pointed, but the attacks arriving by mail are even sharper and carry a far longer shelf life than a fleeting 30-second commercial.

title: Where to Count Down Till Midnight in Prague
description: Prague never disappoints when it comes to New Years Eve. Known as one of Central Europes biggest party hubs, the city is expecting thousands on Saturday, packing its large public squares for a night of gleeful indulgence and debauchery.

title: A Season Opens With a Touch of Bach, of Course
description: Bach is central to the mission of Bachanalia, the string ensemble founded in 1988 by the violinist Nina Beilina. His music is included on every program, no matter how varied.

title: Man Freed After Being Trapped in Times Building Elevator
description: A man was stuck in an elevator at The New York Times Building in Midtown Manhattan for an hour and a half on Friday morning, and firefighters had to break through the wall of the elevator shaft to free him. The man, who works at BT Americas Inc., an information technology company that leases office space on the 46th floor, was not injured and refused medical attention, the Fire Department and witnesses said.

title: Getting Away With an Error at a Team Event
description: The main team event at the Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional, which ended on Friday in Manhattan, is the Truscott Board-a-Match.

title: Answers From a Dog Expert: Part 2
description: The second set of answers to  readers questions  to our visiting expert, William Berloni, a theatrical animal trainer and the director of animal behavior for the Humane Society of New York.

title: A Home, Even If It Is Backstage
description: With the closing of Billy Elliot and The Addams Family, two crew members narrate a look at backstage spaces where they have spent much of their time.

title: Be Wary of Bobo, Sasquatch
description: These marauding Bigfoots must be stopped.

title: Republican Abandons Bid for Re-election
description: The redistricting battles playing out across the country have exacted another casualty.

title: Pairings: Lamb Braised With White Beans and Turnips
description: Bordeaux is more distinctive for wines than food, though its vinously sauced dishes are famous, as is its lamb from Pauillac. Indeed, while tasting, it struck me that succulent lamb, with slightly gamy fat, would best unpin the tight embrace of the 2008 vintage from the Mdoc. I braised chunks of lamb shoulder in wine, gave the dish an edge with lemon zest and white turnips, and added buttery white beans, a classic partner for lamb. If you like canned beans, rinse and drain them, and add in place of the cooked beans, with the turnips, during final simmering.

title: Ready or Not, 2008 Mdocs
description: ITS been a rough few years for Bordeaux in the United States. While bottles of its highest-end wines have gone for record prices in Asia, many American consumers, particularly younger wine lovers, have largely turned their backs on what for centuries was the worlds best-known and most prestigious wine region.

title: Backstage Veterans, Taking a Breath After Long Runs
description: No show runs forever, not even Cats.

title: Planting the Beach
description: American demand for year-round organic fruits and vegetables has incited a farming boom in the arid deserts of the Baja Peninsula in Mexico.

title: Street Style: Shearling and Fur
description: The best of readers street style for the week of Dec. 26.

title: A Rescue That Soured
description: At first, an agreement on a Greek rescue package was well received by markets, but as it became clear that the deal would not hold, stock markets became weaker and much more volatile.

title: Organic Agriculture May Be Outgrowing Its Ideals
description: TODOS SANTOS, Mexico  Clamshell containers on supermarket shelves in the United States may depict verdant fields, tangles of vines and ruby red tomatoes. But at this time of year, the tomatoes, peppers and basil certified as organic by the Agriculture Department often hail from the Mexican desert, and are nurtured with intensive irrigation.

title: #trendingnyc: The Week on Twitter
description: There was a day, perhaps, a few short years ago, when some Christmas traditionalists might have shunned the annual broadcast of The Yule Log, whose flames and seasonal soundtrack have for decades entranced New Yorkers with good cheer, if not warmth.

title: A Band Tradition, Both Carried On and Changed
description: Its not the ball drop, but for tens of thousands of people, Phishs annual run of shows at Madison Square Garden, which winds up on New Years Eve, is the more significant year-end event in Manhattan. Always an immediate sellout (but still available for pay per view at livephish.com), the concerts are both a tradition and a challenge. Phish has to provide its familiar joys but vary them enough to surprise fans who are obsessively meticulous tabulators.

title: Major Shale Gas Basins
description: With help from an independent contractor, federal energy officials have mapped the sites of some of the worlds largest shale gas resources. The study was limited to about 32 countries for which there was enough geological data to produce informed estimates.

title: For a Student Ensemble, Beethoven as One Trainer
description: Viewed from nearly any angle, the concert presented by the New York String Orchestra at Carnegie Hall on Wednesday evening seemed ideally tailored for an ensemble of outstanding young players like this institution, a venerable training seminar for aspirant players between 15 and 22, with a long history of success and a substantial list of celebrity alumni.

title: Dont-Miss Movies You Probably Missed
The Year in Puzzles, Part 1
description: SPECIAL POST  When I took over writing Wordplay from Jim Horne and Patrick Merrell almost a year ago, it took me a long time to explain to people what I was about to do.

title: New Years Eve Eve Music
description: As regular readers know, for me this has been the year of terrible macroeconomic policy and wonderful stuff from YouTube; music, especially as performed live, has been a big comfort in these very uncomfortable times.

title: In Libya, Modified Weapon Becomes Less of a Threat
description: An article in The New York Times last week discussed an American proposal to buy heat-seeking, shoulder-fired anti-aircraft missiles from the many armed groups and people in Libya who are holding them. Even the older variants of these missiles, known in nonproliferation circles as Manpads, are a threat to civilian aviation; the American proposal is intended to take as many of them as possible out of circulation, with hopes of trimming the number available on black markets.

title: More on How Stock Options Are Valued
description: Several readers wrote with additional questions about the tax treatment of stock options. Given the complexity of the issue, its not surprising that there might be confusion. So here is a more detailed explanation, using the example cited in the article, involving Sirius XM radio:

title: The Year in Puzzles, Part 2: The Puzzle Masters Turn
description: SPECIAL POST  Happy New Year, everyone!

title: At Iowa Restaurant, Some Patrons Not Wild About Santorum Visit
description: AMES, Iowa  Flat-screen TVs scattered around the Buffalo Wild Wings restaurant here were tuned to an important Iowa State University football game Friday when Rick Santorums pickup truck pulled around back.

title: Organic? Yes. Sustainable? Not Always.
description: More Americans are buying foods with the organic label, but the products are increasingly removed from the traditional organic ideal of locally grown on small farms in a way that protects the environment.

title: Story Time, Debunked
description: AS parents of a young child, we are in the enviable position of reading a lot of beautifully drawn and smartly written short stories that fall under the monikerchildrens books. And in doing so we have discovered one of the immutable truths of childhood: a book worth reading once is worth reading 17 times in a row.

title: Parental Quandary: Should You Bring a Child to an Adult Party?
description: This weeks parenting quandary is short but timely: Betsy (all names and identifying details in this quandary have, as always, been changed) is hosting an adult New Years Eve party, in a restaurant, of the fancy variety (to celebrate her recent marriage). She has a baby sitter arranged for her children, and although the invitation didnt specify, she thought it was understood from the venue and timing of the party that her guests would do the same.

title: The Best, and Worst, of the Rest
description: Here are a few models that, by varying degrees, failed to make our experts lists.

title: Hunt for Gas Hits Fragile Soil, and South Africans Fear Risks
description: KAROO, South Africa  When a drought dried up their wells last year, hundreds of farmers and their families flocked to local fairgrounds here to pray for rain, and a call went out on the regional radio station imploring South Africans to donate bottled water.

title: An American Dream  in Switzerland?
description: When most people think of Switzerland, they envision stunning landscapes and beautiful ski resorts. But the Swiss-born photographer Yann Gross captured another view of Switzerland, set in a part of the Rhone Valley most travelers bypass.

title: Week in Pictures for Dec. 30
description: Photographs from the past week in New York City and the region include the serenity of Christmas morning, a ship laying cables beneath the Hudson, and Central Parks increasing draw after dark.

title: Vanderbilt Quarterback Finds Help in Green Bay
description: NASHVILLE  The whole idea of following the path already traveled by his brother only goes so far with Jordan Rodgers.He may have done the championship belt touchdown celebration favored by his older sibling, Aaron, once, just to appease some of his teammates, but he aspires to have a more creative expression of himself the next time he reaches the end zone.

title: The Tragic Tale of the Deer Hunter
description: To the Editor:

title: A Queens Woman Begins Her Third Career, as a Designer
description: A dream can be deferred for only so long.

title: Week in Pictures for Dec. 30
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include holiday window displays, the laying of an underwater power cable beneath the Hudson and jogging after dark in Central Park.

title: After Outcry, Verizon Abandons $2 Fee
description: Verizon Wireless bowed to a torrent of criticism on Friday and reversed a day-old plan to impose a $2 bill-paying fee that would have applied to only some customers.

title: A Lion of the Pulpit, Aging Now, Has a Message for New Generations
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Several hours before the other ministers were to arrive, a young preacher named Reginald High drove up to a tidy town house here, the home in retirement of the greatest black churchman in America, the Rev. Gardner C. Taylor. At 93, after a lifetime of religious and political vigor, Dr. Taylor was finally bending to the ravages of age. He said he had been thinking a lot lately of the biblical Jacob  old and weak, leaning on his staff, yet still worshiping God.

title: For Collectors, Saab Parts Likely to Remain Available
description: The last few decades have been rough for the few remaining automotive iconoclasts and nonconformists in the United States. In the 1970s, Citron  which had been the patron saint of these types  left our shores, followed by Peugeot and Alfa Romeo in the early and mid-1990s. The final blow may have come with the recent announcement of the end of Saab as a going concern.

title: Postcards From the Car Beat, 2011
description: The year 2011 threw some of everything at this automotive reporter, from a visit to Thomas Edisons garage in West Orange, N.J., to a Lamborghini drive on the Pacific Coast Highway. Behind each moment is an untold story.

title: Thief With a Sweet Tooth Likes Coney Island in the Winter
description: This was easier than taking candy from a baby. There was no baby.

title: Walgreen Begins to Offer a Special Prescription Plan
description: Walgreen is introducing a national plan it hopes will minimize customer disruption from its contract battle over payments with its pharmacy benefits manager, Express Scripts. For customers who want to remain, Walgreens plan includes a special discount in January to customers for its prescriptions savings club. Though those enrolled in drug plans managed by Express Scripts will have better coverage and pay less by using another pharmacy, Gregory D. Wasson, Walgreens chief executive, said the discounts Walgreen would offer through its prescription savings club would be competitive on generic drugs and most therapeutic categories.

title: Whirlpool Files Antidumping Complaint on Washers
description: Whirlpool asked the United States to impose duties on washing machine imports made by LG Electronics and Samsung Electronics, saying the two companies sell washers made in Mexico and South Korea for less than the products fair value, undermining competition and threatening American jobs. Whirlpool also sought countervailing duties against imports from South Korea, saying that countrys government provided unfair subsidies. LG strongly rejects any suggestion that it has sold clothes washers at dumped prices or that it has been unfairly subsidized, a company spokesman, John Taylor, said. Ethan Rasiel, a Samsung spokesman, declined to comment.

title: Romney Says He Expects to Be the G.O.P. Nominee
description: MERRIMACK, N.H.  Mitt Romney said Friday night that he expected to win the Republican nomination for president.

title: A Jets Victory Would Let the Squirming Begin
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  As powerless as the Jets feel now, forced to rely on the kindness of others in order to qualify for the postseason, just imagine what their emotions could be on Sunday evening.

title: Neediest Cases | Bertha Astor
description: Bertha Astor worked as a laboratory technician and then as an office administrator for years. But her passion is fashion, and she now hopes to emulate Ralph Lauren.

title: Housing Aids the Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: War and Peace Trends
description: To the Editor:

title: Prosecutors Stand Accused
description: To the Editor:

title: A Collapse at a Poultry Shop Exposes a Rift Among Neighbors
description: Some of the neighbors had been heard to express the wish over the years that a divine hand would smite Yeung Sun Live Poultry.

title: And the Nominees Should Be...
description: The critics make their Oscar choices.

title: Eva Zeisel, Ceramic Artist and Designer, Dies at 105
description: Eva Zeisel, a ceramic artist whose elegant, eccentric designs for dinnerware in the 1940s and 50s helped to revolutionize the way Americans set their tables, died on Friday in New City, N.Y. She was 105.

title: 19 Car Fires Are Set Around Hollywood
description: LOS ANGELES  The first car fire began on Friday shortly after midnight, in the underground parking garage of a West Hollywood apartment building. Three minutes later, the Fire Department received reports of a similar fire just blocks away. Then another, and another.

title: A Pizzeria With Dishes That Go Beyond the Pie
description: POLPETTINA, a tiny storefront pizzeria with youthful enthusiasm and Brooklynesque charm, has won serious devotees since it opened in the Crestwood section of Eastchester last March. Its a pizzeria at heart, but what turns heads are the sparkling salads, the way-above-average pasta dishes, a profoundly good roasted chicken half, and trimly tailored desserts.

title: Paul Assails Rivals Criticism of His Policy on Iran
description: DES MOINES  Representative Ron Paul of Texas assailed criticism of his opposition to United States military involvement abroad, saying he fears an overreaction to worries about Irans nuclear program could lead to war.

title: Sex Education Gets Directly to Youths, via Text
description: While heading to class last year, Stephanie Cisneros, a Denver-area high school junior, was arguing with a friend about ways that sexually transmitted diseases might be passed along.

title: Toward Clearer Bank Fees
description: To the Editor:

title: Named for a Car and Following Its Lead
description: THE first thing diners notice at Cafe Giulia, in Lakeville, is the little Italian race car parked on the lawn out front  a good landmark, but an even better teaser for what to expect inside.

title: Tasting Rooms, Far Away
description: One Long Island vintner has joined the numbers of those with tasting rooms at locations away from the wineries, and another is planning to open such a satellite as well.

title: Italian-Asian Fusion, Recognized at First Bite
description: OPENING a restaurant within a specialty food market is not an original idea, but it is still an attention-getter. In the case of DoraNonnie Tapas and Wine Bar @ Bernards in Glen Head, which opened at the end of September, the attention is warranted. This is not a casual cafe where shoppers grab a quick sandwich amid the merchandise; the handsome dining space, where creative fare is served, is separated from the store by draperies and Japanese screens.

title: Rutgers Goes Deep at Yankee Stadium to Seal Victory in Pinstripe Bowl
description: Iowa State had closed within a touchdown in the fourth quarter, and Rutgers needed a big play from its biggest receiver. Mohamed Sanu has been the Scarlet Knights most productive receiver, but he is a shrimp compared with the redshirt freshman Brandon Coleman.

title: Kurds Protest Airstrike Killing Dozens in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL  Kurdish separatist banners in red, yellow and green draped the coffins of 35 Turkish civilians and fluttered among mourning crowds on Friday, a day after the Turkish authorities admitted that airstrikes in northern Iraq intended to kill Kurdish militants had instead claimed the lives of young smugglers.

title: Dispute Over Evaluations Imperils Grants for Schools
description: Negotiations between New York Citys Education Department and union officials over a new evaluation system for teachers and principals broke down on Friday, jeopardizing roughly $60 million in federal grants designated to help 33 struggling schools across the city.

title: Sri Lankas Ghosts of War
description: Colombo, Sri Lanka

title: Yankees Re-Sign Andruw Jones
description: The 2012 Yankees are shaping up to look an awful lot like the 2011 version after the team reached a deal to bring back Andruw Jones.

title: Police Tactic: Keeping Crime Reports Off the Books
description: Jill Korber walked into a drab police station in Queens in July to report that a passing bicyclist had groped her two days in a row. She left in tears, frustrated, she said, by the response of the first officer she encountered.

title: At the Gym Site, Food for Fitness Lovers
description: NEW YEARS resolutions take many forms, but a good number have to do with eating better and getting more exercise. Both goals can be pursued at health clubs with on-site cafes that serve food geared to fitness-conscious patrons.

title: A New Hampshire Focus for Huntsman
description: BOSCAWEN, N.H.  Jon M. Huntsman Jr. glanced around at New Hampshires barren political landscape. Its wonderfully empty, he said with a grin.

title: Michigans Robinson Draws Comparisons to Vick
description: NEW ORLEANS  Virginia Tech Coach Frank Beamer glanced up at the bright lights of the Mercedes-Benz Superdome, lost in a memory.

title: Just Glad to Be Here
description: The first thing Delilah Santos did four years ago after being diagnosed with cervical cancer was to buy the most comfortable bed she could find. If I was going to die, I wanted to die in the best bed ever, said Ms. Santos, who is 50. The diagnosis took her on a mental roller-coaster ride, she said, exacerbating a mental illness that had already left her unable to keep a permanent job.

title: A Citys Hockey Identity Distilled Into One Man
description: PHILADELPHIA  From Citizens Bank Park, which will be packed with fans clad in orange and black Flyers sweaters for Winter Classic weekend, to the municipal rinks where local kids play for free, this is undeniably a hockey town.

title: Lottery Numbers
Big Coals Bidding
description: It is a national disgrace that the strongest supporters of tougher mine safety concede that it will likely take another disaster before lawmakers will be willing to buck Big Coal and pass desperately needed safety legislation. This is out of mind until another explosion takes place, Representative George Miller, a California Democrat and sponsor of reform legislation, grimly predicted.

title: A Painting and a Bond of Questionable Authenticity
description: He introduces himself by listing his credentials as a curator and general art expert. She serves him weenie rolls with Velveeta. He can detect an art forgery at 50 paces. She has a painting of a red-nosed clown on her wall. So of course this match is meant to be.

title: Groups Ads Rip at Gingrich as Romney Stands Clear
description: DES MOINES  The attacks began three weeks ago and have not let up since: Television ad after television ad slamming Newt Gingrich for having more baggage than the airlines, for being fined by Congress for ethics violations, for his position on illegal immigration, even for admitting that he has made mistakes on the campaign trail.

title: As Gingrich Reels From Attack Ads, Some Aides Suggest Fighting Back
description: DES MOINES  Alarmed by Newt Gingrichs decline in the polls in the face of a fusillade of negative advertisements, some senior aides and grass-roots supporters have suggested that he reverse course and fight fire with fire, fearing for the future of his candidacy if he does not.

title: A Sad, Fearful, Raging Year
description: Camp Wood, near Munfordville, Ky., Dec. 31, 1861

title: Egypts Obstructionist Generals
description: Egypts military council continues to demonstrate its utter contempt for the citizens who risked their lives to end President Hosni Mubaraks authoritarian rule. In the latest outrage, security forces on Thursday shut down three American-financed democracy-building groups in Cairo and as many as six other nonprofit organizations. Armed with automatic weapons, troops provided no warrants and, in some cases, detained the groups employees for hours. They confiscated computers and files and sealed the doors when they left.

title: Giving Voice to the Legions Buried in a Potters Field
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y.

title: China: Villages Ballots Canceled
description: Provincial officials in Guangdong Province have canceled the results of recent elections in the seaside fishing village of Wukan, which evicted all its Communist Party officials this month over a land dispute, according to the state news agency. The cancellation of the election results was an attempt to appease the villagers, who have complained about the corruption of village officials and say they want genuine elections where they can put into power people they trust. Villagers protests received prominent coverage by the foreign and Hong Kong news media after they took over governance of the village this month following the death of a village advocate in police custody. It is unclear when or how new party officials will be selected to govern Wukan.

title: At Times, the History Is in the Margins
description: Holbrook, N.Y.

title: Up-to-Date Partners for the Orchestral
description: CAUGHT up in rehearsals, recordings and performances, the hip-hop artist Dominic Shodekeh Talifero  known professionally by his middle name  has little time these days to reflect on his improbable rise from the street to the orchestral stage.

title: Holiday on Monday: New Years Day (Observed)
description: NEW YORK

title: A Turbulent Year in Perspective
description: While the year had fewer days with big market moves than during the 2008-9 financial crisis, it was still among the more volatile of the last three decades.

title: Amid Inquiry, Comptroller Ends $800 Cap on Donations
description: In 2010, shortly after becoming New Yorks first Asian-American elected to citywide office, John C. Liu, the comptroller, made a pledge underscoring his confidence as he looked toward the future: He would not accept donations greater than $800, an amount well below the legal limit, reflecting the Chinese belief in eight as a lucky number.

title: Montefiore Reaches Contract Accord With Nurses
description: Nurses at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx settled their contract Friday, joining several other large New York City hospitals that recently reached their own agreements and bringing labor peace  or at least a truce  on the brink of the new year.

title: This Revolution Isnt Being Televised
description: Washington

title: Taking to the Airwaves
description: Restore Our Future has spent $2.8 million and counting to blanket the airwaves in Iowa, where the first votes in the 2012 presidential contest will be cast Jan. 3.

title: Umenyiora Preparing to Return for Finale
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Osi Umenyiora is known among his Giants teammates for his almost reclusive weekly schedule. That plan has taken on a different dimension this season: Umenyiora has not been practicing, or playing, because of injuries.

title: Facing Consequences of Success in Bid to Save a Goose
description: WILLOWS, Calif.  These are good days to be a snow goose on the Pacific flyway. The water in the rice fields is at an ideal depth for snacking on marsh plants. A bit of grain is left over from the harvest around the Northern California city of Chico, which is gearing up for its annual Snow Goose Festival.

title: Saturday: One on a Liszt List
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Can you believe it? Here we are, at the very last puzzle of 2011. One more Saturday stumper to push through. Lets get to work.

title: Moving in Lockstep
description: Prices for stocks, bonds and commodities prices have been increasingly moving in the same direction in recent months.

title: The Damage of 2011
description: After they took power in January, the hard-line Republicans who dominate the House reached for a radical overhaul of American government, hoping to unravel the social safety net, cut taxes further for the wealthy and strip away regulation of business. Fortunately, thanks to defensive tactics by Democrats, they failed to achieve most of their agenda.

title: In the City of Occupy, a Year of Extremes
description: As we mark the passing of a year that will be remembered, one hopes, for turning a spotlight on social inequality, consider this: as the homeless population reached unprecedented heights in New York City, a new and entirely mind-detonating record was set in the residential real-estate market.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: A boom in bourbon, trouble for television makers and sellers, store closures at Sears and a shortage of organic milk.

title: In Shortened Season, Panic Can Set In Early
description: LOS ANGELES  A stagnant offense, an impotent backcourt, a weak bench and a slumping star have made this a rough opening week for the Knicks, who are already preaching a no panic mantra after consecutive losses on the road.

title: As Crop Prices Soar, Iowa Farms Add Acreage
description: WHITTEMORE, Iowa  A splash of green on a solid beige horizon, the golf course at the edge of this tiny town promised residents nine modest holes of refuge from corn country. Decades earlier the spot had been farmed, too, but the rocky soil was so poor, the saying went, that you couldnt raise hell there with a fifth of whiskey.

title: The College Sports Cartel
description: Twice a year in Vienna, the members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries gather to decide on the short-term direction of oil prices. Sometimes, O.P.E.C. agrees to cut back on oil production, pushing up the price of oil. Other times, it decides to boost production. Always, the goal is to fix the price of oil, rather than allow it to be set by the competitive marketplace. Indeed, collusion and price-fixing are the main reasons cartels exist  and why they are illegal in America.

title: Reinventing the East Side Waterfront
description: ONE by one, the announcements have come. Of a deal to convert Pier 42, located between the Williamsburg and Manhattan Bridges, from a storage facility into open space. Of design guidelines for Waterside Pier, a former Consolidated Edison site along the East River in Midtown, released in December by the Municipal Art Society. Of the opening of Pier 15, a block below South Street Seaport, which offers double-decker views of the East River.

title: A Quiz for All Seasons
description: What a big week coming up! New Years Day and then the Iowa caucuses! Doesnt get any better than that. And, in honor of this double-whammy of exciting events, heres the End-of-the-Year Republican Presidential Primary Quiz:

title: Keeping an Eye on Times Square
description: Theyve been dropping the New Years Eve ball in Times Square since 1907, and since 2002, Tim Tompkins, president of the Times Square Alliance, has been in charge of worrying about potential malfunctions and other angst-making details. Mr. Tompkins, 47, is too engrossed in logistics to socialize with headliners like Justin Bieber and Lady Gaga; he claims to be hopeless at mingling with celebrities but finds it amusing that Matthew Broderick portrays him as a jerk (as the boss to Hilary Swanks character) in the romantic comedy New Years Eve. Except for an afternoon catnap, Mr. Tompkins patrols Times Square from 7 a.m. on Dec. 31 onward into the wee hours of the New Year. Jan. 1 figures to be a major blur for him, as for many. His typical Sundays are jammed with socializing, yoga, Broadway matinees, Italian dinners and multiplex action movies. He lives in the West Village.

title: A Grid, Lost Synagogues and a 1959 Tale
description: YOU dont have to be a geometry major to love The Greatest Grid: The Master Plan of Manhattan 1811-2011,  jointly published by the Museum of the City of New York and Columbia University Press and edited by Hilary Ballon, a trustee of the museum and a professor of urban studies and architecture at New York University. It is a paean to what Professor Ballon hails as the citys first great civic enterprise, and a vision of brazen ambition. After all, John Randel Jr. and three state-appointed commissioners mapped the grid all the way to 155th Street at a time when most Manhattanites lived and worked below Canal Street.

title: The iKnight: Apples Jonathan Ive Gets British Honor
description: That will be Sir Jony, from now on.

title: Many of Indias Poor Turn to Private Schools
description: HYDERABAD, India  For more than two decades, M. A. Hakeem has arguably done the job of the Indian government. His private Holy Town High School has educated thousands of poor students, squeezing them into cramped classrooms where, when the electricity goes out, the children simply learn in the dark.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Car Bombing, Claimed by Separatists, Kills 10 in Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A huge car bombing in the restive southwestern city of Quetta killed at least 10 people and wounded 23 people on Friday evening, according to police officials.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: A Chinese Official Tests a New Political Approach
description: BEIJING  In a year of China under lockdown, when dissident writers have received breathtaking prison sentences and the mere whisper of a Jasmine Revolution has spurred mass detentions, perhaps the riskiest thing a Chinese politician could do is put his iron glove on the shelf.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Ryan Gosling and Siri
description: Heres what the tech reporters and editors found on the Web.

title: Later Alumni-Game Start
description: Temperatures in the 50s and sunny conditions have led the N.H.L. to push back the starting time for Saturdays Flyers-Rangers alumni game at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia. The game was moved from 1 p.m. to 3 p.m. to ensure optimal game conditions for players and fans.

title: Corrections: December 31
description: FRONT PAGE

title: A Street in Transition
description: Orchard Street runs like a spine from Division Street at the southern end to East Houston Street at the northern end, and has a kind of split personality.

title: Orchard Street in Manhattan
description: Scenes from along Orchard Street including morning deliveries, the Lower East Side Tenement Museum and late-night partygoers.

title: On Orchard Street, a Place of Fresh Starts
description: ON a recent Wednesday, as the late morning sun shone on the Lower East Side, two gentlemen had crossed Canal and were headed north on Orchard Street. Both wearing one of the better uniforms of the day  dark washed jeans with one-inch cuffs skimming the ankle above brown leather oxfords, blouson jacket zipped up, short wool scarf in neutral tone looped around the neck, sunglasses with dark lenses and metal frame  they were out for a stroll, maybe to take in a few of Orchard Streets new art galleries.

title: Poor, But Attending Private School
description: In India, the choice to live outside the faltering grid of government services is usually reserved for the rich or middle class, who can afford private housing compounds, private hospitals and private schools, Vikas Bajaj and Jim Yardley write in the New York Times today.

title: At School in a Mumbai Mill, Igniting a Desire to Learn
description: Jyoti Gupta, age 8, had never been inside a classroom when she started at the Sitaram Mill Compound Mumbai Public School this past June.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Haryana: More than 200 children, including 72 girls, have disappeared from the state in the past six months. Senior police officials have not ruled out the involvement of child trafficking gangs and claim that in neighboring Delhi five minors went missing every day (The Tribune).

title: Gay Marriage Victory Still Shadowed by AIDS
description: ON the evening of June 24, Steve Mendelsohn celebrated in the street with his friends and nearly a thousand other supporters of same-sex marriage outside the Stonewall Inn, the storied gay bar in the West Village.

title: India 2011: The Year Gone By
Obama to Turn Up Attacks on Congress in Campaign
description: HONOLULU  President Obama is heading into his re-election campaign with plans to step up his offensive against an unpopular Congress, concluding that he cannot pass any major legislation in 2012 because of Republican hostility toward his agenda.

title: The Weekend Word: Gone Negative
description: Todays Times:

title: Jan. 1 Is Worst Day for Drunken Driving, Analysis Shows
description: Editors Note: Wheels will take a short break for the New Years holiday and return to our regular coverage on Tuesday, Jan. 3. If youre on the move this weekend, the editors and contributors at Wheels remind you to drive safely.

title: Jets at Miami: Matchup to Watch
description: Jets (8-7) at Dolphins (5-10), 1 p.m. Eastern on Sunday, CBS

title: China Says Man Dies From Bird Flu
description: HONG KONG  A man in southern China died of bird flu on Saturday, the state news media reported, in the countrys first reported human death attributed to the virus in 18 months.

title: Before Jets-Dolphins, Rex Ryan Speaks
description: Excerpts from Jets Coach Rex Ryans news conference on Friday. He expounds on Shonn Greene, Jim Leonhard, LaDainian Tomlinson, Santonio Holmes, Nick Mangold vs. Paul Soliai, Darrelle Revis, the safeties, the offensive line. Contrast his remarkswith Tom Coughlins talk with reporters on Friday, via Giants.com:Coughlin seems to just want it over with.

title: My Resolutions for 2012
description: I love making New Years resolutions. No matter if 25 percent of resolutions are forgotten within a week, and 88 percent go by the wayside entirely. Its a time to wipe the slate clean, reset expectations and get excited about what lies ahead. Its a time for hope, and Ill take hope for any reason. While I have run across a number of excellent lists for both business and personal resolutions this week, I thought Id share some of mine and invite you to share yours. Bring on 2012!

title: Hungarian Diplomatic Protest
description: In response to the post my colleague Kim Lane Scheppele wrote on this blog, the Hungarian Ambassador to the United States sent her a letter disputing some of her claims. That letter has now been posted here. Her reply is beneath the fold.

title: I Like Math
description: Math is a friend of mine. There have been a number of occasions in my life when doing the math on an economic model has led me to conclusions very different from my preconceptions.

title: A Thought on Debt History
description: One thing that apparently comes as a surprise to many people who love to intone about what history tells us about the dangers of debt is the fact that Britain has had remarkably high public debt relative to GDP for most of its modern history. But heres a question: how relevant are these historical debt levels to current concerns?

title: Dallas at Giants: Matchups to Watch
description: Cowboys at Giants, 8:20 p.m. Eastern on Sunday, NBC

title: Montreal on Ice, in Miniature
description: Visions of sugarplums and flights of fancy with Frosty wont end with the New Years hangover if Montreal can help it. The city is home to a new Snow Village, a mini-city of snow and ice that includes models of some local landmarks like the Olympic Village.

title: Romney Focuses on Obama Before Leaving New Hampshire
description: HAMPTON, N.H.  Holding one last event in New Hampshire before bolting back to Iowa, Mitt Romney drew a few hundred people to the Old Salt restaurant here on the seacoast.

title: As Sponsorships Dwindle, Track Officials Loosen the Rules for Athletes
description: Lauren Fleshman arrived at the start of the New York City Marathon in November as a human billboard, wearing temporary tattoos that advertised an energy-bar company she founded with her husband.

title: Sanchez, Used to Stability, May Soon Confront Uncertainty
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Mark Sanchez transferred to Mission Viejo High School before his junior year, and his football career has been a portrait of stability ever since. He played for one head coach at Southern California, where he worked with the same offensive mentor for four years, then joined the Jets just as a new staff was taking over.

title: Departure of a Star Is a Test of Faith
description: As a native Clevelander and a lifelong die-hard fan of the Indians, the Browns and the Cavaliers, whats left of my heart goes out to the fans of St. Louis upon their recent loss of Albert Pujols to the merciless scourge of free agency. Small solace though it may seem in the throes of fresh grief, you are not alone.

title: Manchester United Stumbles Badly on Fergusons 70th
description: If Manchester United Manager Alex Ferguson presents his players with gifts on Saturday, his 70th birthday, they are more than likely to be powerful hairdryers.

title: Variety: A Super Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  Happy New Year! Welcome back to a whole new slew of brain puzzles: puzzles to pore over, puzzles to rhapsodize over, puzzles to shake a fist at, and puzzles you can use to show your friends how smart you really are.

title: Patrick Head Leaves Williams Team
