description: The Williams team announced Saturday that Patrick Head, the director of engineering and a founder of the team with Frank Williams in 1977, was leaving its board.

title: Patrick Head Leaves Williams Team
description: The Williams team announced Saturday that Patrick Head, the director of engineering and a founder of the team with Frank Williams in 1977, was leaving its board.

title: From the Sideline to the Bottom Line
description: Before their teams take the field in the Bowl Championship Series title game on Jan. 9, Alabama Coach Nick Saban and his Louisiana State counterpart, Les Miles, will, from a financial standpoint, have already won.

title: The Caucus | Iowa Caucus Preview
description: Dec. 30, 2011 - Republican presidential candidates sweep across Iowa ahead of Tuesday's pivotal Caucus.

title: N.F.L. 2011, From January to Tebowary and Beyond
description: From last seasons Super Bowl to the off-season lockout, from the whirlwind free-agency period to Tebowmania, this has been an N.F.L. year like any other, only more so. Here is a look back at the year that almost wasnt.

title: No Fireworks for Euro as It Reaches the 10-Year Mark
description: BERLIN  When the euro was introduced just after midnight on Jan. 1, 2002, celebratory fireworks exploded above the European Central Bank headquarters in Frankfurt. The historic bridge the Pont Neuf in Paris was lit up in European Union blue with 12 rays of light to symbolize the 12 nations circulating the euro  as people in those countries lined up at A.T.M.s to get their hands on new bills that would be daily reminders of the project of European integration and unity.

title: Strategic Somali Town Is Seized by Ethiopians
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Ethiopian troops poured into a strategic town in central Somalia on Saturday, seizing it from the Shabab militant group and opening a new axis of conflict in this country.

title: In Coaching Contracts, Deals Within the Deal
description: Contracts for major college football coaches have become increasingly lucrative and complicated. Here are a few examples.

title: Last-Minute Scramble as Caucus Night Nears
description: INDIANOLA, Iowa  The Republican presidential candidates spent the final day of the year jostling for a large share of undecided voters on Saturday, with the cast of former front-runners fighting to not be left behind when the contest to pick a challenger to President Obama begins on Tuesday.

title: Over Phones and Greasy Pizza, a Battle for Iowa
description: DES MOINES  A few days before the Iowa caucuses, Newt Gingrichs campaign headquarters just outside the city is a spectacle of pre-computer-age disorder, with volunteers rushing voter updates across the room on yellow Post-it notes.

title: Documents: Coaching Contracts
description: Complete coaching contracts of Les Miles with L.S.U. and Nick Saban with Alabama.

title: NASA Mission Will Look Beyond the Surface of the Moon
description: A pair of NASA spacecraft are slipping into orbit around the Moon this weekend to try to answer persistent questions about Earths celestial companion.

title: Plenty of Heat Generated in Thunders Fast Start
description: Much of the attention on the Oklahoma City Thunder in the first week of this season focused on whether Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook could co-exist. Talking heads are discussing whether or not they are friends, and what their recent argument means to the future of the franchise.

title: Iowans Weigh Options at Gingrich Appearance
description: COUNCIL BLUFFS, Iowa  These are the days when Republican hopefuls make what journalists call the candidates closing arguments.

title: Strive for Results, Not for the Accolades
description: This interview with  John Donovan, chief technology officer at AT&T, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Letters: Lessons From the Shackleton Mission
description: To the Editor:

title: A Year of Me-Firsts, and of Lessons Relearned
description: LIVE and learn. And well we should, given that 2011 was packed with teachable moments.

title: Dream Come True, and a Title, Too
description: His Norwegian language skills may be rudimentary, but Josh Gatt has begun to develop a fluency in the life of a professional soccer player in Europe.

title: Even a Giant Can Learn to Run
description: BECAUSE it has become so consistently successful, I.B.M. is almost boring. This is a company so predictable that its financial forecast is packaged as a five-year road map, as if it were some sort of state planning exercise.

title: Syrian Opposition Groups Aim for Unity
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  After a month of negotiations, the two largest Syrian opposition groups said Saturday that they had agreed on a common approach to organizing a transitional government, a move that could help unify a movement divided between exiles and domestic dissidents that has differed about how to topple President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Orphans Defender Jostles With Afghan Corruption
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In a country desperately in need of a hero, Sayyid Abdullah Hashemi would like to apply for the job.

title: US Net Investment Income
description: Hows that for a sexy blog post title? But this actually matters.

title: Defining Words, Without the Arbiters
description: TRADITIONAL print dictionaries have long enlisted lexicographers to scrutinize new words as they pop up, weighing their merits and eventually accepting some of them.

title: The Most Precious Resource of All
description: I took this photo in Paris in 1980, at the sleepy peak of the August vacance, when most shops, including this watch store, were shuttered.

title: I Just Got Here, but I Know Trouble When I See It
description: BELIEVE it or not, times are getting better.

title: Keeping Score: Assessing the Return on a Yankees Investment
description: Rob Neyer is SB Nations national baseball editor and the author or co-author of six books about baseball.

title: Office Owners and Cleaners Reach a Deal, Averting a Strike
description: The union representing some 22,000 cleaners and other workers at 1,500 New York City office buildings has reached a tentative deal with the building owners, averting a possible strike.

title: The Man in the Mask Is a Key Giant
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When the Giants defensive linemen gather for their last meeting before Sunday nights game against Dallas, their captain, Justin Tuck, will almost surely stand aside for the final invocation. The young superstar Jason Pierre-Paul will probably stay quiet, too, same as Osi Umenyiora, the stalwart opposite Tuck, who has battled injury and hopes to play for the first time in a month.

title: The Battle for Iowa
description: Far from candidates spotlights, hundreds of aides and volunteers are waging an unglamorous ground war with hidden intensity.

title: 30 Seconds With Pat Sajak
description: Pat Sajak, who celebrated his 30th anniversary as the host of the game show Wheel of Fortune last week, holds another proud distinction: he has attended every N.H.L. Winter Classic. He plans to be in the crowd at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia on Monday, when the Flyers host the Rangers in the fifth annual outdoor event.

title: Acknowledging Futility That Yielded 37 Points
description: IRVING, Tex.  The Dallas Cowboys defensive coordinator, Rob Ryan, did not want to revisit the night of Dec. 11, specifically what happened in the final 5 minutes 41 seconds of the Giants 37-34 victory.

title: Your Recycled Resolutions Are a Boon for Business
description: THIS year, I swear, I will lose those 10 pounds. I will hit the gym more than once a month. I will buy less and recycle more. I will kick that $4.20-a-day cappuccino habit.

title: Plenty of Blanks Left to Fill In on the N.F.L.s Final Weekend
description: A season that began in a frantic swirl of signings and practices after a lockout ended comes down to Sunday, with three playoff spots on the line, playoff pairings to be determined, coaches fates to be decided and one of the best teams of the past decade in the awkward position of possibly being able to secure its quarterbacking future for at least another decade  if it can finish an embarrassingly awful season with a loss.

title: After Struggle on Detainees, Obama Signs Defense Bill
description: HONOLULU  President Obama, after objecting to provisions of a military spending bill that would have forced him to try terrorism suspects in military courts and impose strict sanctions on Irans oil exports, signed the bill on Saturday.

title: Perhaps New York Will Be Next Stop on Winter Classic Schedule
description: PHILADELPHIA  One of the chief topics of conversation at any N.H.L. Winter Classic is where the next Winter Classic will be held.

title: How Dividends Could Save the Day
description: WHEN the global economy slowed last year, investors looking for reasons to be bullish could at least point to one positive sign: the continued strength of corporate profits.

title: Time to Sell the Gold
description: DO you know how to unclasp this? asked the jeweler on West 47th Street in Manhattan, holding a gold bracelet. Instantly, I flashed back to my childhood. Yes, I knew how to unclasp it. Because I was inquisitive and clumsy as a boy, my mother taught me how to open her favorite bracelet without breaking it.

title: A Hmong Generation Finds Its Voice in Writing
description: FRESNO, Calif.  In many ways, the preoccupations of the young writers who gather every week here over supermarket cheese and crackers are those of young people everywhere. They grapple with loneliness, the mystifying behavior of siblings, being gay, the parents who do not understand them.

title: Fiats Rough Road, and Its Renewal
description: NINE times out of 10, its possible to predict the quality of narrative books, especially those set in the business world, even before the author sits down and begins writing  even before the first interview is secure in a tape recorder. Its not the idea or the specific angle that is the giveaway. Sad to say, its the access.

title: Pieces From the Hmong American Writers Circle
description: Members of the Hmong American Writers Circle in Fresno, Calif., have written poems and short stories reflecting their culture and lives.

title: The Year of the Multitaskers Revenge
description: ITS a far different work world today than it was even 10 years ago. Technology and the economy have converged to create a set of priorities and preoccupations that are unique to our times. Here are just a few workplace and employment issues that are likely to stir debate, frustration and a search for solutions this year.

title: An Imperfect Political Weather Vane
description: A heartland sampler of statistics is presented to reflect the Iowa caucuses vital, sublime and (some might even be tempted to say) ridiculous role in the democratic process.

title: From Opossums to Gorillas
description: WHEN I was growing up in Canton, Mass., south of Boston, I had all sorts of pets, including opossums, frogs and raccoons as well as stray dogs and cats. My favorite was Colonel Joe, a German shepherd who never left my side.

title: Politics and Power Plays, Both on and Off the Board
description: Chess again crossed paths with politics in 2011, with the most remarkable moment occurring in Tripoli, Libya, during the NATO bombing campaign against Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi.

title: In Washington, Large Rewards in Teacher Pay
description: WASHINGTON  During her first six years of teaching in this citys struggling schools, Tiffany Johnson got a series of small raises that brought her annual salary to $63,000, from about $50,000. This year, her seventh, Ms. Johnson earns $87,000.

title: Sean Collins, Who Used Science to Help Surfers, Dies at 59
description: Sean Collins, who created Surfline.com, whose forecasts and real-time views of beaches reach 1.5 million surfers a week, died on Monday in Newport Beach, Calif. He was 59.

title: Romney Quotes His Favorite Patriotic Songs and Offers Voters an Interpretation
description: AMES, Iowa  Iowans have spent the last week getting to know Mitt Romney as presidential candidate, businessman and ... performance artist?

title: In Des Moines, Seeking the Pulse of the People and Finding a Hall of Mirrors
description: DES MOINES  The only people the pundits listen to is each other, Rick Santorum, a Republican presidential candidate, said on Friday at Legends American Grill in Marshalltown, Iowa.

title: Which Words Will Live On?
description: COLLECTING the past years words is like sifting ones pockets at the end of a trip. Some things youll keep, some youll discard  the dinner receipt for the expense-account meal vs. the one-peso coin. Each is a reminder of what you did, where you went and whom you were with.

title: She Made Me Run!
description: DES MOINES

title: Pariahs and Prophets
description: IN 1984, after serving three terms in the House of Representatives, Ron Paul was defeated by Phil Gramm in Texass Republican Senate primary. Paul left Congress, and a few years later he left the Republican Party entirely to run for president on the Libertarian line. In the 1988 election, after a campaign that Texas Monthly compared to something out of Robert Altmans movie Nashville,  he took home just 0.47 percent of the popular vote.

title: Iowas Harvest
description: Coralville, Iowa

title: Angelina, George, Ben and Mia
description: HERES a paradox: Were finding authentic leadership these days not from our nominal leaders in Washington but from unelected (and mostly unelectable) figures whom we like to deride as self-indulgent narcissists.

title: New Hope for Republicans Left Off Virginia Ballot
description: DES MOINES  Virginias attorney general said on Saturday that he will propose emergency legislation to change the states ballot access laws in ways that would make it easier for candidates to qualify.

title: As Good as It Gets?
description: The economy was weak in 2011, but it ended better than it started, with growth up from its lows and unemployment down from its highs. The question now is whether that progress will continue into 2012. We wish we could say yes, but unless policy makers are incredibly lucky or remarkably adept  certainly not the description that comes to mind when thinking of, say, Congress  the answer is no.

title: A Farewell to Cheetah, the Original or Otherwise
description: PALM HARBOR, Fla.  In the end, maybe it didnt matter whether Cheetah really was the same grinning, goofy sidekick who swung through the cinematic jungle with the Olympic swimmer Johnny Weissmuller in the Tarzan movies of 1930s.

title: Perry Highlights Texas Record in 2 Stops
description: BOONE, Iowa  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas made last-ditch appeals to conservative voters in a pair of campaign stops in central Iowa on Saturday, boasting of balancing budgets and cutting financing to Planned Parenthood clinics as governor and arguing that he alone had a record of results to go with his conservative beliefs.

title: In Tsunami Aftermath, Road to Future Unsettles a Village
description: BABANAKAYAMA, Japan  Freshly carved out of the side of a hill, with layers of rock still exposed along some of its stretches and trees lying nearby, the construction project that was supposed to help this fishing village relocate and rebuild after the earthquake and tsunami in March was optimistically named the Road to the Future.

title: How Great Was 2012!
description: Happy New Year! And I really mean it! Because 2012 is going to be the best year ever! Seriously! I know, because Im a person from the future! And here in the future, guess what? Its 2112 and were celebrating the centennial of 2012! Thats how amazing 2012 is going to be!

title: A World in Denial of What It Knows
description: Bath, England

title: Relying on the Kindness of Strangers
description: Joplin, Mo.

title: Westchesters Desegregation Battle
description: The struggle for racial integration is neither bygone nor exclusively Southern. In Westchester, north of New York City, county leaders are stonewalling federal authorities over a longstanding housing desegregation case. Led by County Executive Rob Astorino, they are defending an ultrawhite status quo against the federal governments effort to upend decades of housing discrimination.

title: A Tempestuous Year
description: Is there a connection between last years extreme weather events and global warming? The answers might be a lot clearer if the Republicans in Congress were less hostile to climate change research.

title: Out the Door and Into 2012
description: Perhaps you have a New Years Day of your own  a day when it suddenly feels as though youve truly left the old year behind. It may be the day you no longer have to think twice when putting the date on a check, if you still write checks, that is. Perhaps your new year started the moment the days began lengthening just before Christmas. Or perhaps you hold off for the vernal equinox (March 20 in 2012), when New Year used to be celebrated and when, in many places, you can feel the newness of the year about to burst out of the ground.

title: The Backstory of my Column on Celebrities  and Politicians
description: Okay, okay, celebrities are not my thing. I have never in my life read People Magazine, and when Im in the grocery store passing the scandal tabloids, I have to get page one nicknames translated by my kids to know whos supposedly having an affair with whom. But my Sunday column dips its toe into celebrity waters anyway.

title: Protecting the Accusers
description: Re Name Withheld, but Not His Identity (Dec. 18):

title: The Recession Squeeze On Buses and Trains
description: For the average American driver, the time wasted in traffic jams has more than doubled in 30 years. The best way of easing that gridlock  not to mention saving gas, curbing pollution and finally finishing that novel  is public transit.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Will a Third Party Help?
description: A letter writers call for a centrist third party to help ease our political dysfunction was met with both praise and skepticism.

title: An Imperfect Political Weather Vane
description: On Tuesday, perhaps 100,000 to 150,000 Iowans will gather in buildings ranging from high school gymnasiums to small airports. They will munch leftover Christmas treats and cast ballots in a straw poll, which asks them whom they would like to see become the Republican nominee for president.

title: Report of Clash Disputes Chinas Account
description: BEIJING  The latest report about a confrontation on Wednesday in the far western region of Xinjiang appeared to contradict versions carried by the state media that suggested the police had killed violent terrorists on their way to jihad training.

title: Alan B. Krueger
description: Alan Krueger, a professor of economics and public affairs at Princeton, recently became chairman of President Obamas Council of Economic Advisers.

title: Sunday: Addendum
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Happy new year, and welcome back!

title: Live from Times Square: New Years Eve
description: Watch live streaming video from 2012 at livestream.com

title: Emmett L. Bennett Jr., Expert on Ancient Script, Dies at 93
description: Emmett L. Bennett Jr., a classicist who played a vital role in deciphering Linear B, the Bronze Age Aegean script that defied solution for more than 50 years after it was unearthed on clay tablets in 1900, died on Dec. 15 in Madison, Wis. He was 93.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, January 1
description: Having spent weeks or even months wooing Iowa voters, four Republican presidential hopefuls  Representative Ron Paul of Texas, Representative Michele Bachmann of Minnesota, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas and Rick Santorum  take to their case to a national audience on the Sunday shows.

title: F.D.A. Finds Short Supply of Attention Deficit Drugs
description: Medicines to treat attention deficit hyperactivity disorder are in such short supply that hundreds of patients complain daily to the Food and Drug Administration that they are unable to find a pharmacy with enough pills to fill their prescriptions.

title: A.D.H.D. Drug Shortage Has Patients Scrambling
description: A shortage of medication for attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder has left many patients struggling to fill their prescriptions.

title: Flyers Win Alumni Game, but Bernie Parent Steals Show
description: PHILADELPHIA  Maybe the best moment of the Flyers 3-1 victory against the Rangers in the Alumni Game on Saturday was simply the sight of Bernie Parent, the great Flyers goalie of the 1970s, striding toward the rink in his gear, his vintage mask tipped back atop his head, a huge grin on his face, basking in the cheers of 45,000 fans at Citizens Bank Park.

title: Man Accused of Driving Drunk With Son in Back Seat
description: A New Jersey man who was pulled over and arrested on Staten Island on Friday night was accused of driving drunk across the Outerbridge Crossing from New Jersey with his 4-year-old son in the back seat of his vehicle, the police said.

title: Did Too Much Well-Wishing Crash Twitter Again?
description: Twitter welcomed the new year in with a bang by more than an hour of unavailability Saturday morning.

title: In China, Reality Television Proves Too Real
description: After censors threatened to cancel a popular television show, producers raced to tone it down.

title: Move to Allow Vote to Merge Treasurer and Comptroller Jobs Stalls in House
description: On the 15th floor of the Thompson Centerin the Loop, the states two financial officers, the comptroller and treasurer,work next to each other.

title: China TV Grows Racy, and Gets a Chaperon
description: NANJING, China  Wang Peijies idea for what would become the most-talked-about show in China was simple: Throw a spotlight on this countrys bright young things as they court each other on stage to pop music and audience applause.

title: A Date With the Censors
description: Reality TV shows have become common on Chinese television but the sometimes racy and materialistic content has attracted the attention of Chinas censors.

title: Latest Santorum Spot Reflects New Confidence
description: DES MOINES  Even Rick Santorums latest ad reflects the new buoyancy of his campaign.

title: Study of Waterways Stirs Debate on Roles in the Regions Future
description: A new Army Corps of Engineers study  of Chicago-area waterways has stirred the debate over whether to sever the connection between Lake Michigan and inland waterways that was created by the construction of canals a century ago. The study, released on Dec. 7, is part of the Corpss nearly decade-long process aimed at preventing invasive species, including voracious Asian carp, from spreading between the Great Lakes and the Mississippi River ecosystems.

title: Some Lesser Imaginings (if John and Yoko Were Living in Chicago Right Now)
description: James Warren writes a column for The Chicago News Cooperative.
